column1: [SAK-30037] file picker in select mode, menus aren't shown as menus
column6:
When the file picker is used in select mode (typical is attach mode), the menus are messed up. The options show as text, and all the menus start out open.

I've redone them as jquery UI dialogs.

I initially used the existing code and just initialized them as closed. But the results are ugly and probably not accessible. It's easy enough to convert to dialogs.
column10: file picker in select mode, menus aren't shown as menus
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: I'm classifying this as a blocker because without some kind of fix this tool isn't useable.
column45: The easiest way to test this is in lessons. Add content link, then click choose existing file. That will open the picker.
column49: Presumably this only affected the picker as it has it's own templates.
column53: I think it would be good to have both the picker and the standard resources tool have the same UI, but that is much more work.
column57:
It's not all pickers. There are actually two different UIs for the picker. Most pickers run in attach mode, which means that they expect you to select or upload a file and they then copy it into the hidden attachments area. Only Lessons and the MOTD tool use select mode, which returns a pointer to resources in the normal resources. I only changed the UI for select mode, as attach mode worked. (It doesn't seem to have popup dialogs.)

I don't object to doing other work with those menus. I need them to work, so we can test Lessons. I'm more confident in accessibility of jquery UI than some javascript I might create to make it look like resources.
column61: I was just meaning it should be using the UI already developed rather than developing a new UI (or re-implementing it).
column65:
Tested on http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu:8080/portal/

The file picker looks correct in Lessons as well as Resources.

column1: [SAK-30036] 'Insert Original Text' links broken when replying within Forums

column1: [SAK-30035] Forums - Automatically Mark All As Read When Viewing Thread
column6:
The current behavior for a thread in Forums is, if a user clicks on a thread, they need to either select a message to mark it read, reply to it, or click the "Mark all as read" button. In the case where a user wants to quickly browse the Forums, but still get an indicator of when new, actually unread posts are added to Forums, this quickly becomes tedious.

The feature request is for every post that is physically rendered on a screen to be marked as read automatically, as is commonly done on Forums across the web.
column10: Forums - Automatically Mark All As Read When Viewing Thread
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Noticed this option does exist while browsing through the code. Please ignore this ticket.

column1: [SAK-30034] Add a webservice to update the user's timezone
column6: Maybe and institutions have users in different timezones and have a central place to set the user timezone. Then this webservice can be useful to update Sakai from this central place.
column10: Add a webservice to update the user's timezone
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
Test scenario:

1. Check the timezone of the user in preferences(so you can view that it changes)
2. Call the webservices with rest (it is the easier way to test it)
2.1 Open a session with: HTTPS://YOURSERVER/sakai-ws/rest/login/login?id=ADMINID&pw=ADMINPASSWORD
2.2 call it: HTTPS://YOURSERVER/sakai-ws/rest/sakai/setUserTimeZone?sessionid=YOURSESSIONID&eid=THEEXTERNALUSERID&timeZoneId=Europe/Oslo
3. Go to the user preferences again and check if their timezome is the right one.

If timezone is not a valid value it sets it to GMT. Maybe a good improvement should be doesn't allow bad values in the timeZoneId.

column1: [SAK-30031] Send bug reports email in server language rather than affected user's language
column6:
Bug report emails and logging use the locale of the affected user instead of the system's default language. This can make it difficult for support staff to read the reports and logs.

The linked PR will use the system default locale for email contents and logging statements.
column10: Send bug reports email in server language rather than affected user's language

column87:
1. Find (or create) a reliable way to trigger a bug report
2. In preferences, set your language to something other than the server's default language
3. Trigger the bug report, confirm that the UI messaging is in the user's language
4. Check the bug report email and the logs, confirm that the messaging is in the server's default language

column1: [SAK-30024] Clean up display of section eids in groups and rosters interfaces
column6:
Section eids are usually meaningless to end users and just add visual clutter to the interface. The linked PR does two things:

1. In the groups interfaces, replaces the section eid with the section title, while keeping the eid available behind a tooltip (where possible).

2. In the rosters interfaces, hides the eid behind a tooltip for courses and sections.

column1: [SAK-30023] Create a view for Joinable Sets to see which users haven't joined a group yet
column6:
Maintainers need a way to tell who has not yet joined a group in a given Joinable Set. The linked PR introduces a new section in the "Edit" Joinable Set UI for exactly this purpose.

It is a collapsable/expandable div with a triangle disclosure, showing all users who have not yet joined a group in this set in the format of "<lastName>, <firstName> (<loginID>)"

column1: [SAK-30016] Resubmission date is more restrictive than Due Date or Accep Until Date if student has saved a draft.
column6:
If allowed resubmission date is in the past but Due Date or Accept Until Date are in the future, then student can't edit the drafts and send.

STEPS:
Create an assessment with a resubmission date before the actual date and due date and Accept until date in the future.
Enter as a student and save the assignment as a draft
Try to edit it.
Expected Behaviour: Allow to edit the draft and send (we are inside the due date or the accept until date and we have never sent anything, only saved a draft)
Actual Behaviour: Not allowed to edit.

column1: [SAK-30032] Allow Students to attach files during Peer Review
column6: Instructors would like student reviewers to utilize and attach a finished rubric when completing a peer review.
column10: Allow Students to attach files during Peer Review
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: Moved this issue from the contrib Assignment2 jira space
column45:
Attached is a patch to add the peer review attachments feature to Sakai 10.5.

You will need to add an additional table to manage the peer review attachments. The query to do so is below.

Mysql

CREATE TABLE ASN_PEER_ASSESSMENT_ATTACH_T (
SUBMISSION_ID varchar(255) NOT NULL, 
ASSESSOR_USER_ID varchar(255) NOT NULL, 
RESOURCE_ID varchar(255) NOT NULL, 
PRIMARY KEY(SUBMISSION_ID,ASSESSOR_USER_ID,RESOURCE_ID)
);
create index PEER_ASSESSOR_I on ASN_PEER_ASSESSMENT_ATTACH_T (SUBMISSION_ID, ASSESSOR_USER_ID);

Oracle

CREATE TABLE ASN_PEER_ASSESSMENT_ATTACH_T (
SUBMISSION_ID varchar2(255) NOT NULL, 
ASSESSOR_USER_ID varchar2(255) NOT NULL, 
RESOURCE_ID varchar2(255) NOT NULL, 
PRIMARY KEY(SUBMISSION_ID,ASSESSOR_USER_ID,RESOURCE_ID)
);
create index PEER_ASSESSOR_I on ASN_PEER_ASSESSMENT_ATTACH_T (SUBMISSION_ID, ASSESSOR_USER_ID);

I don't believe auto.ddl will create this table, but that wouldn't be too hard to do if that is required.

Lastly, we don't use the ' or select more files from workspace or site' button so it has been commented out and hasn't been tested with peer review attachments. However, if this is needed for your institution it (probably) doesn't require too much extra work.

I've made sure this change was reflected in the Sakai 11 conversion scripts sakai_11_mysql_conversion.sql and sakai_11_oracle_conversion.sql.

column1: [SAK-38834] Some antisamy changes for Ensemble (position/scrolling)
column6:
Ensemble appears to have added some new attributes that need to be added to the antisamy rules.

The div tag had a style attribute, "position", that could not be allowed for security reasons.<br/>
The iframe tag had a style attribute, "position", that could not be allowed for security reasons.<br/>
The iframe tag contained an attribute that we could not process. The scrolling attribute has been filtered out, but the tag is still in place. The value of the attribute was "no".<br/>

http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_positioning.asp
column10: Some antisamy changes for Ensemble (position/scrolling)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
It looks like the position has been restricted from the antisamy files we pulled over originally, it's a prevention for a possible phishing attack (like if someone puts up a fake page or form over the original one). I'm not sure the risk for this but I feel like it's safe to remove this restriction in the low-security policy and just leave it in the high.
.
http://stackoverflow.com/a/5092441/3708872
column45:
I'm not even sure if this is the completely right thing to do here, but the (new?) embed code from Ensemble is including a position element and a scrolling attribute that's new and causing the error message to popup when embedding.

I don't feel like anyone could be doing a phishing attack by using css positioning but I can't say for sure. Also scrolling is deprecated so I hate adding a deprecated tag to the filter. Maybe we could try to contact them to get them to fix their embed codes.
column49: I agree with your original assessment: I don't see much risk here. I would proceed by adding them to our default AntiSamy files.
column53: Ensemble said that the have two embedding modes, one that's responsive and one that isn't. The responsive mode has attributed that result in errors when pasted and doesn't even work with Sakai anyway when this is fixed because of a 0 height div. So I'm just closing this for now as won't fix.

column1: [SAK-30014] Feature Request: Assignments - Allow listing of assignment before open date
column6:
Apologies if thisfunctionality already exists. If there is a flag or setting under the hood, please add anote in comments with the details for an institution interested in this feature and we'll close this ticket!

OVERVIEW:

We have received requests of allowing a list of all assignments (whether open or not) to help students plan their course work. While many professors may also list these items in separate documents, like the syllabus, the goal would be to leverage the existing tool to provide a full listing of assignments and dates for students at the choice/discretion of the professor.

We certainly see the one side of not overwhelming students by a long list of assignments (and rolling out in stages with the open date). At the same time, there are some professors or course offerings (such as self-paced offerings) where a full disclosure model can be very valuable to students.

FEATURE REQUEST:

Add a checkbox when adding an assignment to enable a professor to display the title, open date, and due date BEFORE the open date. This way, students can see the entire list of assignments required in a course, listed chronologically. The assignments that are not "open" yet will not have links (they can't view details or submit content). The listingwill provide the big picture of all assignment work ahead of them. Assignments with open dates would work as normal.

Thank you for considering this feature request.

MOCKUP OF POSSIBLE SETTING FOR INSTRUCTORS:

MOCKUP OF STUDENT VIEW IF ASSIGNMENT DISPLAYED BEFORE OPEN DATE:
column10: Feature Request: Assignments - Allow listing of assignment before open date
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41:
I was asked by a faculty member at our instititionback in 2015 for this feature request. In some teaching approaches displaying all of the assignments from the start can be beneficial.

To help visualize the request, I mocked up two quick images and added them to the description.

The setting language I proposed was "Display the assignment title, open, and due dates to students before the open date." I'm sure someone will think up a better way to say this. "Show all assignments even before open date" or "List all assignment titles, open, and due dates" or something else. Very open to the best language to help this feature request proceed.

Thanks for considering.
column45:
We reviewed this at today's Sakai UX group meeting.

Jolie Tingen mentioned that Duke had contributed a Visible Date option for Assignments in SAK-22282 Closed that can be enabled with a sakai.property to provide instructors with the option to make the assignment visible before students can submit.

Alan Regan will this existing option meet your use case and needs?
column49: Jolie Tingen mentioned that this property could be enabled on Experimental Nightly for you, Alan Regan, to try out.
column53:
From https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/blob/master/config/configuration/bundles/src/bundle/org/sakaiproject/config/bundle/default.sakai.properties :

# Enable visible date feature. When enabled, student can see assignment but can not submit/save yet. 
# This feature is driven by a need for us to show students upcoming tasks but not allow them to act on them until the open date. 
# DEFAULT: false (disabled)
# assignment.visible.date.enabled=true
column57:
Thanks, Shawn Foster and Jolie Tingen. The visible date feature is definitely a step in the right direction! I like the approach very much since it meets the requirements of displaying the assignments in the list before the open date. However, it offers too much access. The intent of the original request was to simply showthe assignment in the table with the name and dates, but not make the link to get details on the assignment active. This way, students can't see the description or attachments, just have it on the radar for planning purposes.

Related to the user interface, I would likely run the language through some usability testing with faculty. My gut says that "Visible Date," while accurate, doesn't explain the feature quickly. Perhaps make the initial label more obvious, like "Display assignment before open date" or "Use Visible Date option to display the assignment before the open date" or the like. Else, there would likely need to be a question mark icon with an explanation of what the "Visible Date" feature does.

I like the use of the date picker to be specific.I wish the date was set to the current date/time rather than time in the future. If someone wants it immediately viewable it would save instructors the time of changing the timing.

Perhaps to meet the requirements of withholding the details, an additional checkbox can be added that makes the link to the assignment details active or inactive. Imagine a checkbox that says something like "Allow students to view assignment details before open date"or the like. If not checked, the title of the assignment is not a link to the details. If checked, the title is clickable as it is in the current configuration.

column1: [SAK-30009] Delegated Access functionality is broken with the fix SAK-28186
column6:
Delegated Access functionality is broken with the fix SAK-28186 Closed

There were 2 files modified:

1. delegatedaccess/impl/src/java/org/sakaiproject/delegatedaccess/logic/ProjectLogicImpl.java - This file had an issue where Concurrent hashmaps throw NPE when storing null values https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-28988. Fix for this has been merged SAK-28988 Resolved into the Sakai 10.x Subversion maintenance branch

2. delegatedaccess/impl/src/java/org/sakaiproject/delegatedaccess/dao/impl/DelegatedAccessDaoImpl.java - This file was modified mostly to use list of arguments (ArrayList) as an input to bind to the query method of the JDBCTemplate. As a result of the change , getNodesBySiteRef method is totally broken and is not returning right results.

e.g getNodesBySiteRef - The sql use in this method is as below:
select.hierarchyNode = Select ID, title From HIERARCHY_NODE_META where title in and hierarchyId = ? and isDisabled = 0

But when values are added in List, hierarchyId is added first and which as a result does not return any data.

And what was the intent of changes in this class as it has also removed given below changes which was the reported JIRA issue.

inParams += "'" + subSiteRefs[i].replace("'", "''") + "'"; //escape apostrophe

column1: [SAK-30004] Remove placeholder images added to ckeditor edit mode by audiorecorder plugin
column6:
The Ckeditor audiorecorder plugin replaces the audio and object tags with placeholder images when in edit mode. If a student were to submit an assignment with audiorecorder content the placeholder images will prevent the instructor from listening to it on the grading page. Currently there is a work around that the instructor/grader could click the preview button to listen to the content.

I am submitting a PR to remove the placeholder image creation from audiorecorder/plugin.js.
column10: Remove placeholder images added to ckeditor edit mode by audiorecorder plugin
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)

column45: Hi Kevin, are you confident IE, Safari, Firefox, and Chrome will all render the audio recorder in the CKEditor?
column49: When testing the changes it worked in Chrome, Safari, and Firefox. It doesn't work in IE because of the audio file type, this is documented in SAK-27820 Resolved .
column53:
Yeah, I'd agree, almost all of this was either workaround was for IE or iOS. IE supports the audio tag but won't play back wav files. iOS doesn't support flash. I'd do testing across all browsers before committing this.

It looks like (finally) IE Edge does support wav files, but I'm pretty sure 11 and before did not. Without the placeholders from what I remember IE 10 and 11 would have a problem with the content.

Also without flash installed (like a mobile browser) it would have problems with the flash content. So I avoided displaying either of the actual players.
column57:
I'd be against this change if it's just to fix the problem of grading and rather just put more descriptive text around the preview button. Like "Click on preview to listen to embedded audio or other rich media in the content"

I feel like this would break authoring on a lot of devices still today. Maybe a good idea in ~3-5 years once we don't have to worry at all about Flash fallback for .wav, either because we're converting it to multiple formats that everything can play, or IE10 is deprecated. (Though they say Windows 8.1 has support until 2023!)
column61:
This "might possibly" work if it was so only the <object> (cke:object) had a placeholder attached to it, if the css was working on all IE versions up to Edge to hide the audio tag ( SAK-27820 Resolved like you mentioned)

Though I don't know if the css could hide the element correctly anyway in the CKEditor context for IE? I don't have a super easy way to test IE 10 or 11 at this point to see what it would do.

Another thing the placeholder images allowed is the right click context menu to work but doesn't do anything because we don't have audio or video plugins. (http://ckeditor.com/forums/Plugins/HTML5-Video) I wanted to add both of those though and get rid of the "Strobe Player" plugin.
column65:
Here's the page to test audio format support

http://hpr.dogphilosophy.net/test/

IE Edge supports wav and mp3 only. IE 11 only supports mp3.
column137:
Sorry just noticed all of these comments (joys of email migration). I have a few windows machines easily available to try your suggestion of using the placeholder for the object tag only but given the IE format support it kind of seems like a non-starter. Adding some text about using the preview button to the assignment grading instructions should work for that problem.

Let me know what you think.
column163:
Yeah, I think for now the only thing we really can do is just improve the instructions on the assignment to say something like "Click preview if response contains audio question responses"

I think that having to support older versions of IE at least through one more release will make this a non-starter. So I'm going to close the PR for now.

column1: [SAK-35202] Several times the calculated questions are wrong graded due to the decimal rounding
column6: Please see the images to better understanding the problem.
column10: Several times the calculated questions are wrong graded due to the decimal rounding
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Yeah, I do agree that this is a problem but not sure the correct solution. There's 8 different methods of rounding that are possible. I don't think it should be rounded twice, but don't know which one should be changed. I think it also should be indicated in the UI which method is used for rounding.

I also think in the initial image that having a tolerance of 0.01 with 1 decimal place should also be flagged as an error since that's essentially the same as having a 0.0 tolerance, right? If this was 0.1 tolerance then this probably wouldn't have been a problem here.
column45:
Hi Matthew Jones

After debugging the code I've noticed that in this case the tolerance keeps the value 0,01 in spite of choosing 1 decimal place to the answer key.

The real problem is that Samigo is rounding like this: If you choose N decimal places to the answer key then Samigo will round to N+1 decimal places (Code line: GradingService.java:2844). Therefore if you choose 1 decimal place then Samigo will round to 1+1=2 decimal places. I don't know why Samigo does that. However Samigo does that in several places so I would prefer that this rounding won't be modified.

Taking into account that changing the rounding previously mentioned could break other functionalities due to that rounding is used in several places, if you are in agreement I am going to close this ticket.

Do you agree?
Regards:

Ral
column49:
Taking into account that changing the rounding could break other functionalities due to that rounding is used in several places I am going to close this ticket.

I've asked for feedback in sakai lists but there is no counterarguments.

Regards,
Ral

column1: [SAK-30000] Site creation notification emails should use the site title instead of the site ID
column6:
There are too many instances of the site ID in the two site creation notification emails (sitemanage.notifySiteCreation, sitemanage.notifySiteCreation.confirmation). For the majority of users, they don't care or even know what the site ID is. The relevant information is the site title.

The linked PR addresses this issue, as well as some grammatical errors in the templates. I've left a single occurrence of the site ID in the message body for troubleshooting purposes, etc. I've switched out the domain in favour of the ui.service for better readability, but will fall back to the domain if ui.service is not set in sakai.properties. Also, cleaned up ETSUserNotificationProviderImpl.java a bit while I was in there.

Existing instances will need to manually update the template via SQL. The update SQL is contained in /reference/docs/conversion/sakai_11_mysql_conversion.sql or /reference/docs/converstion/sakai_11_oracle_conversion.sql. Any new instance will get the new template automatically.

column41: I like the change, but doesn't doing this via the SQL conversion script mean that anyone who has customised the default templates loses their changes?
column45:
That is correct. I would hope that upgrading institutions would review the changes in the SQL conversion script before running them, giving them the opportunity to prune things out which they don't want (like email template changes).

This is the only way I can think of to manage updates to email templates. We can't just keep them static forever in the code base, as many of them are outdated and need work.
column49:
For sites with case-sensitive databases, this conversion fails:

UPDATE email_template_item

because the table is EMAIL_TEMPLATE_ITEM.
column53: Stephen Marquard, should both Oracle and MySQL scripts have capitalized table names?
column57: I don't know about Oracle, but for MySQL, the case has to be the same as the case with which the table was created, as some (but not all) mysql installations are case-sensitive for table names. In this case, it should be EMAIL_TEMPLATE_ITEM.
column61: I took a look at some surrounding sections of the conversion scripts. It seems the convention is to just make all table names capitalized for both Oracle and MySQL. I'll submit an amendment PR. Thanks for reporting!
column65: Upper case is correct in this case, but for some other tables they are created lower-case (e.g. rwiki*, signup*). So the conversion script has to match the original case.
column137: Good to know. Seems strange that there is a mixture of both though.... But that's a different issue.

column1: [SAK-36956] Samigo will consider a Test 'active' if the due date is passed, it doesn't accept late submissions, but there is at least one user who has been given the ability to take a retake
column6:
Samigo has a logic flaw that will make a test appear as 'Active' in the authorIndex UI even if the due date is passed and late submissions are not accepted.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. create a quiz with the following settings:
    1. a start and end date
    2. does not allow late submissions
  2. as any student user, use up all of your available submissions
  3. as the maintainer, go to the test's 'Scores' UI, and click the 'Submission Status' link at the top
  4. find the student you from the previous step that has used all of their submission attempts
  5. click the link to 'Allow Retake?'
  6. DON'T use the retake for the given student
  7. allow the due date to pass, or change the due date so that it has already passed
  8. view the authorIndex page, and notice that the 'Status' is still marked as 'Active'

The user with the available retake will not be able to use this retake, as the due date has passed and the test does not accept late submissions. The problem is a small piece of code in the AuthorActionListerner.isStillAvailable() method:

if (actualNumberRetake < numberRetake) {
			  isStillAvailable = true;
}

This code block does not take into account the quiz's setting for allowing submissions passed the due date, and thus will always return true (the test is active) if the following conditions are met:

  1. the test is passed the due date
  2. any user in the group/site still has available retakes
  3. late submissions are not accepted

To fix this, the conditional just needs a very small tweak:

if (actualNumberRetake < numberRetake && acceptLateSubmission) {

column1: [SAK-36570] Restricted Assessments regression, Edit and Remove restrictions
column6:
There were 2 new options added in SAK-35580 Closed

samigo.editPubAssessment.restricted.afterStart=true
samigo.removePubAssessment.restricted.afterStart=true

When these options are set to true the following should be the behaviour:

  • Remove Assessments
    • Admin can always remove
    • Instructor allowed to remove when:
      • have either matching perms assessment.deleteAssessment.any or assessment.deleteAssessment.own
      • if assessment has 0 in progress or submitted
  • Edit Assessments
    • Admin can always edit
    • Instructor allowed to edit when:
      • have either matching perms assessment.editAssessment.any or assessment.editAssessment.own
      • if assessment has 0 in progress or submitted
      • if assessment has in progress or submitted submissions then only after the exam has been retracted (note a retract date must be used here otherwise the exam is never editable)

column1: [SAK-38618] Oracle security service busted
column6:
Hi there,

Since the patch for SAK-29401 Resolved got merged, it seems that the security
service is broken under Oracle. You can see this on
https://trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org if you create a regular
user and try logging in: no error gets logged, but you get back a page
like:

Session

no session established

no tool session established

Unknown Request

Snoop for request

${req.toString()}
Request headers

Servlet parameters (Single Value style):
                    
Servlet parameters (Multiple Value style):
                    
Request Attributes:

After some digging through the code, we noticed that
org/sakaiproject/authz/impl/DbAuthzGroupSqlOracle.java has its own
implementation of getCountRealmRoleFunctionSql that wasn't updated as
a part of the changes under SAK-29401 Resolved . I've attached a patch that
attempts to bring it back into line (and added an @Override annotation
to stop future similar omissions)

Cheers,

Mark

column1: [SAK-29988] Usability improvements for Syllabus
column6:
The linked PR introduces the following usability improvements:

  • add/change buttons on Add Item and Bulk Add Item to be explicit regarding published status (Instead of one button obeying the sakai.property, there are now three buttons for each UI; Add and Publish, Add, and Cancel)
  • * will still fall back to sakai.property if the 'published' parameter is not included in the REST call
  • change occurances of the word 'Post' to 'Publish' for consistency across interfaces
  • add the prefix 'DRAFT - ' to the non-editable portion of a draft item's title, to visually reinforce the idea that the item is not published (this is how other tools handle this as well, such as Assignments, Announcements and Forums)

While I was in the project/files, I fixed up some minor JavaScript issues and switched some syntax to Java 7 style.

column1: [SAK-29984] Gradebook classic permissions can overwrite GradebookNG permissions
column6:
GradebookNG introduced a new permission type, view course grade. However this is interpreted as a standard VIEW permission in Gradebook classic. If an instructor removes it, then they are removing the view course grade permission in GradebookNG. Likewise if its added to GradebookNG, the TA will end up having view permissions to all categories and groups.

Solution:
Parse out the new permission in the list of permissions for Gradebook classic.

column1: [SAK-39345] Conditional Release doesn't have in mind adding new users into a site
column6:
When we add a user into a site, conditional release of resources isn't calculated again causing this user can access (or not) incorrectly.
To reproduce this issue I followed the next steps:

  • Create an item gradebook, e.g. Item1
  • Create a resource. In the properties, check 'Only if the following condition is met', the gradebook item 'Item1' and the condition 'grade is blank'.
    That's mean any user who hasn't been graded in Item1 will be able to access this resource.
  • Now, we add a user into this site.
    This user cannot access to the resource, but he should.

column1: [SAK-38907] Threads performing queries using Spring + Hibernate and HikariCP
column6:
An issue was recently noticed while using the HikariCP connection pool that is related to this SO article:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20775165/how-does-hikaricp-handle-incomplete-jdbc-transactions/20776035#20776035

Using DBCP when a connection was returned commit was called before the connection was returned to the pool.

Since HikariCP does not do this and when used in conjunction with springs transaction advising inside threads some strange issues can happen. Most notably is that transactions are not completed (aka committed) and are then rollbacked according to HikariCP (UPDATE: HikariCP 1.2.2 and above perform an automatic "rollback" for closed connections with auto-commit set to 'false'.)

When auto-commit is on this is a non-issue.

Onto Threads and Spring's HibernateTemplate, while in a Runnable and calling getHibernateTemplate things appear to work normally until you notice that the table has no data but the auto increment has been incremented as though there should be data. The transaction manager is not able to finish the transaction with a commit since there is no Hibernate session bound to the thread. This where the spring strangeness occurs becuase everything tends to work ok except for the transaction manager calling commit and if you try to get the getSessionFactory().getCurrentSession() this will fail with:

org.hibernate.HibernateException: No Hibernate Session bound to thread, and configuration does not allow creation of non-transactional one here
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.SpringSessionContext.currentSession(SpringSessionContext.java:63)
at org.hibernate.impl.SessionFactoryImpl.getCurrentSession(SessionFactoryImpl.java:544)

This is due to the current thread does not have a context containing the Hibernate session. In this case we open a new session and bind it to the thread.

PRO's
This approach puts all the transaction management in one location and no changes are required to existing methods using the HibernateTemplate.

CON's
You need to manage the transaction explicitly, you could probably add a TransactionDefinition and not have to manage the details but you would still need to construct it here and bind it to the thread.

If there are a lot of places in Sakai that use Threads and Springs HibernateTemplate it probably makes sense to create a Thread Executor Service that properly binds the HibernateDaoSupport to the Thread.

I did look in Spring for any similar patterns and could not find one, as it would be nice if they had this kind of support for threads.
column10: Threads performing queries using Spring + Hibernate and HikariCP
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Earle can we backport this to Sakai 10? We see a fair bit of deadlocks related to update SAKAI_MESSAGE_BUNDLE on startup
column45: This issue wouldn't solve deadlock issues, and is only visible when using HikariCP vs DBCP.

column41: So maybe Lessons is stripping the CSRF token from the JetspeedRunData parameter before ResourcesHelperAction.java gets it?
column45:
This is pretty clearly not a Lessons problem. The problem is occurring at the POST within the helper. VelocityPortletPaneledAction is not seeing the CSRF argument, nor any other argument. I watched the bytes on the wire, and the token is there.

@@ -696,6 +696,7 @@ public abstract class VelocityPortletPaneledAction extends ToolServlet

String csrfToken = params.getString(SAKAI_CSRF_TOKEN);
String sessionToken = sessionAttr.toString();
+ System.out.println("sessiontoken " + sessionToken + " arg " + csrfToken + " pipe-init-id " + params.getString("pipe-init-id"));
if (csrfToken == null || sessionToken == null || !StringUtils.equals(csrfToken, sessionToken))

The argument shows as null. So does pipe-init-id, another argument that is clearly present. I'd say something changed in the picker, or maybe a remaining issue with removing iframes. Most tools set FILE_PICKER_ATTACH_LINKS false. The only tools that use it are Lessons and Motd. Motd fails in a different way. Maybe lessons is doing something it shouldn't, but I haven't been able to find it. At the moment it looks like an issue in the picker or velocity.

I have an instance of lessons in an iframe. With it, I get a null pointer at
org.sakaiproject.content.tool.ResourcesHelperAction.notifyDragAndDropCompleted(ResourcesHelperAction.java:2198\
Looking at the code,

JetspeedRunData rundata = (JetspeedRunData) request.getAttribut\
e(ATTR_RUNDATA);
ParameterParser params = rundata.getParameters();

It looks like rundata is null. I think there's something broken in the bowels of the system.
column49: On the other hand, this may be the only RSF picker call. Heaven only knows what RSF is doing. But this doesn't look to me like it's RSF messing up, since the issue seems to be internal to the picker. It is quite possible that RSF is using it in a way that no other tools do.
column53: Ah! The main problem is that I run with upload.enabled false, because some of my code does its own handling. If I turn it on, things start coming close to working. I think I'll be able to fix this.

Yes. That particular uploader fails in 10. However with the multi-file code, even the conventional upload and selecting existing files fails. The issue is

<bean id="multipartResolver" class="org.sakaiproject.lessonbuildertool.resolver.MultiCommonsMultipartResolver">
</bean>

I have some ideas, but it's going to take a while to figure out.
column163: Looks to me like the Helper is just plain buggy. request.getAttribute(ATTR_RUNDATA) returns null. I'm guessing it assumes some context that is set up if the tool uses Velocity but not RSF. I can work around it by setting up the necessary context myself.
column231:
Fixed in PR-1195. I had to fix things in the Picker as well as Lessons. There were several cases in which uploads didn't work or didn't do what was intended. The fix in the picker adds initialization of RunData where it isn't already set up. I'm not sure whether this was a bug that no one found because Lessons was the only tool using that particular path, or whether the problem is that non-Velocity tools didn't set up RunData. But the fix checks to see whether it's set up, and does it if necessary. A cursory glance at the code suggests that the data is normally set up in doGet. But this code used doPost, where it wasn't set up.

The part that was a side effect of SAK-37458 Resolved was that the code interposed a new handler for multipart submits. The builtin RSF code takes care to disable its code when a helper is in operation. The replacement didn't do that. The problem is that the new code overrode the mechanism for figuring out which code to use rather than just RSF's own multipart handler.
column254: The changes to Velocity and Content apply to 10.x. However you may not want to back port them unless you're prepared to do lots of QA for the helper. While this was reported as a blocker, I'm not convinced. The only thing that was reported broken was a mode of uploading files that I didn't actually intend anyone to use.
column258:

In 10.x the changes to lessons aren't needed. The problems in Lessons were due to a new feature that was never added to the 10 version of Lessons.

This was only happening on windows. Building on linux/mac was working fine. We're already on the latest version of the maven-resource-plugin so upgrading that wasn't possible. One fix was to escape all the @ in the file, but this may well have resulted in the bug appearing again as unescaped @ characters were introduced. The simplest fix seemed to be to stop @ being available as an substitution character.

We did track down the SHA of the change that started presenting this bug was: 15e369dde847dfb98afc32e744bcd2bc55f6af39

column41:
The asterisk indicates multiplication - a variable adjacent to a number is always being multiplied by that number in a math question. Asterisk makes sense to display.

SAK-34715 Open with the delta symbol appears to be a better handling of the feature desired here (always having the variable end up as a multiple of 10 due to change unit of 10).
column45: Marking as won't fix because math logic indicates that having a variable next to a number is a multiplication by that number.

column1: [SAK-29975] Change category score calculation logic
column6:
When an item is released to students and included in course grade calculations, it makes sense for it to be included in subtotal calculations. When the item is released to students but not included in course grade calculations, it doesn't make as much sense, as the item is not counting toward the course grade and the category subtotal score represents a certain percentage of the final course grade. And if the item is not released to students, thanks to the dependency, it's also not included in grade calculations.

So the conditions should be:

1. Assignment actually has points,
2. There is a grade for the student,
3. Assignment is included in course grade calculations

For safety, since the include in course grade calculation and item released dependency is not enforced on the backend, the final check will include

4. The assignment is released to students
column10: Change category score calculation logic
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29974] New UI for Citation Lists (both edit and view)
column6:
This is a new feature for Citation lists where you can create a section with a heading (and a section within that section, up to 3 levels) and drag and drop your citations into those sections, thereby building up a nested citation list (see screenshots for examples of a list expanded and collapsed).
You can drag and drop nested sections containing citations around and add a description to each section.
The reading list title and an editable introduction is also displayed at the top of the nested citation list.
The resulting nested list is then shown as such in the student view (see nested_citation_list_student_view.png screenshot).
column10: New UI for Citation Lists (both edit and view)

column1: [SAK-35382] Wrong correction and wrong answer key when the calculated question answers are too low
column6:
Please see attached images to see the use case.

NOTE:

It is not an issue because:

  • The answer key is 0,00001.
  • The answer key has been set with 3 decimal places so the answer key is cut from "0,00001" to "0,000".
  • The student's answer is 0,00001. This answer doesn't match with "0,000". This is the reason why the student's answer is wrong and the displayed answer key is 0.

column1: [SAK-29960] Upgrade to log4j v2.x
column6:
The log4j v1.x release has reached end -of-life and is no longer supported:
https://blogs.apache.org/foundation/entry/apache_logging_services_project_announces

We should update to log4j v2.x - migration guide is at https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/manual/migration.html
column10: Upgrade to log4j v2.x
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
Rather than upgrade or bridge, we might just want to convert over to logback instead. All of these options like they have a lot of work involved though even if it's just going to be search and replaces.

http://logback.qos.ch/manual/migrationFromLog4j.html
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/pipermail/production/2013-May/002115.html
column45: Do you have some reasons for preferring logback to log4j2 Matthew Jones?
column49:
I don't have any reason, I don't know the pros/cons of one or the other. I was just linking to Seth's post about it. He linked to the logback reasons to switch page. I don't know how this copares to log4j 2.x.

http://logback.qos.ch/reasonsToSwitch.html

In the intro for log4j 2.x they list some reasons why their project is "better" (than logback anyway)
https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/manual/index.html

It just "seems" like the effort for conversion for going to log4j 2.x or logback would be similar. Using the log4j 2.x bridge is less, but still would minimally require the modification of every nearly pom file in the system, and possibly more. And I don't know what effect that would have on the stuff that uses slf4j. (Hopefully none)

Or maybe we should just go to slf4j in the code then it can use either at deployment? It's kind of mixed up right now.
column53:
It's the case that at the moment most code is written against Jakarta Commons Logging (JCL) and that we have JCL use Log4j 1 under the hood. If we upgrade to log4j2 we'd want to have JCL go straight there when possible I think https://logging.apache.org/log4j/log4j-2.3/log4j-jcl/index.html.

Switching logging facade to SLF4J is much bigger as every class file that gets a logger would need updating, although slf4j is generally seen to be better than JCL I think.
column57:
Yes, we would want any JCL to go straight to v2 as indicated above.

There are two other issues that I laid out in 2013:

  • there are classes that use java.util.logging (7 or so in 2013; see the mail). Some of which could just be converted to JCL, but the imsglobal ones would probably have to be maintained.
  • Log4jConfigurationManager (implementation of LogConfigurationManager), which runs afoul of the bridge requirements.

Overall, I think the move to log4j v2 may be easier than moving to slf4j. It's a different world from 2013.
column61:
We also face the question of how to transition the code using the slf4j API. In most cases, these calls are being delegated to log4j 1.x via slf4j-log4j12.jar (from the slf4j project). Apparently, log4j 2.x provides a similar binding:

https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/log4j-slf4j-impl/index.html
column65: Once the logging has been normalized switching logging implementations via slf4j bindings should be straight forward.
column137: Switched from log4j1 to log4j 2 as the logging implementation, note Sakai code still uses SLF4J as it's logging api.

column1: [SAK-38965] clickjacking protection breaks content domain support
column6:
In 11, RequestFilter sets X-Frame-Options to SAMEORIGIN. If separate domain support is being used, this prevents anything from the content domain from being embedded in the main domain.

Since content in the content domain should be static, or at least not operations that could harm Sakai's security, this header shouldn't be set for responses from the content domain.

This is a blocker for sites using separate domains.

I've tested the problem and fix on Sakai 10 (since I don't have a Sakai 11 environment with separate domains), but there's no reason it wouldn't also be present in Sakai 11.
column10: clickjacking protection breaks content domain support
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29953] Job to publish and unpublish sites based on a site property
column6:
This is a simple job that publish any site with this site property:

publish-date: 2015/05/15

where the date is today's date in the moment the job runs, and is in that format (yyyy/MM/dd).

And it unpublish sites following the same criteria about site properties:

unpublish-date:2015/07/23

If publish and unpublish date is the same, it unpublish it.

If someone find this useful I can try to do a pull request to add this to Sakai 11. Meanwhile here is the patch in the case someone wants to use it.
column10: Job to publish and unpublish sites based on a site property

column1: [SAK-29952] Publish and unpublish courses based in Terms dates.
column6:
1. Publish Courses X days before the term starts.

Before a term begins, existing, unpublished course sites are published so that they are then available to the students enrolled in the courses.
The courses will be published a number of days before the start of the term, whose value is specified by a property.

*There is a special use case to consider.
*Say that this method is invoked, and all the course sites for the current term are published.
Now, suppose one particular instructor forgot to add some content, or made some mistakes setting up his course site, and he wants to unpublish his couse site while
he makes some changes to it. He goes into sakai, and uses the site setup tool to mark the course site as unpublished. But, suppose the next day this service is
invoked again (via a quartz job). His course would get published again, even though he doesn't want it to be, and has manually gone into sakai and set it to
unpublished. In order to prevent this case from happening, whenever this service marks a course site as published, it also sets a site property called rsmart.course_site.publish.set. (Note: Name will be changed in the contributed version)
Then, if an instructor manually resets his site to be unpublished, this service will not automatically publish it. Rather, the instructor who manually unpublished the
course site will have to go into sakai, use the site setup tool, and manually publish it.

Course Site Removal

Removes
unpublishes course sites whose terms have ended and a specified number of days have passed.
Once a term has ended, the course sites for that term remain available for a specified number of days, whose duration is specified in sakai.properties. After the specified period has elapsed, this invoking this service will either
remove or unpublish the course site, depending on the value of a sakai property.

Comments
This is a code working in our customers from a long time and they are very happy with the way it works. I will review it and create a version for Sakai 11 to contribute.
column10: Publish and unpublish courses based in Terms dates.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Created the pull request : https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/1165
column45: Where is the documentation on how to use this feature? Thanks!
column49:
I don't believe it needs to be part of this PR but it was discussed that a Site Info option (checkboxes) for the instructor of "Automatically Publish at start of term" and "Automatically Unpublish at end of term" would be nice to give on the publish page for the user.

It's possible that the site admin though sakai property could force both of these options either set as true/false/always/never like presence. So then they'd default to true/false or be either forced (unable to unselect in the always) or disabled (in the never option)

Should open this up as a related feature request after this is resolved.
column53:
Main documentation is explained in the Sakai.properties. So, it needs to configure this properties and then launch the right jobs in the jobscheduler tool...:

  1. ######################################################
    +# SAK-29952 Closed - Course Site Publish and unpublish service and job
    +# ######################################################
    +#publishes and unpublishes course sites whose terms are about to begin or have just ended.
    +#Before a term begins, existing, unpublished course sites are published so that they
    +#are then available to the students enrolled in the courses.
    +#After a term end, existing, published course sites are unpublished so that they
    +#are not then available to the students enrolled in the courses.
    +#The courses will be published a number of days before the start of the term, and unpublished
    +#a number of days after the end of the term based in the
    +#value specified by the course_site_publish_service.num_days_before_term_starts
    +#sakai property and the course_site_removal_service.num_days_after_term_ends one.
    +
    +#The user that will execute the publish job
    +#course_site_publish_service.user=admin
    +
    +# The grace period before the term starts
    +#course_site_publish_service.num_days_before_term_starts=14
    +
    +# the actions can be: remove or unpublish (by default)
    +#course_site_removal_service.action=unpublish
    +
    +#The user that will execute the removal/unpublish job
    +#course_site_removal_service.user=admin
    +
    +# The grace period after the term ends
    +#course_site_removal_service.num_days_after_term_ends=14
column57:
And as Matthew says, a good improvement can be add something in the user interface to allow personalize this in some way by each user. This, together withthe job in this JIRA: https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-29953 and as steve suggested, adding a calendar picker to the UI to program the publish date and unpublish date... (and surely some adjustments to make both things work together) can make a real good improvement about the way courses are published. So, publish by term dates or set the dates manually if you want (useful for projects and other not term related sites).

This feature, anyway, allows the user to publish sites and unpublish manually before or after the term dates, and the manual changes will be respected by the job.

column1: [SAK-36972] Release to groups messaging issues
column6:
Currently in trunk, if you release a test/quiz to any number of groups, the 'Release To' column appears blank. The markup to show/hide the groups the quiz is released to is there, but because of the introduction of the '.collapse' class in morpheus-default/tool.css, it is hidden (display=none). Changing class names in sam_tool.css will rectify this regression.

Another regression introduced by morpheus is setting the default list style for ol's and ul's to none:

ol, ul

{list-style: outside none none;}

We have to override this in sam_tool.css so that we can have bullet-ed lists again.

The second issue is the style class being used when the group(s) have been deleted, to inform the maintainer that the quiz is effectively useless. Currently it uses the 'alertMessage' class, which is not as strongly styled for an error as the 'messageError' class.
column10: Release to groups messaging issues
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29949] Joinable site setting information message is using the wrong style class
column6:
The message you receive when making a site joinable:

"Important: People who join your site can access the materials on your site. Sites with sensitive materials should not be made joinable."

This message is using the "messageValidation" class, which now makes it look like an error. In our institution's flavour of Sakai, we changed this to the "messageWarning" class, but this class was removed from reference's tool_base.css for whatever reason.

The linked PR reintroduces this class to tool_base.css, and changes the class on the element in chef_site-siteInfo-editAccess.vm.

column1: [SAK-39870] record the mapping between usage session id and sakai session id at login
column6:
When you're trying to diagnose problems or looking into possible user misbehavior, it's hard to correlate events and sessions from the database with data from the access log. For the access log you can include the JSESSIONID. But the session number there is different from the session number in SAKAI_SESSION. The first is the sakai session, the second is the usage session.

This patch puts the sakai sessions ID in the REF field of the login event, thus allowing you to map between the two IDs
column10: record the mapping between usage session id and sakai session id at login
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: From a security point of view, it would be preferable to have this disabled by default, i.e. has to be explicitly enabled.
column45: You think there are sites that allow people to read the database who can't hack on or impersonate users already?
column49: We just had a chat about this on the core team call and I was suggesting that maybe having RequestFilter add an additional header on the response of the usage session ID. This way Apache can be configured to log this additional ID and it makes it easy to tie events to a session. As far as I'm aware there's no security implications of making this ID available in the response.
column53:
In Apache you can log arbitrary response headers with a log entry including:

%{Sakai-Session}o

assuming we set a header of Sakai-Session in RequestFilter.
column57: Only thing is that the UsageSession isn't available for unauthenticated requests.
column61: The concern is to connect the apache log to SAKAI_EVENT and SAKAI_SESSION. For unauthenticated events, we don't have a usage session, we don't have a SAKAI_SESSION, and we don't have any usable session information in SAKAI_EVENT. In that case the event is logged with ~SERVERID~USERID. So I don't see what we can do in the context of this Jira to help that situation. It might make more sense to do ~IP~SERVERID~USERID, but that's probably a separate Jira.
column65:
If tracking unauthenticated actions is important, we could generate a pseudo usage session ID and use it for tracking.
However in this case logging the JSESSIONID is probably OK, since it doesn't have any privileges assigned. A new JSESSIONID is created by the login code.
column137: I still think adding the UsageSession ID to a response header is the way to go. Just highlighting issues.
column163:
Right. I'm going to generate a patch that sets UsageSession ID. I've got it running now, and it does work.

We'll postpone handling anonymous events to someone who really needs that. The only thing easy would be to use JsessionID for events without a usage session. But since the backend wouldn't have any info on it, it doesn't accomplish much. I checked into doing more, but there are enough layers on top of the event logging code that getting more information into it is non-trivial.
column231:
/library doesn't use request filter. So the logs don't show a session ID for that. Is that an issue?
I can run it all through request filter, or create a filter that just adds this header and doesn't do any of the rest of request filter.
I think I'd like to be able to track all activities in a session, even /library.

Redirects from sakai to content-sakai also don't show the session ID, because they happen in request filter before the call to assureSession.

I'm worried that this approach is going to turn into whack a mole.
column254:
We're current running with a patch to RequestFilter that adds a header X-Sakai-Session. I'm currently logging both that value and the JSESSIONID. I find that the Sakai session is missing for /library, and for some /access/content/public, primarily things that are retrieved before login.

I can catch /library by adding a filter. I've looked at how to write it. The easier, and probably safest, seems to be to extent RequestFilter, so that the code can use constants and methods from within RequestFilter. It would then contain a simplified assureSession, that only checks for existing sessions, and then a main method that just calls assureSession when appropriate and sets the header.

That would still leave some calls with no session information, apparently when the user isn't logged in yet.

I don't consider this essential for Rutgers. Since our logs are only visible to sysadmins, I can use JSESSIONID and get the maximum possible information about sessions, with this header present on most but not all transactions, making it easy to tie them to the session and event logs.

Would people like me to generate a PR with either just the patch to RequestFilter, or with that plus an additional filter for use in /library? I don't want to generate PR's if core team members aren't going to agree that it makes sense.

column1: [SAK-39910] need to get the user's IP address when we're behind a load balancer
column6:
We are behind a load balancer that acts as a full proxy. The IP address we see is always the load balancer. This makes session logs misleading, and also makes the IP address test in some places not usable.

This patch has two sakai.properties values that lets us get the right address. The assumption is that the load balancer will supply a header such as X-Forwarded-For with the right address. Here's a sample conjuration:

checkforward.addresses=128.6.210.69,128.6.210.70
checkforward.header=X-Forwarded-For

Both values must be set for it to do anything. The addresses value gives the addresses from which the load balancer will send traffic. At Rutgers we have situations where you can access the servers directly. We only want to use the X-Forwarded-For header when access comes from the load balancer. Otherwise users could add their own header and fake their IP address.
column10: need to get the user's IP address when we're behind a load balancer
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Sam Ottenhoff has pointed out a better way to do this.

In server.xml something like

<Valve
className="org.apache.catalina.valves.RemoteIpValve"
internalProxies="128\.6\.210\.69"
remoteIpHeader="x-forwarded-for"
proxiesHeader="x-forwarded-by"
protocolHeader="x-forwarded-proto"
/>

The last 2 lines may not be needed, since probably nothing will look at them.
column45:
Right, internalProxies is only necessary if your load-balancer communicates with your Tomcat nodes over a non-private network.

More examples here: https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/api/org/apache/catalina/valves/RemoteIpValve.html
column49:
Yeah, some of this is documented here as well https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/DOC/Sakai+Admin+Guide+-+Advanced+Tomcat++(and+Apache)+Configuration

Seems the easiest way to do it is modifying this server.xml.
column53: Ya, we do this at Western using the RemoteIpValve in Tomcat's server.xml
column57: RemoteIpValve just works the way you think it should. Columbia has used it (and the 5.5 version) since 2011.

column1: [SAK-34636] Allow instructor ability to see who has 'in progress' submissions
column6:
Many times instructors notice they have in progress attempts of an exam and they would like to be able to tell which students are currently working on the exam.

Would it be possible to the instructors to have the ability to see students who have an in progress attempt?
column10: Allow instructor ability to see who has 'in progress' submissions
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: UVA has had several instructors request this feature over the past few years. Currently, the only way to tell what students have submissions in progress is to go to Event Log and check for quizzes started but not submitted. This is a clumsy workaround and difficult to tell whose quiz is in progress if you have a lot of students.
column87:
1. In a site with at least one student and samigo, create and publish a quiz with at least one question.
  2. Log in as student and start the quiz but don't submit.
  3. Log in as instructor and try to figure out which student is taking it.

column1: [SAK-29942] Add EntityProvider to expose cache and memory status
column6:
Contributing an EntityProvider that exposes cache and jvm memory stats.

/cache - Gets a list of all caches in the system
/cache/:ID: - Gets a single cache by id

Custom Actions:

/cache/cacheSummary - Gets a list of caches along with size, hit count, and hit ratio
/cache/cacheNames - Gets a list of fully qualified cache names
/cache/memory - Gets a summary of free, maximum, and total memory

column1: [SAK-38500] Don't log failures during autoddl run
column6:
Currently, when starting up Sakai for the second time with auto.ddl on, a number of errors are produced because tables are attempted to be created when they already exist.

MySQL provides CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS to avoid this error.

MySQL also provides INSERT IGNORE INTO to avoid duplicate errors.

Here is a sample of the errors I'd like to avoid:

2015-08-21 15:38:05,684 WARN localhost-startStop-1 org.sakaiproject.db.impl.BasicSqlService - Sql.dbWrite(): recordAlreadyExists: false, failQuiet: true, : error code: 1050, sql: CREATE TABLE SAKAI_LOCKS ( TABLE_NAME VARCHAR (64), RECORD_ID VARCHAR (512), LOCK_TI
ME DATETIME, USAGE_SESSION_ID VARCHAR (36) ), binds: , error: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'sakai_locks' already exists
2015-08-21 15:38:05,991 WARN localhost-startStop-1 org.sakaiproject.db.impl.BasicSqlService - Sql.dbWrite(): recordAlreadyExists: false, failQuiet: true, : error code: 1050, sql: CREATE TABLE SAKAI_EVENT ( EVENT_ID BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT, EVENT_DATE TIMESTAMP, EVE
NT VARCHAR (32), REF VARCHAR (255), CONTEXT VARCHAR (255), SESSION_ID VARCHAR (163), EVENT_CODE VARCHAR (1), PRIMARY KEY (EVENT_ID) ), binds: , error: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'sakai_event' already exists
2015-08-21 15:38:15,402 WARN localhost-startStop-1 org.sakaiproject.db.impl.BasicSqlService - Sql.dbWrite(): recordAlreadyExists: false, failQuiet: true, : error code: 1050, sql: CREATE TABLE SAKAI_PREFERENCES ( PREFERENCES_ID VARCHAR (99) NOT NULL, XML LONGTEXT
), binds: , error: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'sakai_preferences' already exists
2015-08-21 15:38:15,484 WARN localhost-startStop-1 org.sakaiproject.db.impl.BasicSqlService - Sql.dbWrite(): recordAlreadyExists: false, failQuiet: true, : error code: 1050, sql: CREATE TABLE SAKAI_USER_PROPERTY ( USER_ID VARCHAR (99) NOT NULL, NAME
VARCHAR (99) NOT NULL, VALUE LONGTEXT NULL ), binds: , error: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'sakai_user_property' already exists
2015-08-21 15:38:15,487 WARN localhost-startStop-1 org.sakaiproject.db.impl.BasicSqlService - Sql.dbWrite(): recordAlreadyExists: false, failQuiet: true, : error code: 1060, sql: ALTER TABLE SAKAI_USER ADD (EMAIL_LC VARCHAR (255)), binds: , error: com.mysql.jdbc.
exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Duplicate column name 'EMAIL_LC'
column10: Don't log failures during autoddl run
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: I think we're only seeing these errors because of the change in SAK-38686 Closed which added the warning.
column45:
Yeah, this seems like a not so great regresion. Previously when failQuiet was enabled it was really because methods like ddl were calling
dbWriteFailQuiet

And were expecting it to try to run the first statement, and fail without writing any output. I think we'd have to change every statement for MySQL to a "NOT EXISTS" because then the first statement wouldn't fail and DDL would just fail somewhere else and produce this message.

Though I don't think Oracle even has this pattern.

I'd certainly like to avoid all of these errors too. I understand the motivation for SAK-38686 Closed but do we need another separate parameter to indicate that this is from the ddl process so that it really fails quietly? I don't know how else to capture the use case of "we want errors when the record already exists, but not during the ddl process"
column49:
I also didn't see the conversation on the (closed) pull request, but sounds like it was similar to my concerns here. I just noticed this today though and feel it should be a blocker for 11 (and possibly even 10.7)

I feel like the targeted ddl specific fix would be easy to implement and maybe the easiest since this is the specific problem we're having.

I also moved this to KNL because I feel like it's going to be a fix again to BasicSqlService rather than the sql files.
column53:
Attached a patch, it's not great but it seems as minimal as I can think of. Really just changes the failquiet parameter to an integer so there's more options around it while allowing for the old boolean to still function to reduce the amount of code that needs to change.

ddl calls directly into dbWrite now with an integer value that will avoid having it print the log message. Please comment/review.

column1: [SAK-29936] Add sakai.property to disable Forums Ranks feature - Phase 2 - disabling the feature in code
column6:
Because of the performance issues ( SAK-29654 Verified ) with the new Forum Ranks feature that we got in Sakai 10 ( SAK-24854 Closed ), we need to create a property to disable the Ranks system to avoid our database from crashing under the hundreds of thousands of queries per hour and the millions of CPU-intensive buffers each hour attribute to the Ranks feature.

However, because of the lack of time over the summer, we decided to implement this property in two phases:

Phase 1 - disable the Ranks page from the UI so that instructors and maintainers cannot add Ranks ( SAK-29934 Verified )

Phase 2 - disable the Ranks feature throughout the code (this ticket)

For this ticket, create a property (or replace/reuse the property from SAK-29934 Verified ) that disables all of the Ranks feature code from Forums for institutions that don't want to use the feature or those that need to avoid the performance issues.
column10: Add sakai.property to disable Forums Ranks feature - Phase 2 - disabling the feature in code

SAK-29936 Verified - Merging PR 1196 from master for msgcntr (matthew@longsight.com: rev 321705)
column45:
For reference, this uses the same property from SAK-29934:
msgcntr.forums.ranks.enable=true (default)

column1: [SAK-29935] The support.email property isn't defined in sakai.properties files, change to mail.support
column6:
In the default.sakai.properties file:

# Sets the 'from' email address and name for password reset emails (if not set, falls back to mail.support)
# accountValidator.checkValidations.fromEmailAddress=
# accountValidator.checkValidations.fromEmailName=

And you can find the mail.support property:

# Email support address used in incoming email rejection messages.
# DEFAULT: none (null)
# mail.support=

The reset password tool uses support.email property.
If support.email isn't defined, then the e-mail notification doesn't work. This property doesn't appear in any sakai.properties files.

Are both the same property? In that case, Reset Pass Tool should use mail.support instead of support.email.
Or, are they differents? In that case, the properties file should define support.email with an explanation of usage.
column10: The support.email property isn't defined in sakai.properties files, change to mail.support
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: Discussed on Sakai Core team call. A larger discussion about email and potential code cleanup, specifically about "from" addresses could be in order.
column45: And/or this issue may be a side effect of SAK-29614 Resolved .
column49:
Yeah, it seems like they're really the same. I'd think it should just use support.email.

However it should still work if nothing is defined (some kind of hardcoded default)

Like maybe "support@"+ serverConfigurationService.getServerName()

Ideally these would be a constant or something somewhere too
column53: Yes, my PR to SAK-29614 Resolved has one occurrence, but there are 7 in total within reset-pass (was just just following the pattern). I don't see a valid use case to keep reset-pass' support email address distinct from the rest of Sakai, so I'd be good with deprecating support.email in favour of mail.support.
column57: Should sub-tasks be created off this ticket to deprecate support.email in favor of mail.support?
column61:
I think it's all within scope of this ticket, it shouldn't be a lot of work.
Just a question about how this should be addressed - we've deprecated properties before. It followed the pattern where property A was unclear, so we introduced property B. We'd accept which ever property was present, and if we had both properties, we'd use B.
In this case, we're deprecating a property in favour of an existing property (mail.support) which everyone should have. So, if we applied the same pattern here, it would be pointless since everyone's using mail.support. We could use support.email if it was present instead, but that would look like we're encouraging people to use support.email. So I'm thinking we should essentially find and replace support.email with mail.support?
column65:
Yeah, I think we should change support.email over.

I think we should keep email.support working though.

So probably replace like
serverConfigurationService.getString("support.email")

to
serverConfigurationService.getString("email.support", serverConfigurationService.getString("support.email"))

For now, so both properties work, until we have a better way of aliasing properties.
column137: But isn't it redundant as per my previous comment? Everybody should have "mail.support" set, so "support.email" would never get picked up if we're giving "mail.support" priority.
column151:
Ensure you do not have support.email set in sakai.properties
use reset-pass with siteManage.validateNewUsers=false in sakai.properties
use reset-pass with siteManage.validateNewUsers=true in sakai.properties
before responding to the email, use reset-pass a second time
with siteManage.validateNewUsers=true in sakai.properties
configure a "New Account" tool instance with a tool property: "validate-through-email", and test it
add an unofficial participant to the site (who isn't already in the system)
Verify you don't get any bug reports and that your mail.support address is used as appropriate
I think that should be a pretty thorough test of all email functionality in reset-pass / account-validator. There's also a "accountValidator.sendLegacyLinks" property, for some old behavior (sends 'reset-pass' users, 'add participants' users, as well as 'new account' users to the same RSF page; it was getting to be impossible to support, so I split everything up at some point in Sakai 2.9, and I strongly recommend discontinuing support for that property).
column163: Yea, if you're confident they would, then just replace it!
column231: How to verify this Jira so it gets merged into 11?
column254:
• Ensure you do not have support.email set in sakai.properties
  • use reset-pass with siteManage.validateNewUsers=false in sakai.properties
  • use reset-pass with siteManage.validateNewUsers=true in sakai.properties
    • before responding to the email, use reset-pass a second time
  • with siteManage.validateNewUsers=true in sakai.properties
    • configure a "New Account" tool instance with a tool property: "validate-through-email", and test it
    • add an unofficial participant to the site (who isn't already in the system)

Verify you don't get any bug reports and that your mail.support address is used as appropriate

I think that should be a pretty thorough test of all email functionality in reset-pass / account-validator. There's also a "accountValidator.sendLegacyLinks" property, for some old behavior (sends 'reset-pass' users, 'add participants' users, as well as 'new account' users to the same RSF page; it was getting to be impossible to support, so I split everything up at some point in Sakai 2.9, and I strongly recommend discontinuing support for that property).

column1: [SAK-29934] Add sakai.property to disable Forums Ranks feature - Phase 1: disabling the Ranks page
column6:
Because of the performance issues ( SAK-29654 Verified ) with the new Forum Ranks feature that we got in Sakai 10 ( SAK-24854 Closed ), we had to create a property to disable the Ranks system to avoid our database from crashing under the hundreds of thousands of queries per hour and the millions of CPU-intensive buffers each hour attribute to the Ranks feature.

However, because of the lack of time over the summer, we decided to implement this property in two phases:

Phase 1 - disable the Ranks page from the UI so that instructors and maintainers cannot add Ranks (this ticket)

Phase 2 - disable the Ranks feature throughout the code ( SAK-29936 Verified )

This ticket will contain the patch for Phase 1.

column1: [SAK-29933] Add getGradesWithoutCommentsForStudentsForItems to GradebookService
column6:
This will be beneficial for anyone who needs to report on grades across multiple gradebook items for multiple students with performance in mind.

Method definition:

/**
     * This method gets grades for multiple gradebook items with emphasis on performance. This is particularly useful for reporting tools
     * @param gradebookUid
     * @param gradableObjectIds
     * @param studentIds
     * @return a Map of GradableObjectIds to a List of GradeDefinitions containing the grade information for the given
     * students for the given gradableObjectIds. Comments are excluded which can be useful for performance.
     * If a student does not have a grade on a gradableObject, the GradeDefinition will be omitted
     * @throws SecurityException if the current user is not authorized with gradeAll in this  gradebook
     * or cannot grade a student in the passed list
     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if gradableObjectIds is null/empty,
     * or if gradableObjectIds contains items that are not members of the gradebook with uid = gradebookUid
     */
    public Map<Long, List<GradeDefinition>> getGradesWithoutCommentsForStudentsForItems(String gradebookUid, List<Long> gradableObjectIds, List<String> studentIds);
