column1: [SAK-29932] Remove/deprecate Mailsender tool from Sakai 11
column6:
There are several issues reported against MailSender in Sakai 11 and I don't believe it's a necessary tool anymore alongside Messages. We asked for a gap analysis and nobody volunteered.

The only options are to fix all of the issues and keep supporting it, or just remove it (and possibly add a few more features to Messages). I'd be more in favor of #2 to consolidate the code.

https://groups.google.com/a/apereo.org/forum/#!topic/sakai-user/nWBey3ZCIL4
column10: Remove/deprecate Mailsender tool from Sakai 11
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Some gap analysis on SAK-29948 Open
column45: Should probably have some conversion script to remove/switch tool ids of mailsender tools.
column49: Chuck suggested on a call just to move the tool registration from mailsender into messages and have it take over the registration. The worst is there would need to be a cleanup if both tools existed, but it wouldn't be too bad even to have both tools placed.
column53:
I have some concerns about this.

Messages was really designed as a PM tool. For us that's a minor role, as most users don't want to have to come to Sakai to read messages. That's why there's no way to add arbitrary email addresses It wasn't conceived as a mail tool. It also seems to send messages always to a private mailbox. You can check "also use email" but that doesn't seem to turn off copies to the private mailbox. We'd really want it to default to just send email.

I'm concerned about the behavior in very large sites. Mail sender lets you ask for roles or users. But Messages produces a single list with all of them. What happens if you use it in a site with 10,000 members?

This seems pretty late in the cycle to remove a tool that's a big deal for our site. I'm also concerned about maintenance. mail sender is a pretty straightforward RSF tool. Messages is part of a system that's really complex, and no one seems to know well enough to do much with. I had to reverse engineer how permissions work to integrate it into Lessons, because no one admitted to being a maintainer for Message Center.
column57: I'm in the process of fixing mailsender. I strongly oppose removing it for 11, unless a lot more work goes into Messages than I think is going to happen at this late date.
column61: Please note SAK-29630 Resolved . I believe mail sender now works. I don't want to see it removed until more work is done on Messages.
column65: Okay, thanks for the fix on that. I think that minimally we should consider putting Mailsender up for deprecation (stealthed). I don't think the all of the gaps will be filled in time for 11, and since you said you have it working we'll just leave it "as-is".
column137: This was blocked for 11 and 12, it may want to be revisited someday.

column1: [SAK-29928] Certain zip files do not upload correctly
column6:
We found that zip files created on certain Ubuntu distributions did not upload correctly into Assignments Upload All feature.

Unfortunately we cannot share the problematic zip file as it contains student data, and could not easily create another zip file with generic data to demonstrate the problem.

Debugging and investigation showed that this code in AssignmentAction was corrupting the file:

tmpFileOut = new FileOutputStream(tempFile);
writeToStream(fileContentStream, tmpFileOut);
tmpFileOut.flush();
tmpFileOut.close();

i.e. the temporary file on disk was not byte-identical to the uploaded file, and subsequent processing of it by the zip libraries failed.

The typical UI error is "Alert: ZIP file is not in correct format. Please ensure there is a grade file and correct folder structure."
column10: Certain zip files do not upload correctly
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
The attached patch resolves the issue on our 10.x system. It has 2 changes:

1. Use java 7 Files.copy method to copy the inputstream to a file rather than the custom writeToStream code (which is problematic in some way)

2. Use java.util.Zip rather than Apache commons-compress zip code.

The second change is probably not necessary but I had made it anyway while investigating, so leave it here as it may be preferably to use built-in java code for this.
column45: Patch for the 11.x branch.

column1: [SAK-38061] Youtube url isn't seen in student's preview in the same way than author's preview
column6:
When an author adds a youtube clip using Add Content -> Embed Content and fills in the url, he is able to see the clip on the preview page, but any student only is able to see a link "Open in new window".

To reproduce this issue:

  • Set the following properties:
    lessonbuilder.basefolder=Lessons
    lessonbuilder.folder.hidden=true
  • Add a youtube clip
    The author is able to see the clip on the preview page, but any student only is able to see the clip clicking on the link "Open in new window".

We think in both author's preview and student's preview, it should be seen the same preview page.

We've solved this issue hidding the main content folder of Lessons but keeping the content accessible to students.
SimplePageBean line 5425:
-edit.setHidden();
+edit.getPropertiesEdit().addProperty(ResourceProperties.PROP_HIDDEN_WITH_ACCESSIBLE_CONTENT, "true");
column10: Youtube url isn't seen in student's preview in the same way than author's preview
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
That's an acceptable fix. But in fact getYoutubeKey is only called from contexts where there's been checking to make sure it's OK to show the video. So the better fix is bypass resources permission checking. That way it will work with old sites that don't use the new type of semi-hidden.

In fact if I were doing it again I'd store the URL as an item property, but I don't think it's worth have two different representations.
column45:

column6:
Release 1.10 - 8/1/2015

  • Tika Config XML can now be used to create composite detectors,
    and exclude detectors that DefaultDetector would otherwise
    have used. This brings support in-line with Parsers. (TIKA-1702)
  • Reverted to legacy sort order of parsers that was
    mistakenly reversed in Tika 1.9 (TIKA-1689).
  • Upgrade to POI 3.13-beta1 (TIKA-1667).
  • Upgrade to PDFBox 1.8.10 (TIKA-1588).
  • MimeTypes now tries to find a registered type with and
    without parameters (TIKA-1692).
  • Added more robust error handling for encoding detection
    of .MSG files (TIKA-1238).
  • Fixed bug in Tika's use of the Jackcess parser that
    prevented reading of v97 Access files (TIKA-1681).
  • Upgrade xerial.org's sqlite-jdbc to 3.8.10.1. NOTE:
    as of Tika 1.9, this jar is "provided." Make sure
    to upgrade your provided jar! (TIKA-1687).
  • Add header/footer extraction to xls (via Aeham Abushwashi)
    (TIKA-1400).
  • Drop the source file name from the embedded file path in
    RecursiveParserWrapper's "X-TIKA:embedded_resource_path"
    (TIKA-1673).
  • Upgraded to Java 7 (TIKA-1536).
  • Non-standards compliant emails are now correctly detected
    as message/rfc822 (TIKA-1602).
  • Added parser for MS Access files via Jackcess. Many thanks
    to Health Market Science, Brian O'Neill and James Ahlborn
    for relicensing Jackcess to Apache v2! (TIKA-1601)
  • GDALParser now correctly sets "nitf" as a supported
    MediaType (TIKA-1664).
  • Added DigestingParser to calculate digest hashes
    and record them in metadata. Integrated with
    tika-app and tika-server (TIKA-1663).
  • Fixed ZipContainerDetector to detect all IPA files
    (TIKA-1659).

column1: [SAK-29925] Web Content and News tool disappears from tool selection menu when user clicks 'Back'
column6:
It is possible to make the Web Content and news tools disappear completely from the tool selection menu.

To reproduce:

  1. Edit a site to add a tool and select the Web Content tool. Click Continue
  2. On the next screen, do not enter a URL.
  3. Click Back
  4. The tool is now missing from the list and an 'Invalid URL' error is at the top of the page.
  5. Similar behaviour for news tool
  6. If you continue to add other tools and click back, the Web Content and News tools are still not in the list and don't come back until you reset.

Expected Behaviour
User can select Web Content or News tool again.

  • Actual Behaviour*
    Web Content and News tools are not in the site list and cannot be selected or deselected. The only way to fix this is to reset the Site Info tool completely and start again, which may result in a loss of configuration data.
column10: Web Content and News tool disappears from tool selection menu when user clicks 'Back'

column1: [SAK-29924] help.hide property no longer works as expected
column6:
The sakai property help.hide used to let you omit help for specific tools by adding the tool id to the property. It no longer functions this way, except for the tool id "sakai.help", which results in hiding all the help content.

Looking at the code, it appears that the sakai.help tool is loading the screensteps help HTML files for all the other tools through the "extraCollections" variable in HelpManagerImpl.registerStaticContent().

I can work on this issue, but I'm not sure how best to restructure things so that the tool id can again be used to omit the associated HTML files. If someone who worked on the original change to the help system in 10 can give me some guidance, that would be useful.
column10: help.hide property no longer works as expected
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
Hi Paul,

The only real hint I have is that this works:

help.hide=OSP Guide
column45:
Having looked at this again, the simplest thing to do is to extend the code that hide categories based on name (ie. OSP Guide) to work at any level of the hierarchy. So, for example, you could set help.hide=Chat and it would hide the Chat subcategory in the Instructor Guide and Student Guide. I have working code for this at the moment (for 10.x at least) and can submit a PR if this is desired as an interim fix. This solution has some advantages (you can hide any category based on the user-facing name even if it isn't associated with a tool), but it also has drawbacks, the main one being localization. However, it doesn't appear that the screensteps help content is currently translated, I can only find English .html files. I don't know what the plan is for this going forward for translations.

A more complex solution to restore the original functionality would likely have to involve adding an optional toolid property to the Category and perhaps the Resource classes (or some other form of mapping) in the help tool, so you could determine in code which tool the category/document belongs to and hide it if desired. All the XML would have to be updated to assign a toolid to each category and/or document with this approach, but it would allow you to set help.hide=sakai.chat to hide any category or document marked with this toolid. If this is a preferred solution, I can work on it.

Out of scope for this issue, but it might be nice in the future to be able to block any document anywhere in the hierarchy by some form of id or id chain. For example, help.hide=Instructor Guide>Chat>3 to block the third document in the Chat subcategory of the instructor guide, if for example the school has the feature covered in the third document disabled.

column1: [SAK-29920] dropbox ZIP should use Display names and not file names as labels for folders
column6:
Potentially, a drop box might contain several hundred folders, of possibly multiple items, for e.g. all students in a year cohort or applicants for a studentship. All of these may need to be downloaded by an administrator or reviewer for use offline.

This is covered by the ability to ZIP a Drop Box at the root folder level.

For this to actually be useful, there needs to be an option that gives the folders in the ZIP export useful names: the same names as the web UI should be used.

Indeed, there should be two export formats: the current format (EIDs?) (so that round tripping will still work) and a 'nice format' where readable names are used.

The labels should be

  • Compress to ZIP Archive (Can Be Reuploaded)
  • Compress to ZIP Archive (Readable Folder Names)

In addition, the on-screen display names should be changed to include the username in parentheses just in case there s more than one "John Smith" in a site, for example, the drop Box should have the following folders

+ .....
+ Smith, Jack (ouit0654)
+ Smith, John (hild0123)
+ Smith, John (kble0654)
+ Smith, Jonathan (wazo0987)
+ ......

If this massively over-complicates things then lets discuss what to do (such as use email address instead?)
column10: dropbox ZIP should use Display names and not file names as labels for folders

Edit: I guess the new default is better, anyone using this won't miss it.

column1: [SAK-29918] Add option to show the Read count in Forum messages
column6:
To have a setting in either the "Template Settings" or in each "Forum Settings" that has the option to show or hide the read count, "Read by: #", in the messages.

Perhaps it could be an On/Off, or have a few options:

  • never - don't show to anyone
  • never to students - All non-students can view the count

column1: [SAK-38710] Set JDBC connection to ReadOnly when reading
column6:
MariaDB JDBC driver has nice ability to use slave database for read-only queries:

https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/failover-and-high-availability-with-mariadb-connector-j/

For a cluster composed of masters and slaves on connection initialization, there will be 2 underlying connections: one with a master host, another with a slave host. Only one connection is used at a time.
Its the application that has to decide to use master or slave connection (the master connection is set by default).
Switching the type of connection is done by using JDBC connection.setReadOnly(boolean readOnly) method. Setting read-only to true will use the slave connection, false, the master connection.
column10: Set JDBC connection to ReadOnly when reading

column1: [SAK-29917] Option to include course site external tools in course copy process
column6:
The ability to include external tools created at the course site in a course copy process would be a great addition to Sakai. The previous BLTI functionality allowed tools to be carried forward in the duplicate site process, however that isn't optimal and no longer valid with the newer 2.9.4+ External Tools functionality.

The preference would be an option to move tools over in the copy process and/or import from site process. Not all tools make sense to be added at the Admin worksite level.

column1: [SAK-29915] Create a Javascript namespace strategy
column6:
Sakai would benefit from a javascript namespace strategy as we have had functions stepping on each other for example:

function update(arg1) { }
function update(arg1, arg2) { }

The last function that is loaded is the one that prevails.

For some info on namespaces see https://javascriptweblog.wordpress.com/2010/12/07/namespacing-in-javascript/

With all that said we should be probably be looking at using requirejs and using their definition of module, see http://requirejs.org/docs/api.html#define

thoughts?
column10: Create a Javascript namespace strategy

column1: [SAK-29914] Make calendar export period to configurable
column6:
Currently when you export a calendar you get 6 months in the past and 6 months in the future in the ICS file

Change this date range to a configuration property (so you set the #months in the past AND the # months into the future as properties)

If no properties are set then the range should be -6 to +6, if a property is set then the range should be adjusted accordingly.

Locally, set the range to be 6 months in the past and 12 months in the future.

column1: [SAK-29909] Regression: no need to collapse left tool menu when needing more horizontal space
column6:
As we discussed on the Morpheus call today, we used to be able to collapse the side left tool menu in a site when we needed more horizontal space, such as when viewing the Gradebook. However, we lost that feature with Morpheus.

On the call, it was revealed that this was on purpose, but attendees agreed that there is the need for more room. Users might want more space when they are visiting any tool.

The addition of expand and collapse buttons to the interface was suggested:
http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/expand/
http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/compress/

I don't think we should hide the tool menu permanently as that will cause navigation issues and more clicks.

It was suggested that the expand button could convert the page to a view like the mobile size/view.

Mockup required before proceeding.

column1: [SAK-36833] Access denied error when attempting to download all responses, can only download responses individually
column6:
When viewing scores, clicking on Questions->Download responses displays the following error:

You do not have permission to access this media. If you are not currently logged in, please log in and try again. If you are logged in and believe you should be able to view this file, please contact your local support for help.

In addition, clicking Okay on this window does nothing. The user is then logged out of the application or unable to do anything without closing the window.

If you want to see all of the responses (for instance in a file upload question type) you have to click and download each of them individually.

See test plan to replicate.
column10: Access denied error when attempting to download all responses, can only download responses individually
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
The problem here lies in the class:

org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.ui.bean.authz.AuthorizationBean

This is a new object introduced in the SAM-2533 patch.
DownloadAllMediaServlet.java now goes to it to do authorization checks rather than
the method canGrade(req, res, agentIdString, currentSiteId, assessmentCreatedBy))

The method in AuthorizationBean that isn't working in this particular case is:

public boolean isUserAllowedToGradeAssessment(final String assessmentId, final String assessmentOwnerId, final boolean published) {
if (!isAssessmentInSite(assessmentId, published))

{ return false; }

// Second check on the realm permissions
if (getGradeAnyAssessment())

{ return true; }

else if (getGradeOwnAssessment()) { final String loggedInUser = AgentFacade.getAgentString(); return StringUtils.equals(loggedInUser, assessmentOwnerId); }

return false;
}

What isn't working is the call to sAssessmentInSite(assessmentId, published)

I found two things wrong, the first of which was fixable, but the second, so far, isn't

The first thing was it wasn't getting a siteId. The call goes to a facade that derives the siteId from a call to
AgentFacade.getCurrentSiteId(). This was returning null. I experimented with getting the siteId at the time of instantiation
and storing it locally and then making the proper three argument call. This resolved that problem. However, the
method itself gathers a list of all the siteId's that have a particular assessmentId:

public static boolean isAssessmentInSite(final String assessmentId, final String siteId, final boolean published) {
// get list of site that this published assessment has been released to
List<AuthorizationData> l = PersistenceService.getInstance().getAuthzQueriesFacade().getAuthorizationByFunctionAndQualifier(published ? "OWN_PUBLISHED_ASSESSMENT" : "EDIT_ASSESSMENT", assessmentId);

for (int i=0; i < l.size(); i++) {
String assessmentSiteId = (l.get).getAgentIdString();
if (siteId.equals(assessmentSiteId)){ return true; }

}

return false;
}

That list returns empty, so it is unable to determine whether the assessment is in the site or not, and returns false.

Anybody who applies the SAM-2533 patch will disable the ability of instructors to inspect file upload questions in samigo.
Any ideas on how to resolve this ?
column45:
The problem in this case is the fact that DownloadMediaAllServelt is a servlet which lives
out of the context of the jsp (QuestionScore.jsp) that links to it. So things inside of the new AuthorizationBean (brought in via SAM-2533) like AgentFacade.getCurrentSiteId()
don't work because there is no valid Placement for that servlet, it's kind of floating off there in space.
Also, its call to isUserAllowedToGradeAssessment supplies the wrong argument - AuthorizationBean want the PublishedAssessmentId
not the publishedItemId. I have a patch that addresses this, and we're in the process of vetting it at U.Va. to see if the patch addresses the issue cleanly without causing additional problems

column1: [SAK-37592] Import/export doesn't respect the original order
column6:
At our university some teachers created content with Lessons (you can see an example attatched). They exported the content and another teacher imported it in another site.
The result was that the content it's imported well, but the chapters don't appear in the original order.
Later, we have done some tests about that and some times the order was respected and some times wasn't.
We've found that in the items of the imported pages, the sequence field is 1 in all the registers of the table LESSON_BUILDER_ITEMS, we thought this is the raison of the random order in the content.
We don't know whether the error is in exporting or in importing the content.

column1: [SAK-29894] Add unit tests for CXF based SOAP services
column6:
Currently there are no unit tests for web services and some of them fail.

One type of error is that of returning null:
rg.apache.cxf.interceptor.Fault: Cannot write part return. RPC/Literal parts cannot be null. (WS-I BP R2211)

These types are not allowed according to the spec.
http://www.ws-i.org/profiles/basicprofile-1.1.html#Bindings_and_Parts
See section 4.4.1
R2211 An ENVELOPE described with an rpc-literal binding MUST NOT have the xsi:nil attribute with a value of "1" or "true" on the part accessors.

If there are other issues that people are also witnessing I urge them to use this test framework to write a simple unit test that replicates the error they are expierencing.
column10: Add unit tests for CXF based SOAP services
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29893] Maintain submission history for assignments that includes submission contents
column6:
Every time a student resubmits or saves a draft, it updates their row in the assignment_submission table. These updates overwrite the student's previous submission, so all previous submission content is gone and unrecoverable. We would like to retain the full submission content for all submissions rather than overwriting the previous one.

It would be nice to give students and instructors the ability to refer to the full content of previous submissions. This would also solve the problem that occurs when saving a draft after submitting, as the draft replaces the submission, resulting in the instructor not being able to view the original submission if the student does not submit the draft. This has lead to support calls along the lines of Student claims they submitted; instructor cannot view submission.

Given that we would need to store a separate row for each submission / draft, there are some challenges to overcome. For example, rather than getting the single submission object for the instructor's view, we would need to pull the most recent non-draft submission. Other concerns include:

  • performance concerns with storing everything in the XML column
  • maintaining compatibility with legacy data vs converting legacy data

Performance:
From a performance perspective, we wouldn't want to grab all submissions for an assignment and then filter out the drafts in application code. It would be more efficient to have the database perform the filtering for us. We propose moving the draft attribute out of the XML blob and storing it in a dedicated column in the table. This would for example allow us to efficiently query for a student's most recent non-draft submission for the instructor view.

Compatibility:
If a new draft column is introduced, we need to deal with legacy submissions. Some options include:

  • Introducing an attribute (call it draft_version) on the assignment which determines whether its associated submissions' draft information is stored in the XML blob vs in the draft column. Code would need to determine which is the case and run the appropriate logic.
  • Script to read the draft value out of the blob and populate the column for all existing submissions.

But is there interest in the community for the removal of all / most of the XML attributes into designated table columns? Considering the proposal to extract the 'draft' attribute from XML into its own column, and introduce a 'draft_version' column to maintain legacy data, if we then discover that we need similarly to extract other attributes, we would continue introducing new 'version' attributes for each attribute we want to pull out of the XML. It would be best to do it all at once, and either do a full conversion of existing rows, or set the version attribute one time for legacy vs current.
column10: Maintain submission history for assignments that includes submission contents
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: Brian Baillargeon Hey Brian, there is interest in converting the XML into columns. I think this would have to be the first major step before this is done. This might be something that is being worked on soon.

column1: [SAK-29890] GradebookService.getViewableAssignmentsForCurrentUser returns duplicates
column6:
Discovered in the development of GradebookNG.

Problem
When a TA is granted multiple permission rules that provide overlap for a given category, the category's items are duplicated in the TA's view.

E.g., TA is granted "View" access to ALL categories in the Gradebook, but "Grade" access to only 1 category (let's call it "Homework"). When the TA views the GB, they will see all of the items in "Homework" twice.

Investigation
Under the above settings, the assignment list is duplicated.

This is because the checks will satisfy BOTH:

if (getGradebookPermissionService().getPermissionForUserForAllAssignment(gradebook.getId(), userUid)) { assignmentsToReturn = getAssignments(gradebookUid); }

*and* the following iteration of assignments within categories, which then adds more assignments to the assignmentsToReturn variable.

This is proven by stepping through this method with a debugger from access of both Gradebook and GradebookNG, and a watch on assignmentsToReturn. If there are two assignments, it will end up with 4.

Gradebook must be then removing duplicates which is dumb, the list should have just been reduced in the first place.

Note that this DOES affect previous versions of the gradebook but there are no other clients using it so not worth a merge IMO.
column10: GradebookService.getViewableAssignmentsForCurrentUser returns duplicates
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-37434] A warning message is needed before deleting a Lessons page component
column6:
This Jira was made a result of reported issue. An instructor created a Lessons Student page for a group and added only one component to the page: text block. She also enabled the 'commenting' feature for that student page. Then she asked her students to edit and comment on the text block. By accident the text block was deleted by one of group members. As a result, comments on the page disappeared.

This made me think that itd be very useful to add a safe net by showing a warning message before deleting a component on any Lessons page. This will also make it consistent with other tools, e.g. a warning message appears when deleting a forum topic or a resource file.

  • Log into a site
  • Add a Lessons tool if it has not been added
  • Click 'Add Content'>'Add text' to add some text on the page and click 'Save'
  • Now you are back to the individual student page . Click on 'Edit' next to the text component and then click 'Delete'.
  • You should get a warning before deleting the component.
column10: A warning message is needed before deleting a Lessons page component
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

  • Click 'Add Content'>'Add text' to add some text on the page and click 'Save'
  • Now you are back to the Lessons page . Click on 'Edit' next to the text block and then click 'Delete'.
  • Before deleting the component, a warning message should show. Something along the line:

"You are about to delete this component (any associated stuff if there is any). Are you sure you want to delete it? "

column1: [SAK-35453] Error importing an EMI question with format "Rich text / Attachments" from question pool to assessment
column6:
1.- Create a new question type EMI whith format "Rich text / Attachments " in a Question Pool.
2.- In this question Enter a option text and Add a Attachment below.
3.- Set the number of options in this question.
4.- Set Item Stems and add a attachment in each either and save.
5.- Import to a assessment the question type EMI from the Questin Pool.
6.- When the question has been copied in the assessment, edit it and you'll see that the format of EMI is "Simple text - for a list of items with no formatting" not "Rich text / Attachments...". If you choose that format "Rich text / Attachments..." the original configuration of the question appears, but without attachments of the Item Stems.

A Survey question which has an image uploaded by CK Editor.
A Calculated question which has an image uploaded by CK Editor.

3. Publish it.

column1: [SAK-29885] PA System isn't loading under jQuery 1.11.x
column6:
The recent upgrade to jQuery 1.11.x tripped code we had in the PA System which checks the jQuery version before loading. We'd set it to only load if jQuery 1.9.x was present, but that's too restrictive since anything newer should be fine too.

This issue will update the checking code to fail gracefully if jQuery is too old, but will work for anything >= 1.9.

column57:
I have a working version of this for resources. Attached is a screenshot of elfinder with a skin that uses the Font Awesome icons to match Sakai. There is an extension to elfinder which adds the ability to pick a specific file and allow the user to accept/cancel this selection. By default FCKEditor is still used but elfinder can be switched in with the configuration:

wysiwyg.editor.ckeditor.browser=elfinder

Currently the browser allows you to pick from resources/dropbox. There is proof of concept code for Forums, but it needs permissions checks to be done. Although this isn't "finished" as it's enabled with a property I think it would be good to review it where it is now and get it into Sakai where is can develop further.
column61:
To support a new tool you need to have a class implement
org.sakaiproject.elfinder.sakai.SiteVolumeFactory
To implement SiteVolumeFactory you will probably need to implement
most of cn.bluejoe.elfinder.service.FsVolume although for read-only
tools you can extend org.sakaiproject.elfinder.sakai.ReadOnlyFsVolume

At the moment there is support for content hosting and disabled
support for forums as the permission checks aren't yet done.

column1: [SAK-29873] Allow non maintain role users to see unpublished sites in worksite setup and filter active/inactive sites
column6:
I'm contributing a feature we created for several of our clients that allows non-maintainer users to see unpublished sites in the worksite setup page of their workspace. The unpublished sites appear in the list with their titles grayed-out and without a clickable link to the site. There are also two new filters added to the view combo box allowing non-maintain users to view only published or unpublished sites. This only affects members of an unpublished site where they do not have the site.upd permission.

To enable this feature add the following to sakai.properties.
sitesetup.show.unpublished=true (Default is false)
column10: Allow non maintain role users to see unpublished sites in worksite setup and filter active/inactive sites

column1: [SAK-29868] Double clicking header column in Resources Folder Permissions toggles unselectable items
column6:
In "Edit Folder Permissions" if a user double clicks the header of a column all permissions checkboxes in togled, including ones that should not be changed, such as read.

Saving the permissions ignores the changes to the otherwise unmodifiable item.

In Sakai 2.9 Resource's Edit Folder Permissions dialog defaults had everyone's read permissions as a fixed, checked, image in the corresponding cell. (If you want to hide the folder, go to options and hide the folder).

In 10.5 all the cells have checkboxes, but read is blurred, unselectable, and checked.... EXCEPT that you can uncheck it when you toggle the header row.

Maybe I'm not understanding what's being presented, but at the very least, the deselection doesn't save.

Comparison video: http://www.screencast.com/t/fvXj6Orow
column10: Double clicking header column in Resources Folder Permissions toggles unselectable items
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Hi Matt Clare. We looked at this in QA call and we weren't able to reproduce. Feel free to reopen if I've missed something here.
column45: Great news. Thanks.
column87:
In a Resources:
Create a folder
Choose "Actions" > "Edit Folder Permissions"
Double click a header row a number of times, each time only the selectable checkboxes (those that be modified onClick) should change.

column1: [SAK-29867] Correct the view course grade permission check to not conflict with existing permission checks
column6:
The addition of the view_course_grade permission needs the other permission checks to be tweaked so that they specifically test for the permission they desire.

This is because the methods getPermissionsForUserAnyCategory and getPermissionsForUserAnyGroup check for any category/group that have null values, and assume that the user has permission, however the view_course_grade permission check explicitly sets null values for its fields as it doesn't apply to a specific category or group.

So this change will adjust those two methods to check for the view and grade permission explicitly. The permission checks where categories/groups are specified are unaffected.
column10: Correct the view course grade permission check to not conflict with existing permission checks

column1: [SAK-29857] getPrivateForumByOwnerAreaWithAllTopics results in a bad MySQL query plan
column6:
To replicate you really need a database with lots of forums, messages, etc. At least 500k rows in MFR_TOPIC_T

getPrivateForumByOwnerAreaWithAllTopics is a method that is supposed to retrieve the private forums, topics, children all in one query. But this query results in two joins onto the same table. In MySQL 5.6+ I'm seeing this query ignore an index on the children table resulting in a full table scan (E.g., 4 seconds to load Messages instead of 0.05 seconds).
column10: getPrivateForumByOwnerAreaWithAllTopics results in a bad MySQL query plan

column1: [SAK-29856] Webdav encoding issue with Finder in OS X
column6:
When using the Webdav in Finder in OS X (at least in 10.9 Mavericks and 10.10 Yosemite) it is not encoding all characters correct.

Example with the same result on both qa10 and trunk:
The folder name is "Tvan igen"

From webdav the url is created like: https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/access/content/user/jonas/Tva%CC%8Aan%20igen/

The correct url created from inside resources is: https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/access/content/user/jonas/Tv%C3%A5an%20igen/

%C3%A5 is the letter "" in utf8 url encoded.
%CC%8A has the name COMBINING RING ABOVE.

  • Safari understand the %CC%8A sequence andprints it correct, the letter "". But when clicking the folder the post/get is not interpreted correct by sakai which results in error message: The collection does not exist
  • Firefox and IE 11 understands it but prints the ring after the "a"
  • Chrome understands it and prints correct, the letter ""

I guess the help text in Resources is explaining it...

Note 1. Depending upon the exact update of OS X, The Webdav support in the Macintosh Finder may well be too buggy to use. If you have problems with this approach, consider using Cyberduck.
column10: Webdav encoding issue with Finder in OS X
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: It seems to be using utf-8-mac. Any suggestion here? I mean any suggestion besides using Cyberduck.

column1: [SAK-39326] User can't login if user-agent header text is larger than 255
column6:
I've found some request in the sakai error reports that shows login requests from iOS browser that are larger than 256.
Ex:
Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 8_4_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/600.1.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/12H321 [FBAN/FBIOS;FBAV/38.0.0.6.79;FBBV/14316658;FBDV/iPhone6,2;FBMD/iPhone;FBSN/iPhone OS;FBSV/8.4.1;FBSS/2; FBCR/OrangeEspaa;FBID/phone;FBLC/es_ES;FBOP/5]

It results in a exception while trying to save the session:
—
caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-12899: valor massa gran per a la columna "SAKAI29"."SAKAI_SESSION"."SESSION_USER_AGENT" (real: 256, mxim: 255)

IMO it should be increased a bit.
column10: User can't login if user-agent header text is larger than 255
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This actually sounds more like your NLS_LENGTH_SEMANTICS were set to byte rather than char when you setup the tables. I wrote about this here and how to convert.
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/pipermail/sakai-dev/2014-February/026482.html

You (we) could probably specify VARCHAR(255 CHAR) as the type here but we'd probably have to do this in every Oracle script everywhere.

http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28318/datatype.htm#CDEFDGFE

I'm surprised I don't see this documented anywhere, but there also aren't many schools that run Oracle anymore. I think if you fixed this, this would be a non-issue.
column45:
It make sense, I'll close the PR. I just write here the query for somebody needs to increase this particular field if the TABLES are already created.

ALTER TABLE SAKAI_SESSION MODIFY SESSION_USER_AGENT VARCHAR2 (255 CHAR)
column49: Well I rewrote the PR just in case we want to correct this particular case. I think others (no many) ORACLE users must have the same issue and this should resolve a problem that probably they may not know. But I'm fine in closing too ... You decide.
column53: My only problem with just changing this instance is I'm sure there will be bugs with other instances of VARCHAR being incorrect, all of them in all the Oracle scripts should be updated as suggested on the email thread. Either that or we should document it better how to set the default and how to convert. Changing just this one would solve this problem but I feel like there's more issues that will come up. While these would be tested on nightly, I'd prefer someone who runs Oracle update these scripts.
column57: I'm also not sure what hibernate does either, respects this setting or creates it with CHAR? If all of the scripts were changed we'd still need a conversion script or process documented.
column61:
I think this one is critical because of its effect, the user can't login because of his user-agent. However, is good to fix all cases, so one script to convert all fields makes sense to me.
We also need to check what columns are created as byte in Sakai OOTB to fix the scripts.
column65:
Juanjo Meroo I'm fine with whatever you want to do here, I just think fixing one is going to leave dozens more columns with error possibilities.

I set nightly to nls_length_semantics=byte and this query on nightly returns 299 rows

select table_name||' '||column_name||' '||data_type from user_tab_columns where char_used = 'B';

This query (only looking at <= 255 returns 264 rows. There are a lot of things in there that look like they'd have a problem if you used byte type here.

select table_name||' '||column_name||' '||data_length from user_tab_columns where char_used = 'B' AND data_length <= 255;

This would generate all of the alter statements to change in-place columns, but it would be different for each installation since they have different combinations of tools installed. But with nls_length_semantics still set as byte, any new columns ever created might need adjustment.

select 'ALTER TABLE '||table_name||' MODIFY ('||column_name||' '||data_type||'('||data_length||' CHAR));' from user_tab_columns where char_used='B';
column137: Alter existing database to change BYTE to CHAR is pretty easy and safe. The hard work is check how many fields are created as BYTE in a Sakai OOTB and check the scripts to ensure that all are created as CHAR, and be aware of new added fileds to always define as CHAR
column163: This is the patch for version 10.x. I've created the 10.5 to 10.6 sql conversion script
column231:

SAK-39326 Closed merge PR 1043 from git (enietzel@anisakai.com: rev 321801)
column254:
It looks like the sql conversions script is tagged for Sakai 11. Does there need to be one for Sakai 10.5 -> Sakai 10.6 as well?

Thanks.
column258: Neal Caidin There was a conversion committed as part of this in the merge

column283: Right, no needed for the release notes.

column1: [SAK-38731] UserDirectoryService could use a way to return all userid's
column6:
We're trying to fix SakaiScript addNewToolToAllWorkspaces. It claims to add a tool to all worksites, but actually adds it only to manually created users, not those from a provider. It does that because it calls UserDIrectoryService.getUsers, which returns List<User> for all entries in SAKAI_USER.

There are other methods for returning all users from external providers. But it seems to me that if you're building a tool that's going to process a large group of users, you probably only want the user ID. You'll get the User class inside the loop if you really need it. (In this case we don't) Indeed for this method, they get a List<user> and then throw away the extra data, producing a List<String> of just the userID's.

So I think a better primitive for the API would be to get all user id's, and probably also a filtered version.
column10: UserDirectoryService could use a way to return all userid's

column1: [SAK-29859] Cannot create site from admin workspace
column6:
Creating a course site from 'Worksite Setup' within the Admin workspace results in a bug report after clicking 'continue' at the description screen. This is reproducible from within prod and ctqa, but not ctdev.

This is an error visible only when there is a LTI tool configured in system with site_id associated with it.

To recreate:
1. login to https://trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org as an admin
2. Go to the Admin site "/site/!admin"
3. Go to the "External Tools" tool, and create a LTI tool with site_id associated
3. Open the Worksite Setup tool
4. Click 'New'
5. Choose course site or project site
5a For Course Site 'Still cannot find your course' enter 'testing 101 001'
6. Enter a description and click continue.

Bug report should occur at this point:
org.sakaiproject.portal.api.PortalHandlerException: org.sakaiproject.tool.api.ToolException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at org.sakaiproject.portal.charon.SkinnableCharonPortal.doGet(SkinnableCharonPortal.java:837)
caused by: org.sakaiproject.tool.api.ToolException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.toolModeDispatch(SiteAction.java:14880)
caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.buildLTIToolContextForTemplate(SiteAction.java:3830)
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.buildContextForTemplate(SiteAction.java:1714)
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.buildMainPanelContext(SiteAction.java:1316)

So it looks like the problem here changing the sequence is calling submit on the form which is triggering the Update Points action. After the sequences are updated (correctly) the scores are updated to be the values that they were on the form, which puts them in the incorrect places.

I'm not sure how 10.x stopped this, I'm guessing there was some change here though? This is going to have to either stop this "Update Points" action from triggering on the sequence update or call some other method to get the POST to trigger.

column1: [SAK-29845] Category average calculation error
column6:
From: https://github.com/steveswinsburg/gradebookNG/issues/196

Category subtotal percentages (within the subtotal columns/student summary/student view and when calculated in the Course Grade) are reflecting null values, calculating them as 0's.

E.g., A category contains two items, each worth 100 pts. Student receives a 90/100 on one item, with no value supplied to the second. Category subtotal should display as 90% (90/100), but is instead displaying as 45% (90/200).

GB1 ignores null values in order to give subtotal/course grade calculations based solely off of entered grades.

column41: Oh Snap. What happens if the tool loads jQuery and then calls jQuery.noConflict() in the tool markup. The post-tool-markup code in portal needs to be aware that this might be the case.

This needs more testing to run through some Signup scrnarios - but with these changes - things look pretty clean.

column1: [SAK-29838] CKEditor autosave looks at wrong assignment
column6:
To reproduce:

1) As instructor, create an assignment. Pay attention to what you write in the Assignment Instructions.

2) Create a new assignment. Before getting a chance doing anything, an auto save dialogue asks if you want to compare content versions, which makes no sense since you have not written anything yet in this new assignment.

3) Click ok. You'll see the text it provides from auto save is from the earlier assignment which you successfully created.

Here is a video showing the issue:
http://www.screencast.com/t/XjUIafAlImI
column10: CKEditor autosave looks at wrong assignment
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
The following CKEditor config is used to detect actions which denote a successful operation and that the cache should be cleared of the users saved entry.

autosave_saveDetectionSelectors : 

"input[id*='save'],input[name*='save'],input[name*='cancel'],input[id*='cancel'],input[id*='post'],input[name*='post']",

adding the jquery selector "input[id*='post'],input[name*='post']" will catch the following button on the Add Assignment template:

<input accesskey="s" type="button" class="active" name="post" id="post" value="Post" onclick="javascript:document.newAssignmentForm.onsubmit();showNotif('submitnotif','post','newAssignmentForm');document.getElementById('option').value='post';document.newAssignmentForm.submit();return false;">

If this becomes to unwieldy to manage I would suggest selecting on any input action (aka button press) to invalidate the cache as this is really meant to catch when the user doesn't perform any action in a reasonable amount of time.
column45:
So I after some more thought about my last comment I think something like this is better:

autosave_saveDetectionSelectors : "form input[type='button'],form input[type='submit']"

This means that whenever a user clicks a button or submit button (they are different) in a form it will invalidate the auto save cache.
column49: Was unable to duplicate in trunk following steps provided in screencast.

column1: [SAK-37457] "Direct Link" should go directly to the subpage it was linked from
column6:
Direct link was added to lessons in SAK-37710 Verified but this link on any page is the same. It always goes back to the top level of that lessons tool rather than the subpage that it was linked from. The user expectation would be that it would go directly to the page it was clicked on.

I'm not sure at the moment even if this would be technically possible without some work to directtool, Like perhaps you could add some parameters which would indicate what subpage it would go to but I don't know if that extra URL info is passed along or not. I'm just filing it as an issue for now. You could just close if you think it's not feasible.
column10: "Direct Link" should go directly to the subpage it was linked from
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Direct link is actually generated by the portal, at least in Sakai 11. It's a Sakai-wide thing that goes to the tool, not to individual assignments, etc.Of course i could hack on it in Javascript.

It is certainly possible to generate a link to a page. Index of pages does it. I can also add all of them to the map used by site copy. But this is something to look at for the portal. It would be easier to make the URLs in index of pages in a standard format, and add them to the site copy map. You can certainly copy and past URLs from index of pages, but they won't be preserved in a copy. They have a complex form, which may not be invariant over versions, which is why I'd need to standardize them.

column1: [SAK-29837] Controling focus on page load in Morpheus
column6:
Pre-Morpheus in Sakai (with a modern browser) when a student moves from item to item (ie. quiz questions, resource folders, forum topic) focus is placed on the content automatically. This is technically because the actions are occurring in an iframe. iFrames are their own full web pages and many specs, like WCAG2, dictate that focus be placed at the top of the page on load - and possibly it's by design too.

In trunk/Sakai 11 focus is placed at the top of the "entire" of the page. This is a change from how Sakai previously worked, but also how other web pages and other LMSs handle this. In addition, Sakai also places at the top of the page the "Jump to content" accesskey to either select or press ctrl+c to jump right back to that next question (though, there's a related regression SAK-29771 Verified ).

It would be desirable to allow tools to place initial focus in a useful location. Certainly error notices and actions (ie. SAK-34478 Open ) and also when it's clear users would either use keyboard nav or their mouse to immediately skip to the #tocontent div.

Options considered in related SAK-29855 Closed include if the portal selected the first important element or if tool could send a hint to portal.
column10: Controling focus on page load in Morpheus
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-29836] Upgrade jQuery to 1.11.3 and load bootstrap.js by default
column6: This will normalize the JavaScript loading in the Portal. We will upgrade to jQuery 1.11.3, make sure UI, Migrate, and Bootstrap are all loaded in the right order.
column10: Upgrade jQuery to 1.11.3 and load bootstrap.js by default
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
So I changed portal,reference and a number of files in my first commit.

In a second commit - I will switch files to using includeLatestJQuery() instead of hand-including the files to make sure that the tools (a) can be changed all at once and (b) so that they all use the CDN for their JavaScript files.
column45:
One of the cool features is that if a tool (like profile2) loads the right version of jQuery but not migrate, UI, and bootstrap, the portal code and the headscripts.js includeLatestJQuery() code will detect the missing plugins and add them to that version of JQuery instead of loading a whole new copy of JQuery for the portal.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13933000/how-to-check-if-twitter-bootstrap-is-loaded

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2260250/testing-if-jqueryui-has-loaded

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18309578/jquery-migrate-cdn-fallback-condition

See attached image for the output when profile2 runs.
column49: Just as a note, the loading order loads jQuery UI after Bootstrap. So where there is overlap, UI wins. This might lead to glitchiness for tools that really want Bootstrap all the way. The most obvious possible overlap is the quite different approach to modals that both use.

column1: [SAK-34129] Many question types lack proper HTML structures
column6:
File Upload: Label should be question instructions, possibly using aria-labelledby.

Fill in the Blank: I'd recommend a title property on each blank of "please fill in the blanks" OR a label preceding the question of something like "Please fill in the following N blanks" ( SAK-34555 Verified )

Matching: Label should be the choice

Numeric Response: I'd recommend a title property on each blank of "please fill in the blanks" OR a label preceding the question of something like "Please fill in the following N blanks with a numeric response"

Short Answer/Essay: Character count should be labelled. Text area should have the question stem as the label.

Others I'm noting I don't have a suggestion for:

  • Survey matrix: Maybe a title combining row and column?
  • Calculated Question: Stem of the question should be the label.

Student Audio Response: ...I think this is fine. I'm not familiar with best practices here.

column1: [SAK-29831] Group assignment submissions are inaccessible if group membership later changes
column6:
The collaborative group feature of assignments (i.e. one submission per group) has a design flaw, in that if the group memberships change between one assignment and the next, then the association of students with their submission is lost.

For example:

Instructor groups students into Group 1: student A, student B, and Group 2: student C, student D.

For Assignment 1, student A submits and student C submits. So there are submissions for Group 1 and Group 2.

Later, student B and student D both drop the course. The instructor makes a new group, group 3, and places student A and student B in it. Because the Assignments tool requires unique group membership, the instructor is forced to remove these students from Group 1 and 2 respectively.

Student A and Student C can now no longer see their submissions for Assignment 1 - it appears as if they have never submitted.

As the assignment submission includes the list of students submitting the assignment in the submission XML, that list should be used whenever the submission is referenced, rather than constructing the list anew each time from the group membership.
column10: Group assignment submissions are inaccessible if group membership later changes
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
I think can be useful to flag the group as in-use and prevent it from being deleted or modified.

Has relation with https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-27980
column45:
In Sakai 10.5, the XML column in the assignment_submission table includes a list of students inside the group when the assignment was submitted (1.png). In 12.x this list is not included, only the submitterid being this the group ID (2.png).

With SAK-27980 resolved, we prevent editting a group "in use" (group assigned in a group assignment), so this error is not reproducible. Only if a student is removed from the site and is added again (student now is not a member of the group and cannot see his submission) we can reproduce it.

Which solution would you see right?
column49:
Just some points :
1) As Jose Cebe comments, the assignment XML no longer contains a list of goup participants, but a reference to the group.
2) The problem described comes because in earlier versions, we can choose a "Group submission" and also available to all users in site. Now (Sakai 12x), when the "Group submission" is checked, we are forced to select the affected groups.
3) Thanks to https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-27980, we are not allowed to modify a group if is used by a group submission.

Because of all of this, I thinks this JIRA is no longer reproducible.

I think I'm seeing something similar with drag and drop uploads in the Dropbox tool, where notifications are sent to users within the site who should not be receiving them. The bad email will usually have the subject: <site title> - New dropbox items in folder "<filename>" . The link in the email will be to another filename previously uploaded to another users' dropbox with drag and drop. Note that the 'folder name' in the email subject is actually the name of a file. Maybe the events are being generated or parsed improperly?
column45:
I am aware of this ticket but I will be out of work for two weeks, so I can't investigate it right now.

Most of the code of SiteEmailNotificationDragAndDrop.java was copied from SiteEmailNotificationContent.java at kernel-impl. Maybe some bug has been fixed in the kernel class and has not been applied to content class?

If you can wait two weeks, I will take a look ASAP. And if you can add detailed steps to replicate the issue it would be great.

Note that in trunk there is another JIRA applied currently on that code: SAK-11647 Closed
column49:
To duplicate:

1. Go to Dropbox Options, and select "Allow notifications to be sent".
2. Upload "file 1.txt" to student 1's folder using drag and drop.
3. Upload "file 2.txt" to student 2's folder using "Switch to file browser upload", and check the box marked "Send an email notification to the student."

Student 2 will receive an email with the subject:
New dropbox items in folder "file 2.txt".
The body of that e-mail contains a link to file 1.txt, inside student 1's folder.
column53: This can also be triggered from 'Upload files to multiple dropbox folders' instead of 'switch to file browser upload', I'm not sure if it's the same issue or a similar one.
column57:
notificationService.addTransientNotification() is being called inside the new method notifyDragAndDropCompleted(HttpServletRequest request) in ResourcesHelperAction.java. That function is called every time a user uploads 1 or more files with drag and drop in dropbox. addTransientNotification() creates an event listener in application scope. It will respond to any event matching its filters for the lifetime of the application.

Any non-drag-and-drop upload to the dropbox (using 'browse' or 'multiple folders') throws an event that these transient notifications catch. They then send out a malformed email that includes links to all the files in the fileList from the original notification.

addTransientNotifcation should probably only be called once for one type of notification, within an init method.
column61:
I have done a PR of a simple patch to fix this. I forgot to propertly clean up the file list in the new D&D Notifications class after the upload has finished.

The list is cleaned every time a new D&D upload starts, but if a usual file upload is done the list is still available and the issue happens.

https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/1141

column1: [SAK-36693] Redirected to Working copies tab after checking/saving settings for a published assessment
column6:
If you open the settings for a published assessment and select "Save" or "Cancel", instead of the expected outcome of going back to the list of published assessments (the published copies tab), the user sees the list of working copies (the working copies tab).

This can be frustrating for lecturers that are using Samigo for multiple quizzes and class tests (e.g. 10+), and need to go through and check each assessment is correctly set up. It adds an additional step where they need to go back to the published copies tab each time.

3. You do not need to make any edits, just click "Save" or "Cancel"

Expected outcome:
Afterwards, the page should go back to the "Published copies" tab (see screenshot) where you selected the "settings" option for the published assessment

Actual outcome:

column1: [SAK-36691] Dates in Samigo aren't consistent with other tools or user expectations
column6:
I was testing out Samigo and noticed that in 11, it sets all 3 dates by default to the time the assessment was created. This forces the user to change the dates to something in order for the assessment to be visible at all. This isn't the same behavior as 10, and doesn't sound like what was mentioned on SAK-36417 Resolved that suggested consistency with assignments. This is 12AM the date created, then 5PM 1 week later.

In the attachment, it has the dates assignment sets by default on top and the dates Samigo sets by default on the bottom for 11. Samigo in 10 set different dates.
column10: Dates in Samigo aren't consistent with other tools or user expectations
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
The sakai datepicker is designed to pick ALWAYS the actual date if there is not value... it takes the actual date and it put it in the hidden fields in the case the picker is designed to have these hidden fields. In this case, (samigo) the hidden field is the one that passes the values to the bean. So configuring the picker in other way seems not a solution to clear this value.

This is not Samigo code, it is the lang-datepicker code:

var init = function() {

// set the initial date for the picker
initDateTime();

// instantiate datetimepicker
localDTPicker = $(options.input).css('min-width','200px').datetimepicker(cfg);

// set the datepicker date if we've got a pre-set value
if (typeof options.val !== 'undefined' || typeof options.getval !== 'undefined' || typeof options.duration !== 'undefined')

{ localDTPicker.datetimepicker("setDate", localDate); // At this point we can go and ask the picker what it has rounded the time to. localDate = localDTPicker.datetimepicker("getDate"); // Handle duration, which relies on the datepicker being set handleDuration(); }

// if the picker is reliant in hudden fields, set them
setHiddenFields(localDate);
};

So... option 1 is to change the general datepicker code to allow it to support empty values. Maybe add a "clear" button to it and some configuration options to allow empty values by default too, and not try to put always the actual date.
Option 2 is to use another datepicker for samigo... or return to the previous one.

Option 3 can be add a checkbox before each date, so only if checked the date in the field will be working... (but I feel that this is worse solution that complicates how Samigo works... enough complex at this moment)... new things to save in database... so I discard this option.

To research a little more:
In gradebookNG when you add a item, they are using this datepicker and they have the option to have it empty. this happens in the "AddOrEditGradeItemPickerPanelContent.html" but they have a different approach and using other way to manage that, that I'm not sure we can copy.

My opinion: From all these options, the first, that implies to modify the sakai datepicker to be configured to allow empty values and add a button to clear the value, maintaining the default behavior as it is now, seems the most feasible, but please, I'm open to other suggestions.
column45: I support #1: Allow empty dates via a property that can be set in the setup of the date picker object
column49:
Done in https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/1880

The property to allow empty dates in the datepicker is:

allowEmptyDate: true

If that property is true then it doesn't try to fill the empty values with the actual date.

In this case in Samigo, was not enough allowing that... it was needed a "clear button" to allow to remove a date when it was set, and touch the bean code to accept empty dates again.
column53:
I have tested this patch in https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/portal

It works perfect in published assessments. However, working copies still don't have a way to set blank dates in assessment settings.

So I'm going to set this ticket as "Tested" but I leave open SAK-29090 Resolved until the patch works also for working copies.

column1: [SAK-29825] New Web service to set the gradebook grading scales.
column6:
This webservice accepts the parameters in this way:

scaleUuid - unique id for this gradescale
scaleName - display name for this gradescale
grades - array of strings representing the grade:

{A, B, C, D}
percents - array of string representing the percent value associated with the grade {100, 90, 80, 70}. The grade and value arrays must be the same size.

NOTE: THERE ARE MORE PARAMETERS BELOW IN THE COMMENTS BASED IN THE DISCUSSION.

NOTE. The grades and the percents are an Array: String[ ], If called as a webservice, then they needs to be arrays String[ ] but when called as a restful with a URL, the parameter can be like this:
&grades={A, B, C, D}

&percents=

{90, 80, 70, 0}

And the code will review it and split correctly in the right Arrays (it reads the first element in the array and if it starts with "

{" and ends with "}

", it considers it that it has been called as a restful service and do the "trick"

It returns the string "success" if successful, otherwise error msg

NOTE2: If you update an scale, all the sites where that scale percents has been customized are updated with the new value. I think it is the right behavior, becuase the scale has been updated, but maybe we should add a boolean to do this or not. Any comments about this?

It has too boolean parameters to select what we want to do with the scales in the old gradebooks. Update all, update only not customized by teachers ones, or not update the old values.

Sample call:

http://SERVERNAME/sakai-ws/rest/gradebook/createOrUpdateGradeScale?sessionid=THESESSIONID&*scaleUuid*=27&*scaleName*=newscale&*grades*=

{eee,bbb,ccc}

&percents=

{69,31,12}

&updateOld=true&updateOnlyNotCustomized=true

updateOld=true updates the old values in the actual gradebooks. It depens of updateOnlyNotCustomized=true if it updates all of them or only the ones that has never been customized by instructors.
updateOld=false only update the scale definition, but not the actual gradebooks.

column1: [SAK-29824] Invalid numberofsubmitters in assignment submission XML
column6:
In some circumstances, an assignment submission can include an invalid value of 0 for numberofsubmitters in the XML, e.g.

numberofsubmitters="0" submitted="true"
submitterid="a9c5379b-afec-4d45-a4b9-215f580f939a"

This can cause permission errors when the student attempts to access the submission (e.g. to view feedback).

In revisions prior to r318808, these could arise by creating a collaborative group assignment and selecting View: Assignment List by Student.

From r318808 on, these can arise by submitting a collaborative group assignment as a student (details below).

These records can be identified with:

select distinct CONTEXT from ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION WHERE XML LIKE '%numberofsubmitters="0"%';

As a workaround for dealing with this invalid data in submissions, the permission check should also include the submitterid (rather than relying on numberofsubmitters and submitterX values), although this is only a partial fix and the XML has to be fixed in the database for the assignment submission counts to be correct on the assignment list page.
column10: Invalid numberofsubmitters in assignment submission XML
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
Patch to expand the permission check to include the submitter id, which is consistent with the comment above this code block:

// double check the submission submitter information:
// if current user is not the original submitter and if he doesn't have grading permission, he should not have access to other people's submission.
column45:
This issue is a regression introduced by r318809 from SAK-28055 Closed .

Here is the XML for a group submission at r318808:

Actually, I'm reopening this one. I don't even think we need the attribute numberofsubmitters. It's only used in one place to set up the iterator, but we can just do the iteration until it doesn't find any more attributes with that numbered value. I don't see the point for this. column1: [SAK-29823] Site type title not editable sakai.property not being obeyed
column6:
After stepping through the code in debug mode, the properties are actually loaded properly. The problem is the implementation in the velocity template.

Whoever updated the property and loading code didn't check the velocity template to see how it was implemented to obey the property. The conditional was effectively the opposite of what it needs to be:

#if (!$!existingSite || $!siteTitleEditable)

The code shouldn't care if the site exists already or not, we want it to obey the property regardless. Also, it shouldn't be rendering the input field if the site title is NOT editable; it should only render it if it IS editable:

#if ($siteTitleEditable)

column258:
Hi,
I am following the steps to reproduce this jira and I am not able to edit the site title. I have the last code in master and almost fresh database.
column263:
I've been testing this more and I'm still able to reproduce. I deployed to a fresh instance of Tomcat, and built master fresh (updated this morning), using a brand new copy of default.sakai.properties. I still get the editable text box for course sites. Here's how the code breaks down:

SiteAction line 1077:

if (ServerConfigurationService.getStrings("site.type.titleNotEditable") != null) {
			state.setAttribute(TITLE_NOT_EDITABLE_SITE_TYPE, new ArrayList(Arrays
					.asList(ServerConfigurationService
							.getStrings("site.type.titleNotEditable"))));
		} else {
			state.setAttribute(TITLE_NOT_EDITABLE_SITE_TYPE, new ArrayList(Arrays
					.asList(new String[]{ServerConfigurationService
							.getString("courseSiteType", "course")})));
		}

With default sakai.properties, the else block executes, the property courseSiteType is not found in sakai.properties, so the TITLE_NOT_EDITABLE_SITE_TYPE array contains the default of "course".

SiteAction line 2451:

if (site != null) {
				// revising a existing site's tool
				context.put("existingSite", Boolean.TRUE);
				context.put("continue", "14");
				
				ResourcePropertiesEdit props = site.getPropertiesEdit();
						
				String locale_string = StringUtils.trimToEmpty(props.getProperty(PROP_SITE_LANGUAGE));
				context.put("locale_string",locale_string);
			} else {
				// new site
				context.put("existingSite", Boolean.FALSE);
				context.put("continue", "4");
				
				// get the system default as locale string
				context.put("locale_string", "");
			}

The else block runs here again, putting "existingSite" as false into the context.

SiteAction, line 2479:

context.put("siteTitleEditable", Boolean.valueOf(siteTitleEditable(state, siteType)));}

which calls siteTitleEditable() @ SiteAction line 8131:

private boolean siteTitleEditable(SessionState state, String site_type) {
		return site_type != null 
				&& ((state.getAttribute(TITLE_NOT_EDITABLE_SITE_TYPE) != null 
					&& !((List) state.getAttribute(TITLE_NOT_EDITABLE_SITE_TYPE)).contains(site_type)));
	}

This method returns false, the site title should not be editable according to the sakai.properties.

Then, the velocity template is rendered; chef_site-siteInfo-editInfo.vm line 164:

#if (!$!existingSite || $!siteTitleEditable)
				<input type="text" name="title" id="title" size="20" maxlength="$!titleMaxLength" value="$validator.escapeHtml($!title)" />
			#else
				$validator.escapeHtml($!title)
			#end

Here, existingSite is false, and siteTitleEditable is false, and I get the input text field allowing me to edit the title. Thus, the sakai.property is not properly obeyed.
column283:
If existingSite is false and siteTitleEditable is false you are able to edit the site title, because you are in the middle of the site creation process. After the site creation existingSite is true and siteTitleEditable is still false so you won't be able to edit the site title. I was trying to edit the site title after the site was created, so that's the reason why I wasn't able to reproduce it.

I think this makes sense (let the user change the title during the creation process, not after), but looking at the code before my change, the original if was:

#if ($!siteTitleEditable || !$hasRosterAttached)

Testing this in a nightly server you could see (looking at the html code) that there is a hidden input named "hasRosterAttached" just below the input title, and during the creation process it has the value "true", so I think you are absolutley right Brian and this is a regresion. If some one can confirm that, in Sakai 2.9 or less, you were not able to edit the site title during the creation process will be great, but anyway I could merge this into master in a couple of days if no one disagree with this. Sorry Brian !!
column287:

I guess that he won't be able to add a site title during the creation process, so he won't be able to create a site, is that right?

But, if you think the PR is acceptable, feel free to merge. If so, maybe we can open another ticket to think about the project issue.

column1: [SAK-29821] Feature Request: Allow user to set "new window" when editing a Web Content link in Site Info - Page Order
column6:
FEATURE REQUEST
(See also SAK-29820 Awaiting Review for similar request but in Edit Tools on adding a new Web Content tool.)

Please add option to set the optional features, particularly the "open in new window" checkbox, when editing a Web Content tool in Page Order.

RATIONALE

"FRAME-BUSTING BLUES" Some sites don't like to be contained. If that site happens to be an HTTPS site, Web Content will try to embed as an iframe. The target site decides to break free, in the same window... and it creates a difficult loop for a majority of users who can never find the "Edit" button in Web Content to set the option for "Open in new window." Technically, it's possible by using the history and not going back one or sometimes even two steps, but to the first instance of Web Content. This is not an obvious thing at all and produces an extra level of training and support overhead that could be greatly reduced by having these options available within Site Info via the Page Order location (where site managers know they can edit/customize site tools).

By having these options available in Page Order, it helps to empower site managers to address Web Content link issues on their own. It makes the service seem more effective; and it also reduces support burden on an institution at the same time.

Thank you for considering this feature request!
column10: Feature Request: Allow user to set "new window" when editing a Web Content link in Site Info - Page Order

column1: [SAK-29820] Feature Request: Allow user to set "new window" when adding a Web Content link in Site Info - Edit Tools
column6:
FEATURE REQUEST

I love Web Content and the changes that Dr. Chuck and others have implemented recently (2.9 and 10). To add make the process more efficient and to address a situation when someone adds a "frame busting" link as a Web Content tool, please consider adding a checkbox during Site Creation or Site Info/Edit Tools so that a new Web Content item can be pre-selected with "open new window" as an option.

RATIONALE
"EFFICIENCY" – For site creators or instructional designers that have to manage many sites, adding this one feature can save support, design, and instructional staff a lot of work and headaches. Why have them go to a separate link and take additional steps if we can add a checkbox at site creation or tool addition right then and there?

"FRAME-BUSTING BLUES" – Some sites don't like to be contained. If that site happens to be an HTTPS site, Web Content will try to embed as an iframe. The target site decides to break free, in the same window... and it creates a difficult loop for a majority of users who can never find the "Edit" button in Web Content to set the option for "Open in new window." Technically, it's possible by using the history and not going back one or sometimes even two steps, but to the first instance of Web Content. This is not an obvious thing at all and produces an extra level of training and support overhead that could be greatly reduced by another place where a user can set the option that is outside of the Web Content tool. (Will create a separate request for updating Page Order, too.)

Thank you for considering this feature request!
column10: Feature Request: Allow user to set "new window" when adding a Web Content link in Site Info - Edit Tools
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
I feel like I'd thought about this in the past, but it would be a decent request. There isn't that much tool configuration that site manage deals with, really just a few things like allowMultipleInstances (if you can have more than one of the same tool like Web or Lessons on a page)

The feature that added that was a pretty large change on SAK-7209 Closed . I feel like this would be a somewhat similar amount of work. Once someone was looking at it, they might think of other things that a tool might want to be able to configure on this page too, and allow for that to be a little more generic.

Is a good idea though, and it can be hard to stop the popup busters. As an admin you can go into the admin Sites tool, edit the page and change the popup option there for the user. This is probably one reason why this feature wasn't implemented, because the support workaround is really quick.
