column45: It believe this was from a removed NPE check in SAK-28055 Closed
column49:
The reason this NPE isn't being hit on trunk is because there's a database error that's silently swallowed now for some in BaseDbSingleStorage reason.

The stack was below.

caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService$BaseAssignmentSubmission.getSubmitterIds(BaseAssignmentService.java:11321)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService$BaseAssignmentSubmission.setAll(BaseAssignmentService.java:11110)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService$BaseAssignmentSubmission.<init>(BaseAssignmentService.java:10422)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService$BaseAssignmentSubmissionEdit.<init>(BaseAssignmentService.java:11969)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService$AssignmentSubmissionStorageUser.newResourceEdit(BaseAssignmentService.java:13313)
    at org.sakaiproject.util.BaseDbSingleStorage.editResource(BaseDbSingleStorage.java:822)
    at org.sakaiproject.util.BaseDbSingleStorage.putResource(BaseDbSingleStorage.java:604)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.DbAssignmentService$DbCachedAssignmentSubmissionStorage.put(DbAssignmentService.java:576)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService.addSubmission(BaseAssignmentService.java:2239)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService.getSubmitterMap(BaseAssignmentService.java:4789)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService.getSubmitterIdList(BaseAssignmentService.java:4661)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.cover.AssignmentService.getSubmitterIdList(AssignmentService.java:829)
    at org.sakaiproject.assignment.tool.AssignmentAction.build_instructor_view_students_assignment_context(AssignmentAction.java:4509)

This is what happens in 10 without this. But in 11, it never gets to the editResource step because in putResource it hits the the line:

		        // process the insert
			boolean ok = m_sql.dbWrite(statement, fields);
	
			// if this failed, assume a key conflict (i.e. id in use)
			if (!ok) return null;

And ok is false! Why is it even trying to do this huge ugly insert and failing everytime anyway?!?

column1: [SAK-29808] New Webservices to read the user Activity
column6:
Here is a new webservice set called Activity that allows to query the user events. This can be very useful to control the user activity externally to Sakai.

-getUserActivityByType returns all the events of a type from a user

http://localhost:8080/sakai-ws/rest/activity/getUserActivityByType?sessionid=ed446383-8e95-48c9-9a62-d71cbe619fa1&eid=admin&eventType=annc.new

-getUserLogonActivity returns all the logins of a user

http://localhost:8080/sakai-ws/rest/activity/getUserLogonActivity?sessionid=ed446383-8e95-48c9-9a62-d71cbe619fa1&eid=admin

-getUserActivity and getUserActivityStringDates return the events of a user between 2 dates.

http://localhost:8080/sakai-ws/rest/activity/getUserActivityRestVersion?sessionid=ed446383-8e95-48c9-9a62-d71cbe619fa1&eid=admin&startDate=2013-09-10%2020:00:00&endDate=2018-09-10%2020:00:00

NOTE: There are 2 versions becuase when we call it as a REST, it needs to convert the string to dates (getUserActivityStringDates) and when calling it as a webservice, the parameters are directly dates.

There is an option to do this with only one webservice using this:
https://cirovladimir.wordpress.com/2012/09/18/apache-cxf-jax-rs-class-java-util-date-can-not-be-instantiated-using-a-constructor-with-a-single-string-argument/

But it needs to create the ParameterHandler and a lot of extra steps. If you consider that having 2 version (one for REST calls and another for the traditional calls) is fine, then this patch works.

column1: [SAK-29805] Add documentation for the LTI 2.0 Configuration Parameters for sakai.properties
column6:
If a Sakai server is not configured for LTI 2.0, you get the following message:

Alert: This server is not configured for LTI2. Sample configuration will be used. Do not use sample data in production.

The names of the LTI 2.0 variables for Sakai 10 and later are as follows:

lti2.guid
lti2.support_email
lti2.service_owner.id
lti2.service_owner.owner_name
lti2.service_owner.description
lti2.service_owner.support_email
lti2.service_provider.id
lti2.service_provider.provider_name
lti2.service_provider.description
lti2.service_provider.support_email
lti2.product_family.product_code
lti2.product_family.vendor_code
lti2.product_family.vendor_name
lti2.product_family.vendor_description
lti2.product_family.vendor_website
lti2.product_family.vendor_contact
lti2.product_info.product_name
lti2.product_info.product_version
lti2.product_info.product_description

These are all documented in the LTI documentation from IMS:

http://www.imsglobal.org/lti/ltiv2p0/ltiIMGv2p0.html
column10: Add documentation for the LTI 2.0 Configuration Parameters for sakai.properties

column1: [SAK-29801] Extending Bootstrap layout and styles into Morpheus
column6:
Extending Bootstrap layout and styles into Morpheus helps tool css and tool standardization. Load bootstrap.js by default. The portal will load the javascripts for these libraries in thisorder whenever it can:

jquery
jquery-migrate
bootstrap
jquery-ui

The only two where the order matters are UI and Bootstrap. In order to prefer UI, in case of naming conflicts, we load bootstrap first and jquery-ui last.

The portal also will detect an existing jquery loaded by the tool and check and add migrate, bootstrap, and ui only as needed.

column1: [SAK-29794] Manual selection of checkboxes in User Membership -> sitelist.jsp doesn't work
column6:
1) Select All
2) Deselect All
3) Manually select any number
4) Use any of the actions
5) Nothing happens because the backing bean thinks nothing is selected.

The problem is that the value attribute isn't being updated on click of the actual checkbox. When the form is loaded for the first time, all the checkboxes have a value="true". The select all/deselect all/invert selection JavaScript functions update the checked and value attributes accordingly. So you deselect all, and all the checkboxes have value="false". Then you go and manually select any number, but their value attribute remains false. So when you go to perform any of the actions, the backing bean thinks that none of the items are selected.

Adding some simple JavaScript to the onclick of the checkboxes themselves to update the value attribute solves the issue.
column10: Manual selection of checkboxes in User Membership -> sitelist.jsp doesn't work

column1: [SAK-29780] Error when deleting assignments
column6:
Deleting an assignment gives an error like:

Alert: Can not find the assignment '/assignment/a/130370e6-a421-4dba-bf32-06df27a38820/78fed328-2108-4ed7-9901-91f67bdf69dd'. Can not find the assignment '/assignment/a/130370e6-a421-4dba-bf32-06df27a38820/78fed328-2108-4ed7-9901-91f67bdf69dd'.

And leaves you on the delete page. The assignment is, however, deleted. A side effect of this bug is that assignments associated with gradebook items will not remove the gradebook item when the assignment is removed. It will leave orphaned gradebook items which cannot be deleted from the Gradebook tool.

The problem is the algorithm responsible for deleting all the data related to an assigment. It ran in the following order:

  1. delete calendar events associated with the assignment
  2. delete announcements associated with the assignment
  3. delete all submissions for the assignment, and the assignment itself
  4. delete the gradebook item associated with the assignment

However, because the assignment is actually deleted in the 3rd step, when it goes to check if it needs to delete any associated gradebook item(s), the code blows up because the assignment has already been deleted.

The solution is to swap items 3 and 4 so that the gradebook code is executed before the assignment is actually deleted.

A second issue was identified where by if you have an assignment sending grades to the gradebook, and the instructor/maintainer has released at least one grade, the attempt to delete the assignment will fail.

The first time the user confirms to delete, it will appear as if nothing happened, the page refreshes and the user is presented with the confirm deletion message again. The second time, the user will receive an error massage stating that the assignment is being edited by another user:

Someone else is editing this assignment '/assignment/a/729b1df6-de93-4213-bc8c-3c1d1aac5e6f/e58ca9d5-a7e6-47e3-99c5-2c447819d2a5'. Are you sure you want to delete 'delete me' which has submissions already?

However, the real problem is that the edu-services code throws a foreign key constraint violation. The cause of this, is because the code attempts to delete the gradebook item without first removing any comments related to the gradebook item. The solution is to explicitly delete the comments before the gradebook item is deleted.
column10: Error when deleting assignments
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-37542] Redeploying lessonbuilder project throws error, have to restart server after every change.
column6:
make changes into 'lessonsbuilder' project and deploy , it throws error.
Attaching stack trace below for more description
column10: Redeploying lessonbuilder project throws error, have to restart server after every change.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I can't do anything about this. Lessons has been designed to allow redeployment, for convenience in development. But some functions are part of an API, and really can't be changed. In most tools they would be in components, which can't be redeployed. In lessons, they are part of the war file, but new versions of those classes will not actually be used after a redeploy for a few purposes (mostly Site Info importing content). That's what the stack trace indicates.

I do not recommend redeploying in production. However for development you can ignore the error unless you're working on the code for moving content between sites. A redeploy in production would probably work as long as none of those classes had been changed, but I don't recommend it.

column1: [SAK-29775] Hidden items in Resources are only indicated with colour, text is also needed.
column6:

During the Aug 5 Accessibility Working group call this was identified and it was suggested the modifying the title="" tag on the link, that currently has the file type, to be title="Hidden: File type" would address this.

column1: [SAK-29774] Limits in the UserEntityProvider (getEntities) seem to be incorrect
column6:
This problem seems like it's been around for awhile, maybe since the beginning of the provider. In order to really test it you have to have more than 50 users in the system.

The user api is set to work on "first" and "last", where this /direct interface is set to use parameters (generally _start and _limit). It looks like it's incorrectly manipulating the _start and _limit to try to fit into the values for first and last.

The way the code is, it looks like there's no way to search above the first 50 users, it will always keep the first and last less than 50, keeping the set in the first 50, but there are a variety of defaults that might be set. It's good to restrict it so it doesn't return more than some number 50 forcing you to page but there is an error here back from the initial version of this code that seems break this.

For example say you have 200 users

  • direct/user.xml?_sessionId=[SessionID]&_page=3

You'd expect 50 users from page 3 (so 151-200 users) instead it returns an empty set.

  • direct/user.xml?_sessionId=[SessionID]&_page=2

You'd expect 50 users from page 2, instead you get back the 10th user

  • direct/user.xml?_sessionId=[SessionID]&_start=55

Returns the first 50 users, because it sets start to 1 since start > 50.

There's a lot of similar problems like this in this call when using all of the parameters (_limit, _perpage, etc) based on how these are limited by the entitybroker and then passed through as "first" and "last" by this method.
column10: Limits in the UserEntityProvider (getEntities) seem to be incorrect
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

column1: [SAK-29773] User Membership active/inactive toggle has problems with non-provided students in provided sites
column6:
If you have a non-provided student in a provided site (added manually rather than in the roster), the User Membership tool will fail to flip the user to active/inactive. It will rather remove the enrolment for that site for the user.

The problem is with the provided check only checking if the site has a provider ID, rather than checking if the user is provided in the realm.

In Sakai 11, I see a _skipnav.scss but it doesn't look like it has any special provision for when the div gets focus. I'm not even sure when this is displayed now.

/* jump-to links, tabbing into focus treatment  */
#skipNav a.internalSkip:focus, #skipNav a.internalSkip:active {
    text-decoration: none;
    font-size: 120%;
    position: fixed !important;
    background: #fff;
    -webkit-border-radius: 3px;
    -moz-border-radius: 3px;
    border-radius: 3px;
    vertical-align: middle;
    padding: 6px 8px !important;
    outline: none;
    z-index: 200000;
    top: 8px !important;
    left: 5px  !important;
    height: auto  !important;
    color: #07b;
    border: 1px solid #07b;
    width: auto  !important;
}

column87:
• Create a new site (either type)
  • Make sure home and site info (the defaults) are selected)
  • Go to that site
  • Click the edit (pencil in 11) icon in Site Information Display on Home
  • In the description enter
    <p>p text</p><script>XSS</script>
  • Click Update, you should get a popup warning and just the text between the <p> tags. Click the pencil again, the text should be gone. (In 10.x the text wasn't removed)
  • Click Update again, there should be no warning
  • Go into Site Info
  • Click "Edit Site Information"
  • Click Source
  • Paste the same text in the description
    <p>p text</p><script>XSS</script>
  • Click continue, you should get a popup
  • Click Home, you should get no warning, clicking the pencil should just show the <p> text.

column1: [SAK-29767] Make sure all core resources are served from Sakai
column6:
Sakai is depending on being connected to the internet for some of the default resources needed to render it's front page. If you are attempting todo development and aren't connected to the internet this can result in pages failing to load correctly.

While CDNs can be a good thing it isn't always the best solution. We should provide the option to serve resources through Sakai.

column1: [SAK-29766] Are you sure you want to logout question when you are trying to login.
column6:
If you have Sakai configured with top.login=false there are two links in the top to login and xlogin.
When you hit login link you show this message: "Are you sure you want to log out?" But you are trying to login in and also is not internazionalized !!
This message should appear only when you are trying to logout and must be internazionalized.
column10: Are you sure you want to logout question when you are trying to login.
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
I think you could add a data-warning attribute in "a" tag which is shared for both links (in and out) and has the same id. Then in SkinnableCharonPortal write message only in case of is a logout link, so you will have:

   <a href="../portal/logout" title="Logout" id="loginLink1" class="Mrphs-loginUser__message" data-warning="Are you sure you want to log out?">
       <i class="login-Icon"></i>
       <span class="Mrphs-login-Message">Logout</span>
   </a>

Or this in case login link:

   <a href=".../portal/login" title="Login" id="loginLink1" class="Mrphs-loginUser__message" data-warning="">
       <i class="login-Icon"></i>
       <span class="Mrphs-login-Message">Login</span>
   </a>

Then you could easily change js code to get things work:

  $PBJQ('#loginLink1').click(function(e){
     if ($PBJQ(this).attr("data-warning") !== "" && !confirm($PBJQ(this).attr("data-warning"))){
	e.preventDefault();
    }
  });

column1: [SAK-29761] Sticky group filter can be used to reveal anonymous identities in Assignments
column6:
The group filter is too sticky in the context of the submission list UIs for different assignments. Steps to reproduce:

1) in a site with more than 1 student/access user, create a group with only one student/access user
2) create at least one anonymous and one regular assignment
3) go to the submission list (grade) interface for the regular assignment
4) select the group you created in step 1 in the 'View' drop down; the submission list is filtered appropriately for the regular assignment
5) go back to the 'Assignment List'
6) go to the submission list (grade) interface for the anonymous assignment
7) notice the 'View' drop down is not rendered, but the filter is still applied; you only see the student in the group you created

In this way, you can abuse group membership to deduce the real identities of the anonymous submissions
column10: Sticky group filter can be used to reveal anonymous identities in Assignments

column41:
Sounds like a good idea to me. Maybe create some subtasks so we can actually make progress on this? We were talking that this is going to be a mostly manual process, either replacing them with ComponentManager or Spring. And we could either go tool by tool or cover by cover. I think it would be easier to import the entire source and go cover by cover, removing one at a time.

Some of them will be quicker, some of them will take more time. There are over 1000 total usages, but some like ServerConfigurationService are used more so I'd have the lowest priority on that one. Where others like UserDirectoryService and AuthzGroupService are out of date.

I think this will tough everything except component-manager covers (for now) and kernel-private. There are covers in each tool but those should be easier to remove?

column1: [SAK-29758] Assignments -> Grade Report -> filter by name/id/email doesn't work in mixed (anonymous and regular assignments) scenarios
column6:
In a site where you have a mix of both anonymous and regular assignments:

1) go to Assignments -> Grade Report
2) type the name/id/email of any student in the list into the filter text box
3) click the 'Find' button
4) form submits, page refreshes, filter is not applied and the filter text box is now gone

The problem is that the code to determine if there's an anonymous assignment (and conditionally not render the filter and group selection) is only checking the assignments on the current page. It should rather be checking the entire collection of submissions for all assignments.
column10: Assignments -> Grade Report -> filter by name/id/email doesn't work in mixed (anonymous and regular assignments) scenarios

column1: [SAK-29757] Assignment's grading notification emails need some improvements
column6:
When a student gets a notification that their assignment has been graded it looks like this:

Site Title: Project Site 017B
Site ID: d3e634a6-73cc-4194-8c71-bbfeb5bdc74f

Your submission to assignment "Asn B" has been corrected. Please go to Project Site 017B to view details.

Provide a link to the assignments tool in the site, and change the strange phrase "has been corrected" to "has been graded".

These changes also apply to the emails when resubmissions are allowed, and the email a student gets to notify them that a grade has been released.

column1: [SAK-29754] Problem with maven eclipse:eclipse and project references
column6:
I seem to be having a recent problem with the maven eclipse plugin that wasn't happening in Sakai 10. I'm not sure when or why this is happening.

I tracked this down to
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MECLIPSE-726

And the fix suggested there is working. Without the fix there when running mvn eclipse:eclipse it would pull in project references that weren't related so you ended up having to import every project. (Something that I never had to do in the past)
(An example in a recent run the .project file contains)

  <projects>
    <project>sakai-kernel-api</project>
    <project>sakai-component-manager</project>
    <project>sakai-kernel-util</project>
    <project>sakai-portal-util</project>
  </projects>

(In previous runs the .project file it would import looking like this)

  <projects>
    <project>sakai-portal-util</project>
  </projects>

I have old files in Sakai 10 and it still seems to not be an issue. I really don't know why/when this happened. I know they released a new version of the eclipse plugin on May 2015 but even changing it to version 2.9 is causing the same issue. Using the fix on that MECLIPSE jira reverts to the old behavior though so I think that's the better behavior.

I'm still using eclipse Luna, so I'm not sure if this is is necessary for Mars or not.

This page https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/BOOT/Import+Sakai+source+into+Eclipse even says that it's an optional step, but it doesn't seem like it's ever been optional to me. So either there aren't too many people that do this or I'm missing something.
column10: Problem with maven eclipse:eclipse and project references
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Is this still an issue?
column45: The process for importing into eclipse is different now (Just import maven project directly without running this). So marking this as won't fix.

column1: [SAK-29753] Comments need to be removed when deleting an externally defined assessment
column6:
Support for comments was added to the external gradebook service in 10. Since externally defined assessments might have comments, they need to be deleted when the grade item gets removed.

Right now, this is causing a problem in assignments where if you set a comment to be sent to gradebook and then try to remove the assignment the grade item won't be removed from the gradebook.
column10: Comments need to be removed when deleting an externally defined assessment

column1: [SAK-29750] Add ability for external tool to construct context-only reverse LTI Launches to themselves via Content Item
column6:
This will allow a tool to ocnstruct a URL that it can put into an iframe that is a context-level launch (i.,e. no resource_link_id) back to themselves. This allows a simple SSO-like behavior or allows the construction of a link that can be blaced in an iframe in a rich content editor as follows:

<iframe src="/access/basiclti/f8937e17/tool:471?data=123456" width="320" height="240"></iframe>

This will require the sending of the primary key of the tool to the external tool as part of the Content Item Launch.

column1: [SAK-35405] Not trimming spaces in the user name or password in the password protected assessments.
column6:
I consider this a bug, but maybe is the desired behavior.

If we add, in the security settings, a user and a password and we paste it with an space at the end, the space is not trimmed, so unless you add the space when entering these data later, the assessment can't be accesses.

To reproduce:

Create an assessment
Set a user and apassword with an space at the end:
User "Diego "
Password "333 "
Publish

Enter as student, try to put "Diego" and/or "333" without the space at the end and it doesn't work.

Insert "Diego " and "333 " with the space at the end and it works.
column10: Not trimming spaces in the user name or password in the password protected assessments.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I've changed the code in 2 places.

1. Trimmed the user and password when saved (in Assessments and PublishedAssessments), so no new passwords with leading spaces or ending ones can be saved.

2. Trimmed the user and password, the saved version and the one the student introduced, when both are compared, so old password stored with spaces will work fine. (Fine means that these spaces won't be considered part of the password)
column45:
Tested on sakai-trunk-atica

It works as described, spaces not considered in validation.
column49:
So while this may seem like a good idea it does have this side effect.

If you have a password of "abcde " it is now the same as "abcde" which is clearly not the case.

Trimming the username maybe fine but manipulating passwords I think is generally not good idea.
column53:
Yes, I understand that situation. The problem here is to decide if this is the good behavior or not.

Some samples of the problems allowing spaces at the end or start of the password:

If a teacher copies and pastes the password from another placeand without notice it copies it with the space at the end, no one will be able to enter in the assessment and the teacher can become crazy thinking about why they can't enter if the password is the right one (becuase he don't see the space at the end in the settings). That's the case I want to avoid. Other situation is... you have a password with a space at the end and you decide to remove the password, then you delete the password but you leave the space without notice it... then you become crazy again thinking why, if the password is empty (it really have an space) it is asking you for a password. I think spaces at the start of beginning of a password is not a good idea.

As you say, if someone adds this spaces, the password will work without it... but you need to know the rest of the password to enter.

In my opinion, the advantages of removing this are bigger than the disadvantages, but of course this should be discussed here. Maybe we can take this to the T&L group to discuss.
column57: I've been testing the user and password in Sakai (the login one) and it trims the spaces at the end too. Try "admin " / "admin " with spaces in trunk and it trims the spaces. So, it is the standard behavior with Sakai passwords and users. I feel it should be done here too in Samigo.
column61:
I normally wouldn't consider a space a valid character in a password, but I think for legacy behavior I'd probably lean on allowing old passwords to work, as well as trimmed passwords. I think this is best for the user experience.

Generally for large systems (like Facebook) I believe what they actually do is take whatever password you put in, and try it a few different waysnot caring if you messed up but allowing it either way. (http://security.stackexchange.com/a/68014/64209) Yeah, it reduces the security profile slightly but reduces user frustration.

I'm okay though if this is already precedent in Sakai, I can't imagine many people using trailing blanks as part of a password.
column65:
A trailing space or leading space in a password should never be allowed ... but yeah, a space in the middle of a password should be perfectly valid.

I agree with Matthew: let's reduce user frustration like Facebook does......
column137: Of course this patch only removes the trailing and leading ones.
column163: Okay, let's get this merged in!

column1: [SAK-30326] grade books using categories don't always copy in duplicate site if gradebook2 is in use
column6:
Gradebook2 has its own code for copying the gradebook in site duplicate. That code only works if it's used before anything else has added items to the gradebook. If Gradebook2 appears in the left margin after tools that put entries in the gradebook, Gradebook2's copy doesn't work.

The right fix would be to make the Gradebook2 code adjust entries to be right, and not just fail when an entry is already there. However the copy code is sufficiently complex that I have no idea how to do that. Instead, this patch will make site-manage copy Gradebook2 before any other tool.
column10: grade books using categories don't always copy in duplicate site if gradebook2 is in use
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: I'm okay with this going into core.... anyone else?
column45:
The code for site copy took the low-road: it does a full export of the gradebook and then imports that into the new site. This overrides general settings that may appear in an existing gradebook, eg, the case of a copy into an existing site where the gb settings my conflict with the imported data.

But, there are separate signatures for the EP that are supposed to separate out the two cases of full or start-from-scratch, and merge.

The merge was punted due to resource constraints. So yes, that case is complex. But we may be able create a simpler basic impl by just importing item and categories by name and leave the other information out or use existing gb's defaults
column49: I'm not sure what to do with this. The original fix doesn't even come close to applying anymore because of the changes to getTools. Maybe it should be moved back as a GRBK issue or just closed as Won't Fix.

column1: [SAK-29745] Clicking the 'Cancel' button on the assignments 'Download All' or 'Upload All' still displays the link to download
column6:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. go to Assignments
  2. create an assignment
  3. click the Grade link from the table for that assignment
  4. click the Download All link or the Upload All link
  5. click the Cancel button

You'll get the following message:

You have chosen to download student submissions. If you encountered a problem downloading all submissions, click on the following link:

Download all link

This is wrong because you've cancelled. The message appears when you click Download as expected, but it shouldn't when you click Cancel (especially Cancel from the Upload page).

column1: [SAK-29741] Unable to change meeting type in Sign-up tool
column6:
1. Create a meeting in Signup configured for any meeting type and a date/time in the future.
  2. Modify the meeting to change the meeting type. No can do.

I can't think of any reason why one shouldn't be able to modify this setting. This restriction means that people who want to change the meeting type have to recreate the meeting with a different meeting type and delete the original (now useless) meeting. That's dumb.
column10: Unable to change meeting type in Sign-up tool
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
This feature request has come up long time ago. Due to its complexity and lack of resources, it has not implemented. Currently, the simple solution is to copy that meeting and during the process to select the right meeting type.

It is not simple as you think. Consider one scenario: You have one meeting with group meeting type. There are 5 people signed up and now you want to change to individual 4 timeslots with 2 people in one slot. How do you divide the 5 people into these timeslots (with email notifications)? If it is also associated with recurred meetings, the complexity goes even worse.

However, we may make the process a little simpler and for some meeting types, you can allow user to modify them such as fromm individual meeting type --> group meeting type --> public meeting type. Other way around will be not simple.

If you team has resources, that will be great to implement this feature.

thanks,
Peter Liu
column45:
Hi Peter:

Thanks very much for explaining the complexities of this issue.

After reviewing this further with my manager, we do not have the resources available to spend on this feature enhancement to the SignUp tool.

All the best,
Cynthia Gast / UVa Sakai Team
column49:
It looks like it even disables changing the type during the copy workflow. I understand the complexity if people are signed up and you want to change it, but you should be able to change it.

  • During the copy on a new meeting
  • If nobody has yet signed up

Otherwise the only solution that makes sense would be to remove everyone from the meeting if this was being changed.
column53: I agree with Matthew's comments

column1: [SAK-29738] Searching for site falsely doesn't return results when searched from 2nd page of results
column6:
The Worksite Setup will fail to show results when the search is initiated from the 2nd (or higher) page of results of a previous search. To reproduce on nightly:

1. As "admin" click on Worksite Setup.
2. Click the ">" button to move to the 2nd page of results.
3. Paste "DAC-EDUCATION-DEPT1-SUBJ1-101", a course from the first page of results, into the Search box and click "Search". The message will say "No sites were found that match your search..."

If you click the Reset button and search again, it will then find the result as it should.

Somehow it seems that Sakai is hanging onto the "page number" of the result page across searches. If the second search doesn't have enough results to require a second page Sakai incorrectly reports no results.

column1: [SAK-29737] Dummy text appears to user on Site Info -> Page Order
column6:
When in Site Info -> Page Order, if you try to delete a tool that somehow has a null page ID, you will get the hardcoded text from the markup file, rather than the actual error message that should be displayed ("A valid 'page ID' is required").

We're not sure how the page IDs are null, but we have seen this happen in production. I have been able to recreate the scenario using a debugger to make the page ID null to satisfy the code path to generate the error message.

The problem is two fold:

1) it's populating a UIOutput component instead of a UIMessage component; this subsequently fails to find the text of the given message bundle key. This results in an NPE in the logs and the hard-coded text from the markup file being displayed to the end user
2) unnecessarily using a MessageLocator object
column10: Dummy text appears to user on Site Info -> Page Order

column1: [SAK-37382] Add ability to link from Lesson page to the top level of a Forum (rather than Topic level only)
column6: Would like the ability to link from Lessons to the top level of a forum rather than the topic only. This especially becomes useful when group topic forums are utilized.
column10: Add ability to link from Lesson page to the top level of a Forum (rather than Topic level only)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: this would be great
column45: So the use case on this is less to do with having students have access to their specific group topics and more to do with having access to a set of topics that they may need to engage in. Rather than providing a link to every single topic that occurs in a forum - it'd be helpful if students could be directed to a single forum. I can see this being helpful when students are directed to engage in say "2 of the following 5" topics... each of the links to each topic could be included, but it would also be just as easy (or easier) to have a forum link that represents and takes students to the one forum that includes those 5 topics.
column49: I concur with Adam; we'd like to see this at UVa.
column53: OK. Can you give me a specification? It's easy to link to a forum. But it sounds like that won't solve your problem. Is that plus "contribute to N topics" enough? N could be set to 1, of course, if the issue is that you have different topics for different groups and don't want to set up separate Lessons items for each.
column57:
Hi Chuck,
Yes, definitely the ability to link to the top level of a forum will be helpful. Are you saying there is additional functionality that you think could help with linking to multiple topics?
column61: When you link to a topic, you can require that a user post in the topic. When you link to a group, how should that translate? One posting to any topic in the group?
column65: I think there are times when a posting to any topic in the group is appropriate. However, many times we have team assigned topics and we'd want students to move to their specific topic forum. So, if there is a way to also have the option to guide students from the top level of the forum to their appropriate topic forum, that would be beneficial as well.
column137: If you want to link to specific topics or forums for a group, you'll have to use a separate link for each one. Otherwise there's no way to attach a different group to each one.
column163:
Ok, that's fine. It's what we've been doing currently. Really just the ability to have the choice to link to the top level of the forum will give us the flexibility we're seeking with Lessons.

Thanks!
column231:
I've done this. The patch could easily be moved to 10.x.

There are two limitations:

  • With topics, I hack permissions in Forums so that the student can't access the topic through Forums if Lessons has prerequisites that they have't met. I can't seem to do this for forums. Permission at the forum level interact oddly with permissions at the topic level. I'm not sure I can make my approach work. If you want students not to be able to go through the forums tool directly, you'll have to hide it.
  • I've implemented it for Forums, but not jforum or YAFT. At least not yet. I may do jforums.
column254: brilliant!
column258:

column1: [SAK-29732] Cannot upload malformed zip file
column6:
Test Plan:
Upload the BlankFIle.zip in Content, and get an error message as follow.
There was an error uploading the file BlankFile.zip to the server

Explain:
While upload a file, BaseContentService first try to parse it with Tika to get content type. During the parsing process, all IOException will be caught and the upload won't be affected.
Yet, not only IOException will occur in this function.

Solution:
Replace IOException with Exception will solve this problem.

column1: [SAK-35278] Students are not able to see an image within question if the image was uploaded in other site
column6:
Use case:

1. Instructor creates a question-pool question in site A, includes a picture uploaded through CK editor. It now has site A's id.

2. Instructor creates an assessment in site A by copying that question from the question pool. The students are able to see the picture in that question when they take the assessment.

3. Instructor goes to site B and he wants to reuse the question from the step 1 in another assessment. Therefore he creates an assessment by copying the question from question pool he made in site A, and publishes it. The students from site B take the assessment and they are not able to see the picture in the question.

column1: [SAK-29731] StringIndexOutOfBounds when grading submission with a low value (0.01 - 0.09) using two decimals
column6:
Grade a submission using two decimals, with any value from 0.01 to 0.09.

The problem is the grade is stored as an integer, then when parsing it to display on this line (AssignmentAction):

grade = grade.substring(0, grade.length() - dec) + decSeparator + grade.substring(grade.length() - dec);

it will only work if grade is >= 10.

It also generates a blocker error on the submission list screen, due to a similar line found on BaseAssignmentService:

decimal_gradePoint = grade.substring(0, grade.length() - dec) + "." + grade.substring(grade.length() - dec);
column10: StringIndexOutOfBounds when grading submission with a low value (0.01 - 0.09) using two decimals
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I've added a new PR https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/908/ that resolves the problem.

Tested with one and two decimals, works fine.

FAILS with three decimals, which is a really weird use case, requires more work as it's more complex.

column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: This makes the reimplementation functionally complete. However I haven't done anything about appearance yet. Phase 3 will be CSS, to make it look as much like the wireframe as reasonable within the overall Sakai design.
column45:
The latest checkin increases spacing and makes other design changes in the direction of the wireframe. I'm still not doing some things:

  • fonts and colors are from Sakai. I'm not using special ones
  • because of this, contrast is higher than in the wireframe
  • I'm using FontAwesome for icons
  • I'm not putting lines between individual items.
  • The edit icon is outside the main body, and the icons for grouping are replaced with small hovering icons
  • Spacing changes as the screen size changes.
column49: I experimented with various ways of handling separation between items. The wire frame looks fine, but with other combinations of item types, and without lots of manually inserted breaks between groups, it very easily collapses into a single mass of undifferentiated text. While I've taken many details from the design, I've gone back to using a contrasting blue background for questions and student content. That's the best way to differentiate items I've found.

  • This is not for features you hope to get into Sakai 11 but for which there is no development effort. Perhaps a later version for those ideas.

column1: [SAK-29716] Provide a link in the email notification message that goes directly to the current message instead of the main page in Messages Tool
column6:
As described in SAK-25235 Open , some users have also requested a similar feature but for MESSAGES TOOL. It might be easier to implement now that Sakai11 will have no iframes.

Current behavior
Link in email notification message takes users to the home page of the Messages tool.
Desired behavior
Link in email notification message takes users to message.

If user already has an active Sakai session and clicks on the link in the email, then the message would open up in a new tab/window without requiring user to authenticate again. If user does not already have an active Sakai session and clicks on the link in the email, then user would be asked to authenticate before the thread could open in a new tab/window.

column1: [SAK-29715] Remove support for the LORI (Lecture Object Repository Integration) API
column6:
The Lecture Object Repository (LORI) is a non-standard integration API that I developed with the hope that a standards-based API that would allow a repository to be integrated into an LMS like Sakai.

I don't think that the code was every used except for a few months as a test at Indiana University.

The problem is that this is being replaced by the use of the emerging IMS Content Item Specification which will be used across LMS systems.

The problem is that supporting the LORI API ends up with some circular dependencies between Lessonbuilder and BasicLTI. As we move towards implementing IMS Content Item in Lessons, there will increasing dependence of Lessons on LTI making the circular dependency worse.

So by removing the unused LORI API support - we eleiminate the circular dependency and the implementation of IMS ContentItem can progress.
column10: Remove support for the LORI (Lecture Object Repository Integration) API
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29714] JQuery Mobile seems to break JQuery UI
column6:
It seems as though JQuery mobile that was recently added breaks the JQuery UI dialog() calls since jquery mobile gets loaded after jquery UI. It may break other things as well.

To reproduce, start Lessons, add Student Comments and then try to delete student comments. If you watch the dev console you will see something about no open method on dialog. This is because the JQuery mobile dialog() has a quite figfferent set of methods than the JQuery UI dialog() and Lessons ends up making all its dialogs as mobile since mobile is the last thing that is loaded and overwrites the dialog() method that UI plugged into JQ.

Reading this:

https://api.jquerymobile.com/dialog/

Dialog is planned to be deprecated in JQuery 1.5.0 - but that is not out yet.

Sheesh I wish these folks would namespace themselves. But what I read ont he net suggests that Mobile is kind if an arrogant framework and kind of expects you will be doing things their way throughout your application - so it might not be a good fit for us - or perhaps the portal needs to aload a separate copy of JQ and mobile that is completely independent of the tools - which would be sad but if the portal needs essential things from JQ mobile - we may have no other choice.
column10: JQuery Mobile seems to break JQuery UI
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29713] Assignment submission histories should reflect whether the instructor submitted on behalf of the student
column6:
When the instructor or the student views an assignment submission, there is a submission history (introduced in Sakai 10).

If instructor01 submits on behalf of student01, the history displays something like:

"Fri Jul 17 16:47:20 EDT 2015 Jane Smith (student01) submitted"

It should reflect that the instructor submitted on the student's behalf. The linked PR will change the format of the history message:

"Fri Jul 17 16:47:20 EDT 2015 John Doe (instructor01) submitted on behalf of Jane Smith (student01)"

However, it should be noted that these strings are generated at the time of submission and then saved in the XML of the submission object in the database, rather than being generated on the fly. Due to this limitation, this fix will only work for submissions created after this is deployed. Submissions previous to this fix will not display the "on behalf of ..." text for the 'History' component.
column10: Assignment submission histories should reflect whether the instructor submitted on behalf of the student

column1: [SAK-29711] Add Unofficial Participants allows email addresses with invalid domains to be invited to a site
column6:
There is code behind the "Add Unofficial Participants" feature to disallow adding unofficial participants whose email addresses end with with any of the "invalid" domain suffixes defined in sakai.properties.

However, the property it obeys has been removed from default.sakai.properties (invalidNonOfficialAccountString), and there is now a new one that is being referenced from a few other tools (invalidEmailInIdAccountString).

The linked PR alters the code in site-manage to reference this newer property, rather than the old one that is no longer present in default.sakai.properties, so that all the tools are obeying a single property for invalid domain suffixes.

column49:
Matthew "Matt Jones" Jones: I think you'd have to look at what tools put in for their event reference. For instance a few months ago we'd noticed the (new) web portlet tool wasn't tracking this exact thing where the older one was, so had to update the portlet to add in the placement to the reference. This is what these other "multi" tools would need to do for it to work. I haven't looked at the SAKAI_EVENT table or the code but I'm guessing there's a chance it didn't.

For instance for the webcontent.revise and webcontent.read after this patch web uses as a reference
String eventRef = "/web/"placement.getContext()"/id/"placement.getId()"/url/"+URLEncoder.encode(source, "UTF-8");
https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-25704
column53: Charles 'Chuck' Hedrick: "Site stats currently collects statistics for individual objects only for resources. However its designed to be extended. Id like to see an extension to record access to lessons pages. I dont think individual items on the page make much sense. The ones that can be clicked on separately (which texts cant) are either resources (which are already handled) or objects such as tests, which should be done with their tools so that you get accesses both through lessons and directly in the tool. I think this should be done in site stats, and that Lessons shouldnt do its own separate recording."
column57:
James 'Jim' Mezzanotte: "Like Josh, my technical knowledge is limited, so I'll leave it to others in the community to provide more detailed answers to your queries!
ANI has a reporting tool that can pull a fair amount of information from the Sakai user events table (at least, more than Site Statistics), but in regards to Lessons, the info is likewise spotty--as your colleague noted, the only reference is an ID number for a specific Lessons page in a specific course site.
Maybe one "low-hanging fruit" approach we could take is cross-referencing some of the existing user event data. For example, maybe there's a way to connect a Lesson buider page ID to specific content items in Resources (linked/embedded on that page) and to specific users. And, to make the data more user friendly, also connect the page ID to its corresponding page title.
+1 for Josh's suggestion that we discuss the larger implications of current learning analytics needs/challenges at the upcoming Apereo conference.
Maybe we could discuss not just how to better incorporate analytics in the future, but also how to best leverage the information we already have, with user events and session data? Apart from adding new user events, I don't think the Site Statistics tool has seen any development in several years. Should we see about enhancing that tool? Or creating a new tool that can better access user events and do a better job of parsing data?
"
column61:
chuck h says that the events are being generated but are not being processed by site stats. He says, do it in the same way that the "resources.read" event is processed. he's happy to fix lessons if it currently isnt doing what it should be.
this needs doing as soon as possible.
column65:
Chuck H

What Id like to see is lessonbuilder.read treated just like content.read. There are events for everything that changes a page as well, but thats normally instructor activity, and probably doesnt need that kind of detail. I could, of course, give details on viewing items, doing polls, etc. There arent events for them currently, as I assume that page views would be enough. When a file is viewed through /access/lessonbuilder, I generate content.read events that are intended to look just like those that would be generated by /access/content.

I was thinking that a new panel could be on the Site Stats front page added under the Resources panel (but only if the Lessons tool is on the site). it should be essentially the same as Resources where each lessons page is treated like a file

column231: I'm going to start having a look at this on Oxford's behalf, just the gathering of the lessonbuilder events initally, no UI stuff.
column254:
From Laura Gekeler:

Site Statistics has a ribbon for Resources and identifies each resource by its original file name, which is very helpful, along with the number of access. There are tabs to sort the data By User, By Date, By Resource (name). It's even exportable. There are some limitations however. It would be nice if those limitations didn't exist, and certainly we wouldn't want to duplicate the limitations to the Lessons tool just because they exist.

Limitations on Site Statistics, Resources:

1. If Students are enrolled at the roster level, but not the site itself, their activity isn't recorded (This is true in ND's Sakai 10.2 environment).
2. The Export feature does not export all the data, but only the arrangement of the tab one is under. This means the export does not serve as a method by which an Instructor could perform further analysis. The better arrangement would be to be able to export rows which contain each action, per date/time, on resource title, by EID, in Role X.

As we continue to tweak existing tools, we need to ensure we do so in a way which is consistent with a roadmap toward true learning analytics and a 3rd party LTI Dashboard presented in each site. Eventually activity data will be reposed outside the LMS, but the way that it is aggregated, stored, displayed in dashboards and reported today in Sakai can move toward that target (or at least not move counter to that target!).

column41:
The reason for the terminology of "set" was to mean a "group of groups". A group can be joinable and, therefore, a "joinable group". But how will we refer to a "group of joinable groups" where a student can join only one of those groups?

Maybe only some of the "set" terminology needs to change?

Then the create page will describe what is a set of groups.

column1: [SAK-29703] Remove Samigo Preview Grey
column6:
On the Samigo preview view there is a message presented on the top and bottom of the page in grey stating "Assessment Preview - This is an example student view of this assessment ". The color set for this item is web grey (#808080).

Standard web grey does not contrast enough to be WCAG compliant as the contrast ratio must be at least 4.5 (currently 3.95) to 1. Removed the color definition all together so the message inherits the standard page colour (black by default).

The message could be made a more distinctive colour but the fact that it's at the top and bottom of the page and bordered already makes it pretty distinct.

column1: [SAK-36181] failed to populateItemBean error in Samigo question pools
column6:
We're seeing this error in Samigo after 10.5 and I believe it's related to recent fixes for 10.5 an incorrect assumptions about the question pool.

There now only 2 places were false is returned from populateItemBean and the second results in a separate stack trace in the log so it has to be this one.

This is the code that is being used to determine if it's a question pool, but it already knows if it's a question pool.

      // Check permissions: if sequence is null, the item is *not* in a pool
      if (itemfacade.getSequence() != null)

I believe it's checking individual questions in the pool to see if they have a sequence as well as the pool, and when the individual questions do, and the user doesn't have access to edit they're getting an error.

I don't know if this should be critical or blocker, I guess it would depend on how many people hit it but the fix seems straightforward.

org.sakaiproject.portal.api.PortalHandlerException: org.sakaiproject.tool.api.ToolException: javax.servlet.ServletException: failed to populateItemBean.
at org.sakaiproject.portal.charon.handlers.ToolHandler.doPost(ToolHandler.java:75)
caused by: org.sakaiproject.tool.api.ToolException: javax.servlet.ServletException: failed to populateItemBean.
at org.sakaiproject.portal.charon.SkinnableCharonPortal.forwardTool(SkinnableCharonPortal.java:1536)
caused by: javax.servlet.ServletException: failed to populateItemBean.
at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:303)
caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: failed to populateItemBean.
at org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.ui.listener.author.ItemModifyListener.processAction(ItemModifyListener.java:116)
column10: failed to populateItemBean error in Samigo question pools
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Since this entire change is around a security issue, I'm marking as security for the moment even though that will reduce the visibility of this bug. I'm not sure if this needs that though. I'm attaching a patch that checks if the question is in a pool directly rather than checking if it has a sequence which isn't working. This seems like the right thing to do, but I don't know if there's anything special needed for that else case that was left empty if the item is in a question pool

It was semi complex and I believed it involved creating an assessment and manually changing the sequencing of items, then adding these items to the question pool, then sharing the question pool. The as another user (who didn't originally create the pool) attempt to edit the questions.

It's going to be some semi-complex workflow like that around question pool sharing when accessed by someone who isn't the original creator. That's going to cross over on the fix for SAM-2592.
column57:
Should we wait on the completion of SAM-2592 ?

Otherwise, to get this verified, it should either be a code review or just overall tool testing of the question pools function, especially playing around with the steps you mention (sequencing of items, sharing the pool, and then trying to edit as the other user). Is the "other user" the person with whom you share the pool, or someone else?
column61:
I found the steps to reproduce the error.

1. Create a question in an assessment
2. Add the question to a pool
3. Share the pool with another user who is a maintainer in the site
4. Remove the other user from the site
5. As the other user, go to your question pools
6. Attempt to edit the question in the shared pool
column65: Paul Lukasewych , as the other user (step 5), did you have a URL to go directly to the Site? or the Question Pool? etc.?
column137: Another question. Is this really a security issue? Or is it labeled a security issue because it was caused by something in the 10.5 Samigo security fixes? What I mean to say, is this a security vulnerability that we are trying to prevent from being exploited, or just a plain old bug?
column163:
I'm trying to replicate in Sakai 10 nightly(MySql), since the fix hasn't been applied yet.

So far, no luck.

This is what I've tried, using a project site:
1) Create an empty pool
2) Create an assessment
3) add 3 true/false questions
4) re-order the questions
5) add an instructor as a maintainer role
6) go to pool and Share pool with instructor
7) Copy questions into the pool
8) log out. log in as instructor and prove I can edit pool.
9) log out. log in as myself (site creator) and remove the instructor from the site. Grab the URL to edit the pool.
10) log in as instructor and paste in the URL to edit pool. System does not let me access. No error thrown.

Also tried simply removing the instructor from sharing, but not site. Still can't access.

In other words, trying to create a problem so that I can show that it is fixed in Sakai 11. But if not, maybe we can simply merge the patch in and do similar testing to make sure nothing breaks?
column231:
The bug is around access to the shared question pool after removal of access to the site that originally contained the question. There is no need for any special URLs, just the regular question pool user interface. If the removed user can still edit the shared pool questions, the bug should be fixed as far as I can tell.

I don't think this bug itself is an exploitable security issue, because it just takes away access to the pool questions from users that would have had access prior to the security fixes.
column254:
Thanks. I think I am understanding better now, but I still can't reproduce the problem in the 10.x branch. This time, after I removed the instructor from the site, but after adding to the pool, I can still edit a question in the pool (as the instructor with whom I shared the pool) changing point value and the question text, as that instructor by adding Test and Quizzes to one of my sites, and editing in the pool. No direct URL required.

Assuming the fix still has not been merged into the 10.x branch, then I am still missing some step to trigger this problem.

However, if you can reproduce the problem in 10 and you can verify the fix in trunk, please click the Tested button?
(and I am still curious what I might be missing about this issue, if somehow you can figure out what that is.)
column258: I reproduced this on 10.x nightly (mysql). I think you might not be going far enough as the second user. The error does not appear until you click on one of the questions in the pool to edit it.
column263: Tested on Sakai - TRUNK - Sakai 584a5f70605a89568a8d035dd0778cae1ee39eb7

    +# Should the .auth role be assignable to a realm? Defaults to false.
  2. sitemanage.grant.auth=true
  3. Should the .anon role be assignable to a realm? Defaults to false.
  4. sitemanage.grant.anon=true
column87:
Set realm.grant.anon=true in sakai.properties
Restart Tomcat
Create a new site in Worksite Setup
You should be able to see the Additional Access fieldset and it should only have the Anyone option, not the logged in users option.

Set realm.grant.auth=true, repeat the process and you should see both options.

If the leave both props false, the entire Additional Access block should be hidden.

column1: [SAK-29694] Keitai Polls service returning other sites polls also when we request specific site polls
column6:
We are trying to get all polls of a user with in a selected site through keitai services(method name is findAllPollsForUserAndSitesAndPermission).
When we request one site polls it's returning polls of another sites also.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Login as user
2. User should have more sites(min 8) as this issue can be reproduced when user has more sites
3. Add polls tool to each site
4. Create at least one poll in each site
5. Get list of polls of each site using keitai service by passing site Id
webservice url: http://localhost:2016/direct/polls/site/siteID.json
6. Check the poll collection information in returned json format

Expected Result:
Always polls of specific site should be displayed.
Actual Result:
You can observe that polls of a site is appearing when accessing another site's polls.

Observation code:
I found that this issue occurring due to code in findAllPollsForUserAndSitesAndPermission(,,-) method of PollListManagerImpl.java class
Root cause of this issue is "for loop" condition to filter requested sites is breaking without checking all allowed sites as allowedSites list is getting modified while looping over it.

Please validate the attached patch.
column10: Keitai Polls service returning other sites polls also when we request specific site polls
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29692] Disassociating and re-associating gradebook item for an assignment causes grade inflation bug (in 10.x only)
column6:
Steps to reproduce:

  • create an assignment with point value and "Add Assignment to Gradebook"
  • submit an assignment as a student
  • grade that submission as the instructor
  • view the score in the Gradebook
  • edit the assignment by changing to "Do not add assignment to Gradebook"
  • save changes
  • view the score in the Gradebook
  • edit the assignment by changing to "Add Assignment to Gradebook"
  • save changes

Assignments may give you a message about "Alert: The assignment "assignment name" has been created but has not been associated with a new gradebook entry due to an existing entry of the same name. Please edit the assignment and provide a unique title."

However, it still goes ahead with the linking. If you check the Gradebook item, you'll see that the decimal has moved (multiplied by a factor of 10).

This does not happen in trunk because the conditional to show the 'Add to Gradebook' radio button has been updated, and is thus not shown in this situation. The attached patch simply takes the updated conditional from trunk and applies it to 10.x to solve the problem.
column10: Disassociating and re-associating gradebook item for an assignment causes grade inflation bug (in 10.x only)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
A workaround does exist:

After step 9, and you've gone to the gradebook and noticed the inflated grades perform the following:

  • go back and edit the assignment
  • change back to 'Do not add assignment to Gradebook'
  • save
  • edit assignment again
    • instead of selected 'Add assignment to Gradebook', select 'Associate with existing Gradebook entry'
      • select the correct entry from the list (the one that has the inflated grades); save
  • go back to gradebook
  • notice the inflated grades have now gone back to the original, correct values

column1: [SAK-29690] Allow LTI tools to go fullscreen
column6:
As described at:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14151899/when-using-video-js-why-doesnt-the-full-screen-button-work-inside-an-iframe

some HTML pages are unable to go full-screen (typically video playback) if the iframe does not include the allowfullscreen attribute.

This should be set by default for LTI iframes, or if that's not desireable, at least an option per-tool or per-placement.

Index: basiclti/basiclti-portlet/src/java/org/sakaiproject/portlets/IMSBLTIPortlet.java
===================================================================
--- basiclti/basiclti-portlet/src/java/org/sakaiproject/portlets/IMSBLTIPortlet.java	(revision 320142)
+++ basiclti/basiclti-portlet/src/java/org/sakaiproject/portlets/IMSBLTIPortlet.java	(working copy)
@@ -252,7 +252,7 @@
 					text.append("height=\""+frameHeight+"\" \n");
 					text.append("width=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\"\n");
 					text.append("marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\"\n");
-					text.append("src=\""+iframeUrl+"\">\n");
+					text.append("src=\""+iframeUrl+"\" allowfullscreen=\"true\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"true\" mozallowfullscreen=\"true\">\n");
 					text.append(rb.getString("noiframes"));
 					text.append("<br>");
 					text.append("<a href=\""+iframeUrl+"\">");
column10: Allow LTI tools to go fullscreen
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29688] Sakai LTI Unit tests Failing on https connections
column6:
The Sakai unit tests now fail on https connections because the PHP cURL in the current PHP distro does not have any default certificates installed. If you own root on your hosting environment, you can install a sert of certificates but for most hosting environments, end-users cannot install certificates. So with a heavy heart I need to turn off CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER in the unit tests.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17478283/paypal-access-ssl-certificate-unable-to-get-local-issuer-certificate

This is too bad. I get why cURL did this - but in the short and medium, and perhaps even the long term it results is worse security not better because now instead of having one set of cacerts that might be flawed, once everyone installs their own copies of the cacert list - there will be millions of broken cacert files all around the world.

cURL just passed the buck here and made SSL less secure because there is no way an app developer without root permission on their server (99% of php hosting) can work around this no matter how well-intentioned they might be.

How they think every system admin maintianing a separate list of certs is a good thing, I will never know. They will just download a gigantic list and install them without reviewing them, hoping the problem will go away - and with that greatly increasing the chance that a rogue certificate will sneak in and be un-noticed forever.
column10: Sakai LTI Unit tests Failing on https connections
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)

column1: [SAK-29673] Add support for the proposed tool_proxy_guid on LTI 2.1 registration launches
column6:
In order for an LTI 2.x tool consumer and tool provider to ultimately agree on a single unique oauth_consumer key that in unique on both sides across all tenants, the Tool Consumer chooses the proposed key as early as possible in the process and communicates the proposed key as

tool_proxy_guid

on the initial registration launch.

For Sakai, this is easy because we already make the deploy_guid, reg_key, tool consumer profile guid, tool_proxy_guid, and ultimate oauth_consumer_key chosen at the moment of deploy creation and maintained throughout the process.

I feel it is a mistake for LMS system that try to do this otherwise. Some make all these values be different -and that means that when the tool provider finally gets the tool_proxy_guid in the response to the registration request, it might violate the necessary uniqueness constraint that the provider must have on its oauth_consumer_key field across all tenants in a multi-tenant architecture.
column10: Add support for the proposed tool_proxy_guid on LTI 2.1 registration launches

column1: [SAK-29670] The newtopic event is never triggered
column6:
The 'forums.newtopic' event means that a user has created a new topic, but we found out that this event doesn't exist in our database.
Later, we realized that due to a programming error, is always triggered the 'forum.revisetopic' event instead. This event indicates a topic has been modified.

We can use the statistics tool to reproduce it.

  • In Forums tool, add a new topic
  • Make sure, the quartz process to generate events has processed the newer events.
  • In Statistics tool, add a new report, selecting at least the new topic event.

No events shown when generating the report.

column1: [SAK-29663] Log exceptions with stacktraces as ERROR instead of WARN
column6:
log4j definitions:

The WARN level designates potentially harmful situations.

he ERROR level designates error events that might still allow the application to continue running.

Using log4j.properties, we're able to send a certain threshold to centralized exception reporting tools like Sentry.

Many Sakai stacktraces are sent with a WARN instead of ERROR. My argument is that if we are sending a stacktrace, it should be an ERROR. If we are catching something we know can go wrong, then let's just WARN about what happened without a stacktrace.
column10: Log exceptions with stacktraces as ERROR instead of WARN
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
You can use a log4j filter to only allow through logging events that have exceptions associated with them.
I don't think there is a one out of the box but it's trivial to write.

I'm not saying that these exceptions shouldn't be logged at error rather than warn level, but I haven't had a thorough look.

column163:
The approach in trunk and the approach in PR#871 won't work. I think that the only solid solution is a page-reset. I can take this over and develop the page-reset code if you like.

It would actually be pretty easy to make it so that navigating to a page always reset all tools. But then hitting the refresh button with no navivation click would also reset. The need for tool-reset and now page-reset is so we can do the reset only at the moment that the left-hand-link is created but not do the reset when the user presses refresh.

So it is like a GET-Redirect-GET pattern to leave a non-resetting URL in location bar.

column258:
The risk I see with reset on navigation to tool is that someone has multiple tabs and loses work by navigating to a tool is a second tab. At least requiring the second click makes this less likely.

I don't see the lack of synoptic tools as a blocker but having consistent behaviour builds trust from user that they know what will happen when they do something.

column1: [SAK-37719] Improve the importing of Common Cartridges with lots of BLTI entries

Right now, when you import a common cartridge with logs of content items, it adds a "tool" to the site for each content item. But it is a very common strategy to have a bunch of links in a cartridge that only differ in query parameters like:

https://courses.candelalearning.com/api/lti/367?page_id=25

column1: [SAK-29656] Fix inlining portal's handling of tilde ~ and %7e
column6:
This problem has manifested itself in several JIRAs including SAK-28086 Resolved and DASH-337 Closed . It seems to only manifest itself when running in Firefox. Things seem to work in Chrome.

The problem is the different way that URLs with "~" (tilde) are handled when in links, on posts, and in redirects. First off - using tilde is bad according to http://www.cs.tut.fi/~jkorpela/tilde.html

The problem only manifested itself since the "all tools are inlined" change. Prior to inlining everything, the request urls to the tool within the iframe were of the form:

http://localhost:8080/portal/tool/a123../

And after the inline by default the URLs become

http://localhost:8080/portal/site/~csev/tool/a123../

So all of a sudden this made it so that frameworks like Wicket needed to deal with URLs, paths and tool contexts with tildes in the URL/Path.
column10: Fix inlining portal's handling of tilde ~ and %7e
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
Sakai produces URLs with "~" in them. Chrome simply does requests to the url with a ~ in them but FireFox is being a good citizen and maps the tilde to %7e in the browser before the request is made. Sakai / Portal decodes the URL, pulls it apart and then reconstructs it for various pieces and set up of buffered requests, etc. This results in a mismatch between the actual request URL and the toolContext path as shown in these two debug log entries from SkinnableCharonPortal.forwardTool() (about line 1430):

Chrome: forwardtool call http://localhost:8080/portal/site/~csev/tool/aaf64e38-00df-419a-b2ac-63cf2d7f99cf toolPathInfo null ctx /portal/site/~csev/tool/aaf64e38-00df-419a-b2ac-63cf2d7f99cf

Firefox: http://localhost:8080/portal/site/%7ecsev/tool/aaf64e38-00df-419a-b2ac-63cf2d7f99cf/ toolPathInfo null ctx /portal/site/~csev/tool/aaf64e38-00df-419a-b2ac-63cf2d7f99cf

We told both browsers to retrieve the URL with the ~ in it - but Firefox "fixes it". The mismatch is barely noticed by our tool frameworks - but it seems to drive Wicket bonkers and Wicket lays down a 404 when it encounters this mismatch.
column45: Since the request object already is pretty sure what it's request URL is, we simply will patch the toolContextPath (something we constructed) to use the same tilde encoding as the underlying request URL so they match. Should make frameworks that do some kind of comparison of the request URL and tool context path work better.

column1: [SAK-29654] Performance issue with user ranking in Forums
column6:
There seems to be a significant performance bottleneck in Forums with large numbers of posts and users. This appears to be due at least in part to the ranking of each user every time a new action is taken. In our (NYUs) instance this query turned out to be our #1 DB time consuming query:

select count (*) as col_0_0_ from MFR_MESSAGE_T messageimp0_ inner join MFR_TOPIC_T topicimpl1_ on messageimp0_.surrogateKey=topicimpl1_.ID inner join MFR_OPEN_FORUM_T openforumi2_ on topicimpl1_.of_surrogateKey=openforumi2_.ID inner join MFR_AREA_T areaimpl3_ on openforumi2_.surrogateKey=areaimpl3_.ID where areaimpl3_.CONTEXT_ID=:1 and messageimp0_.DRAFT=0 and messageimp0_.DELETED=0 and messageimp0_.CREATED_BY=:2

The code looks to the correct indexes, and we measured that the query is taking about 10 milliseconds to complete (maybe more like 30 milliseconds once you factor in network latency). However, because this query runs once for each user, this time adds up significantly in sites with many users and a large number of Topics/posts.

Performance could be improved by adding an option that allows the admin to turn off ranking to or otherwise change the code to calculate user ranks in bulk.

Link to image of all page requests in Firebug: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_Eit0JDnaT1dk03bEFMdXkxQ2s/view?usp=sharing
column10: Performance issue with user ranking in Forums
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
In order to improve this there would likely need to be a cache created that would store this information so that on subsequent requests the information is retrieved from the cache vs the database.

Having a cache just for these counts does seem excessive so if there are other bits that maybe added that would be ideal as well.
column45: Is this ticket a duplicate of SAK-29571 Closed ? It seems to be referencing the exact same SQL query.
column49:
Yeah it does reference the exact same query, but the issue reported in that ticket is where MySQL optimizer selects a bad query plan using the MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I index.

If MySQL doesn't use the MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I index as part of the query plan then you would not be affected performance wise by this query.
column53:
For reference: the named query is findAuthoredMessageCountForStudent in
messageforums-hbm/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/app/messageforums/dao/hibernate/MessageImpl.hbm.xml
column57:
As a temporary fix, a sakai.property will be introduced to disable ranks for these performance concerns in two phases:
SAK-29934 Verified will hide the feature and prevent the findAuthoredMessageCountForStudent query from occurring in sites that do not have ranks. This means the queries will continue in any sites that already have ranks.
SAK-29936 Verified will disable ranks throughout the code, blocking out the query completely
column61:
We're seeing horrific performance when MySQL selects a bad query plan and are going to try SAK-29571 Closed .

This query does get cached through, so future requests are much faster, could some of the performance problems with large site be because it's effectively overflowing the mysql query cache and so it never manages to cache the data for a whole site?
column65: Claremont Sakai was s also affected by this query last week and our users in the sites could not access Forums tool almost for two hours. Affected two sites are not even large sites. They have only 42 and 47 users respectively. They have a huge Forums threads, though.
