column1: [SAK-29652] New module file picker in Announcements opens a new page
column6:
I discovered this on the nightly trunks while trying to test the new "Resource Picker in a Modal Dialog for Sakai 11" that was added July 2015 ( SAK-29627 Resolved ):

When you launch the file picking modal window using "Add Attachments", it goes to a new page (with no content behind) and displays the modal window on top of that page. This defeats the purpose of having a modal window: might as well just have a dedicated page.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. log into nightly trunk as "instructor" (either Oracle or MySQL; links in Environment details)
  2. go to Worksite Setup
  3. click "New"
  4. choose "project site"
  5. give the site a title like "Test"
  6. Continue
  7. choose "Announcements"
  8. keep the defaults to finish the site creation process
  9. go to the site
  10. go to Announcements
  11. click the "Add" button to create a new announcement
  12. enter a title and announcement (anything)
  13. click the "Add Attachments" button
  14. grab the modal window by the top bar (beside "Add Attachment")
  15. move the modal window down and out of the way

Notice that the Announcements page behind is blank (see attached screenshot). Shouldn't it show the previous page where you enter the title and announcement?
column10: New module file picker in Announcements opens a new page
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
Shawn - this is exactly how it is supposed to work for now. This is because the modal is really that underlying markup. Because the modal is its own page - it makes it trivial to fall back to non-modal in various situations. The modal is really more of a UI cue rather than a separate window.

I would prefer not to put the old text underneath the modal is at all possible. If you look at the lessons markup - the modals are all present in the markup all the time and they are just activated and deactivated when requested.

I could put some text under the modal to the effect of "This content will come back when the modal dialog is closed" or "Waiting for a modal dialog to complete" or some such. Also I should probably make the modal non-movable when operating in this mode.

Comments welome.
column45: I guess I don't understand the purpose of SAK-29627 Resolved to make it a modal window then if it just goes to a different page like it used to do.
column49:
It is a UI hint so people know they are in am multi-step workflow that is like a "stack" that wil eventually go back to the original page. It also means people cannot click all over the place and mess up the "modal" workflow. It reduces surprises where you might be half way through editing the announcement, start a modal dialog, then click on a different site or tool and then get confused when you have lost track of where you came from.

The steps in the workflow are just the same - it just makes it really clear that once you start the helper, if you navigate away from it - you can't come back to the picker.
column53: I think this means we should not allow the modal to be moved - since there is nothing underneath anyways and we block all interaction with any other buttons anyways.
column57:
Shawn - If you look at the non-Modal verson of the picker, the user is presented with nearly 20 buttons which if pressed will mess up the picker and potentially lose everything they have typed in the underlying announcement in their attempt to get back to the announcement. I pur a red rectangle around the "buttons that should not be pushed during a modal page".

In a sense what we should do is make it so the user is asked "are you sure you want ot discard your unsaved work" when any of the red buttons are clicked.

In effect, the modal dialog is a simple and well-understood UI patttern t tll useds "focus on the task you are doing and don't click around until you are donw with this little "interruption dialog" - you can escape any time - but doing so will lose intermediate data.

The modal is effectively greying out al lthe buttons that should never be pushed anyways.

column1: [SAK-29650] Editing a joinable set gives an opportunity for lost user data
column6:
If you change the set name, or the unjoin setting of the set and opt to generate more groups while you're there, clicking the 'Generate' button transfers you back to the Groups List interface, and you've lost your change to the title/unjoin setting.

Conversely, if you want to do both things at once, and you click save rather than generate, you've lost all the entries you put into the generate additional groups fields, and the extra groups are not created.

The solution to this is to implement this interface slightly differently, in that the 'Generate Additional Groups' panel acts as it's own form, and posts back to the current page rather than going back to the main groups listing. In this way, the user can create additional sets of groups with different options without leaving the page. The user can also update the name and unjoin setting of the joinable set in the same run, but the 'Update' button will control actually saving the newly generated groups and/or name/unjoin setting changes.

This PR will also change the 'Generate' panel into a triangle disclosure, and introduce a 'Pending Groups' section which will only show after you've generated some additional groups. It also alters the HTML layout to use div's instead of table elements, removes all inline styles in favour of classes/ids and corresponding .css.
column10: Editing a joinable set gives an opportunity for lost user data

column45: How can I test this? In my "New Account" does not show Password Strength. Maybe there is a property controling this? Thanks
column49:
I found these comments which look related in the default.sakai.properties file :

  1. Control user password policy ( SAK-39378 Closed )
  2. Enable the user password policy handling, must be true to enable the password policy
  3. Other "user.password" settings have no effect if this is false
  4. Default: false
    #user.password.policy=true
  5. Controls the name of the password policy provider class, changing this will make the settings below meaningless
  6. Default: org.sakaiproject.user.api.PasswordPolicyProvider
    #user.password.policy.provider.name=name.of.the.spring.bean
  7. default PasswordPolicyProvider: Controls the entropy settings for the password policy check
  8. Defaults: as shown below (minimum.entropy=16, medium.entropy=32, high.entropy=48)
    #user.password.minimum.entropy=16
    #user.password.medium.entropy=32
    #user.password.high.entropy=48
  9. default PasswordPolicyProvider: Controls the maximum length of sequence of characters from the user EID that is allowed for the password
  10. Default: 3
    #user.password.maximum.sequence.length=3

column1: [SAK-29647] Add API method to get category average scores
column6:
The gradebook currently has Category.calculateStatisticsPerStudent which calculates the mean category grade for all of the assignments in that category, per student. This is not accessible outside of the tool as the Category object is not exposed.

This ticket will track adding an API method to GradebookService:

 /**
     * Calculate a student's score for a category given the category definition and grades for that student.
     * 
     * @param category category to perform the calculations for
     * @param gradeMap map of assignmentId to grade, to use for the calculations
     * @return percentage or null if no calculations were made
     */
    Double calculateCategoryScore(CategoryDefinition category, Map<Long,String> gradeMap);

which will return the percentage score for that category for the given grades
column10: Add API method to get category average scores
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29645] Opportunities for lost user (input) data when creating/editing/saving an 'invalid' group
column6:
When creating/editing a group with invalid data (duplicate group name, etc), the page refreshes with the appropriate feedback message, but any changes the user made to the form fields are discarded. The result is empty form fields for a new group, or the previously saved data for an existing group.

After validation failure, the user's input should be preserved so they don't have to key it all out again.

column6:
Tika 1.9:

https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/tika/CHANGES-1.9.txt

  • The ability to use the cTAKES clinical text
    knowledge extraction system for biomedical data is
    now included as a Tika parser (TIKA-1645, TIKA-1642).
  • Tika-server allows a user to specify the Tika config
    from the command line (TIKA-1652, TIKA-1426).
  • Matlab file detection has been improved (TIKA-1634).
  • The EXIFTool was added as an External parser
    (TIKA-1639).
  • If FFMPEG is installed and on the PATH, it is a
    usable Parser in Tika now (TIKA-1510).
  • Fixes have been applied to the ExternalParser to make
    it functional (TIKA-1638).
  • Tika service loading can now be more verbose with the
    org.apache.tika.service.error.warn system property (TIKA-1636).
  • Tika Server now allows for metadata extraction from remote
    URLs and in addition it outputs the detected language as a
    metadata field (TIKA-1625).
  • OUTPUT_FILE_TOKEN not being replaced in ExternalParser
    contributed by Pascal Essiembre (TIKA-1620).
  • Tika REST server now supports language identification
    (TIKA-1622).
  • All of the example code from the Tika in Action book has
    been donated to Tika and added to tika-examples (TIKA-1562).
  • Tika server now logs errors determining ContentDisposition
    (TIKA-1621).
  • An algorithm for using Byte Histogram frequencies to construct
    a Neural Network and to perform MIME detection was added
    (TIKA-1582).
  • A Bayesian algorithm for MIME detection by probabilistic
    means was added (TIKA-1517).
  • Tika now incorporates the Apache Spatial Information
    System capability of parsing Geographic ISO 19139
    files (TIKA-443). It can also detect those files as
    well.
  • Update the MimeTypes code to support inheritance
    (TIKA-1535).
  • Provide ability to parse and identify Global Change
    Master Directory Interchange Format (GCMD DIF)
    scientific data files (TIKA-1532).
  • Improvements to detect CBOR files by extension (TIKA-1610).
  • Change xerial.org's sqlite-jdbc jar to "provided" (TIKA-1511).
    Users will now need to add sqlite-jdbc to their classpath for
    the Sqlite3Parser to work.
  • ExternalParser.check now catches (suppresses) SecurityException
    and returns false, so it's OK to run Tika with a security policy
    that does not allow execution of external processes (TIKA-1628).

Release 1.8 - 4/13/2015

  • Fix null pointer when processing ODT footer styles (TIKA-1600).
  • Upgrade to com.drewnoakes' metadata-extractor to 2.0 and
    add parser for webp metadata (TIKA-1594).
  • Duration extracted from MP3s with no ID3 tags (TIKA-1589).
  • Upgraded to PDFBox 1.8.9 (TIKA-1575).
  • Tika now supports the IsaTab data standard for bioinformatics
    both in terms of MIME identification and in terms of parsing
    (TIKA-1580).
  • Tika server can now enable CORS requests with the command line
    "--cors" or "-C" option (TIKA-1586).
  • Update jhighlight dependency to avoid using LGPL license. Thank
    @kkrugler for his great contribution (TIKA-1581).
  • Updated HDF and NetCDF parsers to output file version in
    metadata (TIKA-1578 and TIKA-1579).
  • Upgraded to POI 3.12-beta1 (TIKA-1531).
  • Added tika-batch module for directory to directory batch
    processing. This is a new, experimental capability, and the API will
    likely change in future releases (TIKA-1330).
  • Translator.translate() Exceptions are now restricted to
    TikaException and IOException (TIKA-1416).
  • Tika now supports MIME detection for Microsoft Extended
    Makefiles (EMF) (TIKA-1554).
  • Tika has improved delineation in XML and HTML MIME detection
    (TIKA-1365).
  • Upgraded the Drew Noakes metadata-extractor to version 2.7.2
    (TIKA-1576).
  • Added basic style support for ODF documents, contributed by
    Axel Drfler (TIKA-1063).
  • Move Tika server resources and writers to separate
    org.apache.tika.server.resource and writer packages (TIKA-1564).
  • Upgrade UCAR dependencies to 4.5.5 (TIKA-1571).
  • Fix Paths in Tika server welcome page (TIKA-1567).
  • Fixed infinite recursion while parsing some PDFs (TIKA-1038).
  • XHTMLContentHandler now properly passes along body attributes,
    contributed by Markus Jelsma (TIKA-995).
  • TikaCLI option --compare-file-magic to report mime types known to
    the file(1) tool but not known / fully known to Tika.
  • MediaTypeRegistry support for returning known child types.
  • Support for excluding (blacklisting) certain Parsers from being
    used by DefaultParser via the Tika Config file, using the new
    parser-exclude tag (TIKA-1558).
  • Detect Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) Directory
    Interchange Format (DIF) files (TIKA-1561).
  • Tika's JAX-RS server can now return stacktraces for
    parse exceptions (TIKA-1323).
  • Added MockParser for testing handling of exceptions, errors
    and hangs in code that uses parsers (TIKA-1553).
  • The ForkParser service removed from Activator. Rollback of (TIKA-1354).
  • Increased the speed of language identification by
    a factor of two – contributed by Toke Eskildsen (TIKA-1549).
  • Added parser for Sqlite3 db files. Some users will need to
    exclude the dependency on xerial.org's sqlite-jdbc because
    it contains native libs (TIKA-1511).
  • Use POST instead of PUT for tika-server form methods
    (TIKA-1547).
  • A basic wrapper around the UNIX file command was
    added to extract Strings. In addition a parse to
    handle Strings parsing from octet-streams using Latin1
    charsets as added (TIKA-1541, TIKA-1483).
  • Add test files and detection mechanism for Gridded
    Binary (GRIB) files (TIKA-1539).
  • The RAR parser was updated to handle Chinese characters
    using the functionality provided by allowing encoding to
    be used within ZipArchiveInputStream (TIKA-936).
  • Fix out of memory error in surefire plugin (TIKA-1537).
  • Build a parser to extract data from GRIB formats (TIKA-1423).
  • Upgrade to Commons Compress 1.9 (TIKA-1534).
  • Include media duration in metadata parsed by MP4Parser (TIKA-1530).
  • Support password protected 7zip files (using a PasswordProvider,
    in keeping with the other password supporting formats) (TIKA-1521).
  • Password protected Zip files should not trigger an exception (TIKA-1028).

Release 1.7 - 1/9/2015

  • Fixed resource leak in OutlookPSTParser that caused TikaException
    when invoked via AutoDetectParser on Windows (TIKA-1506).
  • HTML tags are properly stripped from content by FeedParser
    (TIKA-1500).
  • Tika Server support for selecting a single metadata key;
    wrapped MetadataEP into MetadataResource (TIKA-1499).
  • Tika Server support for JSON and XMP views of metadata (TIKA-1497).
  • Tika Parent uses dependency management to keep duplicate
    dependencies in different modules the same version (TIKA-1384).
  • Upgraded slf4j to version 1.7.7 (TIKA-1496).
  • Tika Server support for RecursiveParserWrapper's JSON output
    (endpoint=rmeta) equivalent to (TIKA-1451's) -J option
    in tika-app (TIKA-1498).
  • Tika Server support for providing the password for files on a
    per-request basis through the Password http header (TIKA-1494).
  • Simple support for the BPG (Better Portable Graphics) image format
    (TIKA-1491, TIKA-1495).
  • Prevent exceptions from being thrown for some malformed
    mp3 files (TIKA-1218).
  • Reformat pom.xml files to use two spaces per indent (TIKA-1475).
  • Fix warning of slf4j logger on Tika Server startup (TIKA-1472).
  • Tika CLI and GUI now have option to view JSON rendering of output
    of RecursiveParserWrapper (TIKA-1451).
  • Tika now integrates the Geospatial Data Abstraction Library
    (GDAL) for parsing hundreds of geospatial formats (TIKA-605,
    TIKA-1503).
  • ExternalParsers can now use Regexs to specify dynamic keys
    (TIKA-1441).
  • Thread safety issues in ImageMetadataExtractor were resolved
    (TIKA-1369).
  • The ForkParser service is now registered in Activator
    (TIKA-1354).
  • The Rome Library was upgraded to version 1.5 (TIKA-1435).
  • Add markup for files embedded in PDFs (TIKA-1427).
  • Extract files embedded in annotations in PDFS (TIKA-1433).
  • Upgrade to PDFBox 1.8.8 (TIKA-1419, TIKA-1442).
  • Add RecursiveParserWrapper (aka Jukka's and Nick's)
    RecursiveMetadataParser (TIKA-1329)
  • Add example for how to dump TikaConfig to XML (TIKA-1418).
  • Allow users to specify a tika config file for tika-app (TIKA-1426).
  • PackageParser includes the last-modified date from the archive
    in the metadata, when handling embedded entries (TIKA-1246)
  • Created a new Tesseract OCR Parser to extract text from images.
    Requires installation of Tesseract before use (TIKA-93).
  • Basic parser for older Excel formats, such as Excel 4, 5 and 95,
    which can get simple text, and metadata for Excel 5+95 (TIKA-1490)

Release 1.6 - 08/31/2014

  • Parse output should indicate which Parser was actually used
    (TIKA-674).
  • Use the forbidden-apis Maven plugin to check for unsafe Java
    operations (TIKA-1387).
  • Created an ExternalTranslator class to interface with command
    line Translators (TIKA-1385).
  • Created a MosesTranslator as a subclass of ExternalTranslator
    that calls the Moses Decoder machine translation program (TIKA-1385).
  • Created the tika-example module. It will have examples of how to
    use the main Tika interfaces (TIKA-1390).
  • Upgraded to Commons Compress 1.8.1 (TIKA-1275).
  • Upgraded to POI 3.11-beta1 (TIKA-1380).
  • Tika now extracts SDTCell content from tables in .docx files (TIKA-1317).
  • Tika now supports detection of the Persian/Farsi language.
    (TIKA-1337)
  • The Tika Detector interface is now exposed through the JAX-RS
    server (TIKA-1336, TIKA-1336).
  • Tika now has support for parsing binary Matlab files as part of
    our larger effort to increase the number of scientific data formats
    supported. (TIKA-1327)
  • The Tika Server URLs for the unpacker resources have been changed,
    to bring them under a common prefix (TIKA-1324). The mapping is
    /unpacker/ {id} -> /unpack/{id}

    /all/

    {id} -> /unpack/all/{id}
  • Added module and core Tika interface for translating text between
    languages and added a default implementation that call's Microsoft's
    translate service (TIKA-1319)
  • Added an Translator implementation that calls Lingo24's Premium
    Machine Translation API (TIKA-1381)
  • Made RTFParser's list handling slightly more robust against corrupt
    list metadata (TIKA-1305)
  • Fixed bug in CLI json output (TIKA-1291/TIKA-1310)
  • Added ability to turn off image extraction from PDFs (TIKA-1294).
    Users must now turn on this capability via the PDFParserConfig.
  • Upgrade to PDFBox 1.8.6 (TIKA-1290, TIKA-1231, TIKA-1233, TIKA-1352)
  • Zip Container Detection for DWFX and XPS formats, which are OPC
    based (TIKA-1204, TIKA-1221)
  • Added a user facing welcome page to the Tika Server, which
    says what it is, and a very brief summary of what is available.
    (TIKA-1269)
  • Added Tika Server endpoints to list the available mime types,
    Parsers and Detectors, similar to the -list<foo> methods on
    the Tika CLI App (TIKA-1270)
  • Improvements to NetCDF and HDF parsing to mimic the output of
    ncdump and extract text dimensions and spatial and variable
    information from scientific data files (TIKA-1265)
  • Extract attachments from RTF files (TIKA-1010)
  • Support Outlook Personal Folders File Format *.pst (TIKA-623)
  • Added mime entries for additional Ogg based formats (TIKA-1259)
  • Updated the Ogg Vorbis plugin to v0.4, which adds detection for a wider
    range of Ogg formats, and parsers for more Ogg Audio ones (TIKA-1113)
  • PDF: Images in PDF documents can now be extracted as embedded resources.
    (TIKA-1268)
  • Fixed RuntimeException thrown for certain Word Documents (TIKA-1251).
  • CLI: TikaCLI now has another option: --list-parser-details-apt, which outputs
    the list of supported parsers in APT format. This is used to generate the list
    on the formats page (TIKA-411).

column1: [SAK-29639] Need better styles for disabled input elements
column6:
Previous to the morpheus development, we had styles in tool.css for disabled input elements like such:

input[type="submit"][disabled="disabled"], input[type="button"][disabled="disabled"], input[type="submit"][disabled="true"], input[type="button"][disabled="true"], input[type="submit"][disabled], input[type="button"][disabled], input[type="submit"][class="disabled"], input[type="button"][class="disabled"], input[type="submit"][disabled="disabled"]:hover, input[type="button"][disabled="disabled"]:hover, input[type="submit"][disabled="true"]:hover, input[type="button"][disabled="true"]:hover, input[type="submit"][disabled]:hover, input[type="button"][disabled]:hover, input[type="submit"][class="disabled"]:hover, input[type="button"][class="disabled"]:hover, button[disabled]:hover, button[class="disabled"]:hover, .formButtonDisabled, .formButtonDisabled:hover {
    background: transparent linear-gradient(#EEE 0%, #EEE 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0% !important;
    color: #BBB !important;
    border: 1px solid #DDD !important;
    box-shadow: none !important;
    cursor: default;
}

Can we get these back? Or at least the "color: #BBB !important" to make disabled buttons have a different coloured text to visually indicate that the buttons are disabled. Currently, disabled and enabled input elements look exactly the same, and can be confusing for the user.

I would do this myself, but I haven't learned the whole SASS system yet. My appologies in advance!

column1: [SAK-29634] Add Methods Portal's Tool Utilities to pull the request from ThreadLocal if need be
column6:
Add a few convienence methods to the ToolUtils.java in portal.

public static boolean isInlineRequest()
public static String getPageUrl(Site site, SitePage page)
public static String getToolBaseUrl()
public static String getToolBaseUrl(HttpServletRequest req)
public static HttpServletRequest getRequestFromThreadLocal()
public static String getRequestParameter(String key)

These methods are distinct from the earlier methods in that they don't require the HttpServletRequest as a parameter. They pull the request object from ThreadLocal and make all the decisions. This means they can only function after the RequestFilter has been called. So most of the time in normal tool code these work. If the variants without the request parameter are used and there is no request in ThreadLocal it is RuntimeError. We don't want subtle failure here.

This makes things really convenient when you want know whether you are inlined or not deep in a bean with a bean within a bean and the request object is long gone.

Seems like a trade off that needs to be considered.

column1: [SAK-29619] Syllabus dates are not displaying as per timezone
column6:
Start and end dates of syllabus item are not displaying w.r.t time zone.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Login as user
2. Go to a site
3. Go to Syllabus tool
4. Create a syllabus item with start date and end date
5. Go to Home->Preferences->Time zone
6. Choose different time zone and save
7. Go back to the syllabus tool
8. Check the syllabus item start and end date

Expected Result:
Start date and end date should be displayed w.r.t. current time zone.

Actual Result:
There is no change in Start date and end date.

Tested in Sakai MySql trunk

column1: [SAK-29618] Add /direct capabilities for LTI
column6:
This JIRA will capture work to add some /direct services to support LTI data structures. Here is the first round of /direct support for LTI:

contents : show (GET) : [/lti/:ID:/contents] (txt) (json) (html)
Retrieve the content items for a siteId. eg /lti/{siteId}/contents[.format][?first=0&last=10&order=title]

deploys : show (GET) : [/lti/:ID:/deploys] (txt) (json) (html) 
Retrieve the deployments for a siteId. eg /lti/{siteId}/deploys[.format][?first=0&last=10&order=title] (only works for !admin)

tools : show (GET) : [/lti/:ID:/tools] (txt) (json) (html)
Retrieve the tools for a siteId. eg /lti/{siteId}/tools[.format][?first=0&last=10&order=title]

content : * : [/lti/content] (txt) (json) (html)
Retrieve a content item from a siteId. eg /lti/content/{siteId}/{contentId}[.format]

tool : * : [/lti/tool] (txt) (json) (html)
Retrieve a tool from a siteId. eg /lti/tool/{siteId}/{toolId}/tool[.format]

deploy : * : [/lti/deploy] (txt) (json) (html)
Retrieve a deployment from a siteId. eg /lti/deploy/{siteId}/{deployId}[.format] (only works for !admin)
column10: Add /direct capabilities for LTI
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-37427] Add mathjax support to Lessons
column6: It is not possible to see math equations in Lessons though it would be possible do it adding MathJax support to it.
column10: Add mathjax support to Lessons
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: At Rutgers we support Mathjax, but using an implementation that works Sakai-wide. I don't think it makes sense to do this in Lessons. A tool to add it should be in CKeditor, and the necessary support to interpret the Mathjax should be inserted in someplace like headscripts that is used in all tools.
column45:
Mathjax works in Lessons in 11, but has to be enabled. Unfortunately the Sakai implementation doesn't make this easy.
1. it must be enabled in sakai.properties
2. it must be enabled in site info with Edit Info
3. it must be enabled for the specific tool in Edit tools
4. there doesn't seem to be any editor support. So you have to insert the MathML yourself in the editor.

At Rutgers, on a site-wide basis, we support Mathjax in all tools. We have a simple Mathml editor as a plugin in Ckeditor.

column45:
This is because using $

{project.build.directory}

is defined as being $

{basedir}

/target which means it ends up being the full path to the folder which on windows includes the drive letter, this isn't technically allowed.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MECLIPSE-269

Switching to just use target works fine on windows. Although I'm not sure why this section is needed at all as normally the WEB-INF folder is copied across as part of the build.

column1: [SAK-29595] Gradebook comment field is too large
column6:
The comment text field in the gradebook comment is currently a materialized_clob. This needs to be cut down to a reasonable limit of a few hundred chars since all grades and comments are fetched in bulk.

Appropriate checks will need to be be added to the front and backend as well as a db conversion.

<property name="commentText" column="COMMENT_TEXT" type="materialized_clob" not-null="false"/>`
column10: Gradebook comment field is too large
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I've got many rows with this field greater than 500 chars, so I can't do this conversion without losing data. Is it possible to retrieve a fragment of this data (adding a new calculated field) to compose the bulk in order to keep the field with the original size, but allowing a faster bulk operation?
column45: See discussion at https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/749.

column1: [SAK-38068] Page view-ability issues
column6:
If a student has seen a Lessons page, then the student can always see that page.

If an instructor decides to hide a Lessons page (perhaps during an online assessment), the page is still visible to students.

Also, if you use the ability to hide pages on the Page Order tool, it does not hide the Lessons page from list in the Index of Pages (it does hide it in the list of tools on the left).
column10: Page view-ability issues
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Running all the prerequisite checks for all pages still looks unreasonably expensive. The original assumption was that if a user had seen a page, they had met the prerequisites. The use case Maka is concerned about is an instructor that wanted to restrict access during a test. What I can reasonably do during traversal of the tree is

  • check tool-level accessibility of top-level pages, as well as access within lessons
  • stop if I come to a page that is hidden or not released by date.
    This is the same approach used in LessonsAccess.
column45: I have also added group checks to showing items in the index

column1: [SAK-39700] Add Integer Primary Keys to Site, Page, and tool table
column6: This will add an integer primary key to the user, site, page, realm and placement tables. The string guids for these rows will continue to be the primary key and (through Sakai 11) continue to be how the joins and lookups are done for these tables. But these integer primary keys can be evolved to give us much shorter URLs and much faster joins with future post-Sakai-11 modifications.
column10: Add Integer Primary Keys to Site, Page, and tool table
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
Hmmmm.... so now we have two keys, one an int and one a UUID? Why don't we just shorten our UUIDs?

As someone who just merged together two separate Sakai instances, the use of the UUID was great..... the use of integer pkeys in msgcntr, lessons, samigo were a nightmare.
column45:
Yeah, I also don't see the value for this. We already have a url shortening service which could be used in other places if desired to give an alias to to anything if shorter URL's are the concern, though most major sites (google/gmail) have completely long and obscure ids in their URL's nowadays and nobody cares too much about those.

And I remember reading somewhere that there is insignificant performance gain in switching the guids to ids even for doing the joins since it's all optimized at the db level nowadays.

If everything was all just guids I think we'd have been better off, really.
column49:
My theory was to have GUIDs in all the tables and keep them forever and do joins on the integer keys as well as mark all FK references integers. I did some experimentation and it looks like my idea of an easy phased transition will be much harder than I expected. Rules about autoincrement fields being keys and piinting FKs at PKs and having no more than one PK - all made it really difficult.

I never thought of merging two Sakai instances. It would seem that the right thing would be to manifest GUIDs in import/export and use Integers for live/online joins.

My first few hours of experimenting was pretty painful so I think I will take this one off the table.
column53:
While experimenting with this, I wrote this StackOverflow response:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9070764/insert-auto-increment-primary-key-to-existing-mysql-database/31117910#31117910
column57: I made some more progress - but it was mighty tough slogging. I am giving up but throwing this patch in this JIRA in case I get more brave in the future.

column1: [SAK-29589] Add CK Accessibility Help Plugin
column6:

It could also be placed as the first link in the top toolbar.

It's useful inline help. It'd be great to have it added to Sakai 11.

Source and details here http://ckeditor.com/addon/a11yhelp

column1: [SAK-29585] Add additional roles permissions to Admin Site Perms tool
column6:
The Admin Site Perms tool should be enhanced to allow .anon, .auth and provided aditional roles, to have permissions added to the role in a given site type.

  • We will show .anon permission if sakai property "sitemanage.grant.anon" is enabled
  • We will show .auth permission if sakai property "sitemanage.grant.auth" is enabled
  • We always will show .auth and .anon permissions
  • If there are additional roles from a provider, we will show them.
  • We will show these extra options in the "roles" panel, but separated by a <hr/>
column10: Add additional roles permissions to Admin Site Perms tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I don't think you want to check the configuration, otherwise you can't use this tool to remove permissions if the option for normal users isn't enabled.

The Admin Site Perms tool is for administrators who you would hope know what they are doing.

The sitemanage.grant.anon is to stop normal maintainers from having too much flexibility in who they allow into the site.
column45: So, is it fine if we always add .anon and .auth permissions? Or should we take them from some template (like !site.roles or !user.template)?
column49: I think it's fine. In all deployments there are sites with .anon granted (!gateway).
column53:
This works.

Only in the sites that have previously the .anon and .auth permissions. Maybe someone can expect that this will change all the sites... no, it only changes the ones that previously had these roles created. I think this is the expected behavior, isn't it?

column1: [SAK-29577] Give each Plugin Tool/LTI tool instance a different tool id
column6:
When you add an LTI tool to a Sakai instance using the BasicLTI Admin tool, it gives the tool a tool id of "sakai.web.168". This makes administrative tasks difficult, such as assigning a different icon to each type of tool, running statistics for different LTI tools, and determining which LTI tool is being used by which sites.

As we discussed at the Open Apereo 2015 conference, please append a unique identifier to each unique LTI tool.
column10: Give each Plugin Tool/LTI tool instance a different tool id
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41:
Charles Severance I think some PRs got mixed up along the way here. The PR linked to this ticket ("SAK-29577 - Added icon picker to Site info when creating plugin tools") doesn't seem to be related to the title/description of this ticket.

Can you point me to the PR/merge that is/contains the code to address this issue (unique tool IDs)?
column45: The code I checked in allows different icons without changing tool ids - so it is related. There is no progress on changing the actual tool id. That is a harder problem.
column49: The lack of a unique tool ID is also a problem for contextual Help documentation - there's no way to point to a different Help section for each tool with the same ID.

column1: [SAK-39269] Allow MySQL Connector to be easily deployed to Tomcat
column6: Rather than requiring developers to install a copy of the MySQL Connector JAR we could provide a maven profile (disabled by default) that copies the JAR into the correct location.
column10: Allow MySQL Connector to be easily deployed to Tomcat
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: The Oracle OJDBC JAR isn't in a maven repository so it isn't possible todo this with it.
column45: We've also added the MariaDB connector there by default so that people don't have to install anything.
column49:
You can copy the real mysql connector jar using the following maven:

<dependency>
<groupId>mysql</groupId>
<artifactId>mysql-connector-java</artifactId>
<version>5.1.35</version>
</dependency>

I think you can deploy the ojdbc14.jar using this:

<dependency>
<groupId>com.oracle</groupId>
<artifactId>ojdbc14</artifactId>
<version>10.2.0.4.0</version>
</dependency>

IMHO there is no reason not to deploy these all the time.

/Chuck
column53:
Charles Severance There should be no reason to even use the mysql connector anymore since the mariadb one is compatible and has in the past benchmarked to have better performance.

Also it looks like the oracle one that's in http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.oracle is quite old and compatible with Oracle 10 and Java 1.4 (ojdbc14) The latest ojdbc7.jar for 12 (12.1.0.1) and even odbc6.jar for 11 seems to only be available from their website.
column57:
Yeah I think we should use the maria connector too.
But you cannot bundle the oracle driver as its not in any repo due to licensing restrictions (and that version is super old)
column61:
Since committing this patch, trunk-experimental and trunk-mysql are using maria jdbc and MySQL 5.6

driverClassName@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver
column65: Have been running the maria driver on the nightly servers against MySQL and locally against Maria for 6 months now.
column137: Are there any special steps to deploy or will mvn clean install, etc. work? I assume the LGPL license is not a problem because this is a library? Thanks for answering my dumb questions.
column163: Neal Caidin No the maria deploys automatically. LGPL is not a problem because it's compatible and we aren't modifying it anyway, whereas the GPL MySQL driver isn't included by default. There is a profile that you can build with (I believe -P mysql) that will pull in the MySQL driver f you're building from source though, but really isn't needed.

Version 3.12 (2015-05-11)
add Initial XWPFStyles support for working with default document paragraph and run styles
fix If an empty file or stream is given to WorkbookFactory.create, give a more informative exception - EmptyFileException
fix 57552 - Sort PackagePart returns from OPCPackage by name considering numbers in filenames, so Image10.png comes after Image9.png, fixing problems with XSLF adding 10+ images to a slide
fix 57880 - Handle >32,767 cell styles and formats in XSSF (file format limit is 64,000)
add 57593 - Allow WorkbookFactory.create methods to open xlsx files protected with the default password
add 57593 - Add overloaded WorkbookFactory.create methods which take the spreadsheet password
fix 57666 - When removing a SXSSF sheet, ensure temp files associated with it are disposed of
fix 57826 - If a XSSF shape has a buFont but no bullet character, mirror Excel and treat as un-bulleted
fix 57642 - Fix setSheetName with ISERROR on XSSF
add 57747 - Add ISERR() function
fix 57829 - Avoid XmlValueDisconnectedException when removing a XWPFRun from a XWPFParagraph by removing from IRuns as well
fix 57851 - Skip null properties in PropertyTableBase, which is how PropertyFactory reports unsupported POIFS properties
fix 57820 - Avoid NPE on HSLF Tables with a top position of -1
fix 56579 - Throw exception if max string length of 32767 chars is exceeded in XSSF and SXSSF.
fix 55386 - Fix handling of bold formatting in example application 'ToHtml'
fix 47304 - Use fixed encoding when extracting text in WordDocument
fix 56017 - Fix shifting comments with shifted rows
fix 56295 - Fix cloning of styles across workbooks and handling of default value of attribute applyFill
fix 56380 - Remove limitation of 1024 comments per Workbook
fix 56467 - Fix cloning of sheets with pictures
add More helpful ExtractorFactory exception if given a Visio VSDX ooxml file
fix 56799 - Include CTTblGrid in the smaller poi-ooxml-schemas jar
fix 57165 - Avoid PartAlreadyExistsException when removing/cloning sheets
fix 56893 - Additional check for supported string-length to avoid creating broken XLS files later one
fix When saving an OPCPackage with no Core Properties (eg from Jasper Reports), ensure they are always added even if not yet used
fix github-18 - Handle documents with a picture-only header
fix 57622 - Change from XMLEventFactory.newFactory to XMLEventFactory.newInstance, for IBM JDK Compatibility

column1: [SAK-29571] MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I causes bad performance
column6:
Recently it was seen that MySQL was selecting a bad query plan that involved the use of the following index:
MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I

id select_type table type possible_keys key key_len ref rows Extra
1 SIMPLE areaimpl3_ ref PRIMARY,CONTEXT_ID,MFR_AREA_CONTEXT_I MFR_AREA_CONTEXT_I 767 cons 2 Using where; Using index
1 SIMPLE openforumi2_ ref PRIMARY,FKC17608478B5E2A2F,MFR_OF_PAR_BASEFRM FKC17608478B5E2A2F 9 pc.areaimpl3_.ID 1 Using index
1 SIMPLE messageimp0_ ref MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I 1 const 104886 Using where
1 SIMPLE topicimpl1_ eq_ref PRIMARY,FK863DC0BE74C7E92B,MFR_TOPIC_PAR_I1 PRIMARY 8 pc.messageimp0_.surrogateKey 1 Using where

this query took more than 6 seconds to run

select count(*) as col_0_0_ 
    from MFR_MESSAGE_T messageimp0_ 
        inner join MFR_TOPIC_T topicimpl1_ on messageimp0_.surrogateKey=topicimpl1_.ID 
        inner join MFR_OPEN_FORUM_T openforumi2_ on topicimpl1_.of_surrogateKey=openforumi2_.ID 
        inner join MFR_AREA_T areaimpl3_ on openforumi2_.surrogateKey=areaimpl3_.ID 
    where areaimpl3_.CONTEXT_ID='525e4dfd-b3e3-4b35-8988-0de3645330f5'
        and messageimp0_.DRAFT=0 
        and messageimp0_.DELETED=0 
        and messageimp0_.CREATED_BY='1dfa1ae4-d1c1-4c5b-bc26-e6a74b6598a2';

The cardinality on a bit(1) field is horrible and should never be used
column10: MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I causes bad performance
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Locally we have one of our MySQL servers using this really poor plan and another using a different one. Sadly it's the production service that's being dumb probably because of the usage patterns affecting the query planner in a bad way.
column45:
+----+-------------+--------------+------+---------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------+---------+-------------------------------+------+--------------------------+
| id | select_type | table        | type | possible_keys                                                       | key                          | key_len | ref                           | rows | Extra                    |
+----+-------------+--------------+------+---------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------+---------+-------------------------------+------+--------------------------+
|  1 | SIMPLE      | areaimpl3_   | ref  | PRIMARY,MFR_AREA_CONTEXT_UUID_UNIQUE,MFR_AREA_CONTEXT_I             | MFR_AREA_CONTEXT_UUID_UNIQUE | 767     | const                         |    1 | Using where; Using index |
|  1 | SIMPLE      | openforumi2_ | ref  | PRIMARY,FKC17608478B5E2A2F,MFR_OF_PARENT_BASEFORUM_I                | FKC17608478B5E2A2F           | 9       | sakai_staging.areaimpl3_.ID   |    1 | Using where; Using index |
|  1 | SIMPLE      | topicimpl1_  | ref  | PRIMARY,FK863DC0BE74C7E92B,MFR_TOPIC_PARENT_I1                      | MFR_TOPIC_PARENT_I1          | 9       | sakai_staging.openforumi2_.ID |   18 | Using where; Using index |
|  1 | SIMPLE      | messageimp0_ | ref  | FK80C1A316A2D0BE7B,MFR_MESSAGE_DELETED_I,MFR_MESSAGE_PARENT_TOPIC_I | FK80C1A316A2D0BE7B           | 9       | sakai_staging.topicimpl1_.ID  |    8 | Using where              |
+----+-------------+--------------+------+---------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------+---------+-------------------------------+------+--------------------------+
column49: I should add we are on MySQL 5.5, I don't know if the optimizer is better under 5.6/5.7 and so only some deployments will notice this.

should be replaced with

column1: [SAK-29563] Modify interface to improve My workspace return
column6:
The most significant issue uncovered through the UX testing at Open Apereo was the difficulty in returning to My Workspace once a user has left that area and entered an individual course. In order to address that issue, the following navigation changes are proposed:

1. Include home icon in the top left corner. Several users seemed to want to go to the top left to return back to the login landing page, and this location seems to make sense to users in terms of familiarity with navigating back to home in other web applications.

2. Include a link to the Dashboard in the user drop-down menu. Several users seemed to look to this menu to return them to the landing page. (Alternately, My Workspace could be included in the menu rather than Dashboard; however, since the dashboard is very prominent and easily recognizable, users unfamiliar with the term My Workspace might find Dashboard more descriptive/intuitive.)

3. When a user clicks on the User icon and/or Name, the user goes directly to the Profile tool. This is a change from the current behavior.

Users expect to go to Profile and edit personal details when they click on their name or image. This is a common navigation pattern in many web applications.
column10: Modify interface to improve My workspace return
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29562] Add support for the SHA-256 signing as required by LTI 2.1
column6:
Implement the new OAuth signing using SHA256 feature of LTI 2.1.

"A tool consumer should always sign using HMAC-SHA256 if the Tool Proxy contains an enabled capability of OAuth.hmac-sha256; otherwise it should use HMAC-SHA1. A tool provider should always accept the OAuth.hmac-sha256 capability if it is offered and, therefore, sign using HMAC-SHA256; otherwise it should sign all its messages to the tool consumer using HMAC-SHA1."

This should not be back-ported to 10.x

Depends on SAK-29561 Resolved
column10: Add support for the SHA-256 signing as required by LTI 2.1

column1: [SAK-29560] Keep Sakai caught up with IMS LTI 2.1 as it goes through approval
column6:
IMS LTI 2.1 is about to go to public draft. At that point there will be interoperability testing and certification testing and final tweaks to the spec. This JIRA will be used to make those changed. It will be kept open until Sakai passes LTI 2.1 certification.

This adds a property:

basiclti.strict=true

This suppresses extensions that break XSD errors. In particular, we match the Canvas comment extension in LTI 1.1 but it extends the XML beyond the XSD.

column1: [SAK-37401] Make edit/delete comments time configurable
column6:
In lessons when a student edits their comments there's a hardcoded message that says.

You may only edit or delete your comment until it is 30 minutes old.

There's some logic in SimplePageBean->canModifyComment that says
/**

  • Admins can always edit. Authors can edit for 30 minutes.

I'm not sure why this is set to be limited on the student side? This is a feature request to make this unlimited for students (-1) and also configurable to be larger than 30 minutes unless there's some reason why this particular number was chosen.
column10: Make edit/delete comments time configurable
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
I agree. That looks worth doing. I think the reason Eric added the time limit is that comments can be graded. He was concerned about not having them change after grading. Also, some people worry about what happens to a discussion of someone changes an item that others have responded to. One of the Internet forums i use limits edits for that reason.

But it seems like it should be configurable. It's easy enough to do. It just adds extra complexity to the UI. I'll do that after the changes to copying pages that I agreed to, since it has less wide impact, and will be easier to test.
column45: Would this proposed configuration be configurable from the institution level (via sakai.properties) or by the instructor (via "Edit" beside the Add Comments area)?
column49: Thinking about it further, if the time restriction was added to restrict the student from editing after grading, then a less round-about way than an arbitrary time limit would be to automatically lock the editing from the student when a score is entered, which would be controlled by an option in the Edit area for instructors ("Lock comment from student changes after comment is marked" or something like that).
column53: My intent was to put the option in the edit dialog. Probably with the default not to have a limit.

column1: [SAK-37184] Remove assessment confirmation
column6:
We have local enhancement for removing published assessments. For out of box, the published assessment can be removed after you you hit the confirmation button as per screenshot.

We added conditional remove for published assessment – only can remove when there is no submissions in the test. The alert msg at remove attempt when submission(s) is available will be:
"In order to delete this assessment, you must first delete all submissions associated with it."
To avoid instructor accidentally remove test with submissions, they have to go back and manually remove all the submissions (Using the feature added in SAK-37261 Verified ) and then come back to be able to remove the test.

This could avoid published assessment being removed accidently while there were already student submitted their test.

column1: [SAK-29558] Add allow retake to Question function in Lessons
column6:
Add allow retake to question function in Lesson. Use of the Question function in Lessons is great for providing opportunities to students on grasp of content - esp. ahead of high-stakes assessments. However, being able to allow students the opportunity to re-try the question would be beneficial. Courses using the Question function as part of a student grade, could provide students more than once opportunity to take (do) the question, should they get the answer wrong.

Alternatively you could provide an option for students to earn an 'event' point, so that even if the student gets the answer wrong, they're awarded a point for having done the question. This sort of self-check is really good for 'in content' review, esp. in online courses, where progress thresholds are used.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3393906/questionfuctioninlesson.png
column10: Add allow retake to Question function in Lessons
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
This feature seems valuable to us at Pepperdine University.

Conceivably, an instructor could "X" cancel/delete a student's response, and thus unlock the question for that student for another try.
column45:
I'm not sure if the feature would allow a set of properties or just one.

One property could allow for unlimited attempts to the question, until the student correctly answers the question. Or there could be a property as you suggest to have instructors allow a certain number of attempts until the student is permitted to go on. Or there could be a sort of "allow retake" option like what exists in T&Q. Regardless of the method it should be simple to implement and easy for an instructor or TA to administrate.

Perhaps out of the box the default behavior is unlimited attempts.

An option might provide "Grade this item and allow 3 attempts" and then release the next items. This bears out some thinking because it could (like other items - such as requiring a student to post to a forum or get a certain grade on a quiz in T&Q) get really complicated to implement - just in the UX interface workflow.

column1: [SAK-29557] Assignments / grade report
column6:
In 10x, the Grade Report function in Assignments only includes students who have submitted to the assignment. If the student turned in the assignment manually and the instructor grades the assignment, the grade will not be included with the report.

In Sakai 11, the Grade Report screen shows all students at all times. It doesn't matter if they have made a submission to the assignment.

column1: [SAK-29554] Site Deletion: Delete site message is wrong.
column6:
Delete site message is incorrect now that we have softly deleted sites.

If the site has softly deleted sites, change the message to

"This site will be 'softly deleted' but will remain accessible to you via the "View softly deleted Sites" option in the Worksite Setup tool which is found in My Workspace. It will eventually be purged as per the schedule set by your System Administrator.

Participants will no longer be able to access the site, however the contents of the site will be preserved and you can restore access to the site at any time before it is purged."

If the site does not have softly deleted sites, then make the message:

"Deleting a site removes the entire site's content and is not recoverable - no one else will be able to access the deleted site. If you are trying to remove yourself from the site, use the Membership tool in your My Workspace to unjoin the site." (which is what's currently on the qa server)

column1: [SAK-29550] Gradebook is not using the global transaction manager
column6:
In doing work for SAK-38991 Resolved was experiencing a HibernateException related to a prebound JDBC conenction.

The issue was that Gradebook was not using the sakai global transaction manager declared in kernel-component but its own. This is not allowed as you should only have one Transaction Manager per data source.

column1: [SAK-29548] Make search fields default text into true placeholder text
column6:
Currently the default value of the search fields is actually a value, rather than a placeholder. This is annoying for the users, who have to manually clear out the placeholder text before typing their desired search value.

Also, having the default as a value text requires server side code to detect and abort actually searching for the default text.

The linked PR turns the default text into a true HTML5 placeholder attribute text.

column1: [SAK-34945] Add Side Panel to Track Question Progress
column6:
Add a panel available in assessments which shows test takers their current position in the test (i.e. what question they are on), which questions they have answered, which questions they have not answered, and which questions they have marked for review. Also, allows for navigation between questions.

As it stands this panel only displays for assessments which have one question per page. The panel will auto-hide for assessments which have multiple questions per page.

Work was started by Paul Dagnall and then finished by David Bauer.

Here is a video which highlight's it's features: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pU91pnPhT6w
column10: Add Side Panel to Track Question Progress
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
hiya.

+1 for the feature.

We sometimes see the most ridiculous test (e.g. a 400 question True/False test!) such tests would make the proposed UI nearly unmanageable/meaningless. To cope with a widest range of tests scenarios (and abiding by the KISS principle) I'd like to suggest simply listing the number of questions in each category (Unanswered, Answers, Review) - see screenshot.

Can we make the categories plural (i.e. unanswered questions rather than unanswered question)

In addition does the "Question Marked for Review" fall away when the option "Linear access to questions with NO return to previous pages" is selected?

Any thoughts about the comments here: https://groups.google.com/a/apereo.org/d/topic/sakai-user/b85UuA8R8-M/discussion
column45:
I attached a picture of the panel with 200 questions in Sakai 2.9.3.

Consolidating the Panel into an overview of the number of questions they have or have not answered does not help the test taker know which questions they still need to work on.

A nice improvement would be to have Part sub-sections collapsible in the panel.

The mark questions for review is not a feature added or modified by this ticket. It is a per exam setting, whose default is off. I did have a quick moment to check on the 10.x nightly server, and if the assessment is linear you may not allow test takers to mark questions for review.

EDIT: The panel is disabled on linear exams.
column49:
https://groups.google.com/a/apereo.org/forum/#!topic/sakai-user/b85UuA8R8-M? as above, doesn't get me to the topic.This feature may not go far enough, and if it doesn't, the potential is there to annoy or anger students.

Let's say I am taking a timed exam. There are 100 questions delivered one at a time. So far, Samigo performance, if the questions are derived from pools, has been less than instantaneous, and the only way to get to the question I haven't yet answered or want to change my answer to, is to repeatedly wait for the Previous or Next button to respond.

The response time is human noticeable. I would recommend, if this feature is built (and I love it) , that the panel allow direct navigation to the question the student wants to review or change answers for. If it only displays progress, it will be anti-climatic for most test takers.

The panel exists and allows navigation for non-linear tests. For linear tests, as mentioned in a previous comment, the panel does not appear. This probably doesn't cover everything. We need more input.

column65:
Since the July/August time frame ended up being a difficult one in which to schedule faculty and students for a live UX test, we gathered some user feedback via a short UX survey as an alternative to more structured testing.

I've summarized the results of the survey below. There is also a link to view the responses in more detail at the bottom of this message.

UX Feedback Survey - Question Progress Side Panel ( SAK-34945 Resolved )
Summary of Results

There were 31 survey submissions total. Instructional Technology/Support users comprised more than half (55%), but there were also some students (7%) and faculty (22%) responding.

90% of survey participants liked the new Samigo side panel feature. There were 27 positive comments which collectively described the new side panel as intuitive, convenient for navigation, a time-saver for long assessments, and good for providing feedback for students on their progress during the test. Only 10% (or 3 respondents) commented on potential negatives such as the interface becoming crowded if tests are very long, questions about how the side panel would look on a mobile device, and not wanting students to print the side panel to share with other students.

80% of survey participants (24 out of 30 answering this question) stated that they liked the use of the circles to indicate answer status. Many respondents commented that the circles reminded them of printed scantron or bubble sheet tests and they thought the filled-in circle for answered questions was intuitive in that respect. Only 20% (6 out of 30) of the survey participants stated that they did not like the circles, and/or indicated that they would prefer the use of check marks rather than filled circles to indicate completion.

Almost all of those responding (96%) thought this new feature would be helpful to users. In addition, the majority (84%) preferred the side panel to the Table of Contents for navigation within an assessment. However, there were mixed results regarding the fact that the panel only displays in non-linear tests. More than half (56%) did not see this as an issue for users, but 16% of respondents thought it might be a problem, and 26% were uncertain.

Finally, other comments and observations from participants included: questions about how this would look on a tablet or mobile device, positive remarks concerning the addition of the feature, requests for the ability to hide the mark for review option, and requests for the ability to display the side panel on linear tests (for tracking progress) but with some indication that students cannot jump forward or back. Additional UX testing with actual users in a more structured test environment was also suggested.

If you would like to view the survey results in more detail, please go to https://docs.google.com/a/longsight.com/forms/d/10b4WOyTx2ev6OHirFUCIQ5Ca1TeIApkFIidOB64orrk/viewanalytics
column137:
Only 10% (or 3 respondents) commented on potential negatives such as the interface becoming crowded if tests are very long, questions about how the side panel would look on a mobile device, and not wanting students to print the side panel to share with other students.

The side panel is disabled on mobile devices. To mitigate the long test issue, if the test is made with parts the panel should be possible to have the inactive parts be collapsed.

Only 20% (6 out of 30) of the survey participants stated that they did not like the circles, and/or indicated that they would prefer the use of check marks rather than filled circles to indicate completion.

A future improvement could be made which would allow administrators to change the circles to check marks.

However, there were mixed results regarding the fact that the panel only displays in non-linear tests. More than half (56%) did not see this as an issue for users, but 16% of respondents thought it might be a problem, and 26% were uncertain.

Just to note, the Table of Contents is hidden in linear tests as well. Though, I do see value in having it appear in linear tests as a progress indicator.

requests for the ability to hide the mark for review option,

This is an individual assessment option. If the option is disabled, it will not be shown in the panel.

column41:
There's this block of code in StatsManagerImpl, and I don't know what it's on about:

if(enableSitePresences == null)

{ // turn off, by default enableSitePresences = false;// M_scs.getBoolean("display.users.present", false) || M_scs.getBoolean("presence.events.log", false); }

else if(enableSitePresences.booleanValue()){
// if turned on, make sure "display.users.present" is true
// this feature doesn't work properly with "presence.events.log"
if(M_scs.getBoolean("display.users.present", false))

{ enableSitePresences = M_scs.getBoolean("display.users.present", false); }

else if(M_scs.getBoolean("presence.events.log", false))

{ enableSitePresences = false; LOG.warn("Disabled SiteStats presence tracking: doesn't work properly with 'presence.events.log' => only plays nicely with 'display.users.present'"); }

}

It seems to imply that you can only do presence logging if you turn it on via Spring config, so the presence.events.log switch becomes ineffective. I removed that enforced false and presence logging starts up and seems fine, so I don't know what the issue is. Does anybody have any idea?

column1: [SAK-29543] Add a link to the Accessibility Statement from Morpheus portal
column6:
Earlier versions of Sakai have a link to /portal/help/TOCDisplay/content.hlp?docId=accessibilityinformation from the portal footer. This has the label "Accessibility Help".

There should be a link at the start of the Morpheus portal either in addition to the link in the footer or the link should present a shortcut to the footer. Users who need accessibility guidelines should not have to tab through the whole page to get help. It should be virtually the first thing they encounter.

Add this vital link back into the footer I would suggest that it goes either before or after "Gateway". It should be a list item and should open a new tab.

Whilst you're at it, you could stylise the list a little, add a vertical bar in as list separator. This is done with the following

portal.css (line 111 on my machine):

#footer-links li {
  border-left: 1px solid #ccc;
  display: inline;
  list-style-type: none;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}
#footer-links li:first-child {
  border: medium none;
}
column10: Add a link to the Accessibility Statement from Morpheus portal

column1: [SAK-29540] Improve discoverability of To and BCC name lookup in Messages tool
column6:
In Sakai 10, the Messages tool got a new interface for selecting which users to send a message to (see https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-25495 ). After upgrading, we had several users who didn't realize they should click on the text box to get the list of users they were accustomed to seeing.

To resolve this, I upgraded the select2 library to its most recent version (4.0.0 - MIT License), and added some placeholder text and an icon to the dropdown. I'll submit a pull request with that work.
column10: Improve discoverability of To and BCC name lookup in Messages tool
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Sounds nice. Thanks! Maybe the second part should be a separate ticket?
column45:
I think it's probably ok just being a footnote here... worked for our users but I don't think it's a clear improvement. I'll move it into this comment:

We also had a couple complaints from end users that were accustomed to selecting multiple names from the list using the shift key. They felt the disappearance of the list each time a new was selected made their workflow less efficient. We're resolving that locally by adding one parameter to the select2() call in messages.js (line 96) - closeOnSelect: false . I'm not including that in the pull request because I'm not convinced that's a universally beneficial change, and it's small enough that making it configurable seems silly. If other people want that option, feel free to use it.

column1: [SAK-29547] Owners/Instructors are unable to access permissions for individual Resources folders
column6:
Owners/Instructors are no longer able to see the Edit Folder Permissions in the Actions menus of any Resources folders (screenshot). This functionality is frequently used by instructors to give the Student role the ability to upload content to a given folder.

Admins are able to see the entry in the drop-down list and make changes. Making someone an admin allows them to see the item, removing them from admin removes the item.
All Resources perms are selected, both on the site and in Realms.
Looking in Sites, nothing in the tool itself seems to be incorrect.
No relevant entries in the Sakai.properties file.
The Edit Folder Permissions item is missing from old (2006) sites and newly created sites.
Seems to be a permissions issue but since ALL perms are assigned it is more likely the result of a change to the code.

Ref: INC0453997

column1: [SAK-29531] PNotify regression in portal (morpheus)
column6:

column1: [SAK-37891] improve auto created folders for uploaded files
column6:
When files are uploaded, we create a folder. Make the following improvements:

  • folders are in a hierarchy matching the page hierarchy
  • there is one folder per page
  • if the page is renamed we keep using the same folder, so that there's just one folder per page. The folder name is remembered as an attribute of the page.
  • folder names are limited to 30 characters, to allow for a fairly deep hierarchy
  • folder names are always unique. The -1, -2 approach is used to avoid duplication.
  • If the length of a folder name would be too close to the limit, just use the name of the page
  • limit file names to 30 characters

For long names, truncation is done in the middle.

Note that existing files will be left where they are, to avoid breaking links.

A field is added to lesson_builder_pages. If auto.ddl is on everything will work automatically. folder varchar(250).

column1: [SAK-29530] Event Date not changed - the starting date displayed in all recurring events
column6:
When viewing / editing a single event of recurring events, if one selects any occurrence other than the first occurrence, the date that is displayed is only the starting date (first date) of the recurring events not the date of the selected event.
Here are steps to replicate this date issue:
1) Create a recurring event
Title: Office Hour
Date: June 12th
Start Time: 3PM
Duration: 1 hours
Frequency: daily
Ends: on June 19
2) Save the event
3) Click the June 13th Office hour > you will see "Date: Jun 12, 2015" rather than "Date" Jun 13, 2015". The same goes for June 14 ~ June 19th Office hour.

I've tested Sakai QA servers (10.2, 10.4, and 10.x). They have the same behaviors as described above. I also tested the local Sakai 2.9.3. The schedule tool of Sakai 2.9.3 displays the corresponding date for each occurrence of the recurring event. For example, if you click June 13th Office hour, Date is displayed with Jun 13th rather than Jun 12, 2015. Despite of editing and saving the date, the displayed date is never changed and it is only shown as the first starting date.

column1: [SAK-38941] Add ability to "promote" sakai.property entries to be System Properties
column6:
In order to set a System-wide property, we add the suffix of "@SystemProperty" to the property in the sakai.properties file:

kernel.test.key=kernel
system.test.key@SystemProperty=sakai

Once this is done, any Java code anywhere in the Sakai JVM can do

System.getProperty("system.test.key")

To retrieve the value of that property key. The use case for this is if a third-party jar that we do not want to modify in Sakai needs a bit of configuration in order to work. As an example, a Factory within a third party jar might need to be told which implementation to use when running within the Sakai JVM.

I would like to see this back-ported to 10.x once we like the implementation.
column10: Add ability to "promote" sakai.property entries to be System Properties
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
There is already a way to "promote" Sakai properties to system properties using org.sakaiproject.util.SakaiPropertyPromoter and editing:

kernel/component-manager/src/main/bundle/org/sakaiproject/config/sakai-configuration.xml

This is there for legacy properties and probably can be removed at some point. And in general it is too brittle to require changing a Spring XML configuration deep in the kernel just to set a System property.
column45: Please review this carefully to make sure that this (a) fits our architecural style, (b) there is not a more Spring way to do it and (c) is unlikely to harm a bean that is named "System" in case we are ever so dumb to create such a bean.
column49:
From Earle: I've been thinking of a larger idea to provide meta data to configuration via property files. I don't think the "@" annotation is ideal since these properties are typically passed to Spring.

Maybe we can have a discussion on this topic?

I was hoping to have a conversation about it. The @properties get passed to Spring. Our code controls that and we could "eat" the @SystemProperty properties at a really clean place. But the code that hunts for a bean with the @name and passed the property to it does not care if the @bean does not exist:

fred@org.samsonite.briefcase=zap123

I am also happy to change the code that passed the properties into beans and stop the @SystemProperty ones from being forwarded to Spring.

I would be rather opposed to some new place for these kinds of properties - it is jsut one more thing to drag around when supporting lots of clients. There needs to be some convention in sakai.properties IMHO.
column53:
Earle,

Is this the "remote property setter"?

./cxf/src/java/org/sakaiproject/webservices/SakaiConfiguration.java

Looking at it, it does not support bean properties at all. Which of course is quite a limitation as it means that we cannot setup a DB conneciton using this meshanism. This kind of makes this CXF a second-class citizen as a property setter (for now). And given its logic, using @SystemProperty properties will be ignored by the CXF - so there is no harm with my change.
column57:
I am going to close and re-submit the PR and rename the string to "@SystemProperty" and resubmit

https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/702
column61:

column163: FWIW, the sakai-configuration.xml file does not need a rebuild. You can add one to sakai.home and it will take effect. It does have to be a valid bean config file and I haven't personally played with promoting to system properties from there, but the whole point of sakai-configuration.xml was to avoid rebuilds. No comment on the new feature.
column231: Thanks - I did not know that. I still like my feature. Simple and direct. Allows things to be set in nightlies easily, etc. Also if one overrides sakai-configuration.xml - how do you get new things when the original file is changed? Or is it additive?

column1: [SAK-29529] High Priority Future Announcements not being emailed
column6:
future-released high-priority announcements in the Announcements tool are not being emailed out when the release date comes. When future-dated, high priority announcements are created, only the last-created announcement is actually sent out via email. To reproduce, the steps are easy:

1. In a Sakai Course site, create an announcement, set it to be released some time in the future and set it to be high priority.
2. Create a second announcement the same way.
3. Repeat "n" times.
3. Wait.

Only the nth announcement will actually be sent via email. Interestingly, this only happens for Sites with type "course" and not "project".
column10: High Priority Future Announcements not being emailed
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
The issue stems from BaseAnnouncementChannelEdit.setMessageUnreleasedMax

essentially the message order was being saved as a message property. When that is updated and saved, it saves it through Message.commitMessage(), which you have to specify the email notification status each time you save (and it was passing NONE). This would then wipe out the scheduled notification and not schedule any new ones.
column45: Tested on nightly trunk. All announcements were sent.

First of all, the page title "Site Type" - this was true when wll you were doing was chosing between two different site types (project / course), now what you are doing is creating a site using one of a number of different methods.

I propose renaming the page Create Site

Change "Choose the type of site you want to create. Only instructors can create official course websites. Instructors and students can create project websites. NOTE: Students, if you do not see a tab for your course, contact your instructor for information about when your official course website will be available."

to

<p class="instruction">
A site can be created in a number of different ways, please choose the most appropriate method:
</p>

<p class="instruction">
This option is for experienced users and lets site owners add individual site tools.
</p>

Under Create site from template put

<p class="instruction">
This option gives a pre-configured site which already contains a selection of hand-picked tools.
</p>

Under Create site from archive put

<p class="instruction">
This option allows you to use an existing site archive as the basis for a new site. Content from the archive will be added to the new site.
</p>

At the bottom put

{code]
<p class="instruction">You can add or remove tools from either type of site at any time.</p>






Sorry for the big change!

column1: [SAK-29520] When sites are copied, do a simple search and replace of all files (and long description) and replace old site id with new site id
column6:
When a site is copied, any dependent resources should be copied too and links to the resource should be updated to point to the new site.

Currently we will need to process all html files in resources and URL resources. And then any HTML content that is in a tool.

Have a kernel util or service which given a string will ensure all resources referenced in that string are copied into the new site, returning the updated string.

As most HTML files should be reasonably small reading the whole file into memory isn't too serious. I think we should warn about processing files large than 1MB and refuse to process 10MB files.

Tools can then use this service to update their HTML and ensure that the resources exist in the new site.

We will only copy content from the source site, any references to content in other sites will remain untouched, otherwise content that is designed to be shared may well end up duplicated across sites.
column10: When sites are copied, do a simple search and replace of all files (and long description) and replace old site id with new site id

column45: How much of this code is needed when Sakai has org.sakaiproject.entity.api.EntityTransferrerRefMigrator?
column49:
Hi Bernardo Garcia (Samoo)

at the jira triage call, there was some discussion about how much work was still needed to fix the comments that were made on the PR.
column53: assigned to you Nick.
column57:
Ok I've been looking at this and here are my notes:

The places that call the EntityTransferrer(RefMigrator) are just SiteAction and WebServices

The tool support for these interfaces is:
EntityTransferrer: 16
EntityTransferrerRefMigrator: 9

There's code that assumes all ETRM implementations also implement ET.
There's also ContentExistAware which should be merged into existing interface with default implementation.
LinkMigrationHelper is used in the updateEntity methods in the services to re-write links.
Site Action generates short URLs for /portal/directtool URLs.

Our ContentCopy code does:

  • Fuller short URL expansion as it looks up all URLs.
  • Hooks into ET so gets used in more places.
  • Copies files from resources that are referenced in HTML and optionally walks references to take the whole tree.
  • Understands more URLs for ContentHosting (eg /web).

We should just have one interfaces and use Java 8's default methods to evolve it rather than the multiple interfaces we have at the moment.
We should keep better track of how the copy goes including error messages.

column1: [SAK-29519] Support cloud storage of content resources
column6:
The FileSystemHandler introduced in SAK-39504 Resolved makes way for cloud-based handlers for content files. The first two obvious candidates are OpenStack Swift and AWS S3.

A successful implementation would be pluggable in that it can be added to an existing Sakai installation without recompiling other modules (even for configuration). With this as a design goal, there should be at least one new top-level module to contain any base/reference handlers, and the selection/configuration mechanism should be external to the module.
column10: Support cloud storage of content resources
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

I'd agree this init method should still have additional error checking. I wonder if we have more beans like this out there.that really are only used in special cases and could be avoided starting to speed up start times & save memory.
