column45: What's the difference between an external assignment and an internal "one"?
column49:
External assignments are created via the GradebookExternalAssessmentService. They're used as a way for other tools to add a gradebook item that they "own". The biggest difference is that the scores for external items can't be edited from the gradebook UI itself. They can only be updated via the GradebookExternalAssessmentService.

Internal assignments are just regular gradebook assignments that were created from the gradebook tool. The assignments tool gives you an option to associate an assignment with an existing (internal) gradebook item or the option to create a new gradebook item (external).
column53:
Thanks for clarifying, Chris. That's what I thought internal versus external meant, but I just wanted to make sure I had the right context.

So before this feature request, comments would only go to the Gradebook from Assignments if the Gradebook Item was created by the Assignments tool? After this feature, comments go to the Gradebook from Assignments there were associated with an existing Gradebook Item? Do I have this right?
column57: Yep, that's correct.
column151:
I believe the test plan for this to be

1) Create a site, add gradebook and assignments tool. You also need at least one student in the course
2) Create an assignment,

  • Pick a points grade scale and points
  • Click "Add Assignment to Gradebook"
  • Fill in the other required fields (like title) save

3) Go to gradebook, you should have an assignment that's From Assignments

  • Add a new Gradebook Item give it some number of points

4) Go back to assignments and create another Assignment

  • Pick a points grade scale and points
  • Click "Associate with existing Gradebook entry"
  • Select the entry you created in 3

5) Now on both Assignments click "Grade" and select a student in the course (You don't need to have submitted)

  • Add a grade (points) and a summary comment.
  • Save and release
    6) Go into gradebook and click on the gradebook item
    7) Check to see that a grade and a comment are both added for both items.

Previously it was only added for items "Associated" (Step 4)

column1: [SAK-29515] Sakai 10.5-RC02 and RC03 new issues
column6:
If you think you've found a bug, please search to see if it already exists (if you are not familiar with Jira, you can use Google [1]). Learning to use Jira can come in handy though [2].

If this is a new issue, open it as a bug in the appropriate project. Most issues will be opened in the Sakai project. Tools that have their own Jira project include:
Lessons - LSNBLDR project
Samigo Test and quizzes - SAM project

Please then link to your issue from this issue as "Relates to".

If you have any questions, please either write the sakai-dev list or email sakaicoordinator@apereo.org

[1] 3 minute video showing how to search bugs already reported using Google - http://www.screencast.com/t/Na2DjAnqAl

[2] Longer video explaining how the Sakai community uses Jira - - https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/PED/Sakai+Jira+Training+10-9-13

column1: [SAK-29514] Support accessibility in Velocity menus
column6:
Some velocity based tools uses the component MenuEntry (org.sakaiproject.cheftool.menu.MenuEntry) to render the menu options (Calendar for example).

With a simple command like this you will have a new button:

bar.add( new MenuEntry(rb.getString("java.import"), null, allow_new, MenuItem.CHECKED_NA, "doImport") );

This will render a link like this:
<a href="#" title="Import Events" onclick="location = '...........">Import Events</a>

The link text is always the same as the link title, the component should allow to use different texts.

column1: [SAK-29508] When using reset-pass with an account type that is not accepted, the feedback message should be configurable
column6:
In reset-pass, enter an email address associated with an account type that is not included in the sakai property:
accountValidator.accountTypes.accept

You will get the following feedback message:
"You cannot use this service to reset your password"

Ideally this message should direct users to their institution's identity management services.

We've opted to make this message configurable on a per-tool instance basis. If we had used sakai.properties, the message would be uniform across all reset-pass instances, but sometimes there are multiple reset-pass instances targeted to different users.

If the tool configuration is not present, it should revert to the message bundle.

The tool property will match the message key in the message bundle, namely "wrongtype"

column1: [SAK-36903] NumberFormatException possible when editing settings on a published assessment
column6:
I was regularly encountering this error when I was changing the Settings for an assessment in the published state. It looks like the code there is inconsistent with the code in SAK-36109 Closed . The way I was able to reproduce this was. Doesn't seem to be a problem with 10, though the code here in the java hasn't changed.

  • Create an assessment, one question is fine. Just leave the settings as they are and publish it.
  • Click on Published Copies -> Settings. Expand the "Grading and Feedback" tab and hit Save. You see the stack trace below.

column1: [SAK-29497] Improve usability of Schedule's "List of events" page
column6:
Changes that the University of Dayton has made to the "List of Events" view:

1. Renamed "Description" column to "Event"
2. Hide the "From site" information from the Time column when viewing in Schedule tool
3. Hide the "For" column from site members with the Student role
4. Change the date format from JUN 19, 2014 to Fri Jun 19 (for example)
5. Combined the three date links into one that takes the user to that day's view.
6. Grouped events by day and separated with a horizontal line
7. Created a new filter called "Future Events" that only shows events for the current day forward

See the attached screenshots for how this looks when all of these changes have been added.
column10: Improve usability of Schedule's "List of events" page

column41: How do you decide who has "Student role" - to be applicable to project sites (which is all we use) this must be based on role. The patch cannot involve comparing a string to see if it equals "Student", it must be general and internationalised.
column45:
We only use course sites with strict role settings so we actually did take a bit of a shortcut and compared a string to "student" to determine if the column should be hidden.

However, we can instead add a new row to the Permissions page (which I believe is just listing the relevant realm functions) that will enable users to toggle whether or not they would like their students to see the "For" column.
column49:
What about using calendar.all.groups permission?

If you have this permissions then you can see all group events and hance have some sort of stake in the group events, if you dont have it then you presumably dont need to know about group events and just see events directed at groups that you are in.

column137: This introduced the calendar.view.audience permission which if granted allows the user to see which groups the calendar event is for. What's the reason for wanting to stop users seeing which groups the event was for?
column163: The permission also doesn't look to affect any other parts of the UI (outside the list view) which indicates to me it's a bad use of the security service.
column231:
Hi all,
I was looking at the new permissions added for Sakai 11.x - While I understand what the new permission 'calendar.view.audience' is doing... I wonder why would you want to hide the 'For' column to students... thinking that, by default, every role should have that permission.

I'm refering to the jira summary: '3. Hide the "For" column from site members with the Student role'

As I understand, the new permission will ONLY show/hide that column but it does not have any effect regarding if a user is actually able to see (or not) a calendar event that its not set for his/her group. Therefore, why would you want to hide the column for any type of user... If he see an event in that list, he should know for which of his group is intended, right?

Maybe I'm missing something. Any advice would be helpful, thanks!!
column254:
I think that, by default, a student use to see that 'For' column in 10. I'm planning to grant that permission locally to every rol (including students) unless someone points me to something that I might be missing.

thanks!!

column1: [SAK-29491] Add Sentry support for elegant exception handling
column6:
Sentry is a great exception logging and aggregation platform. Sentry easily answers questions like "what are the top 5 exceptions our users are running into today"?

Sentry can be integrated into Sakai with its raven-java open libs.

Sentry is open-source and available as a service.

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry

https://github.com/ox-it/wl-sakai/blob/sakai-10.x/raven-sentry/pom.xml

Then Sakai can just pull in that artifact and if someone want to use it drop the appropriate log4j.properties in sakai.home.

column1: [SAK-34250] NumberFormatException after clicking the Statistics button
column6:
Steps to reproduce the issue (Please see attached images);

1. Publish an assessment released to a certain group, i.g. Group 1.
2. Any student from Group 1 submits the assessment.
3. Instructor goes to the Total Scores page and selects Group 2 (no student from that group has taken the assessment).
4. Instructor clicks the Statistics button.
5. Instructor clicks any other button from that list: Submission Status, Total Scores, Questions. Samigo throws a NumberFormatException:

2015-06-05 03:12:01,807 ERROR http-bio-8888-exec-18 org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.ui.listener.evaluation.HistogramListener - Error getting statistics for assessment with published id = 1
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: ""
at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:601)
at java.lang.Long.<init>(Long.java:965)
at org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.ui.listener.evaluation.SubmissionStatusListener.submissionStatus(SubmissionStatusListener.java:169)
column10: NumberFormatException after clicking the Statistics button
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
The problem is in the line 115 from HistogramListener.java (10.x):

"
// reset histogramScoresBean, otherwise the previous assessment viewed is displayed.
// note that createValueBinding seems to be deprecated and replaced by a new method in 1.2. Might need to modify this later
FacesContext.getCurrentInstance().getApplication().createValueBinding("#

{histogramScores}

").setValue(FacesContext.getCurrentInstance(), null );"

That line resets the histogramScoresBean which is the responsible object to transfer the assessment id from one page to another. So the destination page receives a void assessment id which throws the NumberFormatException above.

column1: [SAK-29483] Sakai 10.5-RC01 new issues
column6:
If you think you've found a bug, please search to see if it already exists (if you are not familiar with Jira, you can use Google [1]). Learning to use Jira can come in handy though [2].

If this is a new issue, open it as a bug in the appropriate project. Most issues will be opened in the Sakai project. Tools that have their own Jira project include:
Lessons - LSNBLDR project
Samigo Test and quizzes - SAM project

Please then link to your issue from this issue as "Relates to".

If you have any questions, please either write the sakai-dev list or email sakaicoordinator@apereo.org

[1] 3 minute video showing how to search bugs already reported using Google - http://www.screencast.com/t/Na2DjAnqAl

[2] Longer video explaining how the Sakai community uses Jira - - https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/PED/Sakai+Jira+Training+10-9-13

column1: [SAK-30581] Warning popup about sanitized HTML should appear BEFORE saving it and not after.
column6:
This issue can't be currently tested in trunk because the warning popup is not working there right now, I think that maybe due to some regression of Morpheus. I have tested it in a 10.x but I'm sure that the issue happens in trunk too.

The steps to reproduce the issue are:

1) Create a new Pool and a question in it.
2) In the CKEditor, in Source edition, put some HTML not allowed by AntiSamy filters by default, i.e:

<img src="http://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\frac{\mathrm

{d}&space;35x}{\mathrm{d}

&space;x%2A2}" title="\frac{\mathrm

{d} 35x}{\mathrm{d}

x%2A2}" />

3) Save the question. The questions is saved and no warning is shown to users. So users think it is working fine.
4) Edit the question again. The popup shows the warning (not very explanatory) and the bad HTML is deleted. Cancelling the edition does not preserve it, so the users have lost a part of their work without any chance of recovering it.

IMHO the warning should be shown when user saves the work in step 3, not letting users to save the work until the conflicting HTML has been removed or changed.
column10: Warning popup about sanitized HTML should appear BEFORE saving it and not after.
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: The issue not working in 11 is related to SAK-29531 Verified which is a regression in morpheus portal.
column45:
This issue is a feature request as the warning appearing before and serving as a confirmation to submitting the text is a design change.

In order to have this work anywhere the CKEditor is used, thus avoiding the need to have to update every tool I would suggest creating a JS lib to submit the text to the sakai FormattedText cleaner (aka AntiSamy) and so that feedback can be given before the save actually occurs.
column49: Why is this a SAM jira and not a SAK jira? surely it should be a patch on CK edit
column53: It is now an SAK issue with a CK Editor component.

column41:
Seems this issue is not reproducible in trunk, can someone verify it?

Test case:
1. Create a calendar event in my site.
2. Generate public url (i.e. https://trunk-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/access/calendar/opaq/1cb4e3ae-5839-4309-b05a-4cfb407293a7/main.ics).
3. Use a web-cased ics viewer on a different browser (http://www.instantcal.com/isc/js/cvu.html) and load the url.

column45:
The above Test Case is generating a private URL not a public URL. There is not an issue with Private URLs. To generate a public URL click on "Publish (Public)" and give the calendar a name.

Unfortunately there is a bug on nightly which means the "allow subscription" check box setting is lost upon saving.This in turn means that one can never be shown the public URL.

Having said that, I know what the URL should be an it does indeed work correctly. This jira can be closed but another opened to fix the above mentioned problem.
column49: Agree Adam Marshall, marked as resolved (incorporated).
column87:
export a calendar, ie, generate a public URL - click "Publish (Public) " supply a name and opt to allow subscription. Return to the publish page and copy URL. Attempt to open URL in browser where you're not logged in to Sakai, the file should either download or open a calendaring App.

Also make sure the .ics file contains the events from the calendar.

column1: [SAK-29479] Filter out duplicate events in the collated view of a user's calendars in My Workspace
column6:

column1: [SAK-29478] add 2 columns of activity data to roster
column6:
https://github.com/UDayton/sakai-roster2

Dayton have made Some improvements to roster 2 to show 'site activity' alongside each user.

I think a new permission needs adding 'viewactivity' assigned to "maintain" by default, if you dont have it you dont see activity

This patch adds 2 new columns to roster : last visit : number visits : - this is part of a bigger patch (in GITHUB) but shouldnt make changes to other pages.

Dayton have made some other changes to this Roster page. We could omit the partitioning of the roster list but actually, if it's not too hard it would be good to partition the list as dayton have done. Dayton have combined the staff roles into one section but I dont know how this could be generalised so it works in all situations.

This new facility depends on a new service (not currently in Github) which will also need adding. Performance impact of this new service needs to be undertaken prior to merging.

column41:
Currently, the activity is shown based on role. I think that the permission is a cleaner method though.

Adam suggested partitioning the roster list through permissions. I worry that partitioning via permission would result in a staff member showing the activity when they shouldn't. Perhaps by default the list is partitioned by permission, but there is also a toggle which would allow partitioning via role.

Please let me know if you need any assistance.
column45: How does this relate to the dashboard and sitestats? When you say 'number of visits', visits to what? The site or particular tools? I'm confused as to what data you're showing, and I need enlightenment
column49: they dont use site stats as they often archive old data so a brand new DB table is used which is guaranteed to persist. I see the point here.

Adrian, visits to the site. Site stats wasn't used as the time of a visit is not recorded, as well as the Adam's previous comment.

I am unfortunately unaware of the dashboard's features.
column57: Dashboard harvests data, just like SiteStats. I'm asking as it may well make sense to update this to use either data from site stats, or from the Dashboard. It may make more sense to add the timestamp to Sitestats and pull that data in the roster code, otherwise we may end up duplicating large chunks of logging data. Do you get my drift?
column61:
What will happen if the site stats tool has not been added to a site? Will the required data still be there for roster to use.

Also, U Dayton said that they archive site stats from time to time for performance reasons which means the data is not always present in the DB. If Dashboard always collects data even when not present on a site then that is definitely an option.

Another issue that springs to mind is that we'd like the new Roster facility to display historical data and not just start collecting data from the day Sakai 11 is deployed. Is that possible if we use the Dashboard data?
column65:
If sitestats hasn't been added, no data is harvested for that site. Dashboard always harvests, but I'm not sure what it harvests - I'd also assume that Dashboard data is treated as volatile and gets cleaned out regularly. As for historical data, that implies querying the events table, which can be a pretty hairy process - that being the reason for all the harvesting in the first place. Also, people cull the events table frequently.

Leonardo Canessa, are you okay with me taking it from here? If so, would it be possible to setup a test site on your Sakai for me to try out your changes? Oxford will basically pay for your work to be merged into 11, so it's a great benefit to yourselves - less code to keep merging. Unless I have to completely rework your code to get it in 11 I'll make sure to credit you with the commit authorship.
column137: I think it's important that the access dates are preserved. Even if that date is 20 years in the past, it shouldnt disappear by virtue of Dashboard doing some housekeeping tidying up or site stats data being archived.
column151:

4. Login as a maintainer and visit the same site. Roster should display the two columns and show a visit for the access user. If not, check the permissions.

column283: I'm going to try and just sniff the visit events as they go past, rather than modify portal code. It'll be accepted far more readily if I go that route, I think. I'll add a really basic component which does the sniffing and presents an api for retrieving the counts, but I'll include all that component code as a subproject of roster. Down the line, it seems that this may be a case of making sitestats or the dashboard constantly digest events into this format together with some warehousing strategy.
column287:
IMO this is data that should be collected by sitestats, not roster. You'd be duplicating functionality that SiteStats already has baked in. Just because one institution cleans out data from sitestats, doesn't give a use case for another tool collecting that exact same data to fill the void. Who is to say that this data in roster won't get cleaned out? Why don't you warehouse the data and provide reporting that way? In any case, I can't see how you would track the data here any differently to how sitestats already does it: site_id, visits_date, total_visits, total_unique.

BTW, SiteStats can be configured to collect event data from sites without the tool, according to the config page:
https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/STAT/Configuration+Options

collectEventsForSiteWithToolOnly@org.sakaiproject.sitestats.api.StatsUpdateManager
column291: I agree with Steve on this, I have to say. I've started transplanting some of Dayton's changes, and it just a replication of what SiteStats already does. Perhaps we should just look at the way Site stats data is warehoused or just kept live. Perhaps we could just archive subsets of the sitestats data and keep things like site visit. I don't think we should be duplicating functionality - I'd like to just pull the visit data from a site and surface it in the two columns.
column295: I'm happy with whatever you think is best
column299: Does the visits_date value in sitesstats store the time of a visit?
column340: visits_date is only a date because it is an aggregation of all visits to a site for that day.
column344: I'm on with it. I'm creating a new table which totals the visits and stamps the latest visit time. I don't want to recalculate the total for every roster member on the fly - that would be madness, even with caching.
column348: Neal, are you saying this feature should be disabled by default? If so what is the reasoning? it sounds like a fantastic feature to have, is there something I dont know?

column65:
As we now are sqaushing out iframes the tabindexes for the tools need to be coordinated with the tabindexes for the portal, yeah?

If so we could probably do with a tiny guide explaining to developers what tabindexes they should use in their tools and what the portal is expected to use.
column137:
I've never considered tab order at so large a scale, but it seems to be worth doing here.

tabindex does not have to start with 1. It can be any integer from 0 to 32000. Historically, with Sakai no one piece of code has complete awareness of the content of the page or when the content updates, but the iFrame forced the user agent to conclude that too - this is no longer the case.

A common practice appears to be to group blocks of content into levels of tab index values. For instance, the portal stuff could in the 00 level (I like logout/kill session button as 007), the sites could be in 200 level, and the site tools could be in the 300 level, internal content the 1000 level, and any footer links the 2000 level.

From http://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/tabindex

Positive tabindex values results in unpredictable tab order that do not occur if the natural order of content is relied upon. so tabindex="0" and tabindex="-1" have special meaning and provide distinct functionality in HTML. So HTML finding itself in the middle of the structure could simply set tabindex="0" and everything should be fine.
column163:
Thanks Matt Clair, would be good to get this in the Sakai documentation.

Does raise an issue when there are multiple tools on the page (eg synoptic tools) and how tabindex should work in those instances as if 2 tool developers use tabindex for their buttons and they have the same values.
column231: Although actually the current code doesn't remove the iframes when there are multiple tools we we're ok for the time being.
column254: Maybe tools should always use tabindex=0 as they do on the web components page: https://www.polymer-project.org/0.5/articles/accessible-web-components.html#using-tabindex
column258:
I'd agree.

Until someone knows why they're setting an order, like the linear HTML code flow doesn't make logical senses and can't be otherwise corrected, then tabindex="0" is the way to go.

Still might be worth setting levels across Morpheus.

column1: [SAK-36961] joda-time 2.8
column6:
Joda-Time version 2.8
---------------------
Joda-Time is a date and time handling library that seeks to replace the JDK
Date and Calendar classes.
This release contains enhancements, bug fixes and a time zone update.
The release runs on JDK 5 or later.
Joda-Time is licensed under the business-friendly Apache License Version 2.
This is the same license as all of Apache, plus other open source projects such as Spring.
The intent is to make the code available to the Java community with the minimum
of restrictions. If the license causes you problems please contact the mailing list.
Please also check out our related projects **
http://www.joda.org/joda-time/related.html **
Enhancements since 2.7
----------------------
Encode properties files using unicode escapes 228
The properties files are supposed to be loaded using ISO 8859-1 but Android seems to have issues with that.
Re-encode the files using unicode escapes to sidestep the issue.
Avoid ProGuard errors in Android jar 246
Separate logging from time-zone compilation
Compatibility with 2.7
----------------------
Build system - Yes
Binary compatible - Yes
Source compatible - Yes
Serialization compatible - Yes
Data compatible - Yes
DateTimeZone data updated to version 2015d
In the past year, the IANA time-zone database maintainer has changed unique time-zone data for many parts
of the world into shared "links". For example, in IANA 'Asia/Kuwait' now links to 'Asia/Riyadh'.
(I personally disagree with the IANA time-zone database maintainer's actions but my objections were ignored).
This was a problem for Joda-Time as we interpreted the concept of links (many years ago) as only being used
for backwards compatibility. Links are exposed in Joda-Time, because if you request a time-zone for a linked
identifier you get the target of the link back. As such, in recent versions of Joda-Time, it was not possible
to obtain a DateTimeZone with an appropriate identifier for many parts of the world, such as 'Asia/Kuwait'.
With this release, most links in the main IANA files are now restored to be real zones.
As a side effect of this, some identifiers that used to act as links are now real zones.
In summary, in the last Joda-Time release, requesting 'Asia/Kuwait' would have given back 'Asia/Riyadh',
but it now returns 'Asia/Kuwait' (where 'Asia/Kuwait' and 'Asia/Riyadh' have the same time-zone rules).
In most cases, this won't have any impact on your application

column1: [SAK-34671] Add answer randomization for parts
column6:
When authoring parts that randomly draw questions from a question pool user's often also want to randomize the answers within each question.

At the moment this means the user must edit each question manually to force answer randomization. This can be particularly difficult if a large number of questions have been created either manually (and this option is forgotten) or via markup import which doesn't not have this option.

Instead of adding extra notation to the Samigo Mass Import I suggest adding the ability to force question answer randomization to the Part configuration (just like you can force question points on a part).

A checkbox within the samigo part edit menu stating "Randomize answers for all questions in this part" (or something similar) when "Random draw from question pool" is selected would be a good place for this option.

column1: [SAK-29463] Remove the "Home" tool from the Default Site Setup and leave the top position to new sites to be the ashboard
column6:
SInce the home tool has three tools on the same page it will be forced to fall back to iframes - the dashboard is a single tool and effectively replaces the home tool.

So while it does not solve the issue of how existing Sakai installations will migrate to the Dashboard, new installations will only see the Dashboard.

Comments welcome.
column10: Remove the "Home" tool from the Default Site Setup and leave the top position to new sites to be the ashboard
column19: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
Sites without the Home tool misbehave in a number of odd ways.

Would it not be better to view the Dashboard as another synoptic tool and view it as a replacement for the the current synoptic tools? Lots of our users make heavy usage of the ability to put HTML in the LHS part of the home page.

column6:

Log into site and click on Tests & Quizzes

Click Add New Pool, name the pool and save it
Click on the pool name
Click Add Questions
Select a question type and click Save
Enter details for the question and click Save

Unexpected error displays

column1: [SAK-29457] Add warning about cookie use
column6:
need to inform users that Sakai uses cookies - do this just once.

The warning sits at the bottom with big red dismiss button.The link should be configurable but the default target should be a page in Sakai.

I'll attach such a page to this JIRA.
column10: Add warning about cookie use
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
<h1>Use of Cookies</h1>

<ul>
	<li>jsMath – wiki, has the user been shown the missing jsMath fonts warning message?</li>
	<li>JSESSIONID – session status (secure)</li>
	<li>profile2-tab – stores the current tab index in the Profile tool</li>
</ul>

<p>The only cookie that links to personal data is JSESSIONID.</p>

<p>We consider all of these cookies to be essential for the service, none of them persist after the session has ended.</p>

<p>In addition to the above site owner can develop content that sets cookies. We cannot effectively police these third party cookies and hope that they are only used when necessary. </p>
column45:
the above HTML should be the target of the link in the cookie statement. The page MUST be public and has to be shipped with Sakai. I dont know how you do this.

I think we should put it in admin workspace in the public folder, in a sub folder which is named in such a way to avoid it having a name clash (eg, something like cc2c88fe-a0fe-44d6-0046-89493362b2aa).

The actual file should be named "cookie-statement.html". That way, people can customise it if needs be. It will also pick up the local skins.

column87:
open a private browsing window, visit sakai. There should be a cookie warning at the bottom of the screen. Dismiss it, it should vanish. Go to another page, you shouldnt see the warning.

close the window. open another private browsing window, go to sakai. check the cookie message is there again. go to another page, it should have vanished (without being manually dismissed). go back to gateway, the message shouldnt be there.

column1: [SAK-29456] Site Archive import does not process attachment.xml
column6:
To replicate:

1) Create a course site and add announcements tool
2) Add a new announcement with an uploaded attachment
3) Go to Administration Workspace as admin user
4) Go to Site Archive and export site in 1
5) Purge the site created in (1) and delete attachment from the database table CONTENT_RESOURCE
6) Now try to import the site archive created in step (4)

The site archive seems to copy the attachment if it exists in the database. But it doesn't seem to actually read the attachment info in the XML export (attachment.xml).

Error message in logs:

2015-05-31 15:07:00,412 WARN http-nio-9080-exec-10 org.sakaiproject.archive.impl.SiteMerger - Skipping archive data for for sakai:content (/var/trunk/sakai/archive/6f9a955b-68da-4b80-944e-98f92b0939f6-archive/attachment.xml) to site new-site-id, no service (EntityProducer) could be found to deal with this data
column10: Site Archive import does not process attachment.xml
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: In SiteMerger.java->merge it looks like there's 3 special cases for site.xml, attachment.xml and user.xml. These method sets this index item to null so I'm not sure why this warning is coming up. Not sure what the problem is though.
column45:
I spent a little time looking at this and I think there might be two problems here, whether the import "file" is specified as a directory or an actual file.

If it's a directory of a site taken as an archive like "b548651d-dd9e-404d-ba7c-76f83824e795-archive" then the merge method in common attempts to pre-process attachment.xml though I believe because of SAK-22177 Closed it's still throwing an error because it can't find the entity producer. The element is in the tag

<sakai:content> whereas in content.xml it's org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentHostingService.

One bug is that in the method archiveResources it uses the APPLICATION_ID

		// start with an element with our very own name
		Element element = doc.createElement(APPLICATION_ID)

But in archive it uses the class name

		// start with an element with our very own name
		Element element = doc.createElement(ContentHostingService.class.getName())

and have a feeling that the fix for it could be there. So there's probably two fixes on this one to support old content, and have new content created with the "correct" tag name.

column1: [SAK-29455] Add method to get grading events in gradebook API
column6:
The getGradingEventsForStudent feature which returns a list of grading events for a student, currently exists only in the gradebook tool. To use this outside of the gradebook it needs to be present in the API.

This ticket adds mostly the same logic to the API, slightly different method signature to support just one student/assignment pair (a bit different to the tool). The tool has not been refactored as that is likely wasted effort for Sakai 11.
column10: Add method to get grading events in gradebook API

To reproduce, create a question pool with 2 or more questions. First sort on question text to see the stack trace. Then try sorting on Question Type.

Also, please note that Questions pools seem to be broken completely on https://qa10-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/ in that you cannot even add a question to a pool without getting a stack trace. As a result, I ciuld not test whether the sorting problem was evident there.

column1: [SAK-29447] My Workspace / Dashboard calendar Private URL should have a better name
column6:
schedule.ics which is the ICAL file exported from My Workspace has the following line which is interpreted by MS Outlook & Apple iCAL

X-WR-CALNAME:My Workspace

It would be good to change this to

X-WR-CALNAME:Sakai

We wouldn't want to do this for all sites though. Generally having the site name as the 'X-WR-CALNAME' is a good thing, it just isn't optimal for My Workspace.

The "Sakai" string needs to come from a property so that the code can be contributed back. The Default value would be 'Sakai', Oxford would override to 'WebLearn', other institutions would do thier own thing

I think Google uses

X-WR-CALDESC:

instead. we could also add this to all ics exports, this would have exactly the same values as CALNAME

column1: [SAK-39579] Add a convenience method to kernel service (CHS?) to getQuota for a site
column6: Discussed on the release call and related to SAK-29332 Closed and other issues, it would be convenient if there was a method that could be called and returns the correct quota completely calculated for the site. It could probably be used in dav, lessons and a few other places.
column10: Add a convenience method to kernel service (CHS?) to getQuota for a site
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: Will this re-enforce the cyclic dependency between SiteService and ContentHostingService?
column45: Matthew Buckett I'm not sure I haven't actually looked at the implementation was just thrown out as a convenience idea to reduce LOC and eliminate bugs . Is there a dependency one already? Does it matter if there is between the services in the same tool?
column49: Yep I was just wondering if it might not be better in ContentHostingService as the quota is for uploaded content.
column53:
Yeah, maybe CHS ends up being the best place. I think the end result is that we wanted some type of query that you could call to pre-check if the uploaded file is going to put that specific site over quota. Most (all) of the CHS methods return OverQuotaException after you try to execute them but (I believe?) this drag and drop wants to check before starting the upload.

The only thing I can see in CHS right now is
protected boolean overQuota(ContentResourceEdit edit)

Which is useless for this check

But I guess there there is the
public long getQuota(ContentCollection collection) {

Which should be what is called, but in these cases you don't want a ContentCollection to check on, rather a site or siteId. So maybe that makes sense to have a new method in CHS
public long getQuota(String siteId) {

(Or a site object?)

It's really complex looking and it seems like each tool is doing it's own calculations now and there's many regressions in the past about it.

column1: [SAK-29427] When Citation Lists are copied through WebDAV, no copy actually happens.
column6:
If you copy a citations list through WebDAV no actual copy of the associated citations list is done.

This means that if you only have read access to a citations list and you copy it to My Workspace through WebDAV, you then get the ability to edit the citations list in your My Workspace and it updates the original as well.
column10: When Citation Lists are copied through WebDAV, no copy actually happens.
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: I'm not sure if this is a security issue? Does seem like a nasty bug though.
column45: presumably fixed now? Nick?
column49:
It should be now.

The problem was that the code was treating the webdav-copied reading list as a simple text/plain file and not doing things like adding '/citation/' to the path for accessing it or copying the collection and the citations in it.
column53: What is security-related about this JIRA?
column57:
a student can copy a reading list into their my workspace then edit it. As thisis the same reading list as the original, ie, it's not a copy, the edits will show up in the original reading list. I wonder whether malicious javascript could be included?

In any case, I believe Nick has fixed this.
column61: Is there a Test Plan for this one?
column65: Yes
column87:
Create a reading list with a citation in it in a site.
Connect to that site via webdav and connect to another site via webdav (both sites need to have the Resources tool).
In your webdav client, drag and drop the reading list from one site to the other. This should copy the file from the first site to the second.
Navigate to the second site in Sakai and edit the reading list and check that it looks the same as when you try to edit the reading list in the first site.

Additional check: Edit the reading list in the first site and save it. Check that the same edit has not occurred in the second site.
column137: I checked, it's fine

column1: [SAK-29425] msgcntr: forums: Add Percent Read and # of Posts statistics to individual student pages in Forums
column6:
Use case: Instructor would like for information displayed in the table on the Statistics page in Forums (msgcntr) to also display on each individual student's page.

This feature would allow instructors to be able to quickly reference the percentage of posts a student has read while grading the student.

In the image below, I have highlighted in red the statistics information the instructor would like to have displayed on the student's page:

Here is a sample concept of how the additional information might be displayed (adding the Percent of posts Read at the top of the screen under the student's name and the post counts above the tables displaying which posts the student authored and read):

Please find below the original instructor's request:

It would be extremely helpful if the percentages read for each class could also be shown on the individual student page and not just shown on the class summary page. I have to flip back and forth constantly while grading to see the totals posted and % read.

Is there any possibility of adding that to the individual student profile for each class?

column1: [SAK-29422] Incorporate NYU's "public announcement system" into Sakai 11
column6:
NYU has developed a "public announcement system" that provides:

  • The ability to display a banner message to users. These can be limited to particular servers and given different severity levels. Use cases include allowing administrators to alert users to upcoming system downtime, weather warnings and informational messages.
  • Popup messages on login. These can be used to show larger amounts of information in a modal dialog, and users can dismiss each message either temporarily (in which case it will be shown 24 hours later), or permanently.
  • Timezone checks, which alert the user if the timezone set in their Sakai preferences doesn't match the timezone of their local machine. This warning is displayed as a banner alert and links the user to the page where they can set their timezone.

The patch provides a new tool for managing all of this. Through this management interface, administrators can create/edit/delete new popups and banners and set the start and end times that control when they should be displayed to users.

We're just finishing our port to Sakai 11, but expect to have a pull request ready for review over the coming weeks.
column10: Incorporate NYU's "public announcement system" into Sakai 11

column41: Attaching some screenshots created by Kyle Blythe
column45: Great tool. Do you have example or guide for popup template file? Not sure what to upload there to make it work. Thanks.
column49:
Thanks Yuanhua Qu Any HTML file should work. The example script (https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/blob/master/pasystem/scripts/webservices_client.sh) uses a page like this:

<div>
  <h2>Have you seen this goat?</h2>
  <br>
  <img style="width: 600px;" src="http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/b2/Hausziege_04.jpg">
</div>

Once you have uploaded your popup, clicking the "preview" button in the tool should display it.

You will need to set 'pasystem.enabled=true' in your sakai.properties before the popups will start showing to users.

column65:
Ah! You're quite right: there's a bug here. I've just created https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-29584 and will send a pull request to fix this issue in a moment.

Thanks for taking it out for a spin Sorry one of the wheels fell off!
column137: Do you have a version of this running against Sakai 10?
column163: Nope. I ran this in sakai's trunk of 4 days ago.
column231:
Hi Matthew Buckett,

There's currently no Sakai 10 version of the whole thing. NYU is running a precursor to the PA System in Sakai 10: it has the code for determining applicable banners/popups for the current user, and a neo portal integration to display them, but none of the management stuff (no tool or web services). For example, defining a new banner or popup meant inserting rows directly into the DB and putting a template file into an NFS directory. We developed that additional functionality against Sakai 11, so there was never a Sakai 10 version.

I haven't investigated how much work it would be to backport to Sakai 10, but off the top of my head there'd be differences in how you integrated into the portal (since Morpheus changed things quite a lot), and there are a few places where we depend on Java 8 features (use of Optional and, I think, a few places where we use the new streams). Most of the other logic should probably just work, though.

Cheers,

Mark

column1: [SAK-29418] In an assignment resubmission, removing all attachments should be considered a modification
column6:
Steps:

a) accept Inline and Attachmnents or Attachments Only
b) Allow resubmissions
2) As a student, submit to this assignment with a couple attachments
3) After submitting, view your submission.
a) Notice it the bottom: "You may resubmit if you modify this submission."
b) Click cancel - you are immediately redirected to the assignment list
4) View your submission
a) Remove an attachment. Notice the message "Don't forget to save or submit"
b) Click cancel - notice the prompt
5) Remove all attachments.
Symptom: It behaves like 3), but it should behave like 4)

column1: [SAK-35632] Export Responses button throws a stack trace when the matching item has a distractor option
column6:
We believe that bug can be resolved by the patch attached in the Jira SAK-37107 Resolved by Brooke Biltimier.

Steps to reproduce the issue (please see attached images):

1. Instructor creates an assessment with a matching question which has a "distractor" option.
2. Instructor publishes the assessment.
3. The student takes the assessment.
4. The student answers the matching question by selecting the 'distractor' option.
5. The student submits the assessment.
6. Instructor tries to export the responses to an Excel file and that stack trace is displayed in the application logs:

column1: [SAK-38121] Embed content on this page / alignment
column6:
When you add text and other material in Lessons, the items are added to the page offset to the right of the edit button.

If you use 'Embed content on this page' and link to an item in your resources, the item will be added under the edit link and not aligned as other items are.
column10: Embed content on this page / alignment
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This is intentional. People often want to add images that span the whole page. By putting them against the left margin in author mode you can verify alignment compared to the margins. Of course in student mode the edit buttons aren't there, so other types will move to the left.
column45:
If you really want to do this, you can create a file in /public, /public/LB-CSS/default.css. The following will cause all multimedia types to show with the edit button to the left. However for students it will still be near the left margin:

.multimediaType > :not(.edit-col)

{ display: inline-block; position:relative; left:5px; width:93% }

To get it to align under the links you'd need to add 16 more to the left attribute. If you want to do that, you may need to make changes to the alignments of other types as well.

column1: [SAK-29411] Improve site browser UI
column6:
See: http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/59590

Improve UI so:

1/ In current UI, clicking on the site title brings up an Information Page which is not what youd expect when clicking on the title of a site. The proposal is to move this functionality to a separate column entitled Information about <site>.

2/ Clicking on the site title in the proposed new page will actually take you to the site (or display a site unavailable if you dont have permission).

3/ The name listed under the Owner column is currently the name of the person who created the site, it should be changed to the name given in the Site Contact box on the site and the label should be changed to 'Site Contact'. The rationale is that it is not at all useful to know who created the site.

column1: [SAK-39751] Add getLong method to ServerConfigurationService
column6: Mentioned on SAK-29332 Closed , it would be nice to have a method getLong in SCS api/impl.
column10: Add getLong method to ServerConfigurationService
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Rather than increasing the API size it would be nice if ServerConfigurationService.getConfig() worked well with Longs.
column45:
Yeah, that sounds good too, right now getConfig is using generics and if the default value is a number it's casting it to an Integer. If defaultValue is null it's returning it as a String.

I think we'd end up having to add a new method for getConfig that has a parameter of Class to tell it what class type you'd want returned. It doesn't seem possible to get "T" at runtime without really ugly looking hacks (http://stackoverflow.com/a/3403987) that might not work in this case. So in the end we still have to add a new method to the api anyway, either

<T> T getConfig(String name, T defaultValue, Class class)

or 

getLong( ... )

And even getConfig method is calling getInt.
column49:
But I think you can specify that the default value you are wanting is a long with:

serverConfigurationService.getConfig("my.sakai.property", 10L)

And then have an instanceof check to see if it's a long.

Is your concern that someone is already passing in a long expecting an int back?
column53:
No, even if the option was that you passed in a long, like I said this method (getConfig) is still calling getInt. So it should get a new method getLong anyway, or it would have to call getString and do a cast in this method which would be ugly.

So even if we made getConfig able to return a the correct number for the default, we still really should have a new method in here. And sometimes you want to be able to give null as a default rather than -1 or 0.

It would feels like for completeness we should also have a getDouble too, and that would clean up code that's custom in other places.
column151: The only code that's using this so far is SAK-44302 Verified , these will need to be verified together, ideally by changing some of the properties for ignite on SAK-44302 Verified .

column1: [SAK-39163] PDF files with BOM get incorrectly detected
column6: When a PDF file is uploaded through the Resources tool and it has a BOM prefix then it is incorrectly detected as text/plain instead of application/pdf this results in the PDF not being displayed in the browser correctly.
column10: PDF files with BOM get incorrectly detected
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Attached are a pair of PDF files, one with a Byte Order Marker and one without.
column45: An upgrade to tika 1.8 (trunk is currently 1.5) doesn't fix the issue.
column49:
Did you report this already with tika? I tested with 1.8 and it says

Content-Encoding: UTF-8
Content-Length: 7645
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
X-Parsed-By: org.apache.tika.parser.DefaultParser
resourceName: hello-world-bom.pdf

It looks related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TIKA-1085. In that the header looks like
0L *H<7%PDF-1.4

In yours the header is
%PDF-1.3

In a normal PDF the header is
%PDF-1.3

It sounds like there is a suggestion there about fixing up the magic, right now it's much more strict.
column53: I should say I'm not sure if it's valid to prefix you're PDF file with a BOM (specification is here http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/acrobat/pdfs/pdf_reference_1-7.pdf) but we've seen files like this in the wild so it would be good not fail as badly on them, especially as the extension is good.
column57: Looking in the specification there is no mention of a BOM prefixing the header of the PDF file (section 3.4.1).
column61:
I'd comment against that ticket in TIKA with this example, I'm not sure a workaround other than figuring out how to override the pattern or re-compile tika. I never spent enough time looking into that.

This seems to suggest it's not easily possible to override. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TIKA-1466
column65:
Right, I'd agree, but it's not us failing badly, it's the library.

So it's either

  • We wait until they fix the library so it detects it right
  • We fork the library with our custom fix and use the forked version (if this was the option, submit the patch against that TIKA jira)
  • We have custom code in Sakai to deal (and maybe other?) specific special case(s)
column137: There is a fix in Tika for this, should be in Tika > 1.8 as it's in trunk now.
column163: That's great news getting it in there, they look to release every ~3 months, so probably will have a release 1.9 soon that would fix this.

column1: [SAK-29406] Allow Assignment tool to grade with two decimal points
column6: Some of our instructors needs to grade students with two decimal points. Now, assignment tool allows only one decimal point.
column10: Allow Assignment tool to grade with two decimal points
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I've tested this patch and looks so good to me, also working with gradebook integration.

Also compatible changing the property configuration.

Miguel
column45:
Hi all,
Something about this patch. It requires a new parameter to the sakai.properties file

#DEFAULT: 2 (new assignments will use 2 decimal places for grading by default)
#assignment.grading.decimals=1

By default, 2 decimal places will be used to grade new assignments, but it can be changed to other value. Users who want to continue using 1 decimal place need to uncomment the line.

I want to note that in new assignments created after this code was applied it will be used 2 (or whatever other value selected) decimals to grade.
But, old assignments created before this code will continue using 1 decimal point to grade.
column49: Works fine in trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org
column53: Closed based on the comment from Alexandre Ballest
column57: I've attached a patch for 2.9.3.
column61: I've attached a patch which will cause duplicated assignments to use the system default decimal places, based on Sakai 2.9.3.
column65:
It looks like two properties were added as part of this patch.

+
+ public final static int DEFAULT_SCALED_FACTOR = 10;
+
+ public final static int DEFAULT_DECIMAL_POINT = 2;

what is DEFAULT_SCALED_FACTOR ?
column137:
These are not sakai.properties, they are just the defaults used in the code. The sakai.property introduced is:

+# ######################################
+# SAK-29406 Closed Allow Assignment tool to grade with two decimal points
+# ######################################
+# decimal points used to grade in new assignments (created after this code was applied),
+# old assignments (created before this code) will continue using 1 decimal point to grade
+# DEFAULT: 2 (new assignments will use 2 decimal places for grading by default)
+#assignment.grading.decimals=1
column163:
My bad. Looked at the wrong diff.

While 2 decimals seems reasonable as a default, perhaps this should be communicated more broadly (than just through the Jira)?
column231: Sure, I'm all for documentation, but where to put said documentation seems to be the real question. It is already in default.sakai.properties.
column254: Yes, it is in default.sakai.properties, which is the right place. But in addition, for something like this which impacts end users and changes behavior over previous versions (if I understand correctly, with default going from 1 decimal place to 2 decimal places) we should also notify the Sakai user community, many of whom will need to be aware of this change in training their instructors. And the Sakai help doc team, to update Sakai online help documentation if necessary. I'll probably put in the release notes for 11 as well.
column258: +1 on all three
column263: Has anyone developed a conversion script for old assignments to allow 2-decimal grading? The use case would be imported assignments from old-term sites.
column283:
I wrote an (untested) PHP script to modify old assignments and submissions:

https://github.com/ottenhoff/sakai-utils/blob/master/modify-assignment-scale-factor.php
column287:
FYI, In Sakai 12 you can probably do this with a straightforward SQL script.

SET SQL_SAFE_UPDATES = 0;
UPDATE ASN_ASSIGNMENT SET SCALE_FACTOR = 100, MAX_GRADE_POINT=MAX_GRADE_POINT * 10 WHERE (SCALE_FACTOR IS NULL OR SCALE_FACTOR = 10);
SET SQL_SAFE_UPDATES = 1;

column1: [SAK-29405] Entity Providers for Course Management Entities
column6:
I have created entity providers for entities related to Course Management. The work is mostly complete. I still need to implement updating site memberships based on changes to course management data.

Some background:

At Texas State University, we have a nightly job that updates course management tables in sakai from our banner system. I imagine other institutions do something similar. We're in the process of upgrading to real-time updates. The purpose of these new entity providers is to expose the functionality of the internal CourseManagementService and CourseManagementAdministration APIs as a RESTful service that can be used to update course management data.

I'm doing my work in this branch: https://github.com/txstate-etc/sakai/tree/SAK-29405

column87:

realm.allowed.roles=.anon
realm.allowed..anon=annc.read,calendar.read,content.read

restart Tomcat

Navigate to a site
In Site Info -> Manage Access, give access to non logged in users
Now go to Announcements -> Permissions in that site

You should not be able to check anything other than read access to the anon role.

# Should the .anon role be assignable to a realm? Defaults to false. 
sitemanage.grant.anon=true

This is useful because when you set these in the site you shouldn't then have the option to select them in Resources (they should be pre-ticked).

column1: [SAK-29401] Role-based access to sites
column6:
Implement a new Sakai interface "Role Provider" which can be used to supply new roles (in addition to the default .anon & .auth) that can be used to protect a site.

The Create site workflow and "Site Info > Manage Access" processes are enhanced with the ability to allow any of the provided roles to access a site.

Examples of additional roles could be "Staff", "Students", "Senior Members", "Provided Users" (ie, people with SSO accounts at the local institution), and so on

The Role Provider has a default implementation that can be configured for local deployment

column1: [SAK-29400] Feature Request: Rename "Site Info" to "Info & Settings"
column6:
For years, there has been interest in the Sakai community in renaming the "Site Info" tool to something that better describes its function. For Sakai 11, I propose renaming the tool from "Site Info" to "Site Settings."

RATIONALE:
"Site Info" is not clear and does not communicate the tool's utility, especially to instructors or site managers. Users often say that the label "Info" does not convey that they can change anything related to the site, just view information about it. By changing its tool name, the goal is to clear up this confusion and empower professors to manage their sites. At the same time, "Site Info" isn't limited only to instructors, teaching assistants, or "maintain" users. Students or "access" users also can use the tool. For example, group functionality is part of the Site Info tool. So, student users need access to the tool and a label that doesn't make the tool seem to be only for professors.

I propose "Site Settings" since this communicates a place where someone can check the settings. Settings could apply to any user. Labels like "Site Setup," "Site Editor," "Site Manager," "Control Panel," etc. may suggest that non-instructor/maintain users shouldn't try the tool. The label "Settings" is also used by popular online services like Google to allow users to adjust a tool's settings, so this seems in alignment with software in general, too.

I am completely open to other naming conventions. I'd just love an improvement to the name of this important tool! Thank you for your consideration.
column10: Feature Request: Rename "Site Info" to "Info & Settings"
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41:
There needs to be a new cut of the documentation for Sakai 11. I see 75 articles on ScreenSteps for the Sakai documentation. I will volunteer my time to update the instances of "Site Info" with the changed label (e.g. "Site Settings") to help make this happen.

http://sakai.screenstepslive.com/s/5276
column45:
I completely disagree with this. The end users of Sakai are students. The proposed change is aimed at Staff. It is 100% wrong and should never be considered.

A student adjusts their "Settings" in My Workspace. "Site Info" is the place where they find out information about a site.
column49:
I appreciate the passion in your comment and your perspective, Adam. This is a dialog, so thank you for sharing your viewpoint.

Learners are critical to Sakai's success; I don't think anyone will refute that point. They are the largest number of users, and the primary reason for a learning tool afterall! At the same time, our professors are important, too.

I'd ask you to please propose a solution to better enable faculty members to manage their site. For years of using Sakai at our institution, professors must be trained to go to "Site Info" since the tool name does not communicate its function for professors. It's simply not intuitive, and professors often ask, "Why is it called Site Info?" Many other learning platforms have a clear "Settings" or "Control Panel" area within the site for management by an instructor, TA, or system administrator. What are your ideas to improve the ease-of-use for users that manage the site? That is a pain point and the primary purpose of this proposed feature request.

For reference, here are the details students see in Site Info in case anyone else is curious. All of the information is on one page:

  • Term (also replicated in the "More Sites" label and My Workspace > Worksite Setup. Ideally class sites include the term in the name/title of the site, too.)
  • Site URL (also directly available in the address bar of the web browser.)
  • Site contact and email (with few exceptions, also available in more visible locations like Syllabus (should be!) or other institutional locations like student information system; )
  • Site Description (a truncated version of the description requiring a click to view "More" in a pop-up; this information is displayed fully in the "Home" tool)
  • Groups you are a member of (offers list of assigned group names, if enabled; potentially available in Roster tool, if permissions have been set for student viewing)
  • Groups you can join (if joinable groups available, students can click a label, review the groups, and click a "Join" button to select that option)

In summary, the features in "Site Info" for students roll up to two (2) main items:

  • View some details of the site (term, site URL, site contact/email, site description)
  • View group-related details, if group features are enabled within the site

In comparison, the features in "Site Info" for instructional staff or administrative staff roll up to about 14 items across several buttons:

  • View and edit the enrollment roster of the site (from the main page of the tool)
  • "Edit Site Information" (reflected on the "Home" tool of the site)
  • Edit Tools
  • Page Order (which needs to be renamed as well)
  • Add Participants
  • Edit Class Roster(s)
  • Manage Groups
  • Link to Parent Site
  • External Tools
  • Manage Access
  • Duplicate Site
  • Import from Site
  • Import from Archive File
  • User Audit Log

By sheer numbers, "Site Info" offers the most functionality for instructional staff. There's absolutely detail for students, and the choice to consolidate those features for different users may point to a future revision to spin off the two separate purposes with appropriate labels for each audience. Or maybe the "Site Info" data for students is included on the "Home" tool, perhaps with an accordion "more" reveal? Perhaps the group-specific features for students are added to Roster or "Section Info" or a new "Groups" dashboard for students?

In the meantime, other institutions have simply renamed "Site Info" to other labels like "Site Setup," etc. How do we address this issue for another important audience, our professors?

Thanks in advance for sharing your suggestions. I look forward to your ideas and the ideas of others.
column53:
> the choice to consolidate those features for different users may point to a future revision to spin off the two separate purposes with appropriate labels for each audience.

That summarizes the discussion of the Teaching and Learning call today. The consensus of the people on the call was that "Info / Settings" is too awkward. They liked the idea of moving functions that are used by students outside of Site Info. Probably the biggest function that students need to access is the Groups function. Perhaps we could move this functionality to Roster and then rename Site Info to Settings? Details of the site, perhaps could go in the site Home that's my idea in this moment, not something discussed on T&L)?

If this work goes forward, we might need sub-tasks to track.

column65: The suggestion of "Info & Settings" sounds like a great compromise. Until the community can separate the functionality into separate tools, this should work really well and serve the needs of both roles – students and instructors/site managers. I feel that the ampersand ("&") works better than a slash ("/"), too. Seems less confusing to me. Also aligns with the ampersand usage in "Tests & Quizzes" for consistency, too. My thanks to everyone who has been contributing to the various conversations on this topic!

For instructors, Site Settings makes perfect sense, as that is where they change settings.
For students, it makes no sense as there are no settings at all.

column1: [SAK-29399] Messages sometimes go to incorrect tab
column6:
When using Sakai in multiple tabs, messages can sometimes arrive in the wrong site.

Create two sites, X and Y, and add users A and B to both.
Login as user A and navigate to X
Open another tab and navigate to Y, again as user A
In another browser, login as user B and navigate to site Y.
As user B, send a message to user A. It should arrive in the second tab, in site Y, sometimes it doesn't.

<id>remove-10</id>

column1: [SAK-29391] Improve wording on file upload pages
column6:
Feedback from users complains that the UI is very poor when you have to upload a large number of files at once. Add a sentence to the upload files page pointing out that one can upload a zip file.

Improve explanatory test when uploading files

1/ mention that one can use a zip file on upload files page

Change this

<p>Upload as many files as you like. However, the sum total file size cannot exceed 60 MB. If you change your mind about uploading some files, click X next to them. Click <strong>Upload Files Now</strong> when have selected all the files you want to upload.</p>

to this

<p>You may upload as many files as you like, however, if you have a large number you may like to compress then into a ZIP file first - this may be expanded via the file's Action menu once it has been uploaded. If you change your mind about uploading some files, click X next to them. Click <strong>Upload Files Now</strong> when have selected all the files you want to upload. </p>

<p>Note that you cannot upload more than

{60} MB of material at once, if this is a problem then you should use the WebDAV interface instead. More information about WebDAV can be found by clicking on the 'Upload-Download Multiple Resources (Webdav)' link at the top of the main Resources page.</p>

NB the {60}

is a parameterised value

2/ add explanatory text to drag and drop upload page (to bring in line with browser upload page. The text below comes from non-drag and drop upload page, look at the page source as it contains hyperlinks.

Upload Files

You may upload as many files as you like, however, if you have a large number you may like to compress then into a ZIP file first - this may be expanded via the file's Action menu once it has been uploaded. If you change your mind about uploading some files, click X next to them. Click Upload Files Now when have selected all the files you want to upload.

Note that you cannot upload more than

{60} MB of material at once, if this is a problem then you should use the WebDAV interface instead. More information about WebDAV can be found by clicking on the 'Upload-Download Multiple Resources (Webdav)' link at the top of the main Resources page.

Copyright

It is your personal responsibility to verify that you have permission from the copyright holder to upload the file(s) to this web site. Text, graphics and other media files may all be subject to copyright control even if your site is restricted to site members. Further information about fair use of material.

—

NB the {60}

is a parametrised value which is read in from a properties file.

column49:
Just updated the PR.

By default now, no filter options are shown unless you enable them in
properties. Html is wrapped and doctyped with the html5 doctype by
default. You can specify an alternative doctype in properties and you
can leave the quirks (no doctype) option out of the list, again via
properties.

The three new props are:

resources.filter.show
resources.filter.showquirks
content.html.doctype
column151:
Author a page in resources, view in browser, look at source & check that there is a <!DOCTYPE> line before <html> in source view

Then check that Edit Details > "Use local styles" works correctly:

1/ 'auto' should give <!DOCTYPE> line before <html>

2/ 'always (quirks) should add<html><head> ....</head>to start of the file (& </html> to end)

3/ always (standards) should add <!DOCTYPE ......><html><head> ....</head>to start of the file (& </html> to end)

4/ 'never' should not add <!DOCTYPE ......><html><head> ....</head>to start of the file (nor </html> to end)

"Follow the sequence 1, 2, 3, 4, { "

"org.sakaiproject.portal.api.PortalHandlerException: org.sakaiproject.tool.api.ToolException: javax.servlet.ServletException: String index out of range: -101
at org.sakaiproject.portal.charon.handlers.ToolHandler.doPost(ToolHandler.java:75)

caused by: javax.servlet.ServletException: String index out of range: -101

caused by: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -101
at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1911)
at org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.jsf.validator.FinQuestionValidator.validate(FinQuestionValidator.java:58)
at javax.faces.component.UIInput.validateValue(UIInput.java:801)
at javax.faces.component.UIInput.validate(UIInput.java:665)
at javax.faces.component.UIInput.executeValidate(UIInput.java:869)
at javax.faces.component.UIInput.processValidators(UIInput.java:432)

column10: "Numeric Response" questions (FIN): validation error
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Tested in sakai-trunk.atica.um.es, works as described.
column45:
I looked at this briefly in our 10.2 installation and it seemed to me that the problem here is that the validation code responsible for checking the text between curly braces (samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/jsf/validator/FinQuestionValidator.java, method validate) is executed before the code responsible for checking the syntax (and presence) of the braces themselves (samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/listener/author/ItemAddListener.java, method isErrorFIN). The former has no logic to check the brace syntax, and this exception is thrown when it finds no closing brace (thus a string index of -1) and attempts to fetch a substring between a non-zero index and that.

I wrote a 'quick-fix' to simply catch this exception in the FinQuestionValidator.java validation code so that it'll let the brace syntax checking do it's job and catch these cases. Hacky, but it works. I've attached this patch in case anyone wants it (SAM-2565_uva-10.2-exception-catch.patch).

I expect a better fix would be to reverse the order that these checks happen, but I don't know how to do that and we wanted a fix ASAP.

column1: [SAK-29373] Add the ability to create Auto Groups from roster
column6:
Several faculty members have requested the ability to create Auto Groups from a selected roster, just like how they can create Auto Groups from a selected role.

The linked PR introduces the same set of choices you get for Auto Groups for a role for a selected roster as well:

  • "Create a single group for the selected section" (default)
  • "Create random groups from members in the selected section"

If you choose the later of the two options, you get two sub-options just like with role (random number of groups with specified number of users per group, or random number of users in a specified number of groups).

I continued with the existing design in such a way that you can effectively create groups (random or not) for both sections and rosters at the same time.
column10: Add the ability to create Auto Groups from roster
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29372] Update Sakai LTI provider to optionally trust LTI Consumer's email as userid
column6:
If an LTI Consumer and Provider share the same SSO, it should be possible for them to share the same userid. Some consumers only share the internal userid with the provider, which may not be the same as the SSO userid.

This enhancement will update the Sakai LTI provider to optionally 'trust' the consumer and lookup the userid based on the consumer provided user email. This will allow better integration between LTI providers and consumers.

Configuring this option will parallel the "basiclti.provider.highly.trusted.consumers" value in sakai.properties, by creating a new property "basiclti.provider.email.trusted.consumers", which also needs to match the value used to specify the provider key and secret.
column10: Update Sakai LTI provider to optionally trust LTI Consumer's email as userid

column87:
Create question type Calculated Question.

Put in a question like
Kevin has

{x} apples. Jane eats {y}. How many does Kevin have now? z

Extract the variables

Make x min 10, max 20, decimal 0
Make y min 0 max 10, decimal 0

Put {x}

-

{y}

as the formula, 0 Decimal places.

Go back to the main page, hit print.
Hit Show Answer Key with Feedback and Apply Settings.

Currently "Answer Key" has some numeric answer. It should show the value put in as the formula instead.

column45:
Steve Swinsburg I've digged into the problem, i think is in the definition of SelectionType @ SiteService:

public static final SelectionType DELETED = new SelectionType("deleted", true, true, true, false); //Always filter unpublished sites

The header is private SelectionType(String id, boolean ignoreSpecial, boolean ignoreUser, boolean ignoreUnpublished, boolean ignoreSoftlyDeleted)

If the site is unpublished the user should see their deleted sites, right? If not there's not way to recover them until the administrator recovers it.

Here is a pull request that resolves the problem, feel free to discuss the proposed solution.

https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/718

column1: [SAK-29366] Update POI in all tools for 2.9
column6:
I'm not sure if anyone is still building 2.9, but it looks like something recently broke every tool that includes POI. It gets the following error on geronimo on tools that use POI 3.7.

Project ID: null:project-config:pom:1.1

Reason: Cannot find parent: org.apache.geronimo.genesis.config:config for project: null:project-config:pom:1.1 for project null:project-config:pom:1.1

Upgrading to 3.9 or 3.10-FINAL looks to get around this, just a problem up to 3.8. It looks like there's a ton of POI upgrade jiras out there. Rather than merge them all I'd think every tool can be safely updated to a new version in 2.9 to keep that building.

It also might not be quite as easy as updating the versions everywhere because some of them are transitive dependencies and some of them are properties.

column1: [SAK-29361] Add sortOrder to gradebook Assignment object
column6:
The shared Assignment DTO from the gradebook API does not currently provide a sort order field. This makes it difficult to shift an assignment left or right in a table.

The data is already there in the persistent Assignment object and just needs to be filled into the DTO.

This ticket will add a sortOrder field and a public getter only. The setter will be for the DTO only, it will not actually save the order as it must be done through the API so that the rest of the assignments have their order updated as well.

column1: [SAK-29359] Join site page doesn't consider account type limitations
column6:
When visiting a joinable site you are not a member of, a page appears asking if you would like to join. However, with certain properties enabled, joinability can be limited by account type. If a user tries to join but doesn't have the right account type, they will just hit Site Unavailable.

Linked PR will present a message to users that they will not actually be able to join the site, with an option to return to My Workspace. The PR will also adjust the behaviour of the "No thanks" option to direct the user to My Workspace instead of Site Unavailable.

column1: [SAK-29356] Prompt students when they cancel out of a non-empty assignment submission
column6:
We've had at least one student who erroneously clicked cancel and believed they submitted their assignment.
We need a prompt upon clicking cancel if:
1) It's a new submission and the inline-text is non-empty or they uploaded at least one attachment
2) It's a resubmission and the inline-text has changed or the list of attachments is not identical to their last submission.

column1: [SAK-29355] Allow !error site to keep bad URL
column6:
When someone browses to a site that doesn't exist they get taken to the !error site. If they then browse inside the !error site the URL includes the !error site ID. This is exposing the internal works on the error handling. It also means that if they browse within the site you lose the URL that they were trying to access.

If they then send in a problem report (either by email or through a tool such as the feedback tool (contrib)) the URL the user quotes includes the !error site rather than where they started off.
column10: Allow !error site to keep bad URL
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-38805] Remove old DDL files that are run on every startup
column6:
At the moment some old kernel DDL files are run on every startup when auto.ddl=true. More recently Sakai has developed custom migration scripts and not had them part of the code. These files aren't needed by any running installation and can be removed to speedup startups.

The performance impact isn't to bad as the ddl stops once it hits an error which is normally on the first line.
column10: Remove old DDL files that are run on every startup
