column49:
Yeah, not sure.
connectionTimeout is set to the default : 30 seconds
idleTimeout is set to the default : 10 minutes
maxLifetime the default : 30 minutes

https://github.com/brettwooldridge/HikariCP

It's probably related to that connectionTimeout setting. It looks like it dbcp the mapped value was validationQueryTimeout and we weren't setting it so it never timed out? Try to increase that and see if it helps? If you're on the hikaricp as the BaseDataSource should be able to set it with

connectionTimeout@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=60000 (for 60 seconds)
column53: If it happens really fast, it might be that validationTimeout parameter instead. By default that's only 5 seconds, and it's not exposed through the bean so would probably need to be added to the db-components.xml to be able to be adjusted? Change or suggest whatever values you think are inappropriate, I just either went with the defaults or tried to map with what we had.
column57:
I'm not sure it needs to be adjusted or fixed, as a good value for production wouldn't necessarily match a value for development that kept the stack traces away. I had a quick look to see if you could detect and see if the JVM had been suspended, but it seems the closes that is sometimes done is checking to see if debugging is enabled.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12474153/what-does-it-mean-if-jvm-is-suspended - Timeouts being ignored when debugging enabled.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3776204/how-to-find-out-if-debug-mode-is-enabled - How to check if debugging is enabled.
column61: Yeah, if it is the validationQuery, I think it would be nice to expose it in the bean so it could be overridden when doing debugging so you didn't see these stack traces. Otherwise the default seems acceptable to me too. Maybe it can't be fixed though.
column65: Yep, it's the validation query as it's Hikari executing the statement which has come from com.zaxxer.hikari.AbstractHikariConfig#getConnectionTestQuery()
column137:
I added a PR to just add this config could set it higher for debugging I think and avoid seeing the error, shouldn't be a regular problem.

validationTimeout@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=60000

Maybe mention this in the docs. Would like to write up a small blurb about hikari. I tested setting less than 1000 and it crashes startup with a big error message.
column163: Shall we close this as I wonder if it might be worth having a check in SqlService to see if debugging is enabled and limit the exceptions we throw when it is.

column1: [SAK-29354] Quartz job to backfill a tool into a site
column6:
If a new tool needs to be added to lots of existing sites across a Sakai deployment this can be done with SQL, however running against a live service these changes can get lose as data from the cache gets saved back to the DB.

A safer way to perform updates is through the API which automatically flushes the caches and can be run on a live service.
column10: Quartz job to backfill a tool into a site

column87:
1. Create a Reading List, give it a name, save
2. Opt to edit the reading list, manually create a journal item with title and author filled in, save
3. Click Reset button and click Actions -> Duplicate on the list.
4. Click Edit Citation List on the duplicated list and edit the citation in it (e.g., change the title), save.
5. View the original Citation List. The title of the citation should NOT have changed (to what the copy was changed to).

column1: [SAK-35745] Retract date is taken into account to make currently available an assessment although late submissions are not accepted.
column6:
Retract date should not be take into account if late submission are not accepted. We have noticed some use cases in which those problems occurs:

Use Case 1: an assessment that supports late submissions is published. Once the exam is done the instructor reopen the assessment extending the due date but without accepting late submissions. The retract date would be in the past.

Use Case 2: an assessment that supports late submissions is published. Later on, the instructor duplicate the assessment for publication to another section but without accepting late submissions. The retract date would be in the past.

column1: [SAK-36986] Exported EMI assessments with attachments do not import
column6:
Images attached to EMI question items do not import/export correctly.

Case 1:

Create an EMI
Attach an image to the first item
Preview the assessment to verify that the image is shown with the item
Export the assessment to IMS CP
The image is not included in the IMS CP package, although there is metadata related to the image in the exportAssessment.xml file.

Case 2:

Create a new site
Use Site Info / Import from Site / Tests & Quizzes to import the assessment created in case 1 above.
Preview the assessment
The image is missing.

Case 3:

Create a new site
Use Tests & Quizzes / import from file to import an IMS CP file created by export in 1 above
Images are not part of the IMS CP zip file so this doesn't work.

Case 4 (this does work)

column1: [SAK-29349] New column to mark assignments that include comments in the assignment's submission list page
column6:
Over the years, we've had several requests from instructors about the possibility of displaying information about comments in the list of submissions for each specific assignment. They usually like how submissions are marked and differentiated when they are graded (with the 'Grade' column) and when released to students with the column 'Released'. The proposal would be to add a new column that shows when a submission has already been commented by the instructor. This should not affect any of the information displayed in the other two columns. It will follow the same logic that it is used for grading assignments. The main idea is that they can see from then main page how many submissions have already been commented and which ones they might have on the queue.

Please, consider taking a look at the screenshot to better understand the functionality. We could have all this different scenarios.

  • Empty submission
  • Empty submission with comments from the instructor (SHOW NEW COMMENT'S ICON)
  • Submission with comments and with grade (not released yet) (SHOW NEW COMMENT'S ICON)
  • Submission with comments and with grade released to student (SHOW NEW COMMENT'S ICON)
  • Submission with grade but without comments (not released yet)
  • Submission with grade but without comments released to student

The functionality is very simple, just displaying the icon when there is a comment in a submission.
column10: New column to mark assignments that include comments in the assignment's submission list page

column1: [SAK-29345] Enabling LaTeX support prevents LTI tools from being added to the site
column6:
Enable the LaTeX setting in Edit Site Information and you will be unable to add LTI tools.

This happens because the code which adds the lti tools to the site is modifying a copy of the site object, which never makes it back to the caller. Then, when the latex setup code runs, it is working on the original site object that wasn't modified, and commits that copy. This reverts the modifications made by the lti code.

Linked PR will move the latex setup into the same method that runs the lti setup. As a consequence of this move, the latex enabling code now runs during site creation (although it looks like only if you make the site unpublished). This should be fine because the enabling code will recognize that mathjax is not enabled for the new site and do nothing.
column10: Enabling LaTeX support prevents LTI tools from being added to the site

column1: [SAK-35510] Samigo shouldn't rely on site title not changing
column6:
Samigo should not rely on the site title never changing, instead it should use the site ID.

Brian Jones reported that there are currently places in Samigo that key things off the site title. The site title should be considered changeable by the end user and shouldn't be used in this manner.

Eg: User create a project site called "Field trip survey 2014" and uses Samigo to collect some results. Then rather than creating a new site they just rename the site to "Field trip survey 2015". No data should be lost from Samigo.
column10: Samigo shouldn't rely on site title not changing
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Could you add details either of where in the code, or the exact functional issue? "currently places in Samigo that key things off the site title" is a little vague.
column45:
It was reported in SAK-29138 Resolved .

Brian Jones Are you able to elaborate on this?
column49:
I agree that the site title shows up in the RELEASETO field in SAM_PUBLISHEDACCESSCONTROL_T for example, but in a quick test, renaming a site did not lead to any change in the availability of published assessments to users in that site, nor did it lead to any change in visibility of submissions for instructors. We also haven't ever had this reported as a support issue to my knowledge.

So I'm wondering if this has any actual functional impact.
column53:
I'm not familiar with the inner workings of the Samigo DB tables. When I was developing SAK-29138 Resolved , I remembered that we used to have a query to find assessments for a site which references the RELEASETO field in SAM_PUBLISHED_ACCESSCONTROL_T. This was enough to scare us away from putting the logic for SAK-29138 Resolved into Site.getTitle().

However, taking a quick look at the tables, it looks more likely that the AGENTID field in SAM_AUTHZDATA_T contains site IDs.
column57: This isn't actually true, the AGENTID field contains the site ID.

column1: [SAK-29341] Old links in assignments take students to the wrong page
column6:
A student is looking at their assignment list. While they are looking at this page, a particular assignment enters a state where the student can no longer submit to it (Eg. the accept until date passes). The action of the assignment link on their screen will continue to point to doView_Submission. So, if the student clicks this link, everything renders as if they could submit the assignment, but they can't due to server side validation.

Modify the doView_Submission server side process to render the doView_Grade view if the student can no longer submit.

24-Oct-2016 19:06:27.851 WARN [http-apr-8366-exec-42] org.sakaiproject.assignment.tool.AssignmentAction.getSubmission org.sakaiproject.assignment.tool.AssignmentAction@a5ba5d5:doView_grade user=33561597-a003-4e5a-8ede-a684f59dc2a5 lock=asn.submit/asn.read resource=/assignment/s//d3bb0503-1597-4f2f-9e89-795554eccfa3/9ff3d324-a02f-432d-8c4f-6b9b9cdba132 /assignment/s//d3bb0503-1597-4f2f-9e89-795554eccfa3/9ff3d324-a02f-432d-8c4f-6b9b9cdba132

column49: Just grepping for it, I see a few occurrences. Maybe one every couple days
column53: But the resource that's logged for us appears as a guid as opposed to a ref. And at the end of the log statement, our refs contain the siteId (I notice the siteId is missing in your example as you have "/assignment/s//...")
column57:
The alert that this patch added only works when the user is in the English locale as it usesorg.sakaiproject.assignment.impl.BaseAssignmentService.BaseAssignmentSubmission#getStatus which returns a status for the submission in the current user's locale and checks to see if it equals "Not Started".

Depending on i18n strings for logic is something Sakai shouldn't ever do.
column61:
Whoops! Assignments often uses Strings as sentinel values, but this isn't one of those situations. The lack of a constant should have been a red flag to me.

I agree i18n strings shouldn't be used for logic - it's flimsy. But it looks like these values are coming from BaseAssignmentService.BaseAssignmentSubmission.getStatus() which always returns internationalized Strings suitable to the current user session. A better design would be to represent the status with an enum, and a separate method to convert to i18n Strings.

For the context of 11, it's probably best to change the problematic line to compare with rb.getString("gen.notsta"). Doesn't look like an issue in 20 (and I haven't looked into 12 or 19).

column1: [SAK-29340] No login controls for Morpheus mobile view with xlogin enabled
column6:
The mobile phone view for the Morpheus responsive skin does not display an apparent means to login when an auxiliary login path (xlogin) is enabled, per the following example sakai.properties:

xlogin.enabled=true
xlogin.text=Guest Account

For a wide enough screen (e.g., iPad landscape), the two green buttons for login and xlogin display as a vertical stack on the top right corner.

When the browser width is shrunk to the mobile width (e.g., iPhone 4, or iPad portrait) there are no login controls displayed.

For Chrome and Safari on an iPhone4s (OS 8), the green 'login' button is displayed when clicking the top left hamburger. The button overlaps the gateway site's menu; however, the 'xlogin' button (e.g., for locally authenticated guest accounts) is not displayed. For other browser/device scenarios that I've tested so far, including Chrome and Safari on iPad, the 'login' button over the gateway's tool menu does not appear.
column7: Chrome, Safari on iPhone. (Also, this can be simulated on a desktop monitor by shrinking the width of the browser.)

column1: [SAK-29339] Reduce calls to getNonInlineAttachments when resubmitting
column6:
If we're using Single Uploaded File Only, we don't want to submit inline attachments from the previous submission.

Currently, our code grabs the nonInlineAttachments, and then checks if we're using Single Uploaded File Only. It would be more efficient to first check if we're using Single Uploaded File Only, and then grab the nonInlineAttachments, so we won't be grabbing nonInlineAttachments if we don't need to on other submission types.

column1: [SAK-29332] Upload resources using drag and drop does not obey file size and site quota limits properly
column6:
The current code has the following bugs:

1) if using the drag and drop upload and the site quota is set to unlimited, any file over the 1MB threshold will be reported as putting the user over the site quota

2) the code checks the deprecated siteQuota@... property, but not the new one (content.quota). This is the only remaining occurrence of the old siteQuota@... property. It should just be removed from both the default.sakai.properties and the referencing code

3) the code retrieves the quota and file size limit sakai.properties without providing default values. The result is that if these properties aren't set, the default limits will never be enforced

4) the advertised default value for site quota in default.sakai.properties is not respected due to 2 spring xml injection files specifying that the default value is 1048576KB (1GB). As a result, if you leave the sakai.property for this commented out, you would expect the site quota to be unlimited, but you will discover that the quota will actually be reported as 1GB. The Spring xml files should be specifying 0 instead of 1048576, for consistency with the advertised defaults in default.sakai.properties
column10: Upload resources using drag and drop does not obey file size and site quota limits properly
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Brian Jones Do you have a test plan for this or is it running in production somewhere? Just set the quota low and try to use the drag and drop?
column45:
Ya, no real test plan, but you can try the following:

#1, set the quota to unlimited and use the drag and drop. Previous to my PR, any file over 1mb would be reported as putting the user over the site quota.

#2, previous to my PR, the new property was never checked. So if you didn't set the old one, your setting would never be enforced.

#3, defaults weren't provided, so default values were never enforced

#4, the default of 0 was being overridden by a spring injection in kernel, so the advertised unlimited default value wasn't what was being used
column49:
The default is unlimited. I'm not seeing any error on 10.x nightly or trunk nightly on any sites. By default the quota is unlimited. So I can't tell if this fixes anything or not.

Is the affects version correct? Was this just a problem with 11 or was it also a problem with 10.4?

Would you consider this a blocker for 10.5? I can't seem to reproduce any errors but I might just not be doing something right.
column53:
I originally discovered the problem in a 10.3 instance, and was able to reproduce in trunk.

The default is advertised as unlimited, correct, however there were problems with the code in how it was accessing and enforcing the defaults.

#1 is only relevant when you actually set the property to 0 (which is the default, but you should still be able to explicitly set it to 0).

#2 wasn't checking the new property, so if you didn't set the old one it wasn't enforced

#3 the code wasn't accessing the sakai.properties with default values

#4 was a spring injection of the sakai.property that is contradictory to the advertised default value; so if you didn't explicitly set it to 0, you'd end up with a 1GB limit

If you look at the old code that was changed, it's pretty obvious where the bugs were. Sorry if I'm not explaining this very well!
column57: On the call this week we decided to go ahead and release RC01 without this. This sounds like it would be worth including in 10.5 if we can get it tested a little more, but it would also be nice if the related jiras SAK-39579 Open and SAK-39751 Resolved were completed to go along with this to make the code a little cleaner.

column163:
Is it possible that this commit has changed the default quota from 1GB to unlimited?!

This is a pretty large change in behavior that should be discussed widely. Is it true that as of 10.6 the default behavior is now an unlimited quota?
column231:
Yes, because the default value is advertised to be unlimited but the implementation differed:

 # Set the maximum size for resources (content) in sites, does not affect the dropbox
 # DEFAULT: 0 (unlimited storage/no quota)
 # content.quota={value in KB}

This should have been the default behaviour all along, according to the information in sakai.properties.
column254: Okay, so the docs were wrong. But I would still argue that this is a large change in behavior in a minor Sakai release. I don't understand the Matthew Jones comment that "The default is unlimited." I believe the default was 1GB for 10+ years
column258: Correct. The advertised default has always been listed as unlimited. However the implementation enforced a default of 1GB. This PR simply changed the underlying behaviour to obey the advertised default of unlimited.
column263:
Actually it looks like the default has been 1GB rather than unlimited, I mistyped. I thought it was changed because I must have just glanced at the code but SAK-39104 Resolved changed the value in the service in 10.0 without actually doing anything. it was still using this spring bean to run the setSiteQuota with this value.

I don't care one way or another what value the default site quota should be, unlimited, limited at 1GB or some other value. But it looks like did change that.
column283: Ya, I also don't have an opinion on what the default should be. The purpose of this ticket/PR was simply to make it work as advertised.
column287:

column1: [SAK-29331] Add support for the emerging LTI 2.1 Split Secret Capabilities
column6:
This is the new (still subject to revision) split secret work flow.

The TC (i.e. Sakai) indicates support for split secrets via a new enabled capability in its TC profile.

"enabled_capability":[
"User.id",
...
"OAuth.splitSecret"
]

If a TP is capable of supporting split secrets - the TC will prefer a split secret so this capability should be considered a gentle demand.

When constructing the Tool Registration Request, the TP builds 512 bits of secure random data and encoded in binhex with a-f and 0-9. All the letters must be lower case and the string must be exactly 128 characters long. The tp_oauth_half_secret must be placed in the security_contract instead of the shared_secret. The TP should never send both a tc_oauth_half_secret and shared_secret. The following is sample PHP code to generate the proper half secret:

Tool Producer Profile Sends as Registration Request:

$tp_oauth_half_secret = bin2hex( openssl_random_pseudo_bytes( 512/8 ) ) ;
$tp_profile->security_contract->tp_oauth_half_secret = $tp_oauth_half_secret;

{
"tool_profile":

{ ... }

,
"security_contract":

{ "tool_service":[ .... ], "tp_oauth_half_secret":"05 ... 128 characters exactly" }

}

When the TC receives the registration request, it generates the other half of the split secret and includes it in the response to the registration request as follows. The sample code shows how to generate 512 secure random bits and encode them in binhex in Java. Again 0-9 and a-f must be used with all lower case and the half secret must be exactly 128 characters long.

Tool Consumer Registration Response:

SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom();
byte bytes[] = new byte[512/8];
random.nextBytes(bytes);
tc_oauth_half_secret = PortableShaUtil.bin2hex(bytes);

{ "@context":"http:\/\/purl.imsglobal.org\/ctx\/lti\/v2\/ToolProxyId", "@type":"ToolProxy", "@id":"http:\/\/localhost:8888\/sakai-api-test\/554e5fa26e044", "tool_proxy_guid":"98765", "tc_oauth_half_secret":"3b ... 128 characters exactly" }

Both the TC and TP concatenate the two halves of the secret with the TC portion as the first half of the combined split secret.
column10: Add support for the emerging LTI 2.1 Split Secret Capabilities

column1: [SAK-29328] Add Support for IMS LTI Content Item Protocol
column6:
The IMS LTI ContentItem allows an external tool to be configured as a "resource picker" or self-configuring tool placement. The tool is launched using LTI and the user goes through a picking process and at the end of the process the external tool POSTs back some information for Sakai that sets the tool configuration for a resource link (i.e. we call them Content Items in the table lti_content).

Here is the public draft of the IMS Specification:

http://www.imsglobal.org/lti/ltiv1p2pd/ltiCIMv1p0pd.html

A great use case would be in the Editor - where there is a button to "select an external tool" - the user clicks the pciker and when done the tool is inside of the editor in an iframe.
column10: Add Support for IMS LTI Content Item Protocol
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: This is sometimes known as the LTI picker.
column45:
Here is a related JIRA on the same feature going into Moodle:

https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-49609
column49:
I am making an intiial commit that is realy a refactor of the ToolProxy parsing code. Lots of code is being moved from the LTI2Util class to new ToolProxy and ToolProxyBinding classes. And the entire ToolProxyBinding is stored in the lti_tools table so it can be later parsed and inspected.

All this is needed because it is non-trivial to know when to launch the external tool in ContentItemSelector mode.

column1: [SAK-39573] Add parameter to getDeletedResources to specify age
column6:
As mentioned on SAK-27732 Closed , it would be useful to be able to getAllDeletedResources (and getDeletedResources) older than a specific date to improve the performance of the cleanup job. There is already a column in the database for it, so I propose a new api method

public List getAllDeletedResources(String id, Time olderThan);

Which would query into getDeletedResources and get all deleted resources older than a specific date that should make these queries much more efficient. Default would just return all.
column10: Add parameter to getDeletedResources to specify age
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41:
This is looking to be a major amount of work to pass any additional parameters (especially ones with < > criteria) into getAllResourcesWhereLike. It calls into the storage with getXmlLikeSql which only accepts one single "Like" parameter and storage can be BaseDbBinarySingleStorage, BaseDbDualSingleStorage, BaseDbSingleStorage. So all of these down the line are going to have to be redone to accept multiple criteria somehow.

And the query will have to have a special version for both Oracle and MySQL. Ugh!

column254: So now that this functionality is in 10.x, is there any way to batch update student submissions from pre-10.6 assignment use so they have this flag set appropriately?
column258: Sorry Sam, I'm not sure what you're referring to. This simply introduces some new buttons to allow instructors/maintainers more ways to navigate between submissions for an assignment. It doesn't actually do anything to the submission objects.
column263: Hi Brian, this JIRA implements a new XML attribute on student submissions called isUserSubmission. So if your institution upgrades to latest 10.x today, all previous student submissions will be missing this isUserSubmission attribute.
column283:
Ahh, right, I had forgotten about that, sorry!

There is no update script to set this flag for historic submissions, as it's very subjective and hard to determine retroactively (with a script) if it's an actual user submission or not (it's the code path that determines if it's an actual user submission or not, rather than the content of the submission object).

In these cases (where the flag is not present or not set), the newly introduced buttons may or may not be enabled in the right circumstances, but the original buttons will always be there and work.

Going forwards, all new assignments/submissions will have the flag.
column287:
Okay thanks. I was thinking of writing a conversion that would insert this flag if this string was NOT found in the xml 'submittedtext=""' that would indicate that some text was added. It would also check submittedattachment0 for attachment only. I just didn't want to work on anything if you already had it.

The problem really isn't the buttons, but with this patch in place without a conversion the upload/download process breaks ( SAK-29007 Verified ) as it believes students haven't submitted.
column291: Ya, we never had a need to address a conversion script, sorry about that! Sounds like what you're thinking would work for most cases though.

I attached a file that seems like it would function as a (mysql) conversion script for everything except the non-electronic type. I think those should also be identified and this field added as well.

Looking at this though, it seems like whether or not it was a user submission could be determined by these 3 factors.

  • Has the user submitted with text?
    Yes it is a user submission
  • Has the user submitted with an attachment?
    Yes it is a user submission
  • Is it a non-electronic assignment?
    Yes, it's always marked as submitted, though perhaps we should really have an explicit UI action that does this)

Thanks
column344:
This conversion script currently gives an error on mysql 5.5:

mysql> INSERT INTO TMP_ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION_IDS (SUBMISSION_ID) SELECT SUBMISSION_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION WHERE CONTEXT IN (SELECT ASSIGNMENT_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_ASSIGNMENT WHERE XML LIKE CONCAT('%',(SELECT CONTENT_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_CONTENT WHERE XML LIKE '%submissiontype="5"%'),'%'));
ERROR 1242 (21000): Subquery returns more than 1 row
column348:
What is the impact of the failed conversion script? Anyone know?

Perhaps a new Jira will need to be opened , to be fixed for 10.7, to correct the script?
column356:
Well the major impact of not running it is as Stephen said, you have to click the button for "include students who have not yet submitted" on any assignment created prior to updating to 10.6.

I didn't test it on more than a few clients so I don't really know why it's not working.

Maybe if the query had a distinct in there somewhere?

INSERT INTO TMP_ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION_IDS (SUBMISSION_ID) SELECT DISTINCT SUBMISSION_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION WHERE CONTEXT IN (SELECT ASSIGNMENT_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_ASSIGNMENT WHERE XML LIKE CONCAT('%',(SELECT CONTENT_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_CONTENT WHERE XML LIKE '%submissiontype="5"%'),'%'));
column360: Also, I'm really not sure how to do some of this for Oracle, so nothing was included in the conversion scripts for either database yet. Maybe for 10.7 if someone does the Oracle part.
column364: I can likely figure out how to re-factor this script for Oracle, but I won't have time to get to it for a few days still.
column368:
I took a bit of time today to try to address an Oracle conversion for this script, and it's become a lot more complicated than I initially anticipated. The main problem is that these XML columns are created as LONG datatypes in an Oracle database. LONG has been deprecated for more than a decade, and has serious issues when trying to compare and update values inside a LONG column.

From what I've been reading, this would necessitate creating a PL/SQL script or a very lengthy .sql script that would do a whole bunch of dumping data into various temporary tables so that the comparisons and updates can be made, then copying those identified fields back into the original tables.

As such, it would be a lot more time consuming that merely porting the script to Oracle compliant syntax; time which I unfortunately don't have at the moment.
column372: This seems to be a big problem. I'm thinking we'll have to change the code to do something if the attribute isn't set (null) rather than try to figure out this conversion. I'm thinking this should be a blocker for 10.7. I can create a new issue.
column376:
This CONCAT query is pretty ugly when you have a few hundred thousand rows. Here is a MySQL query using the ExtractValue function:


SELECT ASSIGNMENT_ID FROM ASSIGNMENT_ASSIGNMENT, ASSIGNMENT_CONTENT
  WHERE Substring_INDEX(ExtractValue(ASSIGNMENT_ASSIGNMENT.XML, '/assignment/@assignmentcontent'), '/', -1)=ASSIGNMENT_CONTENT.CONTENT_ID
    AND ASSIGNMENT_CONTENT.XML LIKE '%submissiontype="5"%'
column437:
Sweet, thanks Sam Ottenhoff. I'm wondering if that submission type should be 4 instead of 5 though. From Assignment.java:

/** Non-electronic assignment type */
public static final int NON_ELECTRONIC_ASSIGNMENT_SUBMISSION = 4;

column1: [SAK-29312] Show message making it clear that instructor submitted on behalf of student
column6:
If you submit on behalf of a student, the assignment list by student view will only show that there is a submission for the user, rather than saying it was submitted on behalf of the student. To avoid confusion for users, it will now say "by <submitting user> (on behalf of <student>)". Also applies to the maintainer's list of submissions for a given assignment.

column1: [SAK-39342] Home tools should have their own TitleCustom property
column6:
SAK-39781 Closed added exceptions to dynamic page localization for pages/tools whose titles can be edited (i.e. sakai.iframe, sakai.news, sakai.portletIFrame).

A new property TitleCustom was added to SitePage class. If the property is true, the tool's title is not i18ned and a hardcoded value is shown, no matter what language has the current user. (See SAK-29301 Closed )

This has an important flaw: a page can contain several tools. In fact, Home page usually contains at least three or four tools. And at least one of these tools tends to be an Iframe or PortletIFrame tool.

If this Iframe tool is edited, the page TitleCustom property is set to true and every tool inside Home page gets its title hardcoded.

One simple solution to this issue could be adding another new property TitleCustom into Placement class, so one tool could override their containing page's TitleCustom value.

If the property is added, the usual behaviour should not change, but it would be possible to change each tool's logic to use the new property when it is required (i.e. when a Tool is edited and there is more than one Tool in the containing SitePage).
column10: Home tools should have their own TitleCustom property
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: PR adding the new property: https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/459
column45: I am not seeing either (a) where this is persisted (b) where in the portal this is consulted so it appears in the UI - so this seems incomplete at this point in time.
column49:
I'm having a hard time trying to solve this issue.

BaseToolConfiguration receives a SitePage object as parameter when it's created. When a tool's title is retrieved, the getTitleCustom method looks for sitePage's customTitle property.

However, Placement properties are not set at this point, so I don't know how to override sitePage's property.

By the way, there is some duplicate code in BaseToolConfiguration.getTitleCustom method that is also in SitePage.getTitleCustom.

Trying to get the placement from SitePage object passed as parameter causes a database block, maybe some kind of circular dependency.

I don't know what more to try. Suggestions are welcome.
column53:
I have finally managed to solve this issue creating a new property in SitePage (sitePage.homeToolsCustomTitle). This property has a list of comma-separated values of tool Ids which override internationalization titles. So if page.isHomeTool() is true, this property is used instead of sitePage.customTitle.

I have also added changes to EntityBroker & Sitestats classes too as they are failing to compile after the change.

A new pull request is available at https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/955

We are willing to have this issue fixed in our production environment. I hope that looks good to you, any suggestion is welcome.
column57: Assigned in the S2U call. Verified in https://trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org
column61:
Daniel Merino So in production we're running into some reported cases where some old titles aren't being set to the previous values, for Site Info.

I don't 100% know the reproducable case yet but it seems like it's related to SAK-29301 Closed and previous it was based on the sitePage.customTitle and now for some tools it's sitePage.homeToolsCustomTitle right? But I don't see any conversion script in here.

This new property is on the site right? Should there be some defaults set? Any thoughts?
column65:
Matthew Jones First, sorry for the big delay of this answer, I have been out of work for a while.

I have taken a look on my patch. When any tool's name is edited, the customTitle property is set to true, preventing the i18n. But if the tool is inside Home page, my patch adds the tool's title to a list in the new property homeToolsCustomTitle. This allows to show the custom title only in the edited tools.

I haven't found in the code any use case that sets customTitle to false. I suppose that admin users will do this by themselves. If this is the case, the tool's title should be removed from the new property homeToolsCustomTitle to set the titles to the previous i18ned values.

Is this what you are asking for?
column137: Why keep the flag about if there is a custom title on the page rather than have a custom title flag in the placement? It seems we're keeping state across 2 objects now.
column163:
Matthew Buckett That was my first attempt, but I was not able to get the placement info in BaseToolConfiguration. Database got blocked and I don't know why (maybe circular references?), so I did the current patch that just works.

If you want to set the property into the placement, please do it. It's the better solution, just I don't know how could it be done.

column1: [SAK-35882] "Late submissions accepted" default should be "No, not after due date"
column6:
"Late submissions accepted: Yes" is the default OOTB for Samigo. Accepting late submissions should be an exceptionally case not selected by default.

All the assessments usually have an opening date and a due date and not all of them will have a retract date. The retract date defines an extra period of time after the assessment's official period of time in which the students are able to submit their assessments. Therefore, it is an extra period of time and it should be an optional choice, that's why we also believe that it should be not selected by default.

In the past, there are other assessment params whose default values have already been changed like the param "Students' identities can be seen by graders": SAK-34856 Closed ."
column10: "Late submissions accepted" default should be "No, not after due date"
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
From the dev list, an important comment:

Let me share with the community why we believe that it is important to change that OOTB behaviour. We've had several instructors reporting us this common use case:

1. Instructor creates an assessment with an opening date and a due date and publishes it.
2. The assessment allows submitting after due date because that option is selected by default and there is no retract date so the assessment will keep open forever. We actually believe that this could be considered a bug.
column45:
As mentioned in the Core Team Call, when 'No, not after due date' is selected, the input for the date should be grayed out and the icon removed. Just like it was done on the feedback section for the date when feedback should be displayed.

Earl's changes on the feedback section: https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAM-2559
Thanks!!

column1: [SAK-29301] Editing "Site Information Display" in Home changes "Custom Title" property to false for every Home tool
column6:
When some user edits any web content tool placed in Home, like Site Information Display, Home tool's property "Custom Title" changes to true.

This makes that the title of every Home tool (i.e. Synaptic Announcements, Messages & Forums, Calendar, etc) is saved with their current text and does not change anymore when user changes its language.

Just moving a line in the code to avoid this change when PortletIFrame edition is done inside Home would fix the issue:

In web/web-portlet/src/java/org/sakaiproject/portlets/PortletIFrame.java:

try
{
Site site = SiteService.getSite(toolConfig.getSiteId());
SitePage page = site.getPage(toolConfig.getPageId());
//page.setTitleCustom(true);

// for web content tool, if it is a site page tool, and the only tool on the page, update the page title / popup.
if (toolConfig != null && ! SPECIAL_WORKSITE.equals(special) && ! SPECIAL_WORKSPACE.equals(special) )
{
// if this is the only tool on that page, update the page's title also
if ((page.getTools() != null) && (page.getTools().size() == 1))
{
page.setTitleCustom(true);
String newPageTitle = request.getParameter(FORM_PAGE_TITLE);
...

More logic could be added, like changing Custom Title only if the title has been changed when saving.
column10: Editing "Site Information Display" in Home changes "Custom Title" property to false for every Home tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Looking better, my proposed change prevents the title of Home tools to be modified.

The problem is that Title Custom property is only in Pages, but not in Tools. And if this property is changed in Home page, every tool included there is affected.
column45:
I think that a reliable solution would be that Placement class, as it has setTitle/getTitle methods, also would have its own Title Custom property and getter/setter methods. So every tool could be set to have a title custom in pages with more than one tool.

But this involves changes in kernel code.

column1: [SAK-39562] Fix HikariCP startup errors under Oracle
column6:
When starting up under oracle with HikariCP connection pool there are a ton of errors that repeat forever.

2015-04-23 03:19:37,664 WARN localhost-startStop-1 HikariPool - Exception during keep alive check, that means the connection (oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CConnection@35d62bd2) must be dead.
java.sql.SQLException: SQL statement to execute cannot be empty or null
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleSql.initialize(OracleSql.java:113)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeQuery(OracleStatement.java:1234)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatementWrapper.executeQuery(OracleStatementWrapper.java:420)
at com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.HikariPool.isConnectionAlive(HikariPool.java:138)
column10: Fix HikariCP startup errors under Oracle
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
Our recommendation for Oracle is to NOT set a validation query:

  1. For improved Oracle performance, implementers using Oracle should strongly consider
  2. enabling all the following settings just as they appear (suggestion from the University of Michigan).
    #validationQuery@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=
    #defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=
    #testOnBorrow@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=false

We may need to restore this one:

validationQuery@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=select 1 from DUAL
column45:
Yeah, according to the docs if you don't define it, it calls isValid against the driver.

"If your driver supports JDBC4 we strongly recommend not setting this property. ". So they recommend setting it to null. I don't see this property defined. I'd expect this to happen as an empty string but it should be going through as null.

I'll have to debug it and see what's going on. Currently trunk seems incompatible with Oracle but I'd expect this to be fixed in the next few days. (Not sure too many people other than nightly are testing it on Oracle anyway)
column49:
For reference, Oracle states that that its client drivers are JDBC4-compatible for JDK 1.6 and above:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01_03
column53:
It looks like setting this to null is fixing it. I had it as null in the spring bean but kernel.properties was actually defining a value for
validationQuery@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=select 1 from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SYSTEM_USERS

And it could not be removed.

Looking better now. Also going to upgrade hikaricp as we're a few versions behind.

column61: Added in SAK-39486 Resolved (the main task), only support in 11 so far.

column1: [SAK-29299] roster 2 ignores privacy status
column6:
When a user hides themselves in a site Preferences > Privacy, Roster 2 lists them anyway regardless of permissions.

To whit:

User A goes to Preferences > Privacy and hides himself in Site X. Hes got maintain role in X.

User B is an access user in Site X with permission roster.viewallmembers but NOT roster.viewhidden. In Roster user B can see user A in Roster surely he shouldnt be able to?
column10: roster 2 ignores privacy status
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: matthew says its a mixup between EIDs and User IDs
column45:
I confirmed this same behavior in one of our ANI instances, but using two "access" role site participants (i.e., one student can see another hidden student). Also, FYI--the Preferences tool does not appear to be configured for "privacy" settings in QA10 (https://qa10-mysql.nightly.sakaiproject.org/), so we can't test there.

Another question/comment:

Since there is a "roster.viewhidden" permission (as well as a "roster.viewgroup" permission), the "roster.viewallmembers" permission seems a bit misleading, because you might expect it to accomplish the same thing. In other words, you might think that a "view all" permission would include display of hidden users and groups.

So because we do have "view hidden/view group" permission, perhaps "roster.viewallmembers" should be renamed to the "roster.viewmembers" permission?
column49:
"roster.viewallmembers" is poorly named, I also think it should be "roster.viewmembers". If it's not ticked you dont see any members (except yourself) in roster.

The viewgroups didnt seem to do anything as far as I could tell.
column53: Should a user in the roster be able to view a hidden member under any circumstances? Surely hidden is hidden, full stop?
column57: The tool should obey the 'view.hidden' permission. (Maintain role can see hidden users in Site Info therefore, by default, should see them in Roster => the 'view.hidden' permission should be set for 'maintain' out-of-the-box
column61: But roster.viewhidden isn't set by Preferences -> Privacy. Aren't these two different issues? When I set myself to hidden in all sites, access users can still see me in Site Info. I have no idea what permission that action changes.
column65:
Being able to view participants in Site Info is dependent on the "site.viewRoster" permission. Hidden users are always shown in Site Info. I believe this is correct

It is my belief that "site maintainers" always need to be able to see hidden users, by default, "students" shouldnt be able to see them but they can be given permission in Site Info & Roster should the site owner see fit
column87:
User A goes to Preferences > Privacy and hides himself in Site X. Hes got maintain role in X.

User B is an access user in Site X with permission roster.viewallmembers but NOT roster.viewhidden. In Roster user B should not be able to see user A in Roster 2
column137: Should students be able to see hidden users in Site Info ?
column163:
I believe that if they have been given the view roster permission then yes, a student should be able to see all users. I agree that these permissions are confusing but the system doesnt have the notion that the user of the system is a student, all it knows are the permissions of that user so that's what we must base our decisions on.

There is mileage in saying that a role must have both "site.viewRoster" and Roster tool's "view.hidden" but the issue here is to fix the broken Roster tool not to unpick the muddle related to who can see hidden users.

Personally, I dont believe that users with the access role should be able to hide themselves in a non-joinable site - it's a recipe for disaster. It means the student can hide themselves from a "core course site" and when they fail can claim they never had access to the site and that's why the failed. There would be no way of proving that the student was actually in the site in the first place. I believe the facility to hide oneself should only be for staff to allow admin or IT staff to hide themselves from students so they dont get asked questions about the course which the wont be able to answer (or so they arent evaluated as one of the course lecturers).
column231: Is this fix going to be merged into 10.x ?

column1: [SAK-29290] JavaScript error occurs when clicking checkboxes before page fully rendered

If you click in a checkbox when the page is partially loaded, you will get a JavaScript error, the function adjustCount is not defined, caused by page is not fully loaded.

After that, when page is fully loaded, whatever checkbox you select you will have only available the options Show or Hide, the rest of them (Move to Trash, Move and Copy) won't be unavailable. But, if you select multiple checkboxes you will have the expected behavior.

I've updated my branch, if you'd want to take a look

column137:
I added your css,
.right-col

{ display: block !important; position: inherit !important; }

to Simplepagetool.css, which is used by ShowPage.html. It doesn't fix the problem. Rather than adding a separate css file, my preference would be to add the code to simplepagetool.css and make it conditional on media print. However I'm not bothering with that until it works.

I'm attaching a PDF of what the page looks like when I print from Firefox. I've done an actual print to paper, and the result is the same.

With that CSS print from the print view works. I'll play with it a bit more. If it at least works in print view that's an improvement.
column163:
This fix will also work in Lessons 10.x. (It was developed and tested there.)

I'm using new CSS for the columns. It may well be better than the original CSS, but for the moment I've put it under @media print, pending more testing. It works in print view for Safari, Firefox, Chrome, and IE 11 and (simulated) IE 9. It depends upon the CSS calc feature, though if that fails it should still work well enough for printing.

Note that in most browsers this fix only works in Sakai 10 for print view. I doubt it's possible to fix for the normal view in Sakai 10.

column1: [SAK-29287] Custom fields are not being shown (or removed) until cache is refreshed
column6:
When creating or removing custom schedule fields, the changes are not being reflected immediately. It seems that when resetting the Sakai caches with the Memory tool as admin, this fields are refreshed.
I wonder if SAK-26085 Resolved is related to this issue. The problem cannot be reproduced on 10.x.

An alternative description from SAK-32060 Resolved

On the Fields page, you can create and 'Save' new fields, which appear in the list of fields (see screenshot). Click 'Save Field Changes'. But when you click on 'Fields' again (or try to Add new event), the new fields are not there. If you use Memory tool in Admin Workspace to reset the cache, then the new field appears.

It's also not possible to remove a field, after removal, the field is still displayed. If you use Memory tool in Admin Workspace to reset the cache, then the new field disappears.
column10: Custom fields are not being shown (or removed) until cache is refreshed
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
I can reproduce on the Marist QA server and on nightly trunk /Mysql.

To reproduce:
1) As instructor click on Schedule tool, then Fields
2) Enter a new field name and click Save Field Changes
3) Add a calendar item. You do not see the new field.
4) Log in as admin and clear memory cache. Log in as instructor and you will see the new field.
column45: Tested on Marist QA server and stills seems to be an issue.
column49: Downgrading to Major priority based on input from several institutions. Not a commonly used feature.
column53:
It looks like we're going to need a new method in the service that will invalidate all of the calendars in the current site from the cache.

We could just invalidate the entire calendar cache (for a slightly easier solution) but this may cause performance issues depending on how often these fields were updated, so probably better to just get it right for the immediate site.
column57: Verified the option to create additional fields is working properly on trunk. Ready to merge to 11x.
column87:
1. In the Calendar, click Fields
2. Create one or more new fields
3. For each one, click 'Create Field'
4. The new fields appear in the list - no problem
5. Click 'Save Field Changes'
6. Back on the main calendar view, click 'Fields'.
7. Check that the newly created fields are still there.
8. Click Add Event. Check that the newly created fields are there.

Visit Fields again, delete the newly added field, save, return and make sure it's gone.

column6:
See the downloads page for binary and source distributions: http://poi.apache.org/download.html

Release Notes

Changes
------------
The most notable changes in this release are:

Basic text extractor for very old Excel formats such as Excel 4 (Biff4), and
older Excel 5 and 95 formats
XML Signature support for XSSF, XWPF and XSLF (56836)
HSSF and XSSF support for getting existing Data Validations for a Sheet
HSSF and XSSF formula support for the PROPER function (57010)
XSLF support for adding slide notes (55164)
XMLBeans performance improved when using getXXXList() methods (56854)
Recommended Apache XMLBeans version increased to 2.6.0 (any version from
2.3.0 or later will work though)
XSSF support for evaluating formula references to other Workbooks (56737)
HSSF and XSSF support for evaluating formulas with multi-sheet references,
for functions that support that (55906)
HSSF and XSSF Workbooks are now CLoseable, so you can call close() to
explicitly free the file based resources when you're done (56537)
NPOIFS now fully supports writing, including streaming write, and in-place
updating of existing entries. NPOIFSFileSystem now surpasses the old
POIFSFileSystem in all cases.
XSSF Text Extraction support for Headers, Footers and Comments (56022, 56023)
SXSSF Shared Strings optional support (53130)
XWPF Change Tracking support (56075)
HWPF password hash function (56077)
XWPF document protection with password support (56076)
SXSSF support for a system-wide setting of where Temp files get created, via
TempFile / TempFileCreationStrategy (56735)

column1: [SAK-29280] New index on UUID field at MFR_TOPIC_T highly improves speed
column6:
We are currently using Msgcntr-3.0.2 on Sakai 2.9.2. Our DBA admin has recently located a simple query that was causing slowness in our MySql 5.1 database.

Adding a new index in UUID field on MFR_TOPIC_T table has fixed the issue, the performance of Messages Tool has had a big improvement, but I can see that this index is not in official MySql scripts.

I paste the EXPLAIN queries before and after the new index. Before the index the query's time is 4,61 seconds. After the index is almost 0 seconds.

The results differ because the before query has been run in a backup database that is the same that in production environment, but it has a lot less data in the tables.

If you need any other data, please ask me.

BEFORE INDEX

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

VERSION72_, topicimpl0_.UUID as UUID72_, topicimpl0_.CREATED as
CREATED72_, topicimpl0_.CREATED_BY as CREATED6_72_, topicimpl0_.MODIFIED
as MODIFIED72_, topicimpl0_.MODIFIED_BY as MODIFIED8_72_,
topicimpl0_.DEFAULTASSIGNNAME as DEFAULTA9_72_, topicimpl0_.TITLE as

column1: [SAK-29292] Import enhancements do not work with multi tools (like Lessons)
column6:
On the current trunk, Lessons is not coming up as being available for import.

  • Create one site with the Lessons tool (with or without Resources)
  • Create another site with the Lessons tool

Go to Site Info -> Import from Site(choose merge or replace doesn't matter).

On the next screen Lessons is not available. If you'd added Resources then that is available.

Adding content to the source lessons doesn't fix it. I'm not sure what's going on with this yet. This is not a problem on the 10.x nightly. I'm not seeing anything relevant yet in the logs.
column10: Import enhancements do not work with multi tools (like Lessons)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: It's probable this could be something in site manage rather than lessons, maybe with SAK-28069 Resolved or the more recent SAK-29159 Resolved .
column45:
It looks like
List<String> importableToolsIdsInDestinationSite = (List) state.getAttribute(STATE_TOOL_REGISTRATION_SELECTED_LIST);

is returningsakai.lessonbuildertool as

[add4e8a0-4046-48c8-b2b7-907b1ec04925sakai.lessonbuildertool, sakai.resources, sakai.siteinfo]

This is being set by siteToolsIntoState
state.setAttribute(STATE_TOOL_REGISTRATION_SELECTED_LIST, idSelected); // List

And it looks like it appends the page id to the beginning if it's a multi tool
if (isMultipleInstancesAllowed(findOriginalToolId(state, wSetupTool)))
{
String mId = page.getId() + wSetupTool;
idSelected.add(mId);

So that makes sense now. (This was added all the way back in the original SAK-7209 Closed mutli tool)

So when it's doing the comparison it's going to have to pull off this original id. I think it would be "nice" if we added a delimiter.
column49:
Attaching a patch that creates a new state variable that contains just the common names of the tools.

The alternative would be to remove the prefix and just compare against the suffix, but currently in the code there isn't any great delimiter. Maybe it would be easier to just use this new variable?
column53: There's still something missing from this because while the tools correctly show up they're disabled on the resulting page. It got me a little further to solving another problem I had though.
column57:
I think this is only a problem if
site.setup.import.addmissingtools=false

If this is true it seems to work. If it's false it doesn't seem like it can match up the missing tools. It's set to false by default.

I think we could either

  • Set the default to true and have this limitation (if you set it to false, it's not going to match up on multitools correct)
  • Fix this bug for the false case
column61:
Is this still a problem? I just checked in trunk https://trunk-oracle.nightly.sakaiproject.org and could see 'Lessons' when using 'Import from Site'. Please, see the screenshot attached.

I created two sites with lessons and tried to import from one to another.
column65: Jose Mariano Lujan It looks like this was mostly incorporated by SAK-29849 Resolved , although the id's were hardcoded there rather than detected. I guess that's okay for now, but could lead to more bugs and confusion for someone in the future.

column1: [SAK-38164] Stack trace on lessons page creation after ContentProducer (search)

column1: [SAK-29279] Infinite request of credentials when setting up WebDAV in Windows
column6:
Doing the steps for setting up WebDAV in Windows XP:

  • If you put the WebDAV URL, for example: http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu/dav/example, you will get infinitely prompting for username and password.
  • But, if you add a slash '/' at the end of URL: http://qa01-sakai.marist.edu/dav/example/, you can connect sucessfully, entering user/pass once.

Doing the steps for setting up WebDAV in Windows 7 and Windows 8:

  • You will get an error after you get three times prompted for username and password.

column6:
See the downloads page for binary and source distributions: http://poi.apache.org/download.html

Release Notes

Changes
------------
The most notable changes in this release are:

Basic text extractor for very old Excel formats such as Excel 4 (Biff4), and
older Excel 5 and 95 formats
XML Signature support for XSSF, XWPF and XSLF (56836)
HSSF and XSSF support for getting existing Data Validations for a Sheet
HSSF and XSSF formula support for the PROPER function (57010)
XSLF support for adding slide notes (55164)
XMLBeans performance improved when using getXXXList() methods (56854)
Recommended Apache XMLBeans version increased to 2.6.0 (any version from
2.3.0 or later will work though)
XSSF support for evaluating formula references to other Workbooks (56737)
HSSF and XSSF support for evaluating formulas with multi-sheet references,
for functions that support that (55906)
HSSF and XSSF Workbooks are now CLoseable, so you can call close() to
explicitly free the file based resources when you're done (56537)
NPOIFS now fully supports writing, including streaming write, and in-place
updating of existing entries. NPOIFSFileSystem now surpasses the old
POIFSFileSystem in all cases.
XSSF Text Extraction support for Headers, Footers and Comments (56022, 56023)
SXSSF Shared Strings optional support (53130)
XWPF Change Tracking support (56075)
HWPF password hash function (56077)
XWPF document protection with password support (56076)
SXSSF support for a system-wide setting of where Temp files get created, via
TempFile / TempFileCreationStrategy (56735)

column1: [SAK-29271] Suggestion / Feedback tool
column6:
A new sakai tool / app to facilitate supplying feedback

This tool should appear on every site just before the help link. It should replace the "Contact Us" at the foot of every page, we could probably call the LHS page menu link 'Contact us'??

When clicked, the user is faced with four links

1/ report problem with content

2/ Ask for help

3/ Report a technical problem

4/ suggest an improvement

Clicking on the first link allows the user to send an email to the 'Site Contact' or somebody with "maintain" rights

Clicking on the 2nd and 3rd sends an email to the helpdesk

Clicking on the 4th link takes one to a webpage where a suggestion can be made (or initiates a 'feature request' email).

All emails should include as much info as possible about the user / site and so on.

Test edit - please ignore..

it would be good to have a conversation about fitting it up to be on every site on new downloads of Sakai. We could also provide conversion scripts so people could back fill their local installations.

column1: [SAK-29267] Add ability to disable profile2 search and connections
column6:
Many of the features of profile2 can be disabled but it doesn't look like search is one of them. (https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/PROFILE/Profile2-Settings) We'd like search to be disabled via property. This would also need to remove the "Search for connections" link and possibly even the connections button (or at least the functionality in the connections)

Currently there exists a property to disable messages.
profile2.messaging.enabled=true

This will add the properties
profile2.connections.enabled = true/false
profile2.search.enabled= true/false

All would be true by default

column1: [SAK-39238] Site info or Roster not showing any site participant after site creation (using demo rosters)
column6:
It seems like a regression to us, it is important for testing purposes.

When creating a new site using the demo sections (Spring...), no one is listed in site info or roster, only the site creator. I waited for 20 minutes without any change so I had to log in as an admin and manually go to 'Memory' and 'Reset all caches'.

After that I got the full list of participants in both tools.

Steps to reproduce:

1- login to a nightly server using demo accounts (instructor, ta, student)
2- create a site (maybe using demo rosters)
3- log in with different users to reproduce the jira you are testing
4- Right now, at this point, only the site creator will be enrolled in the site.

So, lets say you are testing a Samigo ticket: instructor creates the site, then creates an exam, then you try to log in with one student but it is not in the site yet. Same happens with assignments. Also, if you are testing something with roster or site info, no one is in the site until some time has passed

We have waited until SAK-29153 Resolved has been resolved because in one of the mailing list it was mentioned that both problems could be related.
column10: Site info or Roster not showing any site participant after site creation (using demo rosters)
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
So in short the refreshing of realms did not adjust the realmRoleGRCache if a realm actually had changes in it.

Add a little logic to determine if there were changes as a result of refreshing the realm and then invalidate the realmRoleGRCache accordingly.

column1: [SAK-37701] Site import / customized css file could not be found
column6:
The error "The customized CSS file could not be found" is presented when a site is using a custom CSS and that Lesson is imported to a new site without bringing over the original css/resources.

Can the default css be applied and this error message not be shown if there is no custom css available?

Steps to replicate:

1) Create SiteA and add Lessons and Resources
2) Add custom CSS to Lessons in SiteA
3) Create SiteB and add Lessons but not Resources
4) Go to SiteB -> Site Info and import from Site -> Lessons
column10: Site import / customized css file could not be found
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41:
I'd expect this to come up if you didn't select Resources during the import but it appears like it's coming up even if you select resources. The CSS looks correct based on ( SAK-37551 Resolved ). So what I'm planning on doing

  • Figure out why it can't find it even when it should be finding it (when you select resources as part of the import)
  • If it really can't find it, update the error message once (maybe indicate that it's fixing it) and remove the CSS
column45: It might be coming up also if someone removes this from the resources, or if the resources are removed. There's no way to remove this css without going in the database and removing it or applying another css.
column49: I just submitted a PR that removes this warning to the end user. I don't think it's really even that useful. I'm not sure of the best way to handle it really.
column53: Verified that importing just Lessons on trunk experimental that the error message does not occur when loading Lessons in the new site.

column1: [SAK-29262] Forums NPE in method isDisplayTopicDeleteOption()
column6:
We have discovered that the method isDisplayTopicDeleteOption() in class DiscussionForumTool can generate a NullPointerException, which is easily reproduced by clicking multiple times on the "General Discussion" default forum.

It appears that the issue is related to the "selectedTopic" object becoming null during execution of the method, likely due to the shared nature of session scoped beans. I'll submit a PR which uses the selectedTopic immediately after its null check to minimize the chances of it being null at the time of use.
column10: Forums NPE in method isDisplayTopicDeleteOption()
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Press save-Answers are still available
Press save again - Answers are erased as well as rationale

column1: [SAK-29261] 'Upload new version' action is being displayed to users without 'content.revise.any' permission
column6:
When an user doesn't have the permission 'content.revise.any' granted, the action 'Upload new version' is not rendered over the files from a different user. This is the expected behavior.

But, if he is the owner of the parent folder we are experimenting a wrong behavior. In those cases, the action 'Upload new version' is being rendered (on files from a different owner), and when the user tries to upload a new version the content isn't modified (because he has no permissions for doing it, which is ok), but no error message is being displayed, so the user can think that the content was replaced.

I think that the action shouldn't be rendered in that use case.

The view where the user is located seems to affect.
Also, the actions 'Edit Content' and 'Edit Details' should have the behavior as 'Upload new version' action does.

I took some screenshots.
column10: 'Upload new version' action is being displayed to users without 'content.revise.any' permission
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I think that inheritedPermissions should not be evaluated in cases of Revise or Delete at least (in getPermissions method), it should depend on the file owner.

content/content-tool/tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/content/tool/ResourcesAction.java
protected static Collection<ContentPermissions> getPermissions(String id, Collection<ContentPermissions> inheritedPermissions)

column1: [SAK-39019] ServerConfigurationService.getConfig(String, T) doesn't work for arrays.
column6:
The ServerConfigurationService allows a developer to request a configuration parameter and also supply default values. For arrays if the value isn't defined the default is not returned. So if I call:

serverConfigurationService.getConfig("doesNotExist", new String[]

{"1", "2"}

);

I get back null instead of my array.

column1: [SAK-29260] Assignments / decimal point moved on scoring
column6:
The assigned score for a student can be changed incorrectly in the Assignments tool. The decimal point is moved one place showing a higher score that what was assigned to the student.

How to reproduce:

Create assignment worth 15 points
Grade student response and give a grade of 11
Save and dont release
Choose the grade screen again for the student
Select the Add button at the top of screen to exit the grading screen
The grade is updated to 110.
If the instructor saves twice, the incorrect grade will be saved for the student.

column137:
Molly Kelsey it seems that you're testing this feature in a course site rather than a project site. By default, course sites are not allowed to switch between 'public' and non-public, which is why you see the banner with no options below it. From sakai.properties:

  1. The following properties allow you to override the settings in sakai.siteinfo.xml and sakai.s\
    itesetup.xml
  2. By default, only project sites are allowed to be changed from private to public. Provide comm\
    a separated
  3. site types to override any of the settings.
  4. NOTE: site.types.privateOnly and its corresponding property in the XML files (privateSiteType\
    s) do not
  5. work; see SAK-28173 Resolved
    #site.types.publicChangeable=
    #site.types.publicOnly=
    #site.types.privateOnly=
    #site.types.defaultType=

I have tested this feature both locally and on the nightlies, and it's working as expected. You should not get these options in a course site, but you will get them for a project site (before and after the project site is created).

Please try testing this again on a project site. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-29258] Sitestats update manager write errors to stdout/stderr
column6: The sitestats update manager writes errors to stdout/stderr instead of using the logging framework, this means log messages can be difficult to fine in some setups. If should use the loggin framework instead.
column10: Sitestats update manager write errors to stdout/stderr
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29257] Allow SitestatsUpdateManager to be monitored over JMX.
column6: Currently the Sitestats service has an update manager that collects events and then updates it's tables based on the data in the events. These updates can cause performance problems if they start taking too long to run. The update manager collects data about how much time it is spending doing the updates and exposing this data over JMX allows easier monitoring.
column10: Allow SitestatsUpdateManager to be monitored over JMX.
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
The JMX bean name is:

org.sakaiproject.sitestats.api:name=StatsUpdateManager

and it will export the interface:

org.sakaiproject.sitestats.api.StatsUpdateManagerMXBean
column45: I don't see this JMX bean available in Sakai 11

column1: [SAK-38043] pages from resources (referenced via Content Links) are not "top and tailed" with CSS refs etc

column1: [SAK-35726] getBasicInfoOfLastOrHighestOrAverageSubmittedAssessmentsByScoringOption should use the agentId passed instead of looking up the current user
column6: Discovered using a webservice that retrieved all scores for a user in a site. The assessment I wanted a score for was group-released. It turns out the method getBasicInfoOfLastOrHighestOrAverageSubmittedAssessmentsByScoringOption was calling getSiteGroupIdsForCurrentUser(siteId) which would then lookup the current user (e.g., the webservices user) instead of using the agentId passed in the method parameters.
column10: getBasicInfoOfLastOrHighestOrAverageSubmittedAssessmentsByScoringOption should use the agentId passed instead of looking up the current user

column1: [SAK-38565] Allow for single space character in URL's
column6:
Generally URL's are encoded in url's as a + or %20 and generally a space isn't safe in a URL because it can be hard to tell one space apart from multiple but it does seem to be technically allowed. So I think the regex for URL's should be changed to allow a single space. Included a new unit test.

http://stackoverflow.com/a/497972/3708872
column10: Allow for single space character in URL's
column19: Indicates QA is complete and an issue has been tested and verified (Migrated on 12 Oct 2021 03:05 UTC)
column41: For whatever it's worth, Sakai currently allows space characters in absolute URLs, but not in relative URLS. This would make it consistently allow space characters in both.

column1: [SAK-29251] Default for Turnitin assignment 'save' option should not be set
column6:
WL-2704
When creating a new assignment with TII feature , the default is 'None' for the repository in which to submit/store the student's paper. Remove any default so that the assignment creator is forced to make a conscious selection. Pop up a reminder box if they have not done so.

Test Plan

1. Add new Assignment.
2. Select Turnitin option.
3. Check that there is no pre-selected default for 'Submit papers to the following repository'.
4. Try to proceed without making a selection.
5. Check that pop-up reminder appears to force you to make a selection at this point.
6. Make a selection and proceed with the rest of the assignment creation.

This is configured by turnitin.repository.setting.value. I've made my fix so that this server config will override the fix. As such we should make sure it is not set.
https://github.com/ox-it/wl-assignment/pull/3
column10: Default for Turnitin assignment 'save' option should not be set
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41:
This commit broke the VeriCite content review implementation since it requires VeriCite to have " Alert: Please specify a Turnitin repository to submit papers to."

Please install VeriCite impl and test all modifications to ensure that you do not break other services. If you need a tmp key, let me know. You can do most testing without actually submitting to the service (in this case, you don't need a key).
column45: This change should be predicated on whether Turnitin is being used (as opposed to Vericaite). is there a flag or some other property that says whether TII is being used?
column49: The UI code (vm) for displaying the TII specific options uses "getServiceName" from the ContentReviewServiceImpl class. You'd have to test "turnitin".equalsIgnoreCase(service.getServiceName());

column1: [SAK-29250] Strengthen wording of Turnitin alert
column6:
When this alert appears on saving an assignment, site owners tend to ignore it. Only later they contact us when TII reports fail to be generated:
"Alert: The assignment was saved, but Turnitin information was unable to be updated. Please try saving again."
Strengthen the wording so that they do something about it.

"Error: The assignment was saved, but Turnitin has identified a problem and the Originality Reports may not be returned. The problem may be due to the following:
1. Clash of assignment titles: If you have duplicated an assignment or used a similar title to one that exists in the Turnitin database, then rather create a brand new assignment with a new title.
2. Unauthorised site members: If anyone in the site has status 'Expired', or is an external user without having set their first name, surname, email address, either remove them, or ask them to set their personal details in My Dashboard > Account."
If this does not solve the problem, please contact weblearn@it.ox.ac.uk, giving the site URL and title of the assignment you are trying to create."

Fixed in https://github.com/ox-it/wl-assignment/pull/13
column10: Strengthen wording of Turnitin alert
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: This error is specific for Turnitin but the error can happen for any content review service implementation
column45:
So, what i think should be done here is that the error message should be customised for whichever content review service is being used.

If Turnitin then
display our error as above
else if vericite
display vericite error message as defined by Bryan
endif
column49:
This isn't an error/issue for VeriCite. VeriCite only needs two options: 1) Use VeriCite 2) Allow Students to View Report. The other options are not even displayed unless its a TII integration. So you'd just have:

If Turnitin then
display our error as above
endif

column1: [SAK-29249] Sakai 11 Early Warning QA
column6:
If you think you've found a bug, please search to see if it already exists (if you are not familiar with Jira, you can use Google [1]). Learning to use Jira can come in handy though [2].

If this is a new issue, open it as a bug in the appropriate project. Most issues will be opened in the Sakai project. Tools that have their own Jira project include:
Lessons - LSNBLDR project
Samigo Test and quizzes - SAM project

Please then link to your issue from this issue as "Relates to".

If you have any questions, please either write the sakai-dev list or email neal.caidin@apereo.org

[1] 3 minute video showing how to search bugs already reported using Google - http://www.screencast.com/t/Na2DjAnqAl

[2] Longer video explaining how the Sakai community uses Jira - - https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/PED/Sakai+Jira+Training+10-9-13
