column1: [SAK-37537] Back and Next buttons have a different look to other buttons
column6:
The Back and Next buttons on sub-pages look different from the standard Morpheus (non-green, non-red) buttons in that the text looks emboldened.

See screenshots
column10: Back and Next buttons have a different look to other buttons
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: Screenshot: Lessons back and next buttons are in bold
column45: Screenshot: announcements buttons look like all other morpheus buttons that aren't rendered in green or red. This is how the lessons buttons should also look.
column49:
For many item types, the back and next are in the title bar. Note that anything that has to be displayed in an iframe is that way. E.g. look at what happens with an assignment or quiz. The difficulty is the Morpheus generates the help and direct buttons. The way they're added, I can't make sure any buttons that I do will match and line up with them perfectly. Better just to put them in the top bar. I think it's going to be best to do the same thing with the top buttons for subpages as well (which is what you've shown).

The bottom buttons were intentionally different to separate them from the page content, which tends to have buttons in it as well. But with the default page content now having borders around the columns, I don't think that's needed any more, so I can change them to be standard.

I'm actually not that enthusiastic about buttons at the bottom at all, but several people felt strongly. I can't do them for pages that need an iframe without getting involved in complex issues with sizing the iframe.

column1: [SAK-29248] Add API method to allow retrieving a sorted list of gradebook assignments
column6:
The gradebook UI has the ability to sort the assignment list based on several comparators (name,date,points,order etc). However this is not exposed as an API method in the GradebookService so other applications cannot sort by those criteria.

In addition, the sorting is based on the persisted Assignment bean. The GradebookService impl actually retrieves this internal bean, then converts it to the shared bean for passing back, which lacks some of these fields.

This feature adds an API method to allow retrieving of the assignment list with a sort order type passed in.
column10: Add API method to allow retrieving a sorted list of gradebook assignments

column1: [SAK-29247] Gradebook API accessing by id fails when assignment name is duplicated
column6:
When you have more than one assignment with the same name in the same gradebook (distinct category), the method getAssignmentScoreString accessing by gbItemId get this error: org.springframework.dao.IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException: query did not return a unique result: 2; nested exception is org.hibernate.NonUniqueResultException: query did not return a unique result: 2

Looking in depth the impl code of edu-services (GradebookServiceHibernatImpl.java) this method get the name of the assignment and finally it returns a call to the method getAssignmentScoreString accessing by assignmentName.

At the University of Murcia we have detected this error using the GradebookService Api from a third party tool, we don't think that there are any issues in Gradebook itself. Now, we are solving this issue temporally by asking our instructors to rename the assignment.
column10: Gradebook API accessing by id fails when assignment name is duplicated

column41:
How did you get multiple gradebook items in the gradebook with the same name? There is a check for this in the impl:

if (assignmentNameExists(session, asn.getName(), asn.getGradebook()))
                {
                    throw new ConflictingAssignmentNameException("You cannot save multiple assignments in a gradebook with the same name");
                }

column1: [SAK-35444] Code bug results in a grading failure on calculated questions
column6:
There is a code bug in the boolean method: "isCalcQuestion(List tempItemGradinglist, HashMap publishedItemHash)" from the GradingService.java class. That method should return true when the list "tempItemGradinglist" (student's answer list) has any calculated question.

That method has a code bug because it only checks the first element from the list "tempItemGradinglist". Please see the attached image "Code bug.png".

That issue results in a grading failure. Please see the attached image "grading failure.png".

column41:
Hi Raul,

Your pull request looks good. Can you list steps to replicate this issue?
column45:
Hi Sam

You can reproduce that issue following these steps:

1. Publish an assessment with that type of questions: 9 multiple choice questions and 1 calculated question. The calculated one should have 2 or more formulas like that question text:

"Answer these formulas:

{

{x}

} =

{a}

+

{b}

{

{y}

} =

{c}

+

{d}

"

2. The student correctly answers the calculated question.
3. The student answers the rest of the questions and submits the assessment.
4. The second formula is wrong graded:
The "x" formula is successfully graded. However the "y" formula is wrong graded.

column1: [SAK-29245] Possibility of stack trace in logs and user action not taking place in Assignments -> Grade Submission -> Unsaved changes + submission navigation buttons
column6:
We have seen that it is possible for an assignment to get into a state where the property which defines gradebook integration gets set to an empty string rather than the three available values ('no', 'add', 'associate').

This becomes a problem when the integrateGradebook() method is run inside AssignmentAction.java in the situation where an instructor/maintainer is grading submissions for an assignment that is not set to send grades to the gradebook:

1) the instructor navigates to the assignment submission they wish to grade
2) they provide a grade and/or some comments, etc
3) they click any of the submission navigation buttons ('Return to List', 'Next' or 'Previous')
4) the changes are saved and the page is refreshed rather than saving and taking the desired action of the button clicked in the previous step
5) the attached stack trace will come up in catalina.out

The problem with the integrateGradebook() method, is that it checks that the assignment property is != to 'no'. However, when comparing against an empty string, this check returns false and the gradebook integration code is run when it shouldn't, thus producing the attached stack trace.

The attached PR takes the approach of changing the algorithm in integrateGradebook() to check that the property == either 'add' or 'associate', rather than checking that it is != 'no'.

In this way, the algorithm will correctly determine that the gradebook integration code should not be run if the property is either an empty string or 'no'. We chose not to identify when/where the property is being set to an empty string rather than 'no' simply because that approach would not rectify the situation for assignments that already have an empty string in the database for this property.
column10: Possibility of stack trace in logs and user action not taking place in Assignments -> Grade Submission -> Unsaved changes + submission navigation buttons
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Does this have a test plan? Thanks.
column45: Yes, it's in the description. I've copied it to the test plan section as well.

I could not reproduce the problem on nightly 10.x for mysql.

I followed all the steps, but when I clicked Next or Return to List as instructor grading (and not connected to gradebook) it worked fine for me. Saved and did the action.

That is likely because we're not sure how to actually get the assignment into the (in)correct state where the property is an empty string:

"We have seen that it is possible for an assignment to get into a state where the property which defines gradebook integration gets set to an empty string rather than the three available values ('no', 'add', 'associate')."

That being said, we have seen this in production, which is why we addressed the problem.

column61: Seems reasonable, thanks Neal.

column1: [SAK-29244] Allow bulk setting of email preferences from site info
column6: Allow bulk setting of email preferences from site info. It would be useful to be able to turn off email notifications for all users in a site, with a couple of clicks. If you have an active site with a large membership, the members will potentially end up receiving many notifications. This can result, as it has with me recently, in an admin being tasked with going through all the members and setting their preferences one by one.
column10: Allow bulk setting of email preferences from site info
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: I think this should be some kind of a service that overrides preferences. So, if a site admin has specified that no tool in his/her site should send any kind of notification, that should be honoured even if a user tries to override it in prefs.
column45: To do this right, there needs to be a centralized email control page that controls notifications for all of the tools in the site. All tools would need to handle email notifications in a standardized way too.
column49: There is, sort of. Notifications in Preferences would fulfil that role if all of the tools in a site allowed site by site configuration. In other words, you'd have to add code to a lot of tools to bring them up to spec. I was thinking of taking the less onerous route of setting up a service which just filters notification events against a list of silent sites, dropping them as appropriate. Even then you'd potentially get some tools avoiding the notification service all together and just using the email service directly, so emails from them would still get through, but it would be a start. Really, all tool emails should come through the notification servic e and all tools should allow site by site config in Preferences, but that's perhaps a longer term goal.
column53:
Can you please clarify the use case?

My original interpretation was the site maintainer deciding per site whether to allow that site to send notifications (e.g. choosing to not allow any notifications from a particular site). If that is the intention of this ticket's task, then it should be a site control rather than a user preference control. Therefore, the users' Preferences would not be an ideal place to put these controls. The controls should be managed from within the affected site.
column57:
The use case is exactly as you describe. There would also need to be a way of blocking the preferences tool from overriding the site pref. This is only a problem if tools in a site implement the site by site preference functionality. So, there would have to be some kind of registry that the user preferences tool checks when rendering the UI.

So:

1. Site maintainer gets loads of complaints about emails from a site. The site has a lot of members and they are a bit narky, so you know that asking them to set their preferences properly will fall on deaf ears.
2. Rather than trawl through all the members of the site and manually modify their user preferences, the maintainer just clicks a button in site info 'Don't allow notifications from this site'
3. A user clicks on Preferences -> Notifications and the site override section for a tool is removed for the silent site.
column61: Adrian Fish, has this feature been added yet?

column1: [SAK-36996] AuthzPermissions should not be localized
column6:
For some odd reason, the realm permission strings in T&Q (e.g. "assessment.editAssessment.any") are localized in org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.bundle.AuthzPermissions and referenced in

samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/bean/authz/AuthorizationBean.java
samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/servlet/delivery/ShowMediaServlet.java
samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/servlet/cp/DownloadCPServlet.java

These have fortunately not actually been translated otherwise things would probably break if you used T&Q with a different language to the server default:

find . -name AuthzPermissions*properties

./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_it.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_mn.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_zh_TW.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_fr_FR.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_de.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_en_GB.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_pt_BR.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_es.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_sv.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions_ko.properties
./samigo-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/AuthzPermissions.properties

These bundles should all be removed in favour of defining the permission strings as constants like other tools do, and the calling code simplified.

column87:
Create a question pool with 3 questions

Delete question 2 from the question pool
Edit the published assessment and update the questions so it should pull from the changed question pool.
Save
As a student, take the assessment. Within a few attempts, the deleted question will be delivered to the student.

column1: [SAK-34889] SamLite: randomize answers in multiple choice questions
column6:
Adding the possibility of randomized answers in multiple choice questions through keyword #randomize at the end.
For instance:

1. (10 points) (2.5 discount)
Who was the first president of the United States?
*a. Washington
b. Jefferson
c. Lincoln
d. Clinton
#randomize

This will create a question with randomized answers.
If no keyword is written, the question won't have randomized answers.

column1: [SAK-37847] Lessons tool- unable to provide mark to comments made by a student
column6:
• Add the Lessons & Gradebook tool if not added in the site
  • Go to the Lessons tool >Add content>Add Student Content
  • Once the item is added, click on 'Edit' next to the item. A pop-up window opens
  • tick the check box " Add a comments section to each page" and "Grade these comments", provide maxium point: e.g. 10.
  • Log into the site again as a access user, e.g. Student A > create a page
  • Log into the site as another access user e.g. Student B and comment on the page created by Student A
  • Log into the site as a maintainer> Go to Lessons page where you can find the student pages > click on "Show Grading Pane for Comments on Student Content.
  • On the next page, you are able to input points for a student who made comment ___/10.
  • Type in the point, e.g. 8, and click on "Update Points" button. A spinner appears and is hanging there for more than 5 minutes.

column1: [SAK-29236] Peer assessment assignments average score misses the last record sometimes
column6:
When a student is grading another student submission in a peer assessment assignment the score is recorded in the db but the calculated score average is missing the last commited result.

That case just happens one of 100 tries, so it's hard to try to reproduce and maybe you'll be not able to do but I tell what we seen.

We prepared an instance with tons of debug lines and we saw that in some cases when the process calls the method updateScore from AssignmentPeerAssessmentServiceImpl in list of rows returned to calculate the average score, the last stored record is missing. It must be there because previously it has been recorded by the savePeerAssessmentItem, and if you look at the db the record is there.

What it's happening here is that process saves and retrieves rows in the same thread process and in some cases it has no time to store it to the db before the list is gotten.
column10: Peer assessment assignments average score misses the last record sometimes
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-29235] CKEditor plugin dialog position moves upon resize
column6:
When attempting to resize a CKEditor (v4.4.5) plugin dialog, the dialog jumps position away from its original central position (http://note.io/1ID2J5R).

This issue seems to have been introduced in 10.1 where we move the dialog so it displays at the same offset as the editor. I noticed that the resize began playing nice after a drag and drop, which led me to the patch forcing this initial move to "save" the dialog's position:

--- reference/library/src/webapp/editor/ckeditor.launch.js	(revision 318134)
+++ reference/library/src/webapp/editor/ckeditor.launch.js	(working copy)
@@ -216,7 +216,7 @@
           var onShow = dialogDefinition.onShow;
           dialogDefinition.onShow = function() {
               var pos = findPos(e.editor.container.$);
-              this.move(this.getPosition().x, pos[1]);
+              this.move(this.getPosition().x, pos[1], true);
               if (typeof onShow !== 'undefined' && typeof onShow.call === 'function') {
                   var result = onShow.call(this);
                   return result;

This seems to fix the issue in 10.4/10.x, but I didn't have the same luck in 11.x as the offsets are a little skewed now iframes are no longer present.
column10: CKEditor plugin dialog position moves upon resize
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
I tested this (resizing a plugin dialog) and could not reproduce any issues with it. Do you have more steps to this? Can you still reproduce this on 12 and master?

Closing for now as "Cannot Reproduce"

column1: [SAK-29234] Consolidate roster authorization properties and allow for authorization email
column6:
SAK-29000 Resolved added a new property for roster authorizations ( site.addroster.authorizationrequired) but there was already one that existed for that process (wsetup.requireAuthorizer)

I believe these both serve the same purpose.

So I'm going to remove one of them and fix this.

However there is stil some locall desire to have email sent to the authorizer when creating a new site even if the authorization is not needed.

So here's what this will do

  • Change site.addroster.authorizationrequired to use wsetup.requireAuthorizer
  • Add property wsetup.emailAuthorizer which will email the authorizer. (Default true). If wsetup.requireAuthorizer is true this is also forced to be true.
column10: Consolidate roster authorization properties and allow for authorization email
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-37256] List of pools to be deleted has some styling/formatting issues
column6:
When you delete question pools, you are taken to a confirmation page with a warning and a list of the pools you selected to delete.

There is a heading of 'Pool Names' followed by a list of pools marked for deletion. The problem is that the header is the same font size and weight as the text of the pool names. This looks bad and can confuse the user. Also, there is un-necessary use of tables to create the HTML layout.

The linked PR re-structures the page using divs and an unordered list rather than tables, and provides distinction between the headers and the list of pool names to be deleted.
column10: List of pools to be deleted has some styling/formatting issues
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29233] Missing message bundle key in Announcements
column6:
Unnecessary log bloat:

015-04-06 14:40:43,689 WARN http-bio-8080-exec-5 org.sakaiproject.util.ResourceLoader - bundle 'announcement' missing key: 'gen.draft' from: sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor456.invoke(Unknown Source)

Even though this is only referenced once and from within an HTML comment, the Velocity engine will still try to resolve 'gen.draft' because it's not a Velocity comment, and thus has to be output in the resulting HTML.
column10: Missing message bundle key in Announcements
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-29232] Site creation - users can select templates of a site type which they can't create
column6:
Users who don't have permission to create sites of one or more types can still see and select templates of those types during site creation. When they attempt to create a site using the template, they get this error message in the UI:
Alert: You do not have permission to add the site c2b0517e-ce5c-4152-a5dc-e3fd44fff0f6.

And this stacktrace is thrown in sakai.log:
2015-04-06 13:47:24,450 WARN ajp-bio-8009-exec-7 org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction - org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction@3820779e.addNewSite: You do not have permission to add the site c2b0517e-ce5c-4152-a5dc-e3fd44fff0f6.
org.sakaiproject.exception.PermissionException: user=67977bab-0b44-47c6-a551-fdb4525fb390 lock=site.add.course resource=/site/c2b0517e-ce5c-4152-a5dc-e3fd44fff0f6 id: /site/c2b0517e-ce5c-4152-a5dc-e3fd44fff0f6
at org.sakaiproject.site.impl.BaseSiteService.unlock(BaseSiteService.java:190)
at org.sakaiproject.site.impl.BaseSiteService.addSite(BaseSiteService.java:1278)
at org.sakaiproject.site.cover.SiteService.addSite(SiteService.java:264)
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.addNewSite(SiteAction.java:11489)
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.doFinish(SiteAction.java:6339)
at org.sakaiproject.site.tool.SiteAction.doManual_add_course(SiteAction.java:5373)

To reproduce:

  • Set up a user type which to not have permissions to create all types of sites (i.e. grant the .auth role in the !user.template.guest site.add.project, but not site.add.course).
  • Create a site template for both project and course site types.
  • Log in as a user of the type described above.
  • Go to Worksite Setup, then New.
  • Check the radio button next to 'Create site from template'.
  • Select the site type that you shouldn't be able to create, and select a template of that type.
  • Attempt to complete course site creation using that template.

This issue will be resolved when users only see templates for sites of a type which they're allowed to create.
column10: Site creation - users can select templates of a site type which they can't create
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-39063] Upgrade spring-core from 3.2.3.RELEASE to 3.2.13.RELEASE
column6:
Changes in version 3.2.13 (2014-12-30)

fixed Java 8 bridge method handling can lead to false positive detection of autowired annotations (SPR-12187)

fixed use of the same configuration annotation of javaconfig (SPR-12442)
fixed NPE in org.springframework.core.MethodParameter.getParameterName (SPR-12453)

fixed problem with static methods conflicting with instance methods (SPR-12502)
fixed prototype with changing bean class does not get populated with dependencies after type switch (SPR-12526)
fixed hashCode method of AbstractFallbackTransactionAttributeSource.DefaultCacheKey doesn't take targetClass into account (SPR-12536)
fixed AbstractApplicationEventMulticaster "lost" application listener (SPR-12545)
fixed duplicated interceptors in HandlerExecutionChain after intermediate getInterceptors() call (SPR-12566)
update consistent bridge method handling in annotation post-processors (SPR-12495)
improved misleading documentation for SqlRowSet (SPR-12476)
improved documentation after SPR-3542 (SPR-12570)

Changes in version 3.2.12 (2014-11-11)
-------------------------------------

fixed directory traversal with static resource handling (CVE-2014-3625) (SPR-12354)
log context cache statistics in the TestContext framework (SPR-12409)
fixed ConfigurationClassUtils fails to introspect inner classes with dot name syntax (SPR-12390)
fixed ResponseStatusExceptionResolver does not get a MessageSource injected in the MVC Java config (SPR-12380)
fixed NPE inTilesConfigurer when no definitions found (SPR-12363)
fixed @Import in another annotation results in double scan (SPR-12334)
fixed private @Scheduled methods end up on 'empty' proxy instance in case of CGLIB auto-proxying (SPR-12308)
fixed Provider<...> declaration for @Value method argument fails with TypeMismatchException (SPR-12297)
fixed DataSourceTransactionManager closes JDBC connection on doBegin failure but leaves it attached to transaction object (SPR-12280)
fixed web Async responses force concurrentResult.toString() call (SPR-12253)
fixed LiveBeansView.generateJson generates invalid JSON when resources already double-quoted (SPR-12252)
allow for further locking optimizations for the retrieval of non-singleton beans (SPR-12250)
improved error messages for MockRestServiceServer (SPR-12230)
allow spring HTTP clients to enforce RFC 6265 (cookies in a single header) (SPR-12196)
fixed @Qualifier resolution with Spring Batch parent/child context arrangement (SPR-12191)
improved Scheduled/JmsListenerAnnotationBeanPostProcessor to not scan every scoped instance (SPR-12189)
fixed HttpHeaders should accept empty Content-Type header (SPR-12173)
add log warning for single optional constructor when no default constructor to fall back to (SPR-12161)
fixed util:map does not recognize the attribute of value-type (SPR-10994)
removed outdated ContextLoaderServlet from the documentation reference (SPR-7725)

Changes in version 3.2.11 (2014-09-04)
-------------------------------------

fixed cachingConnectionFactory should catch exceptions on logical close (SPR-12148)
allow Cache.get(Object key, Class<T> type) to be more explicit about what to do in case of a type mismatch (SPR-12145)
fixed plain FactoryBean declaration on @Bean method leads to early call (pre injection) (SPR-12141)
fixed performance issue on ResolvableType cache (SPR-12122)
fixed GuavaCacheManager ignores cache specification due to eager initialization of internal cache map with static cache names (SPR-12120)
fixed mockMvc security filters causes FileUploadException: the request was rejected because no multipart boundary was found (SPR-12114)
fixed ServerEndpointExporter causes application context refresh to fail with an NPE when used in a Spring Boot app (SPR-12109)
update Apache HttpComponents to 4.3.5 - CVE-2014-3577: Apache HttpComponents client: Hostname verification susceptible to MITM attack (SPR-12100)
fixed shallowEtagHeaderFilter doesn't support Servlet 3.1 setContentLengthLong (SPR-12097)
exclude spring-framework-bom artifacts from release distributions (SPR-12087)
include all source artifacts in published sources jars (SPR-12085)
fixed BeanNameViewResolver should not try to use non-View beans (SPR-12079)
updated tiles 3 TilesViewResolver to accept custom TilesView subclasses (SPR-12075)
fixed includeFilters and excludeFilters of @ComponentScan cause failures when used in meta-annotations (SPR-12065)
allow AbstractTypeHierarchyTraversingFilter to be more lenient when loading types (SPR-12042)
fixed incorrect documentation for AbstractAnnotationConfigDispatcherServletInitializer.getServletConfigClasses() (SPR-12028)
fixed ConcurrentMapCacheManager has interdependent setters (SPR-12026)
fixed documentation typo (SPR-12020)
fixed Spring may invoke @Bean methods too early in case of a circular reference (SPR-12018)
fixed RestTemplate with InputStreamResource does not work if Content-Length is not set (SPR-12017)
fixed AbstractMessageListenerContainer#doExecuteListener can cause a dropped message if using CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE and the container is stopped and subsequently started again. (SPR-12015)
fixed exceptions thrown during AbstractApplicationContext.refresh() not being logged right when they are caught (SPR-12010)
fixed changes to AbstractApplicationEventMulticaster in 3.2.9 break HttpSessionEventPublisher in Google AppEngine Runtime (SPR-12002)
fixed NPE in SelectedValueComparator with null bound value (SPR-12001)
fixed StaxStreamXMLReader ignores significant whitespace (SPR-12000)
fixed user destinations docs are missing the brokerPrefix (SPR-11992)
revert (SPR-11973) when bugfix verified in JDK 1.8.0_20 (SPR-11974)
fixed UriComponentsBuilder.fromUriString may not parse correctly when there is no path (SPR-11970)
fixed getBean(Object.class) fails when introspecting Environment bean (SPR-10542)
fixed injecting EXTENDED @PersistenceContext into JUnit 4 test class causes NoSuchBeanDefinitionException (SPR-8834)
fixed XmlBeanDefinitionReader runs 10x slower due to resetBeanDefinition check (SPR-8318)
remove outdated IDE, JIRA and Tomcat references (SPR-7521)

Changes in version 3.2.10 (2014-07-15)
-------------------------------------

restored backward compatibility in RestTemplate's messageConverters (SPR-11962)
consistent declaration of private static final logger variables (SPR-11905)
fixed documentation links (SPR-11935)
allow HttpHeaders to return getAllow() if it was previously set to an empty collection (SPR-11917)
improved performance of ReflectionUtils.isCglibRenamedMethod (SPR-11894)

allow manually registered transaction manager to be recognized by qualifiedBeanOfType (SPR-11915)
fixed misleading exception message for using JPA with custom IsolationLevels (SPR-8325)
prevented Objects created by FactoryBeans from being processed multiple times by BeanPostProcessors if beans are created lazily (SPR-11937)

revisit class cache in CachedIntrospectionResults (SPR-11867)
fixed JBoss EAP 5.1.1 VFS compatibility (SPR-11887)
fixed various Portlet issues (SPR-11295, SPR-11816)
removed shared state from URIComponentsBuilder across calls of .build() (SPR-11885)
improved unclear error message on BeanPostProcessor returning null (SPR-11951)
fixed isGlobalRollbackOnly always returns 'false' with WebSphereUOWTransactionManager (SPR-11876)

Changes in version 3.2.9 (2014-05-20)
-------------------------------------

added basic Java 8 bytecode compatibility for Spring 3.2.x through ASM 5.0.2 (SPR-11656, SPR-11719)
fixed potential excessive memory and CPU usage (SPR-11545, SPR-11520, SPR-11606, SPR-11720, SPR-9274)
fixed cache key issues for methods with arguments of array types (SPR-11505)
fixed FlashMap retrieval when target parameters are encoded (SPR-11504)

optimized handling of @Bean method override regression with return type narrowing on JDK 8 (SPR-11718)
prevented double evaluation of method arguments in SpEL (SPR-11445)
fixed reinjection of Servlet mocks into test instance between TestNG test methods (SPR-11626)
fixed If-Modified-Since header is parsed as HTTP-date; but IE 10 sends length (SPR-11727)
fixed unsafe fallback pointcut construction in AspectJExpressionPointcut (SPR-9335)
updated UrlResource.exists() to properly detect JBoss vfszip resources (SPR-11676)
fixed potential NPE with SpringProperties, ConstructorResolver and JRubyScriptUtils (SPR-11721, SPR-11517, SPR-11747)
consider parent definitions with overriding bean definition message (SPR-9671(
improved exception message for failed property access in SpEL (SPR-11535)
fixed Spring MVC Test async result timing issue (SPR-11516)
treat empty log config refresh interval as infinite interval in Log4jWebConfigurer (SPR-11507)
improve CollectionToCollectionConverter.convert() for untyped collections (SPR-11479)
fixed XmlValidationModeDetector length of a string is always greater than index of any of its characters (SPR-11477)
improve memory consumption with MarshallingView (SPR-11646)
fixed SpEL issues when working with Maps (SPR-11609, SPR-9861)
add ResizableByteArrayOutputStream and ByteArrayOutputStream capacities (SPR-11594)
logged Forging in DispatcherServlet via requestURI (SPR-11591)
fixed BufferedImageHttpMessageConverter to no longer fail if JAI is installed (SPR-11581)
updated AbstractMarshaller to avoid SAXSource workaround when processExternalEntities=true (SPR-11737)
close Resource's input stream when using ResourceHttpRequestHandler (SPR-11644)
consider proxy interfaces in AbstractAdvisingBeanPostProcessor.isEligible(...) (SPR-11725)
protect against security exploits via system identifier in DTD declaration (SPR-11768)
fixed Access Denied exception within Spring MVC application on WebSphere 8.x (SPR-11758)
fixed servlet 3 multipart parameter binding on Weblogic12c (SPR-11074)
updated ConfigurationClassParser.invokeAwareMethods(...) to consider EnvironmentAware (SPR-11744)
fixed JDBC findColumn result in the case of duplicate column labels (SPR-11786)
improved prefix detection in StringUtils.cleanPath (SPR-11793)
fixed JMS problem with Oracle AQ when underlying DataSource is decorated (SPR-11791, SPR-10829)
support lazy resolution with StandardServletMultipartResolver (SPR-11730)
fixed StringUtils.parseLocaleString issue where locale variant cannot contain country code (SPR-11806)
detected NoClassDefFoundError within BeanInstantiationException for getTestExecutionListeners (SPR-11804)

Changes in version 3.2.8 (2014-02-18)
-------------------------------------

  • fixed potential LinkageError with aop:scoped-proxy (SPR-11398)
  • fixed various memory leaks (SPR-11440, SPR-10785)
  • added processExternalEntities support to OXM (SPR-11376)
  • fixed URL mapping issue (SPR-11101)
  • prevented unwanted side-effects from PreparedStatements (SPR-11386)
  • restore correct equals/hashCode for AbstractBeanDefinition (SPR-11420)
  • fixed various HTML form issues (SPR-10837, SPR-11426)
  • wraped runtime-registered EhCacheCacheManager caches with TransactionAwareCacheDecorator (SPR-11407)
  • fixed StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in AbstractErrors for class-level JSR-303 validator (SPR-11374)
  • fixed off-by-one regression in AbstractMethodMockingControl (SPR-11385)
  • fixed potential ClassCastException in RequestContextListener when destroying the request object (SPR-11378)
  • fixed various stream closing issues (SPR-11411, SPR-11413)
  • fixed broken documentation links (SPR-11404)
  • improved error reporting for issues related to @Controller types requiring AOP proxing (SPR-11281)
  • consider nonPublicAccessAllowed flag and SecurityManager with resolveFactoryMethodIfPossible method (SPR-11422)
  • don't lazily populate a hash field for Objects with multi-threaded access (SPR-11428)
  • fixed locale specific unit test failures (SPR-11392)
  • explicitly skip BindingResult when searching for a model object in MarshallingView (SPR-11417)
  • fixes potential malformed JSON from LiveBeansView (SPR-11366)

Changes in version 3.2.7 (2013-12-12)
-------------------------------------

  • fixed memory leaks with @Async (SPR-11275, SPR-11276)
  • restored full Java 5 compatibility (SPR-11313, SPR-11349, SPR-11321)
  • fixed various dependency compatibility issues (SPR-11359, SPR-11265, SPR-11362, SPR-11284)
  • improved performance and reduced memory consumption for some edge cases (SPR-11343, SPR-9014, SPR-11344, SPR-11304)
  • fixed WebSphere compatibility issue (SPR-11341, SPR-11297)
  • fixed ServletWebRequest.checkNotModified() methods to treat HEAD identically to GET (SPR-11317)
  • fixed various regression issues (SPR-11320, SPR-11246, SPR-11231)
  • fixed theme resolution fails with "IllegalArgumentException" issue (SPR-11128)
  • fixed @Enable registrars subclass issues (SPR-11251)
  • allowed consolidation of all configuration into the "root" context with AbstractAnnotationConfigDispatcherServletInitializer (SPR-11357)
  • provided alternative RestTemplate constructor to avoid default MessageConverter creation (SPR-11351)
  • handle NoClassDefFoundError for TestExecutionListeners consistently (SPR-11347)
  • fixed @Bean meta-annotation detection when using ASM (SPR-10488)
  • provide access to SimpleTriggerFactoryBean property startTime (SPR-10940)
  • added patch() to MockMvcRequestBuilders (SPR-11299)
  • provided a mechanism for adding ApplicationContextInitializers to DispatcherServlet's ApplicationContext (SPR-11314)
  • fixed various documentation issues (SPR-3983, SPR-11364, SPR-11331)
  • enabled ServletTestExecutionListener by default in abstract base test classes (SPR-11340)
  • fixed type comparison in ReflectionHelper.getTypeDifferenceWeight (SPR-11306)
  • improved logging and exception information (SPR-11346, SPR-11333)
  • fixed read/write method mismatch problems with BeanWrapper (SPR-11361)
  • fixed context:component-scan element in the mvc-cofig.xml (SPR-11221)
  • fixed XMLEventStreamWriter handleing for writeEmptyElement() followed by writeAttribute() (SPR-11254)
  • fixed CronTriggerFactoryBean to allow calendar name and description to be specified (SPR-9771)

Changes in version 3.2.6 (2013-12-12)
-------------------------------------

  • added Maven bill-of-materials POM
  • fixed BeanUtils.copyProperties() issue caused by recently changes to GenericTypeAwarePropertyDescriptor (SPR-11209)
  • fixed issue with ServletTestExecutionListener breaking existing code (SPR-11144)
  • fixed SpEL ReflectivePropertyAccessor to not consider "is" methods with non boolean returns (SPR-11142)
  • support multiple comma-separated values in X-Forwarded-Host header (SPR-11140)
  • fixed tests related to java.beans.BeanInfo changes in JDK8-b117 (SPR-11139)
  • added synchronization to EhCacheFactoryBean.afterPropertiesSet (SPR-11132)
  • fixed dependency injection issue when using ManagedMap or ManagedList in BeanDefinitionParser (SPR-11131)
  • fixed support for combining multiple @Cacheable within @Caching annotation (SPR-11124)
  • allow autowire qualified scoped-proxy @Bean definitions (SPR-11116)
  • fixed type resolution fails for uninitialized factory-method declaration issue (SPR-11112)
  • fixed "CglibAopProxy: Unable to proxy method" warning when bean class contains static final method (SPR-11107)
  • improved performance for repeated JDBC 3.0 getParameterType calls in StatementCreatorUtils (SPR-11100)
  • fixed minor issue with prior fix for CVE 2010-1622 (SPR-11098)
  • added mapping for additional Sybase error code to DataIntegrityViolationException (SPR-11097)

  • added synchronization to MBeanExporter & MBeanRegistrationSupport (SPR-11002)
  • removed integer conversion from JmsListenerContainerParser (SPR-10986)
  • fixed @ResourceMapping issue with Portlets (SPR-10791)

Changes in version 3.2.5 (2013-11-06)
-------------------------------------

  • fixed type prediction for generic factory method with conversion of method arguments (SPR-10411)
  • fixed GenericTypeResolver issues relating to ParameterizedType (SPR-10819)
  • allow indexed constructors to be used with @Autowire resolution (SPR-11019)
  • refined JavaConfig overrides algorithm (SPR-10988, SPR-10992)
  • fixed multiple calls to @Autowire setters when defining several beans of the same class (SPR-11027)
  • provided more lenient fallback checks for setter injection (SPR-10995)
  • allowed AnnotationConfigWebApplicationContext.register to be called multiple times (SPR-10852)
  • fixed various SpEL issues (SPR-9495, SPR-10452, SPR-10928, SPR-10884, SPR-10953, SPR-10716, SPR-10486, SPR-11031)
  • added XStream catch-all converter (SPR-10821)
  • fixed issue with AOP Advisor being silently skipped during creation (SPR-10430)
  • fixed use of configured prefix for Jackson message converters (SPR-10817)
  • fixed SimpleJdbcCall function return issues (SPR-10606)
  • protected against memory leak in AntPathMatcher (SPR-10803)
  • fixed memory leak in AbstractBeanFactory (SPR-10896)
  • fixed Ehcache RMI replication issue (SPR-10904)
  • fixed ArrayStoreException with ASM reading of enum subclass (SPR-10914)
  • prevented duplicate scan of @Import annotations (SPR-10918)
  • fixed issues using non-shareable @Resource (SPR-10931)
  • ensured malformed content type is translated to 415 status code (SPR-10982)
  • fixed issues when converting a single element array to object (SPR-10996)
  • allow override of @ContextConfiguration initializer when using @ContextHierarchy (SPR-10997)
  • fixed issue with ordering of @PropertySource values (SPR-10820)
  • fixed parsing issues with JNDI variables (SPR-11039)
  • fixed MockHttpServletRequestBuilder handling parameter without value (SPR-11043)
  • fixed ClasspathXmlApplicationContext inherit/merge of parent context environment (SPR-11068)
  • fixed wrong translation of MS SQL error code (SPR-10902)
  • fixed JMSTemplate issues when used with Oracle AQ (SPR-10829)
  • fixed AbstractMethodMockingControl off-by-one error (SPR-10885)
  • fixed potential NPE with JaxB2Marshaller (SPR-10828)
  • fixed potential NPE with RestTemplate (SPR-10848)
  • fixed potential NPE in AbstractApplicationEventMulticaster (SPR-10945)
  • fixed potential NPE with RedirectView (SPR-10937)
  • fixed NPE with ExtendedBeanInfo on IBM J9 VM (SPR-10862)
  • improved subclassing support for RequestMappingHandlerMapping (SPR-10950)
  • made AnnotationConfigUtils.processCommonDefinitionAnnotations public (SPR-11032)
  • removed unnecessary char[] allocation with NamedParameterUtils (SPR-11042)
  • refined logging output (SPR-10974, SPR-11017)
  • minor documentation updates (SPR-10798, SPR-10850, SPR-10927)

Changes in version 3.2.4 (2013-08-06)
-------------------------------------

  • fixed potential security risk when using Spring OXM with JAXB (SPR-10806)
  • support for Quartz 2.2 (SPR-10775)
  • updated spring-instrument manifest to include JDK 7 redefine/retransform attributes (SPR-10731)
  • TypeDescriptor class is marked as Serializable now (SPR-10631)
  • ConfigurationClassPostProcessor is Ordered.HIGHEST_PRECEDENCE now (SPR-10645)
  • @ImportResource supports $ {...}

    placeholders as well (SPR-10686)

  • BeanFactory's getBeansWithAnnotation ignores abstract bean definitions (SPR-10672)
  • fixed regression with non-String value attributes on custom stereotypes (SPR-10580)
  • fixed regression in nested placeholder resolution in case of ignoreUnresolvablePlaceholders (SPR-10549)
  • fixed SpEL's MethodExecutor to correctly cache overloaded methods (SPR-10684)
  • fixed ClassFilterAwareUnionMethodMatcher equals implementation (SPR-10604)
  • introduced latest CGLIB UndeclaredThrowableStrategy changes for better memory usage (SPR-10709)
  • fixed regression with AspectJ-based @Async handling in case of no executor set (SPR-10715)
  • proper parsing of JPA's "exclude-unlisted-classes" element with a nested "true"/"false" value (SPR-10767)
  • resource-based PlatformTransactionManager implementations defensively handle Errors on begin (SPR-10755)
  • re-introduced RmiInvocationWrapperRTD.xml for WebLogic which has been missing in 3.2 (SPR-10649)
  • Jaxb2Marshaller scans for @XmlRegistry annotation as well (SPR-10714)
  • XStreamMarshaller's "getXStream() method is non-final again (SPR-10421)
  • DelegatingFilterProxy avoids synchronization for pre-resolved delegate (SPR-10413)
  • fixed regression in @RequestParam empty value handling (SPR-10578)
  • fixed ResourceHttpRequestHandler's locations-list-empty warn log (SPR-10780)
  • fixed ContentNegotiatingViewResolver regression in case of no content type requested (SPR-10683)
  • fixed MappingJackson(2)JsonView's handling of a prefixJson="false" value (SPR-10752)
  • added configurable JSON prefix handling to MappingJackson(2)HttpMessageConverter (SPR-10627)
  • several UriComponentsBuilder refinements (SPR-10779, SPR-10701)

column1: [SAK-29229] Dropbox / incorrect quota view while instructor
column6:
As a student, the 'Check Quota' feature works within drop box showing the correct amount of space used.

As the instructor, the 'Check Quota' feature always shows 0KB used. I assume this is pulling the root level directory file size instead of the combined student folders size.

Edit (Tiffany Stull): The quota in Drop Box is on a per-user basis. There cannot be a "collective" or "combined student folder" quota because each folder has its own quota.

For example, if Drop Box is set institutionally to 1 GB quota, each member in a site has 1 GB available to them.

There is similarly a collective folder quota (in the example above, 1 GB) for all instructor/administrative type users at the top level (i.e. the folder that contains all the student/member folders). This is the quota that displays when the instructor/project site administrator checks quota, so if an instructor uploaded no files, it's 0 KB used.

If the text of theCheck Quotapagesays something like, "You are currently using 0% (0 KB ) of yourUnlimitedquota for the Drop Boxof this site,"no quota has been set for Drop Box at the institutional level and is therefore unlimited for all users.

It would be a New Feature to allow instructors/administrators to see each student's/member's folder quota. Something would need to be able to query the quota from each folder in the site to draw its value.

UVA's solution was to modify the text on the Drop BoxCheck Quota page so it reads as follows (Drop Box is renamed to File Drop):

This is your usage and your quota for the File Drop of the current site.
column10: Dropbox / incorrect quota view while instructor
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41:
we removed the drop box quota as we didn't believe it made sense to display it because the quota is set on each individual folder not for the drop box as a whole.

If this approach is deemed correct, let me know and I'll get either adrian f or steve s to do a pull request.
column45:
From testing, it looks like the site quota accurately reflects the content amount for each individual student's drop box.

Just to confirm--is the goal in this ticket to eliminate quota display altogether, or only for the instructor role? If the former, it seems like the quota display is still useful for students to see.

So if possible, maybe we just hide the quota button for instructor role, since the UI already displays different functionality for this role. Then, perhaps we can just change the UI text that students see, to something like "Your current dropbox quota is x KB"

Ideally, maybe the quota UI for an instructor would provide an expandable list displaying current quotas for each student dropbox, as well as the total cumulative site quota out of the possible quota.
column49: I think this behaviour is right, it's not always 0Kb. The quota is checking for the size of the root folder, for example, as instructor select one folder (student folder) and choose "Compress to ZIP Archive". The zip will be created in the root folder. Then check again the quota, you will see the remain space in the root folder for you as instructor (the only user that can write there). You can also upload files there (only for you, or other instructors), and the root folder is limited with quota so I guess you should be able to see the available space.
column53:
In our instance, we changed the message in the quota view to say, "This is your usage and your quota for the Drop Box of the current site," so that it would be clearer that it's the individual's quota.

Ideally, the instructor's/project site administrator's Drop Box should report on each member's quota separately (e.g. in a list on the Check Quota page), since each user can be using a different amount of their individual quota, and the instructor/administrator may be using some of that space in each member's box.
column57:
From 14/04/2015

Jim M

From my testing, quota displays accurately per each student's dropbox content upload. So my suggestion (if possible) is that we hide quota for the instructor role and let it still display for students, and tweak the UI text, so it indicates "your current dropbox quota" for each student.

Another suggestion--it might be a good enhancement (again, if
possible) for instructors to see a list of each student dropbox quota, as well as the cumulative total quota (against possible site quota).

Alaanizar

I totally agree with Jim. The best way is to display the quota next to each student folder.

Better yet, the color of the students folders can inficate at sight the level of the quota.
If it's less than let's say 75, the instructor will see a green folder.
More than 75%, or a certain threshold, the folder is marked yellow, and RED above 90%.

This way, the instructor will have a general overview of the status of quotas and the ability for students to store files.

More details can be obtained by clicking on a link next to each student box, or the Check Quota will show a list of students qiotas, as suggested by Jim.

Adam Marshall

I can envisage there being performance issues for a site with (say) 700+ students. Wed have to check 700 individual quotas when an instructor views the page.

I do agree that it would be very useful for students to see their own quota though. It would also be useful for Resources to display the quota on the page rather than behind a button.

I would suggest therefore:

1/ remove Quota button from top of Drop Box and Resources

2/ In Resources (always) display Currently using x% (yMB) of zGB quota. Put this beneath the buttons and either above or below Location: . Whichis best? Put the text in a <div> that is rendered in red text if over 90%. (I dont think we should colour code if > 75%.)

3/ In Drop box, for somebody with dropbox.own permission, display Currently using x% (yMB) of zGB quota. Put this beneath the buttons and either above or below Location:

4/ In drop box for somebody with dropbox.maintain do not display any quota info at all.

Having said all that, the quota button as it stands is totally useless isnt it? or is it just hat the QA10 server doesnt have a quota set for drop box?

Alaanizar

Your remarks and suggestions are relevant and interesting.

For Point 4. I would suggest that the dropbox.maintain role should see the quota, BUT only wh they click on the student' dropbox.

I agree there will be performance issues if quota is displayed next to each dropbox AT ONCE.

Jim M

Great ideas! Here's my attempt to expand/summarize the discussion and provide a potential roadmap based on a "low-hanging fruit" approach (quicked/easiest to accomplish):

1. Remove the "check quota" button entirely and display the quota text at the top of each student's dropbox page.
2. Quota text for students should say "This dropbox is currently using x% (yMB) of individual dropbox zGB quota"

This approach has several advantages:

1. Eliminate superflous click to display quota information.
2. Eliminate need to base the display of the "check quota" button on user permission.
3. Site maintainers see quota for a student when they access that student's dropbox. I'm assuming this will be the case, since site maintainers can already view the "files can only be seen by you"
message when they access student dropboxes.

I tweaked the quota text to: A) make it even more clear what the quota is for, and B) make it more universalized so it's appropriate for a site maintainer to see too.

With that same goal in mind (universalized/role-agnostic text for each student dropbox page), I suggest we also tweak the "files can only be seen by you" message so it reads:

"Files in a site participant's dropbox can only be seen by the participant and the site maintainers. Other participants cannot access them."

I can think of one potential problem: with the current "check quota"
button setup, the quota is displaying independently of any subfolders a student might create. So we would have to make sure this also applies to our new approach--i.e., the quota displayed at the top of each student dropbox UI is always for that student's root folder and not any particular subfolder being accessed.

One last comment-the idea of a color-coded warning system for an almost-full dropbox seems very useful. But I wonder if we should attempt that, given the current emphasis on accessibility-which includes avoiding warning systems based only on color.

What do you think? Hopefully this approach is relatively easy to implement and won't impact performance. The only part I worry about (and I'm not a developer so I have no idea) is if the load time might increase when a site maintainer accesses a particular student's dropbox, since the system will need to retrieve the quota information.

Adam M (me)

The proposed changes sound good.

We've had request for using colour to highlight that storage limits are being reached - this was for resources.

I think it would be good to display the quota in Resources and drop box upfront. That is, not behind a button. Its important for people to know so they can plan ahead and ask for an increase if needs be.

It's most relevant to maintainers and Students are kind of maintainers of their own drop box.
If students have been given permission to upload to resources then they'd be interested too. So perhaps it should be displayed to all users in Resources.

I would add the following to the description:

In resources, get rid of the Quota button and move the quota display to the main folder display page. It should show the quota usage possibly in parentheses after the root folder name. This could be colour coded. So long as the quota is is spelled out in text was well as being colour coded then there won't be an accessibility problem.

I've also no idea whether it is an expensive operation to check a quota. I would imagine not, I'll try to remember to ask Matthew who wrote the Quota checking code.

In drop box, remove the quota button and display the quota in exactly the same way as Resources except if the user has "drop box maintain" permission. (With this permission the quota is only of use if its attached to every folder and that's too inefficient to consider).
Having said that, it would be useful for a maintainer to be able to see the quota for an individual's drop box. Perhaps every folder in drop box should have a 'check quota' link in it's Actions. This wouldn't be needed for Resources.

Surely a drop box quota is for an individual student not per folder so it would be OK to display in the same way as resources?

I see this as a separate JIRA to the original one about removing the meaningless Quota button from drop box. I think that issue should be resolved with our patch and a new Feature Request JIRA created for the proposed improvement.

Unfortunately, I can't promise we will address this new JIRA as we have heaps of other tasks to work on of higher priority especially as drop box isn't used much here - Its good to have things mapped out though and there's clearly interest.

Changing the ' files seen by you' text is yet another much simpler JIRA.
column61:
I'm not sure I understand this part of your last comment: "So we would have to make sure this also applies to our new approach--i.e., the quota displayed at the top of each student dropbox UI is always for that student's root folder and not any particular subfolder being accessed."

Currently, in Sakai 10.x (and I assume 11), the quota displayed for each student is their own Drop Box quota. That is, each Drop Box has a per-user quota entirely INDEPENDENT of Resources in a site, and if a student is logged in and chooses to view quota in Drop Box, that's what they will see. For example, in UVa's instance, default Drop Box quota is 1 GB per user (can be modified on a per-user basis). If a student uploads files to their drop box, it does not impact the default 4 GB we have allocated to Resources or the 1 GB Drop Box quota for any other user.
column65: Neal please test "Check Quota" feature in Dropbox and report anything that maybe an issue.
column137:
Neal, feel free to rope me into any discussions about this. I feel partly responsible! (Our fix is to remove the quota button from drop box because it confused staff.)

Earle thinks there may be a better fix which is getting the quota to display correctly.

Note JuanJo's comment about the quota actually being useful. He says it just displays the space left in the root folder and its useful to know if the instructor tries to to zip all submissions but it fails due to lack of space.

My suggestion is that if the quota that is displayed is just for the root folder and is actually useful, then maybe the page that displays the figures should explicitly say this is for the root folder and does not represent how much space each student has left.
column163:
I think it's helpful for students to be able to see their own quota for their drop boxes; this is why we didn't eliminate the button in our instance when we upgraded to 10.2. It's also helpful for us to see at a glance if a student emails us requesting more space in their box. Our local solution was to edit the text in the Quota display as follows:

This is your usage and your quota for the Drop Box of the current site.

As far as I know, the quota page has no way to distinguish by role which user is viewing the quota. Additionally, if the Quota page is set up to warn Instructors/TAs that they're not seeing the student's quota in Drop Box, Owners/Admins in project sites would need to have a similar view to Instructors/TAs in course sites.
column231:
I like the idea of editing the text.

Can I just that that the way you check a student's quota is to use the Become User tool and then visit said drop box?
column254: Yes, you can check the student's quota (or the instructors' at the top-level folder) by suing to them and then visiting the site's Drop Box tool.
column258: Earle Nietzel , I forget why you assigned this to me. It looks like it is not fixed. Do you want me to get QA on it to see if it is still a problem?
column263:
Neal, Earle assigned this to you as there was a big question about how this actually works. The questions were:

  1. if an instructor clicks on Quota, what do they see? JuanJo (I think) says it's the quota for the root folder which is relevant if an instructor zips up all drop boxes and it fails due to lack of quota. The root folder may have an individual quota to which the sub folders do not contribute.
  2. if a student clicks on quota, do they see their quota for their personal folder?
  3. why / when does the quota show that it is 0kb?

I'm also planning to take a look at these questions (but am not sure when I'll get a round to it).

As far as i can remember, the whole issue arose because our staff were getting confused when they saw a quota of 0kb - they thought students would be unable to upload but this isnt actually the case.
column283:
I have now checked and discovered the following

  1. if an instructor clicks on Quota, they do indeed see their quota and not the total site quota.
  2. if a student clicks on quota, they see their quota for their personal folder?
  3. I didnt see a 0kb quota, I guess that may happen when an unlimited quota has been set?
column287:
The recommended course of action would seem to be to be explicit in the UI about who the quota refers to. Hows about

Instructor

This is the quota and usage for the root folder of the Drop Box in current site. A quota of 0kb means that the quota is unlimited.

Student

This is your personal quota and usage for your Drop Box in the current site.

Need to make sure that the "Quota" message for Resources doesnt accidentally get changed
column291:
I'm not sure most instructors/site owners would know what a "root" folder is. I'd recommend the following for Instructors/Owners/Administrators (keeping in mind that project sites can also be using Drop Box):

This is the quota and usage for the top-level Drop Box folder in the current site. A quota of 0kb means that the quota is unlimited.

Note: Each site participant's folder has a separate quota, which will display for them when they select Check Quota.
column295:
I think your wording is better than mine.

I'm not sure how easy it will be to predicate the "help info" based on current drop box permissions, so, for me, it is perfectly acceptable to display both sets of help text to all users and prefix the explanation with who the text applies to

For instructors this is the ....

For students this is the quota .....
column299:
That seems fine to me, but again, I think it should be worded something like...

For instructors and site administrators
For site participants

Instructors/students are only in course sites. Project sites use Drop Box too.
column340: My, my you're good! Much better than my scrappy attempt!
column344: Curious why this Jira is assigned to me?
column348:
It was for you to investigate - I think you can unassign yourself now as the investigation has been done.

Here's the response I posted last time you asked me the same question!

Neal, Earle assigned this to you as there was a big question about how this actually works. The questions were:

  • if an instructor clicks on Quota, what do they see? JuanJo (I think) says it's the quota for the root folder which is relevant if an instructor zips up all drop boxes and it fails due to lack of quota. The root folder may have an individual quota to which the sub folders do not contribute.
  • if a student clicks on quota, do they see their quota for their personal folder?
  • why / when does the quota show that it is 0kb?
    I'm also planning to take a look at these questions (but am not sure when I'll get a round to it).
    As far as i can remember, the whole issue arose because our staff were getting confused when they saw a quota of 0kb - they thought students would be unable to upload but this isnt actually the case.
column356:
Adam, as I've mentioned in some comments above, the answer to all your questions is that each user, instructor/site admin or student/member, always sees the quota/space used up for their own drop box. To answer each question individually:

  • If the instructor clicks on Quota, they see the quota for the root folder. This is the instructor drop box. I.e. Instructors can place files in there to share with other instructors or just for personal use. A way to think of this is that the Instructor's Drop Box contains two things: 1. a quota of space where they can store content, 2. "windows" into the students' individual boxes, the quota of which the instructor cannot see. As Juan Jos mentioned above, instructors may be more likely to create content in their own drop box by creating a zip folder of a student's box than they are to upload content to their own drop box.
  • Yes, if a student clicks on Quota, they see their individual drop box's quota. This is why I don't think the quota should be removed. It's helpful for students to know when they don't have any space left and they can delete content or email support for a custom quota in that site.
  • The quota shows 0 KB used when the user doesn't have any content uploaded to their own drop box. What this means is the instructor/site admin will ALWAYS see 0 KB used if they NEVER upload content to the root folder in the drop box tool. Very few instructors/admins ever upload content there, so they're likely to see 0 KB used!

Per-user Drop Box quota is set at an institutional level and can be edited on a per-site basis. You can make a custom quota the same for all members of a site, or set an individual custom quota for a specific user.
column360: Setting this to non-issue. If it isan issue please feel free to re-open. If it is more of a discussion and investigation , it should probably go to the lists (email groups).
column364:
I reopened this becuase, going by what Tiffany says above, the quota is wrong when viewed by a user who hasnt uploaded any files.

Neal, I dont think you are the right assignee though. I also dont thinnk it's a particularily serious issue but I do believe it's a bug.
column368: I can't seem to assign to Core Team. Is "Core Team" a user or group (just thinking that we disabled a whole bunch of user accounts recently. Not sure if related.)

column376:
Hi Adam and Neal. Per my comment above, this is in fact a non-issue.

The instructor sees the instructor's quota.

Instructors cannot see each student's quota. For the instructor to be able to see each student's quota, this would be a new feature. It's not a bug. The Issue type and Description should be edited accordingly, but I'm not able to edit the Issue type to say Feature Request.

If the text of the Check Quota pagesays something like, "You are currently using 0% (0 KB ) of your Unlimitedquota for the Drop Boxof this site,"no quota has been set for Drop Box at the institutional level and is therefore unlimited for all users.
column437: Tiffany Stull - Maybe we should close this JIRA and open a new one, so it's clearer? Then it can have a new title, be a feature request, not have some comments which are connected with the issue and some which may be a misunderstanding, etc. What do you think?
column557: Sounds good. I was checking back through our local jiras to confirm, and it looks like Drop Box quota is set institutionally with the sakai property content.dropbox.quota. This determines the per-user quota in each site.
column561: Sorry for misunderstanding. In my defence, I've been on holiday for a month. Head full of French cheese I'm afraid.

column1: [SAK-29228] Make tests run headless by default
column6:
Tests in Sakai are run by the maven surefire plugin and on OSX this will steal focus when the test are run. This means you can't easily leave Sakai compiling in the background and use another piece of software as every so often you lose focus to your application.

The workaround is to setup a environmental variable:

export JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS='-Djava.awt.headless=true'

however this puts work on all developers on OSX, we can just add this as a command line arg for the surefire plugin so it is added by default.
column10: Make tests run headless by default
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
